description:
Honestly, does it get any better than Pancho Villa?

No frills, reasonable prices, and fresh ingredients (no lard or MSG). My go-to spot to take friends visiting for authentic taqueria-style food.

Pancho Villa's menu (their vegetarian friendly items) overwhelms me every time I stop by, but I can't help but always pick their nachos, and cheese quesadilla. The flour tortillas are SO good, and the nachos have the perfect bean and cheese distribution. I recommend making it a "super" so you get all the key toppings (sour cream, guacamole, and pico de gallo).

The line is almost always out the door, but it moves fast, and the people sitting at the table tend to wrap up quickly, so you're never stuck holding your food without a place to sit. It's like this unspoken camaraderie that each patron understands the time it takes to find a table, so you do your part by eating your food, and moving on quickly. 

The only wrench is the amount of smoke that's in the restaurant, but you tend to get over it pretty quickly. That said, if you're there for more than 30 minutes, be prepared for your hair and clothes to smell.

Don't waste your time getting overwhelmed by all the taqueria's in the Mission - just head straight to Pancho Villa.
author: Sejal D.

description:
What a shit hole , how long does it take to make a burrito 

The owner is idiot and no wonder he will lose his shitty building and is suing his own family 

Dumbshit
author: Sean S.

description:
I previously had a great experience here so I recommended it to a couple of friends who were looking for solid Mission burritos. Unfortunately, their experiences were not similar.
 
We came in on a Sunday night. The restaurant was bustling and there was a line, just like last time. My friends got in line and ordered their burritos. A few minutes later, one of my friend's number was called for her chicken burrito. She was going to wait to eat it at home after my friend received his order. Nearly 30 minutes go by before my other friend received his burrito. How is that possible, when they ordered basically the same thing at the same time?

The disappointment doesn't end there. We noticed on my friend's receipt that the restaurant charged 25 cents for his little to go bag. And my other friend, well, her chicken burrito had no chicken in it! Unfortunately, not much could be done as she didn't discover it until she got home (on the opposite side of town).

Overall, their food is delicious but the service is iffy. My advice is to check up on your order is taking a while, and ensure that your order is correct before you leave the restaurant.
author: Roya B.

description:
Did a 3-taco deal with the fish taco, shrimp taco, and carnitas taco. I am sad to say I was not impressed by either of the tacos. The fish taco was mediocre. Shrimp taco was leaning a little bit on the salty side. And the carnitas taco was OUT-OF-THIS-WORLD SALTY. As I bit into the taco, a few tomato pieces fell out of my grip. I like to eat every morsel of my food, so I picked it up from my plate and put it in my mouth. I think it's safe to say it was the saltiest tomato I've ever had in my life. Usually it should be limey and cold, but it was warm and salty.

Their churro is quite over cooked and you can taste the oil it was fried in.

Overall, would not recommend.
author: Lillian T.

description:
Food: 3/5       Price: 4/5       Service: 4/5      Ambience: 5/5

*** MICHELIN Guide 2018 ***

Located at Mission District, Pancho is a super popular Mexican restaurant with huge open kitchen and very long lines. You can see the chef grilling the meat on a skillet and assembly your food in front of you.

Happy hour M-F 3-5pm, 1/2 off tacos.

Complementary chips with lots of salsa options!

Al Pastor Super Burrito ($10.45) - 3/5. BBQ Pork, rice, beans, cheese, guac, sour cream, lettuce, tomato, salsa. The bbq pork was barely there....they should be wayyy more generous on their meat. Rice was flavorful and the other condiments were all delicious and worked well together.

Orange Juice ($5, Large) - 4/5. Freshly squeezed, delicious and healthy!

NEXT TIME: Shrimp/fish/al pastor Tacos. Garlic shrimp dinner plate. shrimp and carne asada burrito. Quesadilla.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Food: 3.5 | Service: 4 | Ambiance: 3

First things first, Pancho Villa is cleaner than other reviews state. It has an open kitchen so you can have a look for yourself. 

I ordered the super burrito with carne asada. When the burrito arrived, the first thing I did was to pat it with my hands because it was hefty and made me excited. It passed the "can it stand upright on its own?" test too. The initial bite was great, but was soon met with the slightly soggy crunch of lettuce. NO burrito should EVER have lettuce. It becomes a soggy mess with the heat of the meat. And if it doesn't become soggy it means your burrito is COLD. Throw extra onions and cilantro in there instead if you must add "filler". 
For this reason (the lettuce) and the fact that the meat was a bit dry, I had to knock some stars off. I think if I ordered it with no lettuce I'd have a different experience. Oh, also their Spanish rice has peas in it. 

Anyways. If you upgrade something to "super" make sure to leave out the lettuce (this includes quesadillas as well). The salsa verde with avocado is great though!! 

Service here exceeds a typical Mexican joint. At the time of my visit, there was a doorman (who opens the door for you obviously) which was a nice surprise. Plenty of staff, cooks, cashiers, bussers, and food runners. Seemed to be a well-oiled machine. Food quickly arrived via a lady yelling our number down the aisle. 
Decent amount of seating with quick turnaround so you can probably find a spot with little to no wait. 

However, I'm still in search of the best burrito in SF so let me know if you have an answer.
author: Kimmy T.

description:
I don't know if this was just bad timing but not only did I end up having to wait around 30 min in line to order and then get my burrito to go, but I also was completely ripped off on my protein. 

I ordered a carnitas super burrito on whole wheat and when I got my burrito, it was looking a tad small in diameter based on what I saw around me and via posted photos. My first thought was that it was the wrong buritto so I ripped open the foil and yup, I saw a whole wheat wrap. So I took my burrito home and cut it open...

What I found was beans, lettuce, cheese, rice, and guac. There was BARELY any carnitas, maybe three pieces. Where I cut the burrito for the cross-section photo there happened to one little piece. This might as well been a rice and beans burrito. For a base price of $10.49, this was a complete rip off. I doubt I will ever come here again. Instead, I'll stick with my normal order at El Farolito. 

FYI, they also charge extra 69 cents for whole wheat (which I didn't see listed anywhere) and 25 cents for the paper bag when you get it to go. They don't ask at all, they just charge you and give you the bag. I'd expect at least some signage giving people a heads up.
author: Liza X.

description:
Came here for a late night snack after attending a nearby show. My two friends and I arrived on a Tuesday night around 9:50 pm and there was a short line. Like most taquerias, you order first and then find a seat and wait for your number to be called.

I wasn't too hungry, so I shared the prawn nachos ($8.95) with a friend. It's a pretty big plate and comes with beans, diced tomatoes and onions, and cheese (though I asked for mine without cheese). There was a good amount of shrimp as well, but I felt like there could've been a little bit more. It's a great dish for sharing, so highly recommend this if you're looking for a snack rather than a full meal.

The taqueria is pretty large and there is a good amount of seating. We didn't have any trouble grabbing a table.
author: Dianna H.

description: You can simply spot a good taco and burrito place by the length of the line during dinner time on a Saturday. I was in the neighborhood with plans to eat elsewhere, but when I saw how popping this place was, I had to join and try it out. We had the steak dinner with shrimp - simply decadent! Their salsa stand has a huge variety of salsa, make sure you try their super spicy green sauce and challenge your friends to try it! The staff work very hard, and it was a perfectly well oiled assembly line behind the counter. Very infectious environment to dine in and enjoy the rich flavors of Mexico!
author: Yingna L.

description:
I come here when I'm craving Mexican food in sf lol it's literally such a nice place. I remember I got Kenny's tacos once and it was comparable to what I had in sd which was pretty solid. I also got the shrimp and steak quesadilla which was excellent. Their salsas are fresh and the chips are a great compliment to the main dishes. 
The interior is really big and there's plenty of seating but it still gets crowded bc of how popular this place is. They cook the food right in front of you too so you know exactly what you're getting. 
Overall would come again it's really good and I love it.
author: Lawrence H.

description:
This is a place I regularly come to. Love the steak and prawn burrito here. Both cooked to perfection with good quality ingredients. Also chips here for free!! Huge selection of salsa.

One of the few places I regularly come back to in the city because it's consistently tasty and cheap.

I know others like other burrito places, this place just never lets me down.
author: Victor D.

description:
Came here for an early dinner after work. Got their 3 taco deal for $7. You get to choose your meats and comes with your choice of beans and salsa. I really liked the al pastor! Carne asada and lengua were ok. Don't forget to ask for chips (free if you eat there). There also have a nice variety of salsas and taco fixings like onions, cilantro, hot carrots, radishes and jalapeños. 

Thought this place was solid, but not amazing. Would come back though because the 3 tacos deal is worth it.
author: Denise H.

description:
My last day in SF we spent walking and walking and more walking. Because it was Father's Day and my brother-in-laws favorite meal is Mexican food, I was hoping he would have taken us to a taco truck. But no such luck.  Instead, the last 1-hour, for dinner, before heading to the airport, was spent at his favorite Mexican restaurant, Pancho Villa Taqueria.

Pancho's is in the Mission district.  Back in 2002, I had a somewhat of a frightening experience in the Mission.  So I was dreading going into that part of the city.  No matter how much gentrification and rehabilitation this part of town is going through, I the incident is so clear to me that it felt like it just happened a few hours ago.

Sunday, wasn't to bad in the city.  Although we had to park 3 short blocks away, we were able to find parking rather quickly.  And I wasn't too fearful walking to the restaurant because my husband was with me.  But he made damn sure that I wore my purse as a crossbody instead of my usual left shoulder.

We walk into the restaurant and this place is busy.  Most tables were full.  Many families were there enjoying dinner.  Plenty of people waiting for their orders to be completed.  So that means, we are at the tail end of the rush.  

I chose the chicken flautas plate, while my brother-in-law got his usual three tacos with prawns, my husband and sister got the super burrito. So although my husband checked in on Yelp to use the $2 off deal on the super burrito, they didn't apply it.  A negative but not enough to ruin our family time together.  My brother-in-law asked my sister how much his tacos were. I can't remember how much it was, but they charged $1 more for the prawns for each of his tacos.  When we told him the price, he was shocked.  Later he says, during the weekdays, they have "happy hour" where those same tacos are cheaper.  

What was free you ask? Chips and salsa bar.  The chips were made fresh and was really good.

Because I did not grow up on Mexican food, I thought it was good, not spectacular, but good.  My husband and sister could only finish half of their super burrito. And because we were flying home, we gave all of our leftovers to the sister, even if she kept trying to push it on me to take it home.

And although I don't believe we did anything wrong, one of the cooks was mad dogging our table.  I chalk that up to being a cultural difference thing, but lucky my husband's back was facing towards them and of course I didn't tell him.  It would have been a bad situation and I didn't want to ruin a beautiful day.  Just watch your back if ever you go the Mission.
author: Edith S.

description: Love the variety vegetarian options for vegan/vegetarian lovers. We ordered the carne asada special taco (topped with beans and cheese) and fish taco. The fish taco was pretty fresh, but bland. The food itself was very mediocre, not as authentic as I hoped. Salsa bar options are great, my faves are the green avocado salsa verde and the orange one.
author: Fei S.

description: I used to love coming here for takeout in my way back to the East Bay. But now, thanks to all the takeout app orders they are processing, it can take as long as 40 minutes to get in and out. That's missing two BART trains. These people are letting the new economy apps undermine their business. I for one am done. How many more regular customers are coming to the same conclusion?
author: Richard L.

description:
Their rice has peas! Automatic three stars (jk).

Great salsa bar and quick service even when there's long lines. I have been underwhelmed by their burritos -- something about the carne asada/carnitas lacking that flavor/robustness I look for, and a little bit of dryness from the rice making extra salsa a must. The portions however are great and even the baby burrito is big enough to share. My friend did get a prawn burrito and it looked delicious, so maybe seafood is the way to go for burritos. I also tried the churros and they were a little hard and not the freshest, so I'd skip that. 

On another note, the quesadillas here are top notch! I tried a chicken supreme quesadilla and it was flavorful and filling. I would go back for that.
author: Edwina D.

description:
Not my favorite.

What I tried:
*Super Carne Asada burrito

Overall thoughts:
*Busy place but line moves fairly quick

*Waiters bring food to you too

*Big portions

*Check in for a discount on a super burrito 

*Burrito was just ok

*Sauce/salsa bar was just ok but I may be spoiled from San Jose Mexican places 

*Free chips but again they weren't that great to me

*Most likely won't come back again or if I do I would try a quesadilla
author: Sarah W.

description:
Whoa, this place's vegetarian tacos are pretty awesome! It was super busy when I got here around 7pm on a Tuesday, but my friend managed to snag us a spot while I went up to order.

I wasn't expecting a lot from the vegetarian tacos, but they came as two tacos with a sizable pile of vegetables. There was tomato, broccoli, squash, and all manner of things that had been stir fried to perfection. I actually ended up having to just eat it without the tortilla because I don't think I could've picked all of it up, and they were only around $5! 

The salsa bar is great and has so many flavors to try with your tortilla chips. Now that my vegetarian stint is over, I will have to return to try the lengua quesadilla, which my friend raved about.
author: Sophie W.

description:
I came here and tried their "Super" Burrito and while I wanted lengua they didn't happen to have any that day so I ended up getting it with asada. I also tried one of their agua frescas.

The good parts of the meal were the salsa. That was excellently made and there was a good variety to choose from. The burrito however, was not that great. 

The asada meat was incredibly chewy and in some parts quite dry. The whole burrito itself felt rather dry, and the taste was bland and quite boring. Thankfully there was the salsa, which made the whole thing bearable and edible, but beyond that, I didn't think the food quality was all that good.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Great late night spot with an amazing salsa bar. 
Good selection of tacos and dinner plates, an unpretentious and reliable spot in mission.
author: Puxan B.

description:
This is an awesome choice for Mexican food in the neighborhood of the Mission District.

I got the Pollo Asado meal - comes with broiled chicken (a tad dry/slightly overcooked, but was fine once I doused it with their delicious red salsa), rice and beans, side salad (no dressing included, you can substitute salsa for it instead like I did), and choice of corn or flour tortillas (I always pick corn tortillas, my fave for handmade tacos!).

I ordered my meal to-go, so everything was boxed up separately and neatly. Moreover, I suggest picking Pancho Villa Taqueria as a dinner spot if you're visiting San Francisco and craving authentic Mexican cuisine!
author: Anna B.

description: This is a very good place to eat. Everything is excellent and top notch except for the kind of meat they use for their Carne Asada plate. I looks like the cheapest cut of meat. Even Chuck beef (Diezmillo) would be way better and juicier. RibEye would be ideal but it's probably too expensive. But please don't use the horrible meat that your using now. It's dry tough and flavorless.
author: Arturo R.

description:
I wish I had a better first experience with Pancho Villa Taqueria. I ordered a regular burrito (rice, beans, and salsa) with al pastor, and instead I received carnitas (which is probably my least favorite meat to have inside a burrito). This was disappointing because everything else about the burrito was pretty good. 

Aside from the burrito, the complimentary chips I got were 80% crumbs and it was all very greasy. 

I'd like to come again and give it another shot.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Once I stopped living near a BART station, Mission burritos weren't a huge part of my life anymore. Sad reality... I'm too lazy to take more than 1 mode of public transit to get anywhere. Fortunately I was seeing a play at the Victoria Theater down the street and needed to eat dinner beforehand.

It had a carne asada super burrito which was good! Not my favorite Mexican place in the Mission, but I see why this is one of the most popular. It's conveniently located, service is friendly, and quality of food is excellent. FYI: When you order, keep it simple because not everyone who works at Pancho Villa speaks English.

There's plenty of seating inside. It's actually amazing how much square footage Mexican restaurants manage to procure in San Francisco. That profit margin, though! Most people seem to do take-out, which I realize backs up the line like crazy during the week. 

Another time I went to Pancho Villa took me 20 minutes just to get a burrito. Not worth it. Definitely order ahead if you're going during rush hour, or don't plan on being somewhere immediately after. Other than that, the experience is positive, and it's a Mexican restaurant you should cross off your list in San Francisco!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Been coming here for decades, still one of my favorite taquerias in SF. The food is cooked in front of the ordering line. Nice selection of meats or prawns. The combo plates are large as are the burritos. Great self service salsa bar and selection of Mexican juices.
author: Roy A.

description:
I hadn't been to Pancho Villa in yearsssss so on a rainy night and in no mood to cook, we agreed on Mexican for dinner.

To be honest, I was a little disappointed when I walked in: The seating wasn't very inviting and the restaurant looked like it needed a good scrub. 

The floor was dirty (though in fairness it was raining earlier) but the counters looked tacky, the area where they have pick up orders (UberEats) was on a lopsided wire rack crowded with restaurant supplies. You can even see dirt on the counter behind the plancha where meat was being grilled (photo).

They have a 90 Health rating so it can't be that bad.

The burritos we got were tasty, nothing to go wild about. The "baby burrito" was very large and I wished I'd ordered that size because mine was humongous (and yeah, I ate it all, I'd only had water that day).

Agua Fresca was overly sweet and tasted of syrup (we had the hibiscus and mango flavors).

The salsas were okay, no reference on the sneeze guard what you were getting with regard to heat. Unhelpfully, the guide on the wall didn't correspond to the salsa bar set-up and was mostly blocked by people jockeying to fill their little plastic salsa containers. 

But the lasting impression of Pancho Villa Taqueria is that it took forever to get our order, 25 minutes after I'd paid at the register. I even checked once to see if they'd forgotten our order- nope.

I won't go rushing back.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I was wandering the city and decided to pop in this taqueria as I was passing by. It smelled good from outside and it looked pretty poppin' inside. It was kind of mid afternoonish, and there was a long line to order. The rush died down a little after I got my food though.

The service is pretty quick. You order your food at the first register, they print out your order on a receipt, then you go to the next register to pay and order any drinks/chips/churros. You get a free side of chips with your order! Which is great because there's a salsa bar in the back of the restaurant.

I got the Super Burrito with al pastor. Mostly because you can get $2 off of one if you check-in. I ordered it without beans or sour cream, and the burrito came out smaller than I thought it'd be. I even looked around at other people's orders and theirs seemed to look larger than mine. Not sure if it's because I didn't get beans or not but oh well. The burrito itself was fine, there wasn't anything too special about it. It just tasted like an average burrito, even with the salsas on it.

I'd stop by again for a quick bite to eat that's not too pricey, but it's not the best I've ever had.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
Used to be my go-to place, easily my landmark for "the best mission burrito".

Ordered a regular burrito to go, came home to discover they gave me a super burrito instead. I'm allergic to dairy and can't eat sour cream or cheese so I got a burrito I can't eat. Nobody picks up the phone when you call them so I can't even ask for a refund without going back there.
author: Ian D.

description:
When I drove down the street, there was a space across the street, so I turned around and parked.

I could see from all the people lined up to order food that this was going to be good and it was. I ordered the enchiladas dinner that came with rice and beans, then I went to look for a table. Someone had just left, so that's where I sat. Then more people came in and lined up to order. I just beat the crowd. The waiter brought the order to my table. I noticed that other tables had chips and salsa, so I went to the cashier and asked if that comes with the dinner. Yes, so he gave me a basket of chips. Very tasty food, but it was more than I could eat. Went up to the cashier and got a take out box.

Just ask.
author: GARY C.

description:
Went here with friends on a Sunday afternoon and there wasn't much of a line! We tried to go to Kitchen a Story down the road but the line was too long so decided to make a stop here instead. 

Food: Got the complimentary nachos and the taco, and the salsa selection was quite good, though it was as quite standard. I think that the tacos had good flavors, better than the usual Mexican food place, but nothing super super mind blowing.

Service: The food came out quickly, and there's a nice system where you pay for your receipt after you get your order in. We got our food in about 10 minutes.

Ambiance: This place is a great place for a quick bite when you're hungry or need to get a burrito before a hike. 

Wouldn't probably come again unless I end up in the area and it's busy at the other places!
author: Jenny X.

description: The food is good here, my rating is based on the takeout experience I had. I placed an order for takeout at 7:30 PM through Yelp, and it got confirmed saying it would be ready at 7:59. I waited until 8:15 and my order still wasn't ready. I asked 2 different employees when my order will be ready, and each of them just shrugged and walked away, and I didn't hear back from them. So in the end I ended up paying, waiting for 15 min, and not getting any food. Will not be back here anytime soon.
author: Dan B.

description:
Dang...this place is really more like two stars (dry meat, dry and flavorless rice, lukewarm food) but because it has an awesome salsa bar with GREAT salsa verde I have to give one of the stars back LOL.

Not the worst, but there are other options in the area that are probably better.

Don't forget about the Yelp check in offer when you go! $2 off any super burrito.
author: Anna C.

description:
On my first trip to San Francisco I was told I absolutely HAD to go to the Mission District and get a burrito from a taqueria. 

Pancho Villa prepares the food right in front of you so when you first walk in you get an overwhelming (in a good way) aroma of the meat sizzling on the grill. They also have a fresh salsa bar that includes 4-5 different fresh salsas, sliced radishes, sliced jalapeños, and cilantro. 

My husband and I each got spicy super burritos (rice, beans, lettuce, tomato, guacamole, and sour cream) and were extremely pleased. I had carne asada and he got double meat (carne asada and spicy chicken) and we would both highly recommend them to anyone. 

Service was standard. The woman taking our order was very helpful in telling us what came with a burrito (chips are included, btw!). They also did a good job turning the tables over quickly as they were busy.
author: Emily I.

description:
This spot two star at best. Here's why.
Inefficiency in having to place your order for food and drink separately. Also only one cash register to order food from. On the plus side, the table service is quick and the food was delivered in a reasonable time.
The down side, the food itself. The corn tortillas on the tacos were lukewarm at best or not fully cooked. The burrito needs work in the wrapping process, too much excess tortilla. In food that's known for its seasoning and flavor, there was none to be found tonight. The "aguas frescas" were really just half powder mix half maybe actual fruit. I would much rather produce a long deuce and dig into it with a fork and knife than eat this again. 2 stars.
author: Jose V.

description:
I live not too far away in the neighborhood, so I feel the need to try all of the taquerias around the area. When I saw this place had so many reviews, it spurred me to put this place at the top of the list. 

The space is quite large, and there are always a ton of people. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The food came out really quickly and looked fresh. I REALLY wanted to love this place.

The food (an al pastor plate and a chicken quesadilla) was all good, but unfortunately nothing to write home about. Everything tasted incredibly fresh, but it all seemed to be missing some flavor that other taquerias in the neighborhood have in spades. There wasn't enough cheese in my quesadilla, so it almost seemed like a wrap. The al pastor meat was incredibly tender, but not terribly flavorful. I would come here for fresh, healthier-seeming home-style food on any regular day during the week, but not to satisfy my Mexican craving (if that makes any sense). 

We thought the salsa bar was fun, but there ended up being nothing too amazing from the selection. 

Overall this place had decent food but was missing the Mexican flavors that I came here for. I'd come back again, but it's not at the top of my list.
author: Jenny D.

description: Great food but they lost a star for not honoring the $2 off coupon for the super burrito. I guess I look like a techie or something, even though I'm not...definitely better than el farolito though.
author: Peter C.

description:
I am so disappointed in this place! They say they strive for customer service but literally we ordered 3 tacos and 1 super burrito and waited for over 30 mins and nothing ever came out or our number was never called. We had to go up to the counter and ask about our order and even then it wasn't ready. The place was not even that busy for them to neglect us as customers. I will never dine at this place again due to the POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. I truly believe they FORGOT OUR ORDER.

The food: 
TACOS: Was mediocre, was not impressed as I've had really GREAT tacos. I didn't even finish my 3 taco plate. I ordered the carne asada, al pastor and carnitas. I took a bite of each and left it.
author: Sindy B.

description:
Please see my review of La Taqueria. I've hesitated visiting this place for some time for dumb reasons but I'm glad I stopped in.

First impression was :
"They have a lot of employees here" 

It seemed like it was a training center for Bay Area Taquerias with the amount of people they had behind the counter. This was no negative however, it just speaks to their popularity and like any good restaurant they are E-F-F-I-C-I-E-N-T (had to spell check that, my 1st grade spelling champ swagger is not the same as it used to be).

I got an Al pastor taco which is my staple for any Taqueria and it came in a to go plate which was pretty darn good. I can see what the hype is and why they've called this place home for so long. My apologies for waiting so long to come by...but we shall meet again.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

author: Rod M.

description: I definitely like they have some good vegan options here. Some things like the tofu ranchero are questionable as far as freshness at times....but this is one of the most affordable taqueria's in the mission. I mean you can walk out of here with the veggie burrito that's pretty loaded up for like $6...it's pretty crazy. The salsa bar is a great addition, and the salsa Verde continues to reign supreme here. Although things are not always the cleanest, or most consistent I think it deserves a solid 4 stars for being a classic SF spot that you can load up on for relatively cheap.
author: Devin E.

description: Good classic San Francisco Taqueria with great food for decades. I like their salsa and their steak burrito. One of the top 10 San Francisco Burrito places.
author: Juan V.

description: An acquaintance and I stopped in for lunch at Pancho Villa Taqueria on Labor Day. The first thing I noticed was the crowds! There was a long line at the counter to order and the tables were mostly full. A couple of employees were cooking meat for the entrees right out in front. I waited in line and perused the menu. I ended up getting super nachos  with al pastor. Although the line was long, it was not an extensive wait with just paying after specifying your order and waiting a bit for your number to be called. There's an immense amount of aguas frescas which was awesome. I got my usual horchata which was tasty and thick with rice. I tried my acquaintance's strawberry drink which was extremely sweet. The nachos were nice with flavorful al pastor and it was nice getting salsa from the salsa bar which was large. Overall, a great taqueria to check out if you are in the mission area of San Francisco.
author: Heather R.

description:
At the moment, my favorite burrito place in the Mission. Incredible diversity in the choices on the menu, with plenty of different meats and styles of those meats along with tons of veggie options. 

To continue the amount of options, the toppings bar in the back has at least 5 different salsas and all sorts of toppings (lime, onions, greens, etc) so there is never a need to ask the staff for more of a certain type of item. 

In addition, each order gets a side of fresh tortilla chips, which often costs extra at other places or isn't included in to-go orders. I'm super thankful for this because it makes trying all the different salsas much easier!

It's constantly packed, but the 10+ people on staff handle the long line really well and keep things moving to get to-go orders in and out the door in under 15 minutes. 

My favorite part is the price, since many other places cost upwards of 13 dollars for a super burrito. Here, it's only $10.25. 

Most of the time when we go we get a super veggie burrito with refried beans and hot salsa for $8.25 and a  super burrito with carne asada fajitas, black beans, and hot salsa for $10.25. I personally always love the grilled veggies part of fajitas and not many other places offer this style of meat prep in a burrito.

We'll definitely be looking forward to coming back here again, and have never had a bad experience. Thanks!
author: John B.

description:
Thanks for the reply Gary of Pancho Villa but there was absolutely no confusion regarding this charge.  Your cashier willingly scammed me.

It is definitely a good idea to talk to your cashiers though about their behavior.  I did have to report Pancho Villa to the Department of Tax and Fee Administration this week for sales tax evasion.  Considering the number of transactions Pancho Villa does, this is definitely worth an investigation.

 Hopefully this will serve as good incentive for you to put honest people at the register.
author: Mailah G.

description: I ordered a veggie super burrito bowl for delivery and it came with no guacamole, sour cream, or salsa despite having ordered it. Absolutely tasteless and cost nearly $30 for two bowls by the time delivery and tip was included. I don't think I've ever written a 1-Star review for anything but this is a total travesty.
author: Erika N.

description: Love this taqueria! The line is usually long but they are swift and well worth the wait. Best bang for your buck and best veggie burrito. Not to mention the salsa bar
author: Jasmine C.

description: Horrible service, the guy taking my order was totally rude. I come here all the time and never have any problems with my order. He wanted to argue with me about something they messed up on and didn't wanna accommodate me. I politely asked for a refund & my business else where.
author: D B.

description:
Oh Pancho Villa, what can I say that so many people haven't already said?  

They're easily in my top 3 burrito spots in San Francisco.  Great food, good prices.  I haven't actually been here in years, but I stopped in after thrift store costume shopping before Bay to Breakers and was reminded of how much I loved this place when I lived 3 blocks away.  I love that they've remained consistent all this time.  I'm going to have to remind myself to venture out to the mission more often.
author: Jessica F.

description:
These are some generous stars. But mainly because they do what they say, and are, exactly as advertised. It's not fancy or elevated in any way, but this place is still damn tasty. 

The line isn't fun, the lighting isn't fun. The food delivers. The salsa bar has something for everyone. Also, free mini chips. 

I'll be back when my belly is empty and my wallet is close. Pricey? No.
author: Mari H.

description: Have been trying to order from here since I've been working in the city and I finally made the jump to order from Pancho Villa. I got a burrito which I don't normally do but ohhh man let me tell you that was a good choice on my end. Not sure which burrito I got but I ordered the one with the two meats I got the Assad/Carnitas and the meat had tons of flavor and you could tell they make there food with pride . If you're in SF I would highly recommend them
author: Will D.

description:
We were craving a burrito after working a few Saturday's ago and one of my fellow co-workers mentioned we should check-out Pancho Villa.  We lucked-out, since we found a parking spot right out front, so fortune was definitely on our side.  

My co-workers commented about how good the steak was and as we get in line, I see a mound of steak on the grill.  Since my mouth was now watering, I just had to order the Super Steak & Shrimp Burrito.  As an added bonus, I got $2 off with my Yelp check-in, so my day continued to get better.  The line moved really well and I noticed they had 3 cash registers going, which allowed the line to move really quick.  

Once my burrito was delivered, I couldn't wait to dig-in to it.  The steak was really tender and the shrimp was cooked perfectly.  The burrito was really good and I got to a point where I had to make a decision to finish it and take a long nap when I get home.  Or I save some, since I knew we were going-out for ice cream afterwards.  I wrapped it up and finished it for lunch the next day and it was still delicious.  

The staff were friendly and the service was really quick, considering how crowded it was.
author: Lon H.

description: Expect a long line when eating here cause this place is poppin. I was really excited to try Mexican food in the Mission since I'm not from around here. This was one of the places I got to try and it was actually really good. A burrito with two meats consisting al pastor and carne asada and they were a little dry. Drier than my phone basically. But maybe I didn't get sour cream? Nonetheless I'll be back for more
author: Alex L.

description: This is "ok" place for mexican food but there are better options around, their quesadillas and tortas are good but nothing special.
author: Jostin H.

description:
Great burritos! I've been enjoying PVT for 14 years now, and can never get anything but a burrito. I love the open kitchen, the cleanliness and the way that they can move the line fairly quickly.

Pancho Villa is a nice balance between being clean and modern, but the food is nothing but authentic mission-style fare made by people who work hard and really seem to care about their customers.

My long-time order: Super burrito with chile rellano. Don't miss their great salsa bar and my very favorite thing - whole grilled jalapeno peppers.
author: Scott N.

description:
**Updated review: 
WARNING: Yelp indicates their health Score has been decreased BUT the restaurant still has "90" on the wall behind the register! What's up with that? 
Their takeout process is an unorganized, chaotic mess. We go here quite frequently and it hasn't improved. Today, for example, my order was placed in a bag and put aside with the UberEATS orders. I asked multiple times about where my order was and they said one moment. Fast forward 25 minutes (after waiting 15) I decided to look at the receipts inside the UberEats bags myself & sure enough my order was there. They didn't seem to care. Their veggie dinner is sooooo good though! Sigh....**

Original review (months ago): 
Everything about this place is amazing. Carnitas are delicious. Their fresh squeezed juice will quench anyone's thirst and satisfy your tastebuds. Affordable & fast, too.
author: Rob M.

description:
Came to try the super burrito and I was not disappointed! It was quite packed with flavor, but I definitely found myself drowning it with the many sauces they had. My all time favorite sauce would probably be the green one they had. It's a bit spicy, but so flavorful. 

The burrito is really big, my sister and I shared one and I was so full! Be sure to ask them to cut it in half though! Theres really nothing bad to say about this place. Its fast and delicious. It's a place you basically go to get in and out within 10 minutes. The chips are delicious too!
author: Chelsea W.

description:
The food looks amazing. It tastes amazing. But if it's busy expect there to be a lot of mistakes made... like forgetting no to actually bring you your food. We ordered two of the exact same #8 dinner platters and got one. We waited and waited (while the other person -being polite - let their food get cold). Went up to tell them. Manager let them know they forgot a plate... more waiting. Went up to tell them again then finally got the plate out to us. The second plate is missing stuff. Exact same order but missing stuff. SMH. Ridiculous. 

It's busy. Got it. Mistakes happen. Understood. But the waiter/waitress should verify your receipt to be sure all of your food has arrived, that way if it hasn't they can be sure it makes its way to you at an acceptable time. Five stars for flavor and appearance of the dishes. Minus three stars for bad service. Being busy isn't an excuse.
author: Noel R.

description:
excellent juice selection!  refreshing while not too sweet! I love the watermelon.

if you're a salsa fiend, you will love Pancho, they have a great selection of salsas at the salsa bar. they have something for every one.

i love their steak and prawn burrito. the smoky steak was tender while the fresh shrimp has a pop. Burrito was moist but wasn't wet enough to melt the tortilla. the fresh onions add a little bit of crunch with every bite. I always love a good balance of flavors and textures. dont forget to top off your burrito with their salsas.

chips are on the house so you have something to munch on before they bring you your order. Chips are on the thin side. I personally enjoy thicker chips.
author: Jason C.

description:
I ordered the Super Burrito as you get 2 dollars off it which was nice. The style of the taqueria is like a buffet where you chose what you want on your tacos, burritos, quesadillas etc. The carne asada to me was kinda bland with not a lot of juicy flavor. The beans, rice, & guacamole took over the overall taste of the burrito but overall the burrito was good. 

My sister ordered a few carne asada tacos which were also bland in flavor. The wait time was a bit long due to the lunch hour but it was an overall good experience in the Mission District.
author: Eddie F.

description:
This is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. I'm writing this review because I've ordered from Pancho Villa so many times that I really think it's due. 

My personal favorites are: 

1. Super Burrito with Chicken Fajitas
2. Steak Fajita Dinner Meal
3. Cheese or Meat Quesadillas (order this without sour cream and beans if ordering delivery to keep it from getting soggy)

Honestly you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They somehow make everything super delicious and get orders out very quickly. 

I had burrito from a different restaurant the other day and immediately regretted my decision. Sometimes it's good to venture out and try new things but I've learned my lesson. Pancho is where it's at.
author: Hannah Y.

description:
I ordered takeout dinner here, and honestly it's just not that good. 

I ordered the Lengua Special Burrito, and the Steak nachos. And both were disappointing. I was horrified to taste that the rice had peas in it, do I need to say any more? (At least there aren't carrots?) The steak nachos were kind of mediocre. There just wasn't any flavor to anything, so it all tasted like cardboard without salsa. 

Overall, I don't know how service was, but the food got to me pretty promptly, but it was disappointing, an I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Sophie W.

description: Anytime I'm in the Mission I stop by here and I'm never disappointed. Staff is consistent (same faces) and friendly and prices are reasonable here.
author: Jorge P.

description:
I came here during happy hour not knowing they had happy hour. I wasn't really sure where you go to pay or order but here's what I know now. There's two registers and you order at one. They give you a receipt and you take that to the next register and pay. 

I brought a friend here and we each ordered two tacos for a total of 4. The price came to 9 dollars. I was shocked because that's really cheap!! I got two chicken tacos and my friend got a tofu taco and a veg taco. I looked at the receipt and the basic tacos are 1.50 while the rest are about 2.50 or around there. 

We went to sit down and our food came back about 5 minutes later. They have really fast service which was cool. I also really appreciated the amount of veg options they had so if you're vegetarian and are craving some good food, come here!
author: Karishma K.

description:
Hungry after going to a bar, we stopped here for a late night snack. After much of my indecisiveness, I just went for a cheese quesadilla and was surprised to see it stuffed with cheese and salsa! They also have a pretty good salsa bar where you can grab more sauces to add to your meal. Also, they give you free chips with every order so my snack became a pretty full meal. The quesadilla itself was really good and totally hit the spot with the cheese and the carby tortilla.

Overall, good spot for late nights.
author: Sophia Y.

description: I enjoy Pancho Villa's carnitas from time to time, though sometimes they add too much gristle in with the meat when making my baby burrito. The husband throughly enjoys their chile relleno burrito, when made without rice. They make excellent refried pinto beans and their guacamole is not half bad either.  It's certainly not elevated cuisine, but its usually reliable and delicious, if one is lucky enough to have it made with care.  One hopes one is always so lucky.
author: Archana P.

description: The line goes out the door which is always a great sign. I think this place is bomb if you had a few drinks in your tummy, lol. I wasn't impressed. They messed up on my orders and forgot my tortilla chips with my order... it's so busy that there was no way I was going to ask them to change my burrito; for some reason they served me a burrito where they pour all the red sauce. I must have ordered wrong. I was really sad. Left feeling disappointed. Was not worth the wait in line. Maybe we can try going during the day time not at 10:00 pm at night to see a difference.
author: Ann A.

description: OMG! I ordered a chicken and pawn salad for lunch. It was not only deliciously amazing, it was well worth the money. I thought about uploading a picture. But I'd eaten over two thirds of it, so what good would that have done. Maybe next time I won't be so hungry!!!
author: Carmen R.

description:
Mixed experiences on two recent visits:
On the first one, loved the burrito to go, and it came out quickly. Probably the best option near the 16th-Mission BART.
On the second, placed an order via the takeout service featured here, got an email with ETB (estimated time of burrito) and then got a call from the service just as I was about to leave saying they couldn't get confirmation from Pancho Villa. Turns out their equipment failed and they were closed. They seem to work with many third-party services -- I once waited 20 minutes for takeout while seeing seemingly dozens of UberEATS bags being filled and taken out -- and should work to improve their communication with them, for instance telling them of unexpected closure.
author: Carl B.

description: If you like your Burrito's super SALTY and super disgusting, be sure to visit this place. The Burrito's tasted like they had about a pound of MSG in them! Pancho Villa, if you are using products with MSG, you should relay that to your customers, because it's really unhealthy!!
author: Delilah W.

description: Used to be a favorite spot when in the City but last nights service was unacceptable. Both orders were incorrect with mine being totally different from what I ordered. I ordered and paid for a grilled chicken and shrimp super burrito with no guacamole or tomato's. Received a shredded chicken burrito with sliced avocado and tomato's Took it back to be remade and it was incorrect again (steak instead of chicken). My fiancé burrito was incorrect also but we both were frustrated at that point and he just ate his. I felt like the guy taking orders had some personal issue with us or at least it felt like it. Oh well, after patronizing this establishment for 20+ years, I guess I have to find another spot in the city...
author: Tracey A.

description:
This is a really awesome place to come and chill. If you love tacos and burritos, then you've come to the right place! There's plenty of tables and chairs here, it's super spacious. The interior is bright and colorful and gives off that home-y sort of vibe to it. The environment is very family oriented-like. You come in here and you want to get a bite to eat and share with your friends and family. They've got complimentary tortilla chips and salsas with your order. 

They've got a wide variety of Mexican cuisines to choose from. Along with that, they also offer a wide variety of meats to go with it. I'm always on the lookout for good taco and burrito places. This is definitely one shop you've got to try! It's always pretty busy here, but the food is definitely worth the wait. Good food, good service. Definitely try to stop by if you're in the area for the foods! And don't forget your friends and family! They don't wanna miss this, which means that you definitely don't wanna miss this either!
author: Brandon D.

description: This place was amazing. We stumbled upon it after having drinks in the mission area and came in because the place was packed with a line to order. It's not fancy or frilly but the tacos were amazing. Everything was fresh and authentic and very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend it to anyone in the area.
author: Becca M.

description: Ordered delivery and the food is mediocre compared to the other taquerias in the Mission.  I ordered an appetizer medley and it was a pile of glump.  Not sure if the delivery service is as fault, but it was super embarrassing of the price paid.  Even if I was desperate for burritos, not ordering from here again.
author: michele g.

description: Chill dive that will keep you coming back for more. Few things are better than tacos after a long day in Dolores park. My husband frequents this taqueria, and it's always a treat for me, as well. We like to get 2 tacos each plus a side or two (like guacamole and refried pinto beans). We had the carnitas, beef, chicken verde and pastor. Also don't forget to grab a few salsas to try! (Careful, they can be spicy). The chicken verde was a stand out! Lots of the lime marinade came through and the chicken was falling apart juicy and tender. For dessert, I had to splurge and get a cookie. Thise are such a treat, and the whole meal is sure to please. Enjoy!
author: Kirby W.

description: The Mission district is jam packed with tons of delicious Mexican food on almost every corner, so for this establishment to have survived in business for 30+ years, they must be doing something right. I haven't tried too many items on their menu, but out of the items that I have, I think their super burritos are my favorite. Their burritos are always made fresh with quality ingredients and feature some of their award winning salsa in either mild or hot; whatever your tastebuds and stomach can handle.
author: Joseph A.

description: Steak and shrimp burrito was the best I have every had, well seasoned and grilled perfectly without over cooking. You have to try the Fiesta platter who ever was working the grill that day had every done perfectly. I will be definitely be heading back soon and the line is worth the wait for the yummy goodness that you will be receiving.
author: Sandy S.

description: You can literally get pints of meat here and that was super neat since my friend's keto. I got the $2 off super burrito and it was really value and I saved half for a second meal. On a Monday night, the queue to order moves pretty quickly and there's ample seating. Would come back when I'm in the area for a good burrito.
author: Regina X.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night and the place was still crowded for 9:30pm! They had a lot of workers but didn't seem to care about the customers, just to push the line along. Had no eye contact with the girl taking my order and very little with the cashier so it made me feel awkward. 
Anyways... the food was very good! Had the super burrito with the yelp check in! They gave complimentary chips and they have a ton of salsas! We took our food to go and we had a salsa tasting at home (my favorite kind of tasting!) Green salsa was my favorite! Our al pastor super  burrito was very good and had so many flavors! I'll have to get over the service because I will be back for the great food!
author: Megan M.

description: Descent food if on a budget, and you get plenty of it. The service is good and the open kitchen shows their cleanliness. I always order the taco dinner for 11.50, and I can never finish it because it's so much. I recommend this to all my backpacking friends/tourist who are in need of a lot of food for a low price.
author: Lolita R.

description:
Very good burrito, full of flavor and fulfilling.
This place gets very busy, but fortunately it's a large restaurant with allot of seating.
author: Khaled A.

description:
Super disappointing. How do you mess up every single thing in a simple three item order?! 
No guacamole with the chips. 
No meat at all in my carnitas burrito.
No meat, cheese or sour cream in the carne asada super burrito.
Now GrubHub is saying they need Pancho Villa's approval for a refund...
I can't get thru to Pancho Villa either
author: Emily W.

description:
4/19/2017:

I felt the need to crave for grilled steak with refried beans and melted cheese on top of tortilla chips. Without further thoughts, I walked up here and checked it out for myself. I came in, ordered a Steak 'N' Nachos which came with grilled steak, refried beans and melted cheese on top of tortilla chips. This was certainly the best plate of nachos I have had. I enjoyed it and am tempted to go get it again. They are indeed very generous on the portions they give which I really like.

They do give tortilla chips as an appetizer to munch on while they prepare your food. The chips are delicious, crispy and not super greasy, which is also one thing I have to give props to. I came in during lunch hour of course the line was kind of long, but it did move fast.

Reasons for rating:
- friendly team
- prompt service
- good food

Items I ordered on my first visit:
Steak 'N' Nachos with a bottle Jarritos Pineapple Soda. The tortilla chips are perfect for a side dish or an appetizer. This definitely is an excellent taqueria to patronize for burritos, nachos, quesadillas . . .

Overall, positive first experience here.
author: Bennett W.

description: Located on mission and 16th. I ordered a churro and a carne asada super burrito. And when you check in there on yelp you get $2 off a super burrito.  The salsa bar is top notch with a variety of spiciness levels and unique flavors. I enjoyed the churro while I waited for my meal. It was cinnamon crunchy delight. The super burrito was tasty. Overall good food and great service.
author: Warren Q.

description:
Pancho Villa had a short line. stayed in line since 16th St, has more bars & liquor stores than eateries. was able to decide on eats while in line.other eateries seem empty.

drill: give order to lady, lady gives u a slip. she posts order on a board. when u get to end of line, pay cashier. food arrives shortly thereafter. Yelp check-in gets u $2 off on a super burrito. skipped, not a fan of cheese, quac, sour cream.

eats: asada burrito (7)
-choice of pinto/black beans, spicy or mild. broken rice irritating but tolerable. big of free chips  super fresh, crunchy, thin. green salsa at salsa bar too salty.
-burrito resembles a chucky lead pipe.
-asada not stringy, little gristle, overall tender, slightly juicy. 
slight imperfections. 3..5 stars

takes outs:
-available for delivery with $9. $2.99 charge., takes one hour.
-names not seen on all storefronts, older shops have signs barely visible.'
-prompt, friendly service, more mechanical than EL Faro.
author: Victor G.

description:
My favorite Mexican food and salsa bar in San Francisco.  I absolutely love the grilled meats and prawns.  

I can't find food of this quality for the price in the whole city #fanforlife#cheapAF#rarefind
author: Meagan M.

description:
I've found my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant! 

From the South Bay and this was my 1st time there and now I'm trying to find ANY excuse to come to the City! Meats are tasty, which makes everything they're in gush with flavor. Salsas are the bomb. Clean, fast, nice, CHEAP!
author: Mark K.

description:
Food 5 star  Other 1 star  Ave 3 star
This place is my long time (10+ yrs) 5 star mexican place. However they couldnt keep up with the population and demand. Customer service went down. Restrooms are horrible. I am wondering if they purposely play with the water pressure. Automatic paper towel is the slowest on the nation. Did you slow that too to consume less paper? No water cups. Good luck with finding a clean table.
Tonight, asked for a burrito and quesadilla. I checked in for $2 off! They charged and gave me two burritos and a quesadilla. First, why gave me extra? Maybe she heard two instead of one but then where is my 2nd $2 off? I could get those separate with discount right? It doesn't say only one check in per ticket... I could order hundred burritos and I should be getting $200 off
author: Ricky G.

description: Went there for the first time Monday night - as a "buyer" at least. I will say that the cheese quesadilla I had was pretty amazing. I love the fact that the salsa was put inside of the quesadilla. I've never had it like that before!
author: Jeannette A.

description:
Happy hour M-F 3-5pm.

I stumbled into Pancho Villa actually on the way to a smoothie shop (in case you are wondering we never made it). I planned to order a nacho but when I found out it was HH I instead over ordered, getting 6 tacos. I got two of each of the following: trout, white fish, and carne asada. The seafood tacos for $2 were hands down the best non-fried fish tacos I've had. Crispy seared fish with a light dose of sour cream and spicy salsa (if you ask for spicy they mean jalapeno chunks seeds and all). They are normally $4. The regular tacos are $1.50 HH/ $3 normal were forgettable. All orders come with chips. 

Winning factor: Extensive salsa bar with pico, spicy, sweet, chipotle, tomatillo, jalapeno, radishes, lemon, escebeche carrots, cilantro, onion, and more.
author: Tammy T.

description:
disappointed is how I describe my lunch at this taquería.  I ordered 1 taco and it took over 40 minutes to get it.  Yes, it was busy but all folks eating in were standing around waiting for their food.  it seems that the priority at this establishment are folks picking up food who ordered online.  All those who were gonna eat there were just waiting around.  
I've gone to plenty other taquerias in the area and the food is good and so much faster.  Don't waste your lunch hour being frustrated here.  If you can't afford 2 hours for lunch, don't go here.  I had to take mine to-go and by the time I ate it it was so cold the cheese was like plastic.
author: Mariaté G.

description:
Late night Door Dashing of super and baby burritos after two rounds of drinks? Yes!

Pros:
+ Spinach wrap
+ Cheap, filling, tasty
+ Green sauce adds a nice kick
+ Baby burrito is the perfect size

Cons:
- Not saucy enough. Maybe mine was missing tomatoes/salsa

For those who don't eat like a monster, the baby burrito does the trick. Actually, it's a little too filling. Super burrito is perfect for the folks who can seriously stomach a lot. Burrito is dry, so get that green sauce! I'm also not a sour cream person, but maybe that'll make your burrito more moist.

Door Dash was pretty fast. Would try this spot if I'm in the Mission!
author: Fanny W.

description:
After going to the Smash Cut Short Film Festival with my roommates, we were starving as we haven't eaten anything since lunch, and it was already 9 at night. Although our plan was to go to El Farolito, we were not down for a 20-minute walk in Mission District, let alone at night, so we decided to give this close-by place a try as reviews were great.
 
Just like what the other reviews said, the staff is HUGE. Maybe it's not that big, but it's def a considerably larger staff than most of the taquerias around in the neighborhood. 
 
Interior looked pretty clean and modern (of course, compared to other nearby taquerias), and the salsa bar was plenty big and variable.
 
I ordered an Al Pastor Super Burrito (don't forget the $2 off coupon for checking in!) with a can of coke, and the total came out to $8.05, which was extremely cheap for this sized burrito.
 
As mentioned above, we were starving so we gorged down our burritos and were in burrito lala land. 

The smokey flavor of al pastor was amazing! Meat was tender and fatty, and you can see the pink (BBQ pink, not raw pink haha)  properly situated on the inside of the meat. 
 
Unfortunately, rice and everything else were lacking in flavor. A bit of more salt into all the prepped food would've made the experience a lot more flavorful. This resulted in a loss of star.

Although El Farolito still remains the best burrito spot in Mission District for me, I will definitely go back to this place for convenience and my burrito cravings, as it sits directly nearby the 22 Muni stop.
author: David K.

description: I've eaten hear plenty of times & I normally order chicken Asada plate to share with my daughter. She eats chicken & I am vegan; but this time my daughter ate the chicken & spit it out, she said she did not like it. I tried it to see if the seasoning was off, but no it was the chicken. This was disgusting, chicken tasted like if it was in the freezer for long time & they decided to cook it. It was dry & it had like a old freezer taste. I had to throw it away, I would have like to take it back,  but I ordered this for to go @ Pancho villa counter. I would not go here again this has already been a second time & same goes with the San Mateo location. Bad service there & not consistent with freshness of food.
author: Andrea R.

description: If I could give less than one star I would. I waited over 45 minutes for 2 chicken tacos. Absolutely ridiculous. I would not recommend this place based on this wait time which seems unreasonable.
author: Sean M.

description:
Let me start this review off with it pains me to give this place a three star review however amazing food is not the only important part to a dining experience.  Believe me I'm not expecting a candle lit dinner and table side service I'm just asking for simple common courtesy.

When we first walked up the counter no one addressed us or even acknowledged our presence ( coolio  ) so my boyfriend gets their attention while I go snag a table.  As I'm going back up to pay the man at the register had an attitude. He quickly held up a receipt and was like is this your order ? I'm like I don't know I can't see what's on the receipt bc you are holding it.  Then I was like is it a steak quesadilla and a burrito and it cuts me off and is like yes then he was like anything else and I was like no but changed my mind and wanted soda.  With an attitude he cancels the transaction, rolls his eyes, and says is that anything else. 

Later once we were ready to leave my boyfriend went to go grab me a to go container and a bag.  When he comes back he tells me about how rude they were and how he couldn't get anyone's attention.  Then he said they made him get his own container and we're mad when he asked for a bag. 

We live in Oakland were they have some of the best Mexican food.  We legit went out of our way to eat there so some better treatment next time would be great
author: Sukari H.

description:
Pancho Villa Taqueria is an experience as it is the quintessential place to get a Mission style burrito in the Mission. It gets super busy at lunch time as it is a popular place. I recently went here getting a Tofu Ranchero Burrito for $5.95 plus the extras I chose guacamole for .75 cents & lettuce for .35 cents so my total came to $7.67 including tax. I paid & was given a number. 

I was given some corn chips & found a seat luckily as it gets crazy busy here during the lunch hour. I went to the stellar salsa bar to get some salsa, hot peppers, radishes, & pickled carrots w/ jalapeño. I enjoyed my chips & salsa. After a short while my tofu ranchero burrito was delivered to my table. It was filling & flavorful. 

The ambience here is hectic & busy which could be a plus or minus depending on what you are in the mood for. One room for improvement is on the salsa bar it would be great if the salsas were labeled mild, medium, or spicy etc as the aren't labeled. You might do like I did ending up with a very spicy salsa when I was expecting it to be milder.

Their website is
sfpanchovilla.com
author: Shane S.

description: This place has been around forever. They have a Ton of offerings and there will be a line on the weekends.  The ingredients seem decent and the place has been very consistent over the years. Having said this I really don't see anything that really sticks out. It's fine but nothing is really above average compared to other taquerias in the area. It's a fine place to eat but nothing will likely change your life here.
author: Robert C.

description:
PLEASE BE AWARE IT CAN TAKE 35 - 45 MINUTES FROM THE DOOR TO GET YOUR FOOD DURING PEAK ONLINE DELIVERY TIME, plan according. 

I sometimes crave the fresh, hot food they serve here.  I give it a solid 4 1/2 stars.  Always fresh and tasty.  Amazing chips and full salsa bar with lots of extra veggies.  

Reason for the one star rating below:

Tonight I walked in the door at 7:32pm, paid for my meal at 7:42, was handed my burrito at 8:05pm.   
The cashier did not let me know there would be a 20+ minute wait for my food. The food prep area is not large enough to accommodate enough workers to prepare the food for online/walk-in orders in a timely manner. Priority needs to be given to walk-in customers orders. The online orders sat on the shelf for 10-15mins before they got picked up by the driver.  Is anyone in management even paying attention because you're providing a terrible walk-in customer experience.  
I can't say I'll have the time to come back and wait anytime soon. Let me know when this issue has been fixed so I can update my review.
author: Matt D.

description:
Ya know, there's like 2 things in SF that are open late(ish), serve food that's decent, and are affordable and this is one of them.

Prawn burrito- built like a pipe, tasty, affordable, def a full meal. Add from that salsa bar and you're in good hands.

Prawn Quesadilla- With fresh veggie bits, spicy jalapeño kick, and more than fair amount of quality Prawns. 

Horchata- a bit grainy but good. Not a bad beverage to switch to after the bars. 

Service is fast, friendly, and the menu is surprisingly vegetarian friendly. You almost have to search a little find the meat.
author: Candice G.

description: I wish I could give this place ZERO stars! I ordered from them at 3 pm for a delivery at 6:30pm!!! I called to confirm, yes they have it, at 6:41pm NOTHING! Driving is WAITING for them to make it at 6:41pm!!!! Are you kidding me?!?!?!
author: Caren W.

description:
Since this location is purposely not showing the SFDPH  scorecard in restaurant, let's go to the source and just show it to you: 64 due to many citations including "high risk vermin infestation". 

I came in yesterday and they had NO SOAP in the dispenser in the kitchen or either restroom - disgusting and a great way to make everyone sick! They actually had a water cup of soap in ONE restroom and kitchen.  

This was my favorite restaurant for over 16 years- between this location, the former Pier 1 location and San Mateo, I eat here at least 2x/wk. They just lost my faith and business. It's been obvious the cleanliness has gone down hill - tables wiped with dirty rags, if at all, bathrooms dirtier and dirtier.  

I don't come to eat to get sick. NEVER AGAIN.
author: Jason N.

description: Waited 30 minutes, never got my burrito and had to cancel my order. Service used be so good, seems to have gone downhill
author: Marlo M.

description: I got 6 tacos (2x 3-taco deal) for takeout. Massive amount of meat, very delicious. I'd recommend next time (and this is also a note to self) to request no beans and more salsa fresca.
author: Josh L.

description:
Absolutely love the place. They got a great system going. You to through the line, first watching them cooking the delicious food on the big grill, then ordering your food, then paying for it.

Not a lot of seats, but worth a visit!
author: Do P.

description:
I stopped by on Friday to pick up a burrito and super nachos, and decided to add a pint of Lengua ($8.95 a steal) to my order, then I saw the flautas..I had to add 4 to my order.  The food was great as always.  I had the nachos watching the Warriors game, and the burrito the next day.
Would have been 5*'s but I had to wait almost 20min, when it wasn't that busy, and I didn't realize it until way later, but I only received a 1/2 pint of the lengua, what a bummer.  All in all I hade a couple of GREAT meals from this visit.  This is my go to in the "hood."  I'm glad i came when it wasn't too busy.
author: tom l.

description:
After a long day of exploring not only the Mission, but all of San Francisco with a friend, I was longing for a Mission burrito. Having already checked out El Farolito and La Taqueria on previous occasions, I decided to go where the person which I was with at the moment wanted to go to, and this happened to be Pancho Villa.

As soon as you walk in to Pancho Villa, the first smell that will hit you is that of their carne asada. This, along with the recommendation of the friend I was with, solidified that I would be ordering a carne asada burrito. The line can seem daunting at first, and it can be quite annoying when you are starving in line waiting with what seems to be hundreds of workers in the kitchen yet there you are, still in the same spot fifteen minutes later...

Despite the mess that is their ordering system, I eventually got to the front of the line and ordered for my friend and I- it turned out to be $25 for two carne asada burritos, two horchatas, and tip. Pancho Villa definitely gets one star for free chips and their extensive self-serve salsa bar. Try the orange salsa, you will not be disappointed!

As my experience with Pancho Villa was mixed up to this point, all depended on the burrito. After only having had one meal all day, I was more than excited to unwrap this burrito and eat it.

However, I ended up being largely disappointed when it came to actually eating the burrito. Coming from a small town in which there is an abundance of Mexican food, I was confused when I noticed that the rice in Pancho Villa's burritos includes peas and carrots, ya know those peas and carrots that come with frozen rice? Yeah, doesn't seem very appetizing, right? This caught me off guard and honestly ruined the burrito for me. Pancho Villa's- if the rice in your burrito is going to include peas and carrots, please note so somewhere, anywhere, this is not custom in literally any Mexican establishment that sells food.

I sadly will not be returning due to this. Would definitely recommend either El Farolito or La Taqueria!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Bottom line: Yummy food! Super burrito with prawns. Chips and salsa bar. Many choices of agua fresca. Patient staff.

Food: I got the super burrito with both carne asada and prawns. I'm usually a beef fan, but decided to get both types of protein after reading some reviews. I am glad, because the prawns were extremely tasty! I think I would have been disappointed if I had gotten only the carne asada.

Context: Visited 2pm on a Saturday

Service: Patient, even going through a long line of customers.
It was loud, so I had to ask to repeat themselves a few times. And I didn't know the system of going through different registers to order food vs pay, so had to be directed. Even so, the staff never showed impatience.

Environment: Had to wait in line for a bit to order.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: This has been my go to spot for excellent tasty burritos!! Omg nothing will ever top this small hole in the wall taqueria... I mean ever! The food is bomb and I have been eating here since I was a kid (around 25) years! I'm 37 FYI and a San Francisco native and trust me I've eating at plenty of taquerias! Eat here and you will not be disappointed.
author: Noelle S.

description: I went here the other night and it was packed! The tables were filled and the line was long but not out the door. With a quick check-in on yelp, I noticed the $2 off coupon for a Super Burrito so I proceeded to save myself a few bucks. I also got a pork tamale which was even bigger than the burrito. My eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach but both items came out to be around $10 dollars so there was no way I would miss out. It was fast and efficient but the reason for the 3 stars was the lack of meat inside my tamale, salsa bar was okay, and the cleanliness was lacking. The super burrito was pretty good but I would not get the tamale again. Compared to other Mexican restaurants, the tamale is half the size but competitors have more meat. Overall and okay place to go to, but better Mexican food is just around the corner.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
I can see why this place always has a big line! Their burritos are very generous, not to mention super reasonable in price. I ordered a big ol' veggie burrito (add guac, because life is short!). It only cost about $6 plus tax. 

Their prices and flavors are outstanding. Their salsa bar is also on point. The salsa verde and a squeeze of fresh lime really brightened up the beans and rice. I ordered mine spicy, but it didn't seem to be very hot. Next time, I'll have to ask for it extra-extra spicy. I love a nice little kick of heat to wake me the f up. 

Make sure to procure a tasty beverage for only a couple bucks more. I opted for the pineapple Jarritos and it was bubbly and refreshing. 

Even the chips were perfectly crisp, not too salty or oily. I could eat many handfuls of these. If you've got the $, order extra. 

Vegetarian or vegan? Don't fret, there are so many options. During peak hours, they do grill their meats right next to the line to order. If that grosses you out, maybe venture elsewhere. Otherwise, mosey on down to this spot. It's super close to 16th and Mission BART, many bus stops, dive bars, and the Roxie movie theater. 

I love this spot because even on a budget, you can find something delicious.
author: Brandi W.

description: Salad with chicken and prawns was delicious but perhaps a little more messy than a burrito. Is there a way to put a salad inside a tortilla? Preferably a spinach tortilla.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
In life, there are a handful of things one must do before they leave this Earth. 
1. Get married 
2. Have a family 
3. Take that family to Disneyland 
4. Drive from Disneyland all the way to the Bay and eat dinner at Pancho Villa. 


Pancho Villa has changed my outlook on a rice filled burrito. I was not a fan of the rice as I believed it was just a "fill in" in the burrito and took away from the rest of the ingredients. Here at Pancho Villa though, you can taste the careful preparation they put into their food which really makes a difference, especially in their burritos. 

EATS: 

Asada and shrimp burrito. $9 
-So much flavor. The carne asada is char grilled and does not lack in the flavor department. The shrimp is also grilled which gives the burrito that "wow "factor. 
-the burrito is well balanced. There isn't too many of one thing, it is consistent in every bite. What I mean by this  is no one ingredient overpowers the rest. 
-the rice is seasoned, similar to fried rice, right amount of veggies. 

Garlic shrimp dinner plate $10 
-read that price, that's not a typo, it is legit only 10 dollars. 
-when served, you feel as if you're getting something worth at least $18. The serving size is huge! 
-served with: fresh off the grill prawns(shell on), fresh off the grill mushrooms, beans to your liking, house rice, fresh avocado, and tortillas to your liking. 

Pancho Villa is hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant. I believed I could only find the best Mexican food in SoCal, but now I know, the best resides out here in the Bay.
author: James L.

description:
Let's get straight to the point. Hands down the BEST Mexican food I've ever had. I've had So Cal Mexican food which is supposedly the best of the best. But NO YOU ARE WRONG! Pancho Villa is the best! 

There is always a line so prepare for that. While you wait, you can admire the workers preparing the food and decide on what you want. I highly recommend the garlic shrimp plate. That's all I've ever gotten and it never fails me. The shrimp plate comes with around ten pieces of shrimp which is amazing since most places are stingy. The shrimp is cooked with tons of garlic and mushrooms. The plate also comes with your choice of black or pinto beans, rice, and half an avocado. DELICIOUS!!

Their salsa bar is great. My favorite one is the orange salsa. Their horchata and agua frescas are nice and refreshing. They have a few check in deals so be sure to check in. Parking is horrendous but this is the city we're talking about. Quick and friendly service. 

YOU MUST GO HERE. THE END.
author: Melissa M.

description: Haven't been here in years. Used to love this place. Tried the cheese enchilada meal and the super quesadilla with chicken (I was hungry and ordered two meals for myself). The enchiladas were coated in spaghetti sauce, most disgusting enchiladas I have ever had. The quesadillas were filled with large quantities of very wet ice berg lettuce, basically biting into mostly water as it dropped out the bottom. Couldn't get through more than a few bites of either despite my hunger. Went down the street for papusas that were great.
author: Zane S.

description:
I dined in to this taqueria yesterday for lunch and was not disappointed. It is fast pace, no frills, affordable, and completely delicious. I got a grilled vegetable burrito and was pleasantly surprised to see the veggies included broccoli and zucchini. 

I waited only about 10 minutes for my food and they also offer free chips - who can say no to that? I will definitely be returning.
author: Megan L.

description:
I've been here a couple times.  The prices are very low and the food is quite good, although the nachos I got last time were soggy by the time I actually received them.

So why three stars?  Well, it took roughly half an hour to get an order of vegetarian nachos.  They churned out Eat24/Uber Eats/whatever orders non-stop, but only occasionally served a customer who was actually there.  People were obviously growing angry with the situation, watching order after order after order get made, bagged, and stuck on the shelf for drivers to pick up, while we all stood around waiting and waiting and waiting.
author: Jason F.

description: A good reliable late night spot open till midnight for Mexican. Stumbled right before closed and ordered a shrimp and steak quesadilla and boy did It hit the spot.
