There was a line but it moved fast and I didn't have to wait long for my food. The staff were courteous and friendly and got my order done quickly. The quesadilla while not the best I've had was certainly more then good enough to satisfy my late night craving. Had the right amount of steak and shrimp and was just cooked right, the right amount of cheese and crispness. Not my go to spot for Mexican eats but wouldn't pass it up if I were nearby and hungry.
author: Peter P.

description:
Yum yum yum! Went here for the first time ever this past month and was so happy my friend picked this place. Located is the slightly sketchier side of the mission, this restaurant was happening!  Hipsters and Mexicans all gather here for lunch so it must be good. 

We ordered the taco combo, which is 8 dollars for three tacos I believe, and a super burrito to share amongst two people. If you check in on yelp, the super burrito is 2 dollars off. What a great deal!  The super burrito came with meat, we got carne asada, choice of beans, we chose black beans, rice, pico de gallo salsa, sour cream, guacamole and cheese. You can choose spicy or mild salsa. We got spicy but honestly we couldn't even really taste it. 

For the tacos we got lengua, al pastor and carnitas. Tacos came with beans and salsa. The tacos are really big and its juicy so it's a little hard to eat. You gotta use both hands and some utensils to manage it. The lengua was really good!  Super tender and moist meat. The al pastor had the best flavor. It was the most flavorful meat compared to the rest including the carne asada. The carnitas was good. Wasn't dry or too fatty, but it was my least favorite meat out of the four. 

The super burrito was great. Loved the Guac and the sour cream combo. Normally I don't like beans too much but I didn't mind it in this burrito. With every meal they give you complimentary chips. There's also a Sala bar with many varieties!   Becareful as some are super super spicy!  I'm not sure of the names because it was labeled but I pretty much got one of each. Taste it first before you douse it onto your food!
author: Suzanne W.

description: Sad to say I'll probably never go here again. After being a regular customer for probably close to 25 years, I just can't anymore. Their service had degraded over the years that it's just not worth my time to come here when there are other taquerias in the neighborhood just as good. They never answer the phone anymore so I've had to resort to ordering through Grubhub. The last 4 times I've had to wait close to half an hour after my food was due to get it. Too bad. It's hard to say goodbye to an old favorite but it's never good to stay in a bad relationship.
author: Golapendu N.

description: Best value place for mexican food. The burritos are huge, tasty, and cheap. The meat quality in the burrito is pretty good. The ingredients are also very fresh as they get alot of traffic throughout the day. Goos selection of salsas
author: Diane Z.

description: This is where we order 30+ burritos for our school lunch every month. Really delicious food with great vegetarian options and gluten-free menu items. So many salsa options and so little time :) Highly recommend the chicken avocado salad with the house caesar dressing. Located conveniently in the Mission by the BART station on 16th.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Food was ok but service was below par. I place a order at
6:50pm through grub hub. Went to pick up at 7:45pm wasn't even ready. Had to seriously start waving for someone to help me with the status of the order. The guy went back to look but never came back with a status. Didn't get my order til 8:20pm. This is crazy for a burrito, shrimp plate , guacamole and chips and a tamale.
author: Jay B.

description:
This was a REALLY affordable and totally yummy late evening munchie food. 

I loved my agua fresca lemon, my fish taco ,and the chile from the toppings bar was head-on-fire hot, in a good way. 

Everyone behind the counter seemed super busy, organized, and professional and looked super midwesternly cute in their uniforms. 

I wanted to try everything I saw but I don't want to be 200 pounds so...I'll have to go back.
author: Tanya W.

description: Mexican food here is pretty mediocre. I was very surprised to see such a big line after tasting their food. Makes you think that the food will be great. I ordered two tacos. It came with cheese (real Mexican tacos don't have cheese) and guacamole. The guac tasted as if it was prepackaged guacamole from Costco. Definitely not homemade. Definitely don't recommend.
author: Silvia D.

description:
I ordered from Door dash...
Minus one star for the stale chips in me and my daughter's nachos- 2 orders of stale nachos!!
Minus one star for not contacting me when you couldn't fulfill my request per my request to contact me or offer a comparable item
Minus one star because you knew you took my money and said I need to contact door dash for a refund
Minus one star for the bad after taste of the stale nachos
author: Vonny K.

description: Literally can eat this place for lunch everyday if I could. The burritos here are just that good!
author: Kafilat Y.

description:
I ordered a Super Taco via delivery and got a bowl of taco fixings with two soggy shells at the bottom.

Same delivery, I ordered an Alfajor for dessert, which never even arrived.

What I did receive tasted alright, but I would not order from this restaurant again.
author: Dylan W.

description:
Good food, line can get a bit long, and decent prices.

Very missiony feeling vibe and a solid salsa bar.
author: Altair T.

description:
This was worth the wait. I got to the restaurant during lunch hour on a Friday, but the wait was only 20 minutes. 

The food it's cooked and made just in front of you. I knew right away I was going to get carne asada - I just couldn't not get fresh carne asada. I ended up getting a carne asada mojado super burrito. The food was absolutely delicious, and a big plus is that this place is a block away from the 16th Street Bart station. I would come back to this place just for lunch.
author: Daniel K.

description: 4 stars for taking back my order to remake it since i ordered super burrito but was given regular burrito.  No inquisition. Chips were included.  The tongue was salty but very tender.  They are super fast even though there is a line. Those are worker bees. The shrimp was excellent. Beef (asada) was a  bit tough. Loved the salsa bar variety with radishes.  Interesting leather stools.   A bit smokey and steamy.   Grilled chicken looked good.  The best horchata as someone mentioned on yelp. Smooth not gritty. The combination plate was hugh.  Next time I'll get the taco, a meal in a small order.
author: Helen L.

description:
Very tasty food love all the variety of salsas and águas frescas that they have 
definitely going back
author: Katy C.

description: This deserves 5 stars for always serving things the way it should be. Delicious authentic taqueria food at excellent prices. I been eating here for years and failed to do them justice and write this review. Check it out if you're ever around the area.
author: R M.

description: First time here and always assumed you can't go wrong with Mexican food in the Mission, but sadly I was wrong and extremely disappointed. I ordered 2 super burritos with no cheese or lettuce, but still ended up with burritos full of lettuce and "no sour cream." What's the point of making a super burrito without the sour cream? And on top of that, I paid $10.50 for each burrito which wasn't even that good. What an overpriced and complete rip off of a burrito. I'll stick to Mexican food on the south end of Mission.
author: Ha D.

description: Salsas are good. Chips are eh. I ordered a vegetarian burrito, an avocado ceasar salad, and a chicken flauta. What arrived was a vegetarian burrito, a chicken salad, and no flauta. It was really frustrating because I had a conversation with the person who took my order and she asked if I wanted meat on the salad and I said no. She explained how the flauta was prepared. I don't know what happened to the order. The salad was fresh and laden with chicken. I was very disappointed with the forgotten flauta and I really wanted the avocado salad. The food took a long time to come and I was really hungry. It was also really hot in there. Bathroom was filthy. Mango agua fresca was excellent.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Shout out to Pancho Villa for being my go to place during my birthday weekend. Yes I decided to celebrate my birthday meal with friends with burritos and it was one of the better decisions. 

The asada burrito and pastor burrito are so so so good! Check in on Yelp and you can get $2 off a Super Burrito! What a great deal. The portions are huge most of us could not finish the entire thing. 

I love the salsa bar they have a great variety of different salsas that suit everyone's taste buds. The agua Frescas are so good as well! 

I had to stop by again to conclude my weekend because I was truly just craving the burrito the entire time.
author: Yinja L.

description:
I've been frequenting Pancho Villa since 2005. Even after moving back East, I still make it a point to stop by when I am in the neighborhood! It's definitely much busier than I remember it to be, which means I am always waiting in line! Boo.

I always get the Super Steak & Shrimp burrito or Super Shrimp. I love that their shrimp is cut large, plump and has the perfect amount of pop to it. I always do a spinach tortilla, refried black beans, no rice and hot salsa! I love their pickle and salsa bar, makes life so much easier!

Service is good, but much slower now that they are super busy all the time.

Prices have increased, but for the size of the burrito - it's worth it.

Frescas are delicious here as well!

Definitely a SF staple. Location is super convenient to BART.
author: Natasha S.

description:
5 stars for the super chicken fajita burrito! Smoky,, flavorful delicious. Wow! Had it delivered so didn't get a chance to check out the spot.
I will definitely go back when they get their food score back up!
author: Joe R.

description: This place is great. Down and dirty taqueria that has all your typical meats. The burrito I got was huge and the chicken was very juicy. I love that their green sauce isn't too spicy. The place is very big with plenty of places to sit.
author: Kristine C.

description:
This low rating is for the super flour quesadilla, which I thought was bland. 
There wasn't enough cheese, the lettuce was soggy and the tortilla was hard, not soft and chewy.
Portion wasn't big but this is one of the cheaper item on the menu and it was enough for me.

Their complementary chips are good but you don't get a lot. They have a salsa bar with a lot of choices.

Although I didn't like the quesadilla, their meats look amazing so I will come back to try the burrito! 

Place is big with lots of seating, you can call to order ahead too. Service was fast and staff friendly.
author: Coralie S.

description:
The super burrito was actually pretty bad. I guess I can't complain too much because it came out to be around $7 after using the check-in coupon, but there is way better Mexican food elsewhere in the Mission. The lettuce and fixins of the super burrito detract from the flavor and there was hardly any meat inside -- it was mostly rice, beans, and lettuce. Really disappointing. This place does have a cool salsa bar, and strangely a large selection of beans (black refried, pinto, plain refried) for your burrito? It's also cleaner than places like El Farolito, but let's be real, we're not here for clean seats. 

TL;DR if you're craving Mexican you'll have better luck elsewhere in the Mission. People seem to have better luck with the Especial burrito / other menu items rather than the Super burrito.
author: Selena S.

description:
Got a deluxe burrito and my friend got a super. Tasted pretty much the same, and really bland. Like, white-washed bland. None of that delicious authentic Mexican flavor or atmosphere. Halfway through my burrito I found a blue spot on my tortilla that looked like mold-- praying I don't get food poisoning from this place. 

The churros were ok and the horchata was good, and they brought the burritos to our table. That's about it for the plus side. I hear they're famous for their salsa, but the one we tried was gross. Like, made me make a face gross. 

Wouldn't recommend this place if you want good Mexican food. Looks flashy but the food quality isn't worth the money.
author: Maria K.

description: Pancho villa is like an old trusted friend that you can always count on for good food any time of the day. My three favorite taco meat choices are carnitas, carne asada, and lengua. The tacos come with chips and a very well stocked salsa bar. Be sure to try the habanero salsa and the salsa verde with any of the meat tacos. Where else can you get a solid mean for less than $10 in the mission these days? Occasionally, musicians will come through the restaurant and you'll get the sensory overload of mariachi with the smell of grilled meat, and the taste of warm tacos altogether at the same time.
author: D W.

description:
I truly love Mission for having all these wonderful authentic Mexican taquerias!! Another plus is how late they open at night!

Pancho Villa's menu is so vast that it's quite overwhelming to look at, but it's wonderful that they have so many options. From burritos, tacos, tamales, nachos, quesadillas, they are all reasonably priced for their big portion sizes. They also have aguas frescas and churros!! For each order, you get a small side of tortilla chips. There's also a salsa bar in the back and you can use their little menu on top to determine what they are and the level of hotness! My favorite is the salsa verde as many other places cannot compare to it!

It can get quite crowded at night and there's a security guard at the door. Your receipt number is called and it gets pretty hard to hear it due to the noise level. However, tables can also open up pretty fast. 
Take advantage of their offers on Yelp. If there's two offers available, you can only use one of them!
author: Mary Q.

description:
I used to go to Mission High school that is couple blocks away from this Mexican restaurant 20 yrs ago. I did go to this Pancho Villa Taqueria couple times and I was revisiting it yesterday.  It was terrible hot every time I went to the restaurant 20 yrs ago and I was glad finally they got normal room temperature for the 20 mins I spent inside the restaurant yesterday.  After I got my favorite food meat burrito,it didn't taste as good as what my old memory serves me but it is not the big problem. The big problem is their restaurant staffs are racism. Every one got free chips after order is placed and paid. I got special meat burrito meal that is second most expensive meat burrito meal and they didn't bother to pass me free chips. I ended up the only Asian and Chinese guy in the restaurant and the only guy who didn't get any chips on his dining table. You may ask why don't I simply ask for it? Well it is like you going to a Chinese restaurant,every one got his/her tea without asking and their waitress just ignores you.  You don't want to be treated differently.  Same thing as what happened yesterday. Every one got free chips automatically after order is paid but except me.  All customers were either Mexican or white guys. I was the only asian guy. It was very obviously they didn't want to serve me. For all experiences I have had with Mexican restaurants,that is first time I don't get any chips for my meal.  
At last,if you are Mexican and white guys,you may go visit this restaurant. On other hand,avoid this restaurant if you are asian guys.
author: Ji Jin Z.

description:
After walking around Mission for awhile searching for the best taqueria, we finally came across this one. While all the others had a couple people in them each, this place was from my POV packed for a Thursday night at 6p..and our taste buds were soon to confirm why.

When we walked in, we waited in a line next to a glass shield where the chefs stood behind cooking mountains of meat, which almost added the element of dinner and a show.

Onto the menu, there were so many options to choose from, but because of the discount you get on Yelp when checking in, we got super burritos! And they definitely live up to their name in regards to size and satisfaction. Stuffed full of meat, rice, beans, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, guacamole, and your choice of mild or hot salsa. I got the "hot" salsa, and it was far from being overwhelmingly spicy if that is ever a fear of yours. In fact I went over to their salsa bar where they have an array of other salsas to choose from as well and piled on more!

Our order also came with a free side of chips which tasted amazing as well.

The ONLY issue I had was the food was so good, and served in huge portions, that I was so bloated by the end of the meal we had to cancel our ice cream plans after and wobbled home instead.

Definitely a must if you haven't been here yet!
Sadly I was only visiting San Francisco for the weekend, but will most certainly make a trip here every time I'm back in town!
author: Michael H.

description:
I am by no means a vegetarian. I love me some meat. BUT at Pancho Villa, I get the Super Vegetarian Burrito, refried black beans, and no rice. Trust me. It is delicious. 

But maybe you don't trust me, and you want some meat. In that case, the carne asada is delicious, pollo asado is delcious. Shrimp and fish tacos are to die for. 

The salsa bar is the best in the Mission and that is not an exaggeration.
author: Anthony G.

description: Best TACOS I've had since visiting SF...doesn't hurt I came during happy hour also (1.50) but the portions are definitely generous. My go to spot from now on.
author: Donnie B.

description:
This place is the real deal! I ordered delivery through door dash. (my first time using the ap it was pretty cool) but lets get back to this spectacular food. 
I ordered a chili Verde pulled pork super burrito. I just love all the extras. You can customize your burrito. Re fried or whole beans ( i like that i get to choose. )
The burrito was pretty spicy. Lots of chunky jalapeno. The pork was very delicious. I WILL be back for more. The super burrito is way too big for one person to enjoy. So find someone to share it with. 

I also ordered chips and guac. Not super amazing but great flavor for the guac. Looked a little watered down. The chips were great. Thin and crispy. 

The reviews speak for themselves. this place is totally worth a shot.
author: Kat D.

description: Had the wet Carne Asada super burrito with red sauce. Most seasoned to perfection sauce and burrito I've had in the Bay Area. Love this spot.
author: Mark S.

description:
While I might not understand why there's beans on my tacos, I understand decent tacos.

These are decent tacos. Skip the carne asada.

For some reason, limes don't come with the tacos. They are, however, available at the salsa bar. Highly recommend the salsa verde.

The card machine takes an unusually long time to do it's thing and it gets pretty loud inside. 

Still, decent tacos and great salsa verde.
author: Loli L.

description: This place is far better than el faralitos. The portion sizes are huge and filling. Also everything is super affordable and worth the price. I come all the time and have tried half of the menu from the nachos to the tacos and the burrito. I highly recommend choosing the meat option lengua (beef tongue I know but it's so tender!!).  They also don't skimp on the meat and serve chips along side a lot of their items for free. Additionally, for work and dinner I'll buy the pint of rice and meat to use for meal prepping during the week. I'd say this is the best taqueria in the city by far.
author: Kalani R.

description: Love the logo, but the sliding horse doesn't touch the fire grilled beef and shrimp with delish fresh ingredients.  Additionally, it is very cheap! Unbelievably cheap!! I want to come back on Thursday night to hear the mariachi
author: Moses S.

description: Pancho Villa offers delicious vegan options and an excellent salsa bar! I hated burritos until I tried Pancho Villa...they just do it right. I especially love vegetarian burrito "C" with avocado, so good!!!
author: Christina M.

description:
I have been here several times! I'll tell you the reasons I keep coming back 

Pros: The food is delicious! You can watch it be made right in front of you. Theres so many options on the menu, they truly have a nice variety.

Cons: Its always crowded so there's usually a line 

Tip: Call your order in!

Ambience: Is ok, a little scrunched and the tables are small. I usually take my food to go! 

Overall: its great and a community favorite
author: Quania J.

description:
Out of all the delicious places to grab lunch in San Francisco I came down to this one. I was sold because of their many options from meat eaters to vegetarian and also their Yelp coupon of $2 off the super burrito. As my boyfriend and I walked in we took a look at the place and the menu. We stood in a line to place our order. (Prepare yourself and know what you want) The lady at the register was rude. Being new to this restaurant we had no idea what the ordering process was. She made us feel stupid and incompetent. I was trying to show her the Yelp coupon and without words she just pointed to ANOTHER register. I assumed that's where we pay right? I get that this place can get extremely busy, I just wished the employees were a little bit more content with their customers. 

Now to the food, we both ordered a carne asada burrito and a watermelon drink. They had burritos with different meats and also with different ingredients. My boyfriend had the super and I had the especial. They were both HUGE! Our tab with the coupon and 2 drinks was $22. I thought it was a a great deal considering the size of those burritos. They were really delicious too. Probably one of the best I've ever had. I also really enjoyed the watermelon drink. It was very flavorful and refreshing. I would give this place 5 stars but the service is lacking and the seating is not so great. In the future, if I'm ever back in San Francisco I would just grab this to go and take it back to the hotel lol.
author: Arissa G.

description: Excellent food! I came here when I was a kid and I try to come back every time I come back home. Good vegetarian options especially the vegetarian burrito. From my friends the meat dishes are delicious and so is the horchata. I will definitely come here again. Located just close to mission Dolores.
author: Ramiro S.

description:
One of my go tos in the city.. can't go wrong with Pancho villa, it's usually busy. I love the burritos and the limon agua fresca is the besssst. I'm a huge fan of the saucy chicken.. and not every taqueria has this option.
4 stars because though I do fancy this place I have a few other hidden gems that beat PV by a short mile.
If you're nearby this place, it's definitely a thumbs up.
author: JL S.

description: Second time eating here, cant say it's the best I've had better. Tacos are huge so don't order too many. Long line to order and pay, tables all taken, and the restaurant including the bathrooms need a good cleaning. Wasnt very impressed dont think i'll be back any time soon
author: J C.

description:
I got my food delivered and half of my order was missing.  The burrito was good but they forgot my "Killer Refried beans and cheese"
I was disappointed
author: Nan M.

description: Honestly, I don't think any Mexican place in the Mission is going to get less than 4 stars from me. I would have given this 5, but they messed up my order slightly, so docking one. I ordered a chicken super burrito since I got the Yelp check-in coupon for it, but they ended up giving me a regular chicken burrito. They still gave the $2 off but it wasn't what I ordered. That being said, I didn't really realize it until I was about 2/3 of my way through eating it because it was so delicious. I also had the horchata which was great. Even though the portions are pretty big, I didn't feel like it was too heavy. Bottom line: really good food for good prices. I just recommend double-checking your order with them, especially if it's at a super busy time of day.
author: Pooja C.

description:
On a random Saturday with no plans, I had one goal in mind: go to the Mission and get tacos. This place is riiiiight next to Bart, making it the perfect first stop on my Tour de Tacos. The line was wild but moved quickly, and it snaked right past the chefs chopping up and cooking all the food. Mouth watering. I got a pastor taco, a chili verde pork, and a carnitas. Basically it was all about the pork for me, I guess. I would rank them in that order as well. My boyfriend got the carne asada, which was dry and unspectacular. I wouldn't recommend it, go to La Corneta or Farolito instead for your carne asada fix. 
The salsa bar is truly a gift from heaven, if not a little hard to navigate with the crowd of people waiting for their food. I love the offbeat art in here and how much seating there is, especially for people-watching the frantic Doordash employees picking up 17 burritos at once.
author: Delaynie K.

description:
I just want to say that I actually hate burritos of all kinds but this place changed my mind. Their garlic mushrooms were the game changer. Their meat was super fresh as I watched their cooks cook each item and put it in the food tray.

This beats chipotle and I LOVE chipotle. Come and check it out. It's super affordable too. Go super or go home!
author: Vanessa K.

description: V cute place, do able line that moved. Had cheese enchiladas dinner portion, two black bean and carne asada burritos.  Referee black beans were awesome!!!  I ate my cheese enchilada cold so the cheese were v salty.  I can live on beans and rice.
author: Kam L.

description: This is about a couple months late but here it is.  I have no complaints. I had a carne asada burrito that was delicious.  The staff was nice and the place was clean.  Will visit again when I'm in the area.
author: Ivan G.

description:
Dear Management,

You don't have a license for live entertainment and secondly have you ever seen anyone that has paid good money enjoying your below health code burrito appreciate the guy screaming songs and strumming his guitar in the restaurant!? You can't even talk, you can't even think, you just want to get the hell out. PLEASE NOTE: the issue is the volume it goes over the people talking, your friend trying to tell you about their day, the restaurant when they are calling out your order number. Anyways I will stop by this week and record a video for people to decide.
author: Gracie A.

description: Good place for Tacos and soups.. we ordered tacos and lamb stew soup .. good quality and quantity.. the place is big and good for groups.. a bit messy and old..
author: Ray K.

description:
Came here and got 2 burritos to go - Al Pastor and Carne Asada. It took a while before we could dig into them. It was a good burrito but not worth the long wait. Seems we came during a rush, when we left the line had died down. The refried beans seemed to be the dominate flavor in my burrito. 

Aqua frescas were ok. They had a higher water to fruit ratio than what I'm used to.
author: melissa c.

description: Moved to South Bay and mostly miss Pancho. I used to eat burritos here erry day. Delicious, cheap, quick. No brainer!
author: Bill Z.

description:
This place is legendary and amazing.  The long line moves so quickly and the efficiency of the open kitchen is down to perfection.

Then there's the salsa bar.  OMG, there's a red sauce, an orange sauce, green sauce, white sauce, yellow sauce....  It just goes on & on and each had their own unique special flavor.  

Tacos were delicious.  Chile Rellenos were the best to date.  Stop by if you're ever in the Mission!
author: Seung Eun C.

description:
Yowza's the absolute best burritos in San Francisco and there are some tasty places in these parts.  Never disappoints and the salsa bar is amazing with so many choices.  This has been our go to burrito place for years, great customer service too! 
5 Star Yum Factor!!
author: Tina T.

description:
I'd give this 5 stars for the food and the service. It was delicious and very reasonably priced.

I'd give this 1 star for the bathrooms. There was pee all over the toilet seat and graffiti was written on the seat itself and the inside cover. The floors were drenched in water (hopefully not pee....) too.

So I'm averaging this rating to 3 stars. Also, I saw no scorecard for cleaniness...which worries me.
author: Katie M.

description: So inefficient , the staff is so unorganized , over an hour to get a single burrito!!
author: Mahmoud E.

description: I was in the city for work and had a night with my friends to stay in and chill. We decided to order delivery due to the good ratings. The time slowly crept past our quoted delivery time (45-60 minutes), and the phone was busy. Three hours after my order was confirmed, the food still hasn't been delivered! I finally got through on the phone and the guy who picked up appeared sarcastic in his responses to me, and wouldn't answer my questions. After a few minutes he put me on hold without warning and I ended up ending the call. It was such a disappointment! Who knows what happened to the food.
author: Jaimee L.

description: Amazing, fresh and spicy salsa's, great burritos, refreshing aqua frescas.  It was out 1st stop after landing at SFO.  We can't wait to come back.
author: Peggy S.

description: Have you had a burrito before? Probably not. Because Pancho Villa will redefine what a burrito is to you. These gargantuan taste-packed burritos are a must if you find yourself in the Mission district of SF.
author: Saahil A.

description: I got a super burrito here the last couple times I've been. Their tortillas are very soft and super burritos come with guac included. Very tasty and delicious :) I usually come here for drunk food after a night out
author: Kevin C.

description: Tasty burritos, but after asking about my order a dozen times and waiting almost an hour I still have no food yet tonight...
author: Christopher B.

description: From the Bay Area was looking for some good Mexican food and let me tell you this is the hotspot join and visit and you will be hundred percent satisfied great place great food
author: Michelle B.

description: My friend introduced me to this spot and the food was delicious! The salsa bar is awesome there were so many different sauces to try. The free chips were also a plus. I had gotten the super burrito with steak and shrimp. The shrimp was very flavorful and fresh! Def loved it!! The steak was okay overall the burrito was very filling! Loved how everything was seasoned perfectly! Would love to Come back and try the shrimp quesadilla!!
author: Sabrina L.

description: Great food!  Long wait.  Parking area is a bit tough.  Neighborhood is interesting and definitely a longer time spent exploring is need.
author: Anthony D.

description:
I ordered a delivery for lunch a few days ago, and I got sick from this food. I ordered a lengua burrito and a side of chips and guacamole. I thought the taste of the food was just okay. It wasn't until I got home when I got sick and was bedridden for days. Definitely will not order here again.

Here's an edit: I decided to look up their health score on the SF County Department of Public Health's website. Here's their score: 64 with vermin infestation and unsanitary/unclean surfaces for food. Good Lord. At least I know from now on to check up on a local county's health score when deciding what to eat.

Here's a link to the SF DPH if you don't believe me. 
https://101g-xnet.sfdph.org:8443/ords/f?p=132:2:::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:3651
author: Bradford C.

description:
Not sure what's up with the food warning. I've lived in the city for over 11 years and Pancho​ Villa is hands down the best! And the staff rules. 

Favorites: 
*Shrimp tacos w. guac
*Steak super burrito with refried black beans
*Steak nachos
*Any quesadilla - HUGE!
*Salsa verde - the salsa bar is everything

Skip:
*Flauta - giant and dry, and doesn't stay crispy
author: Corinne A.

description:
This is where the locals go. Lots of variety from vegetarian, fish, and beef specialties. 
There's also a bunch of fresh juices  (aguas frescas,) to choose from.  
We tried the fish, pork carnitas, and beef tongue soft tacos and they were tasty! 
There's a salsa bar with different varieties, so you could control how spicy you want your meal. 
No frills, casual seating, stool with no backs. 
Great place to catch up with friends and it's next door to the Bond Bar where you could grab cocktails beforehand! 
I'd definitely come back here when I'm back in the Mission.
author: Shelly S.

description: Super veggie burrito - best burrito in the mission. Sauces are excellent, particularly the salsa verde and the roasted tomato
author: Deirdre N.

description: This place has always been the place to go in the mission for a burrito. Came to visit and couldn't leave the city without stopping here first....
author: j p.

description: This is a great spot...i was overwhelmed by the menu and fruit water are a must have during hot days
author: Joseph S.

description: Ordered a small guacamole, charged $3.75 for a tiny cup, about 2 tablespoons. What a waste of money!
author: Douglas A.

description: My meat was dry and the pay area is confusing. We thought the order area was the pay station. The churro was nothing but oily and cold. Meat had a bunch of fat and was chewy. We often give a lot of stars to places but this place was off in taste etc and we drove far to get here. Agua fresca was good but won't be coming back here
author: Licia P.

description:
I call it The Salsa Place. Because an entire wall is dedicated to framed awards for their salsas, which they've won every single year since the early 2000s. Except for 2008. WHAT HAPPENED IN 2008?!

Toyota would be proud of this 21st century example of the modern manufacturing small batch assembly line. These people are professional.

Oh, and speaking of, there is a dude who works at The Salsa Place who does an incredible mental feat. Tell him your birthday and year, and he tells you what day of the week you were born on. I literally don't understand how he does it. Brute force memorization?

While the food is a perfect pitch between the pillars of quality and price, I'd advice you give then an extra 10 minutes to prepare a pickup order...from any platform. That's really my one complaint here is that pickup orders are usually late, sometimes by a lot.
author: Will C.

description: Went here bc I was as visiting SF ( used to live here) & really wanted a decent mission burrito even tho I'm vegan. I found a lot of taquerias on yelp that had vegan options and wish I had gone with a different one. The tofu ranchero burrito was bland & the tofu itself was plain white and unseasoned. Not sure why people on yelp were raving about it! Good guacamole but not a lot for your money. 20$ for a bland burrito guacamole and a modelo.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This is the best burrito and Mexican restaurant in San Mateo. It's fast casual, so be prepared to order before sitting down, but you'll likely have time to review the large menu as they're typically a line. But  on the bright side while your in line you can also watch the team preparing meals and cooking!

I usually opt for the pollo asada burrito and it's both large and affordable. Fresh ingredients and a big bonus is the Salsa bar available with delicious options. This also goes great on the free chips that come with orders.

You really can't go wrong here whether your grabbing something to go or enjoying on-site!
author: Peter D.

description: No matter how good your food is.....your bathroom needs to be in order for the people that you serve.2 restrooms....neither one had a toilet seat. One didn't fully flush.  Water leaking on the floor in both bathrooms.  Good luck!!
author: Shawn C.

description: Ordered via doordash, two super carne asada burritos and an order of asado pollo nachos. They did a great job on following our special customizations and the burritos were great but the chips on the nachos were soooo stale.  I don't know if it was because it was 9pm, but the chips in a bag that were included were perfectly fine and honestly seemed like a completely different chip. its a shame because it made the nachos basically inedible. Would come back for a burrito but probably wont ever order nachos again.
author: Kathryn S.

description:
I was down in the mission this weekend and craving some Mexican food because, why not?! My normal go-to taco shops were slightly out of walking distance so I decided to stick around 16th st and try something I haven't had before. I popped open my yelp app and found Pancho Villa. 

While I was impressed with the massive salsa bar, I found a few things that were just ok about this spot. Let's start with the chips...they didn't taste homemade and reminded me of the store bought kind. I ordered a super burrito with the green chile chicken (you know, the kind that sits in the deep pan, just chillin all day). While the tortilla was fine, solid rice, guac, etc., the chicken was really dry and I can't fathom why. 

The ambiance reminded me of Mexico. Which I love. There was also a guy rolling around playing guitar during service hours, so it helped with my dry burrito. All in all, service was fine and the people were super friendly. They are just a few tweaks away from being a legit stop for a burrito in the mission.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Who packages a hot quesadilla in an enclosed plastic container with wet salsa inside? By the time we got our to go order home it was wet like soggy bread. Made it inedible. 

A little more thought could be taken in your to go packaging.
author: Erik T.

description: This is my favorite place to get a burrito in SF. Born and raised in the Mission so I've been coming here since a baby with my family. I like how their food is always fresh and some new meats are always on the grill. My fav is the super chicken burrito or the super shrimp quesadilla. Friendly staff and team, and quality food.
author: Martin E.

description: Very busy taqueria a half block off Mission.  Line up and order at the counter.  Huge menu.  Went for an appetizer platter.  A little of everything.  Enjoyed the grilled shrimp and grilled green onions.  Salsa bar.  Lots of seating and clean bathrooms.  Prices OK, service fine.
author: Doctor G.

description:
Authentic food, there is always a line. This taqueria wins the salsa awards - who knew it existed. The super burrito is my go to, the chips are free. The guac - hmmm I've had better, but still recommended!

You might get overwhelmed by the menu, but trust me, the burrito is good. The staff is friendly, you might get confused where to pay, but there are two stations. So you order in the first one and pay in the second one. Make sure you get your number so they can hand out the food to you in your table.
author: Kevin L.

description:
"A half pint of black refried beans," I repeat clearly and slowly for the third time. 

A full 20 minutes later I receive a half pint of whole pinto beans. 

Not for the first or last time. 

 bean options
 salsa bar
 price
 value
 order accuracy
 food consistency (Basically just the grilled vegetables I always order with the beans)
 service

This place is tasty, cheap, sometimes fast, and easy. They do aim to hit the spot here. 

I'll be back for those beans!
author: Jessica F.

description: I have loved this place for decades but I've now been waiting for 35 minutes. For a burrito. Yes, I ordered 35 minutes ago. Oh SF, how far you have fallen.
author: Kate G.

description: Hands down my favorite taco place in the city. Why? Because they have LENGUA tacos! It is super good! $7 can get you 3 delicious, juicy, and authentic tacos. If you checked in on yelp, you can also get $2 off a super burrito! Super great deal and not to mention they have free chips:)
author: Yi K.

description: This is one of the busiest non sympathetic restaurants in San Francisco. They haven't won any awards since 2014 and i see why. The service is horrible, my whole order was wrong the desert was a cookie.. well a dried out hard cookie that usually is my favorite. The main manager was made aware of the mistake and non freshness of the food and shrugged his shoulders! Never again..
author: Lénzjae M.

description:
Was not disappointed by this place!! There was quite a line but it was worth the wait. So glad I checked in here and got a $2 discount on the super burrito. It was HUGE and so delicious. My favorite part was the large helping of avocado inside the burrito and the warm crispy chips. My friend and I both got the steak fajitas cause we were drooling over from just watching the steak get cooked. We also got the fresh juices (guava and mango) which was COMPLETELY worth it and so fresh and delicious!!
Mission burrito definitely lived up to its hype!!
author: Jackie P.

description: I came here after I was babysitting a friend's child. I was hungry and this place had good reviews.  I like that this place has delivery also, next time I am babysitting I will definatly order delivery even though it is 3 blocks away.  This place is reasonably priced for the amount of food you get. It is cheaper then gordo's in my neighborhood.  They make it for you and then they bring it out to you by calling your number.  The portions are bigger and it is good for the price.
author: Alix J.

description: While the lines may be huge, the food is highly worth. My favorite dish by far is the Super burrito. My only gripe would be the waiting time as your food can take up to 20 minutes to be served to you. Still, I do appreciate customer service as they are friendly and patient.
author: Leo C.

description:
I went over there by looking at the ratings and didn't pay attention to the low health score warning. I had a bad stomach the complete night and was not able to sleep.
I took a to-go of spicy super-vegetarian and tofu tacos. The food itself was good, however the packing technique definitely needs to be improved. I was not able to pick up the tacos since they were packed so closely and filled more than they could contain. I had to eat the veggies and the bread separately. 
May be I'll visit this place again once the health warning goes away.
author: Varun S.

description: Superb Super Burrito! Enough space for busy lunch time. Great deal collaboration  with yelp, so I got $2 off. Food was worthy enough for waiting in line for a while. Nacho chips for free ;)
author: Jiwon H.

description:
I so happy to have returned!! 

This place is now kept impeccable!

I am so happy they care not only for the quality of their food, but the customers!!

Seriously, during my short visit, there was the employee cleaning the bathroom, even had a clean bleach smell.. then as I was warring a person in the kitchens wiping where the plates are kept, another wiping the glass where we dine. 

This review is not really about cleanliness, but the fact that the care..

I am glad I came back and will for years to come...

BTW.. 
Had a 2 taco plate .. the beans the tacos, amazing!!
author: Trey C.

description: This is my go to taqueria. The service is fast and looks clean. Items with sauce (chicken, tongue, etc. ) do well in a burrito. Grilled prawns also are flavorful. Carne asada is dry whether in a burrito or on a plate. Their aguas frescas are well made, my favorite is the lime. Fresh squeezed and sweet enough.
author: Luis C.

description:
are you kidding me?  three delicious tacos for $4.50 (was a special price though) and a salsa bar included?  yea, definitely coming back here.  there was a line the entire time we were here and there is a reason for it.
 
plus where are you gonna eat this cheap in SFO.
author: Lukus T.

description: There is big line but goes fast. They put less meat inside everything. I had a big order and non of us get enough meat. I eat from other places same stuff too and same price they never miss that much meat. Nachos was so soft. I order super burrito there is no sour cream no Guatemole everything is extra. I dont like that.
author: İrem S.

description:
My new favorite burrito spot! I have tried several hyped burrito places, and this place is by far definitely one of the few top places on my top places for burritos list!

Don't forget to check Yelp for their deals! They have two deals: $2 off for a super burrito for $7 for $10 worth of food.

Food: Excellent! I ordered the steak fajita with grilled pepper and onions super burrito! The meat was very tender and flavorful with the onions and peppers. Although, I wish the pieces of meat were chopped into smaller pieces since it was a little difficult to take small bites and it was a mouthful every time. There is a perfect amount of everything that balances the flavors out. There is a huge selection of sauces and you should definitely try all of it. Most of the sauces are spicy, so if you can't handle spicy, watch out!

Atmosphere: Seating might be difficult and there is a security guarding the door as it gets later. Seating might be a little hard to find even though the place is big, but the tables clear fast since the bussers are working quickly to clean the tables for the next customers. This place could get so packed, there is even a line to leave the restaurant! 

Service: When you go to a casual place like this for a quick bite and casual place, you wouldn't expect much service. Even on a busy Friday night, the workers here seem energetic and were friendly even though some might have language barrier. The guy packaging up to-go orders asked me what my number was even though I only waited for a few minutes. He told my my order would be out quickly and told me where my number on the receipt was since I was unsure where it was stated. We asked the busser lady collecting our dirty dishes if the chips were free and she told us it was and encouraged us to go to the counter to ask for more.

For a beer and a super burrito, my meal came out to be less than $12! Great prices and great food! I cannot wait to come back again
author: Allie Y.

description: This place is incapable of fulfilling an order correctly when you are ordering thru a delivery service. If it's not a missing item then it is an improperly prepared meal. I decided I will no longer be placing orders with his business any longer.
author: Paris G.

description: I used to go to the San Mateo location and glad there is one here in the city! Super yummy burrito and it was huge! Line was extremely long, but it was  high noon. Wish they had faster service and more tables.
author: Aj C.

description:
Dear Management,

I don't know why you bother keeping this place open, you should close it and instead devote your attention to take out. I've been coming here for 27 years and never have I had to wait 35 minutes for one burrito because the staff is busy fulfilling take out orders. It's irritating to watch orders of 10-20 burritos being made while my one item takes forever. I just saw a warning on Yelp that you have a poor food safety score, so I might have to say goodbye, it's been fun, but I don't feel the love anymore.
author: Puddy C.

description: One of many great burrito places in the mission! They have a great variety of proteins/fillings, and the salsas are amazing - I was particularly fond of the green one, as were my friends. Customer service really varied from employee to employee, we had a bit of a wait (over half an hour), and the burritos came out at erratic intervals, but overall it was a delicious meal! We carried out, but it's a bit smoky if you dine in.
author: Maria S.

description: In the land of taquerias, Pancho Villa is one of the OGs. I actually remember sitting in those leather stools as a kid and eating burritos bigger than my head. Hadn't been in years and it really hasn't changed at all. It's always busy because it's cheap and delicious. Standard Mexican fare- I don't need to describe a burrito to you I hope. I will say service can be a bit slow. There's a ton of cooks but there's also a ton of back end orders coming from the delivery services (Grubhub,etc). You order, get a ticket, pay, and wait. Just a heads up bc it's not the type of taqueria where they make your burrito in real time (maybe they do when it's not so busy, but I never see it not busy so...). It's worth the wait. The food is fresh, there are good vegetarian options and they have a large variety of aguas frescas. Yum!
author: Joana Z.

description: Great Mexican food!  Great variety, including shrimp tacos.  The carnitas are memorable.  Great, unique-tasting salsas, too!  PV has been around for a long time.  After you've eaten here, you can see why.  Can't go wrong with PV.
author: Jeff D.

description: Best burritos and fajitas and salsa bar in the mission. I finally switched it up and got the pollo asada dinner. The broiled chicken was seasoned really well retained its moisture. Soo good and generous portions.
author: Christine K.

description: Super busy here! Lots of time there is a line but definitely worth the wait.  Love their burritos with any type of meat.  The restaurant is always clean and welcoming.
author: Gab T.

description: This maybe ranks as one of the worst meals I've had in my entire life. The place was crowded, so I had high hopes. They were immediately dashed by messy, disgusting, and bland food. The ONLY saving grace was the actual carnitas. The tacos were gloppy and falling apart. There was no sense of where the guacamole ended and the lettuce began. It was just put together as an after thought. The flautas (taquitos), were too big, not crispy and soaking in whatever sauce they put on them. The horchata had too much cinnamon and hardly any creamy taste and the churros were utterly forgettable. I don't know where the pictures that are already posted are from, but my food looked nothing like them and tasted nothing like what others are raving about. If you're craving good Mexican, go somewhere else!!
author: Ronnie M.

description:
Big burritos for a decent price. I got the spicy pork burrito and the thing was loaded. 

There's a lot of competition when it comes to Taquerias in the Mission but this place can hold its own. I like that the salsa is self service and unlimited unlike Papalotes. 

They offer a pretty huge selection burritos so it was pretty hard to decide... I wanted to try everything. 

I'll definitely be back to try their other menu items. Stay tuned for an updated review!
author: Milton F.

description: I ordered takeout through yelp/grubhub... prepaid with my card. My boyfriend went to pick it up and they said they needed to see his ID and wouldn't give him our food that we already paid for. He even said my name and told them exactly what we got. Wtf?
author: Yumi T.

description:
Dropped by on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. Yelp had a $7 for $10 which is such a great deal. I decided to order the shrimp and carne asada burrito + super per my friend's recommendation. It was good and super filling. 

The burrito comes with a side of free chips. I tried the green sauce, but it is quite spicy with the chips alone. However, mixing it with the burrito was just right. With the Yelp deal, this place is a serious steal.
author: Edward W.

description: Best burritos in town everything fresh lots of people preparing orders do the long line goes fast. Fresh fruit juices delicious!
author: Patricia H.

description: This place got the Live music and that authentic smoke in the air from the cooking. It was packed but we managed to find a long table that fits the eight of us, just in time while the food came out. The food came out pretty quickly. Their sauces we're good and had a good selection of them! The food is quite good for after a night of drinking. The chicken and asada burittos we're fresh and delicious. We couldn't individually finished the burritos! Definitely come back if we are in town for after hours food run.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Love the burritos, excellent selection of meats, fillers and sauces. Cool Mexican sodas, lovely staff, speedy service. Buskers sometimes. Seems pretty clean. Open late.

What's not to love about this place?
author: Xavier F.

description: New favorite in mission area. Very good quality meat, amazing salsas and though the place is always super packed, each order is made patiently. Hats off
author: Pramod G.

description:
This place is absolutely AMAZING. My co worker bought this to me when she came back from lunch and it was absolutely delicious. She got me a few tacos, guac and chips, and quesadilla with shrimp and steak along wrapped up in a spinach tortilla. The guac was so fresh and everything tasted delicious. I was never a huge fan of mexican food but this place really changed it all for me! Even though it was to go it was still amazing!! And my bf and I came to this place after work one day to try it and WOAH it was AMAZING!!! Absolutely loved everything. 

Great when you take bart, its less than a block away. Make sure that you go early and ahead of time cause the lines are LONG. They also do carry out- LOVE The boxes and tupperware!!!! In addition, the wait for take out is long. You can also do grub hub etc too!
author: Amy Y.

description:
If I ever move away from San Francisco, this place will forever be in my heart. The carnitas tacos here are my go to. I love the fresh ingredients and the friendly people who work here.

And I cannot fail to mention one of the best features of the place. The SALSA BAR! Oh my gosh it's so good. Sometimes I'm a true weirdo, and I just fill up my little salsa container and take sips of it while I stand there. Just a little appetizer before the food comes, you know.

Highly recommended!!
author: Jacob K.

description:
I've been coming here since 1994, and i can't believe how much the quality of the food has declined pretty badly in the past couple of years.  I don't know what has happened to this once exceptional place.
I'm on the search for my new "Mission burrito" spot.
author: John K.

description: The food was very good. I like the salsa Bar that was a nice choice. It was not very fast but they were pretty busy so I get that. I would go back for sure.
author: Scot M.

description:
Good burritos, but arguably better within a few blocks (Cancun, Farolito).

I ordered takeout an hour ahead, and it was still 30 minutes late while they made tons of burritos for all the walk-ins
author: Ben M.

description: THE BEST Taqueria in the city! Large portions, DELICIOUS salsa, and very clean!
author: Emi K.

description: Stopped by during our vacation in Frisco/Napa area for the week. Looked pretty popular considering the line. They had a large wall menu of various items that all looked delicious; but the one thing that I've had a HELLUVA time finding in SoCal, which apparently is regional native to Jalisco MX, are Tortas Ahogadas. This place had them AND they served them asada! Typically they serve it with pork only. It wasn't that spicy as I like them but it was refreshing to see this on a Mexican restaurant menu which I have NEVER SEEN! Oddly enough I had to travel 600 miles to get one . Minus two stars because the restroom was clogged with toilet paper & looked like the local homeless use it as a shower on the regular and of course the lack of parking. Other than that, decent food for decent prices. Fed five of us for about $50. As a bonus they had fruit punch Jarritos which is my favorite; every Mexican place I've been to typically only has the Tamarind flavor
author: B S.

description: I was driving I'm just coming from work and then I get a new mission for good food parade though it was a perfect the problem with speaker line but it's OK it's good
author: Adam E.

description:
Really good hole in the wall mexican restaurant. Prawn tacos will blow your mind. They are out of the world.

Food Quality - Excellent.
Food Taste - Excellent.
Food Originality - Excellent.
Price - Good.
Customer Service - Good.
Ambiance - Good.
author: Vibhor C.

description: It's a very busy restaurant with a long line, always! But this is one of the best Mexican food in town. Inexpensive and great portions, say no more. Beef fajitas and the tacos are my favorites, love 'em!
author: Jason L.

description:
Update:
Came today to give this place another chance because my bf really wanted to try it because of their famous salsa bar. They still can't get anything right. My bf ordered a shrimp burrito and they gave him shrimp and steak . The receipt shows the correct order but they still didn't get it right.They completely messed up our order and mislabeled the burritos as well. WOW after all this time they still haven't changed. LET ME BE CLEAR I WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN LOS COYOTES ACROSS THE STREET IS MUCH BETTER AND ALWAYS GETS MY ORDER RIGHT !!!!! 

First review from 2017:

Came for pick up and I ordered 2 salmon tacos . I specifically came here for salmon tacos because los coyotes doesn't serve salmon tacos only white fish tacos.  Anyway I get to the office and there are 2 chicken tacos. I had to come all the way back and get it fixed and the guy who took my order really tried to tell me that I ordered chicken lmao naaaaaaaaa bruh. Chicken and salmon don't even sound the same so idk how he could have messed that up. I don't even like chicken tacos.
author: China D.

description: Pretty infuriating experience here tonight. I placed an order for super nachos at 7:30. After hearing every number in proximity to mine being called out for 20 minutes I finally decided to go to the cashier to ask where my nachos could have wandered off to. The first person I talked to said "Oh yeah I saw them" and then disappeared into the throng of workers behind the counter never to be seen again. Ten minutes later I was in hangry territory and decided to ask the cashier if they could just check to see if they had even been started, and if not to simply give me a refund. This kid refused and decided to instead take my order *again* on the back of my receipt that had my original order on it (???) Five minutes later I went to inquire again and urged them to just please give me a refund because at this point I had been waiting 35 minutes for some nachos and no longer even wanted them. This person didn't even say anything and just turned around and walked away...okay then. A few minutes later I finally got my food and got the heck out of there. I'm now at home furiously eating the nachos that took the better part of an hour to get and all I can say is MEH. The only cool thing about this place is that Beck once played an impromptu show here back in 2005. Don't believe the hype folks.
author: Jamey G.

description: good variety of really good cheap Mexican good. The carnitas burrito is so satisfying! Close to 16th and mission Bart
author: Diarra A.

description:
what is the best burrito to get from Pancho Villa?
because I had Super Burrito Carne Asada from this place.  
and while the atmosphere was great, the flavor was average.

keep going ..
author: Rudy H.

description: Best burrito in the city. Good service too. Why go anywhere else? And why won't Yelp let me post a short review...
author: A C.

description: Ordered through post mates and it took 2 hours to recieve my food. Our postmate delivery guy had to wait 40 minutes while being constantly brushed off.
author: Nick Z.

description:
I stumbled upon this place while waiting to get a haircut, the place has over 1700 reviews and 4 stars so I figured how bad can it be? Also the $2 off super burrito deal seemed pretty sweet so I figured I'd try it.

I got my super burrito that I ordered with al pastor, black beans and everything else it came with, the burrito itself was big and for $7 with tax I couldn't complain on size.  Once I took a few bites I noticed it was light on the meat and the meat itself was poorly seasoned, the flavors of the burrito didn't really pop :(.

If I'm in the area again I'd probably go elsewhere, due to the fact that there's so many awesome Mexican joints in the mission, $2 bucks off of a super burrito isn't bad but I was just not impressed with it.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I ordered online and not only did the food disappoint as #1 the order I received was wrong! I ordered a torta ahogada and received what looked like a wet burrito!!which was more filled with rice than actual meat. The green Chile carne dish was dry and the tortillas were singular as in one flour tortilla, what Mexican restaurant gives a flour tortilla for green Chile carne dish instead of corn!?! Lastly my delivery came without utensils, napkins and my agua frescas were missing it's straws. Very poor service all around. I waited an hour for my delivery only to throw it in the trash after the first bite.
author: Samantha R.

description:
Ordering food with delivery two times in week
Really happy good food and fast delivery even traffik time 
Thank  you so much for your service
author: Angelica k.

description:
So I get a message from Pancho Villa which I appreciate, but either I'm being lied to or the representative from Pancho Villa doesn't know what's really happening...

Hi Gary,
Thank you for your message. You may think orders are fulfilled in the order they are received, but this is not true. Caviar shows that I placed my order at 5:54pm. I walked in at 6:13pm, and didn't leave until 6:46pm. Meanwhile, the woman who I walked in with ordered at the counter, and was able to leave before me. It is evident, even when just standing there waiting for the food, that walk-ins are given priority. Maybe get out of the online ordering realm if the restaurant cannot handle it?
author: Kitty H.

description:
Food only tasted good because I was starving. I ordered a super nacho through Uber eats and the food came smelling like it was sitting in the fridge for a day or two. The rice and black beans didn't seem too fresh. I grew up on beans and rice so I'd have some idea. I might of been fresh but seriously, it smelled like a f$&@!?g fridge. Taste was out dated like iOS. 


Update: gave you guys another chance but was again disappointed like people are with President Trump. The prawns that came with my meal had their legs and shell attached; made me feel disgusted. I mean I don't know if it's what you guys do but it should be mentioned on the menu if it's supposed to be included. Seriously. I am definitely not ordering from this low budget Restuarant again.
author: Logan C.

description:
You cannot ask more from a taqueria than you get at Pancho Villa!

Steak nachos FTW
author: Greg K.

description:
I've been coming to Pancho Villa since I was a kid and the food is and has always been delicious however, there is an art to getting food from this place because it is VERY CHAOTIC inside and so loud you can barely hear yourself think. 

1. Phone order (lines are ALWAYS extremely long) 
2. Carpool and have 1 person pick up the food while the other waits in the car (the best parking spot is in the alley adjacent to the building) there is NO street parking in the area unless you get really lucky 
3. Get all of your salsa and toppings from the bar before you pick up your food 
4. Pick up your food from the register and enjoy :-) 

*best burrito IMO is the super steak/prawns with salsa on the side
author: Andreea M.

description: Best Burritos Just need better seating. Food Is Good. This place is very well known. Just what we needed with a cold beer
author: Alaya W.

description: Just ordered food from here and the burritos are great. However, my appetizer order of guacamole and chips is why I'm leaving a two star review. Online it said the small order of guacamole was 6 ounces, but we were only given 3 ounces... this was a bamboozle at its finest.
author: Becca B.

description: Just not good. Period. So many great choices in the Mission, but this is not one of them. If they spent more time focusing on the quality of their food instead of their commercials, then maybe they would notice the guac had turned brown and the salsa bar was filthy. Daaaaammmmn!
author: Markus N.

description:
This is not a critique of the food. This is a critique in their  attention to detail. I have ordered 3 burritos from this place on separate occasions with added guacamole. Each time they have not been filled with guacamole. I wonder if they try to get one over on people when they order out. Who knows. On the bottom of their receipts, they claim to make costumer service a priority. This is definitely not a good representation. 

Check your orders before you take them home.
author: Charlie S.

description:
Solid tacos. If you get a burrito you're going to be really full FYI. Expect a longggg line extremely difficult if you have a big group (we were unsuccessful, 6 ppp). Loud and crazy type of dive but it's affordable so take it or leave.

Got the prawn, al pastor, and carne asada tacos with avocados on top. No complaints.
author: Shyann C.

description:
Came here for the first time last week! Had no idea this place was so popular, a group of seven of us came for a quick dinner before bowling on Friday and we were so lucky to miss the long line!

FOOD- friend raved about the shrimp taco so of course I had to try it! The taco was nicely wrapped (to my surprise!) and filed with coleslaw, the few shrimps inside were crispy and bouncy, flavor was pretty good, but I was not wow'ed. On the other hand, I was pleasantly surprised by the fish taco. The large pieces of fish was cooked just right, moist, and delicious with some salsa added on top. I can imagine that both tacos would taste better if I got it 'super' with avocado etc. I liked the fact that your order comes with free chips and you go to retrieve whatever/however much salsa from the back counter. Other friends ordered burritos and shrimp super tacos, which they enjoyed.

SPACE- large brightly-lit space with lots of seating. The small stools make for a casual atmosphere but good luck if you have a large jacket that you took off because it was so hot/stuffy inside and hope for more luck if you also have a purse to carry and did not want to place it on the not so clean floor. :( Bathroom was not that clean and appeared to have flooded all over. We later found out that it was 'just cleaned'. Maybe someone just decided to pour water over everything- the toilet, toilet seat, toilet tank, and floors to 'clean it'. I would avoid using the bathroom if possible.

SERVICE/PRICE- friendly staff and the ordering process was quick and easy. Line may get long, but it moves pretty fast. They take your order, you pay, they they prepare your food per your receipt/order. Shrimp taco was $3.50 and fish taco was $3. They are of decent size, but not quite enough to fill me up. The burrito was pretty large and obviously of more value.

Yelp check-in gives you $2 off any super burrito. They also have happy hour prices in the afternoon. Parking is difficult since this is the Mission, but location is very close to Muni and Bart.
author: Iris H.

description: Waited in line for 25 minutes then waited another 30 minutes for food to come out. They were having problems with an online order and back those up a good 30 minutes to many people working and not focus on one goal which is customer service. One of the guys was making burrito with no gloves. The expo person was picking up random orders calling them out nobody will come pick up and just leaving it on the rack and online customers were mad. My food was sitting on the rack for the past 15 minutes. Quality of the food is amazing perfect texture perfect saucing perfect cooking just a lack of speed And customer service would change my voting 5/5 stars
author: Isaac P.

description: These are not elegant, casual, local canteens. There is a self-service of fresh salsa. Cheap, fresh, good food, large portions. One drawback is that there are always a lot of people.
author: Amira K.

description: Been here over an hour waiting on my food is very poor management I understand being busy busy is good but if your managers don't have the capacity to lead a team then maybe is time to look for someone who can.
author: Reynol M.

description: Super burrito was A-OK -- nothing to write home about. The salsa bar and Yelp check-in offer ($2 off any super burrito) were nice touches, though!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This is my favorite burrito place in San Francisco. Yes, I've been to La Taqueria many times and know they were voted best burrito in America, but I think Pancho Villa wins on several fronts: price, meat, moistness of burrito, salsa, and they take credit cards. All pluses in my book.

First, the burritos are totally reasonably priced. You can even get a baby burrito for $5.50 which is smaller, and then burritos will run $7 to $8.50 depending on if it has guacamole, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, etc. They even have occasional coupons on Yelp for $2 off a Super Burrito (normally $8.50), which is a great deal. The size of the burritos are enormous. I eat a lot and couldn't finish an entire Super burrito. The difference between the burritos here and La Taq are that they have rice inside (which is flavored and has a little bit of veggies inside), and a wider selection of beans black and pinto refried beans, and whole beans. The La Taq burrito has more meat and no rice but I find the meat to be blander and the burrito is also dry. I really like the chicken here as it's flavorful and grilled.

They also give you chips with your order which is always nice, vs. having to buy chips at other taquerias. I also love the salsa bar, with around 10 options of salsa to pick from. They seem to have won a ton of awards on their salsa. La Taq doesn't give you salsas with your food, and it even sucks more when you get takeout there because there are no to-go containers for salsa.

And lastly, seating is fairly abundant so you don't have to fight for tables. They also take credit card which is awesome since who carries cash anymore these days?

5 stars all around for Pancho Villa. This one wins best burrito in SF for me!
author: Christina L.

description:
I wanted some authentic mexican burritos and my friend said that this was a must-have. 

I got the super burrito with carne asada meat. The burrito came with the meat, rice, refried beans, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa. The burrito was HUGE so you may want to share with another person.

A convenient perk is their salsa bar. They have a bunch of different salsas and sauces. In the bar they also have onions and cilantro which I loaded in to my burrito.

The restaurant seemed cleaner than a lot of other places in the area and the food was actually really good.
author: Kristian G.

description: We went there for a late dinner at a quarter to midnight. They were still very busy and not at all annoyed by our late arrival. They were smiling and very nice. We ordered food to go, it was ready in few minutes. We took a taco salad and a super vegetarian burrito, both were really good and comforting! Overall a very nice experience.
author: Morgane R.

description: Carnita elsuper burrito was yum and a great deal (it's huge) but the meat was a little too salty for me! My friend said it was not usually like that though. Watermelon agua fresca was soooo refreshing and I love their salsa bar. Their quesadillas looked massive and packed with goodies too- I would try that next time, maybe during their $1.50 Taco Tuesdays ayeee
author: Grace C.

description: Online orders have kinda ruined this spout.  Giant online orders clog up the process. 30 min wait for a single burrito.  This has been the situation the last maybe 10x I've been here.  The food is good but I'm posting this so maybe they take note of how the online orders are affecting walk in customers.
author: Brady Q.

description: Tacos here are amazing and well worth waiting in the queue for. Tried the fish tacos as well as meat tacos (pork). This place is busy but pretty organized. Loved the free Salsa bar with many choices of Salsa. Also tried the lemon and lime Fresca drink.
author: Vin M.

description: I love this place!!!! Great burritos every single time. They are kind and make delicious food, what more could you ask for? The service is quick and they don't use lard in their beans, which is a plus. Anyone looking for a delicious burrito in the mission- you've found your place!
author: Katherine C.

description:
This place is the real deal Mexican food! 

My friend and I wandered in for a quick dinner. We got the Yelp $7 for $10 of food deal and ordered a lot of food:

-Seafood taco trio: I got one cod, one salmon and one shrimp taco each and it was oh-so-delicious! The cuts of seafood are really big and you get so much bang for your buck.
-Churro: delicious
-Horchata: milky, cinnamon-y and not too sweet. Yum.
-Chips and salsa: the salsa bar has a great selection and is legit.
-My friend also got a mushroom quesedilla (sp?), which was huge. 

We both really enjoyed this spot. It's open late, yummy and the portion and price ratio are great!
author: Ninette C.

description: There's always a long line here and when it's slightly warm outside, it's uncomfortably hot in here!!! However, the food makes up for it. I love their Chile Verde and their Quesadilla is huge and delicious. Everything here is great. You get in line and look through the glass and order what you want. They prepare it and you wait for it. It's not as quick as you'd think but I don't mind waiting since you can munch on a variety of salsas while you sit and wait for them to bring you your food. They've won awards for their awesome salsas and I do think they are all very good. They have a few fresh juices to choose from as well. When I want hot, fresh and cheap authentic Mexican food, I go to Pancho Villa! I've even jumped off Bart on my way home just to have a quick bite.
author: Jen L.

description: Wouldn't serve our order and wouldn't answer any questions on the phone, had to call grubhub customer service to cancel the order
author: Lorenzo G.

description: Wow, yesterday I had a super burrito sandwich, it was really delicious and big enough to make me full. The staff are really friendly but you have to wait in the line for a short while for your order to be taken as well as after you place it you have to wait 15 minuets to get it , but in general I am happy with this experience and I lll definitely go back there. The price is not expensive though
author: Mo'ad A.

description:
You walk in being greeted by friendly staff. they seem happy to be at work. This business has a well laid out menu. Sometimes there's a line and parking can be hard to find. 

THE FOOD IS BOMB  when I really want to spoil myself, I skip the parking and the line and have it delivered. There's only ever no parking and a line during the evening. I can't say enough how great the food and staff are. It's a very clean establishment. And the salsa.. WHAT A GREAT SALSA BAR.
author: Dylan N.

description: It has its pros and cons. The chicken avocado salad came with a ton of chicken. And the chicken had a great chargrilled flavor.  I ordered delivery. So, this might be why I had the following issues. The loaded nachos were soggy yet dryvat the same time. The nachos were soft but the toppings had very little moisture to them. It needed some extra salsa or guacamole. The nachos that I got separately we're pretty good but the guacamole was average.
author: Michael R.

description:
after my $40 dinner, i'm glad random new classmate brought me here for fourthmeal. now i can split the diff & pretend i had a $25 burrito here and "only" a $25 sando x hushpuppies x coffee at some other pleezy.

i realize that doesn't make my sitch any better

cavernous place w crowded yet frequent turnover seating w no backrests

possibly overstaffed w farmville uniform lolas y lolos
does a place like this even need uniforms? cute

meat list only has 2 choices: lengua or tongue
all y'all suckas can eat the other animals

my stage 2 Deluxe Burrito was $9 & change after tip
nothing loco divertido but it's cheap eats thank ffffin gawd
author: Dan B.

description: Delicious burrito always. Price is right. Always order on Yelp then pick up. Never fails. BTW baby burrito is big enough for a full size meal for one.
author: May M.

description: Their tacos are AMAZING and super inexpensive. I always love eating here. The food is delicious!
author: Marco M.

description: Came here with some co-workers for lunch and the place was packed! The line was almost out the door, but the smell of the food kept me in a patient mood. I ordered the Super Nachos and they were really good. Perfect mix of guacamole, cheese, sour cream and carne asada. It was so nice and cheesy and went well with the Mandarin Jarrito drink I ordered as well. The wait for the food took about ten minutes after ordering, but with how many people were in there it was totally fine. They were quick and efficient behind the counter and I appreciated everyone was hustling. I will definitely try this spot out again if I am in the area.
author: James R.

description:
Hi Gary, I appreciate your humility and willingness to respond to criticism to make your restaurant
 better! I was there Saturday afternoon, September 12th. It would be awesome if the tacos I had were not the norm. Some things to point out: the tortillas weren't cooked on the griddle, maybe steamed, but the moisture had dried out before I got them. I prefer tortillas warmed up in some kind of fat, personally. The carnitas were dry, the kind of dry that makes chewing through the mouthful feel like a commitment. The interior of the pork was not 'sweet'. The salsa on top was a sparse pico de gallo, that didn't do much to add moisture. The meat was definitely generously portioned, so that was nice.

The al pastor was similar in the above qualities (dry) but the main disappointment was the lack of flavor. Forgive my audacity, but can you improve your recipe? And perhaps you guys could set up a spit to cut the meat from? That might make them better and provide another reason for Pancho Villa to stand out. I'm definitely not an expert, but I have had enough pleasure derived from tacos to make me yearn for more. Thanks.
author: Art S.

description: I really want to like Pancho Villa. They do my favorite carnitas in the Mission and are really close to my home, but this is at least the third time they have been more than 20 minutes late in getting a pickup order from Caviar ready. I get it that some nights are busy, but if you can't come even close to meeting the time that is promised, then don't offer the service. Multiple times, it has seemed like they just lost my order and didn't even start it until I wait forever to flag down the staff, who seem too overwhelmed to pay attention to order pickups.
author: Jesse R.

description: Made a phone order. They said 10 minutes. Show up and they say they have no order for me. I ask if its going to get started and guy says what do you want me to do about it if i dont know your order. Ridiculous and unprofessional
author: Daniel M.

description: There is a reason this place is always packed! Lines are long but they are pretty fast in getting to your order which is great! Quesadillas are amazing and burritos are good too and i usually gravitate towards one or the other but i'm sure whatever you decide to order you'll be happy with your choice :)
