author: Sophia V.

description: Very disappointed in my meal, it's cold. Didn't get what I wanted. Was looking for churros and I get some other pantry. Never using delivery because my food looks sloppy
author: Sherile G.

description: Four words: shrimp nachos (no lettuce). You're welcome. They're always super busy, but once you've had their food you'll know exactly why. One of the best Mexican spots in the mission...hands down.
author: A M.

description:
Came here with a friend around 6pm. We shared a super flour quesadilla (+guac, sour cream, salsa) because we weren't that hungry. Portions are pretty big and very filling. The quesadilla was average, there wasn't anything special about it. I'm not a fan of their steak. 

They have complimentary chips that are fried just right, not soggy or too oily. I usually get full off the chips before my food is brought to my table. This place also has the largest salsa bar I have ever seen. I really like the green salsa/ sauce. It has a very spicy kick to it. 

I also got a strawberry Fresca and a custard filled churro. The Fresca was sooo good, very refreshing and not too sweet. I don't recommend the churro, it was cold and hard.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Words cannot express what I experienced at this magical establishment. I laughed, i cried happy food tears, the meaning of life came into crystal clear view. 

First off it was packed, but very well staffed. The turnaround is relatively fast paced and there was always someone clearing a table to make room for the next group of patrons. Super laid back, casual atmosphere, i came here with some friends i met on a bike tour (yay for solo travel friends) - this place just happened to be within walking distance of our final destination - so we went for it. And let me say, NO REGRETS. I got the chicken burrito with guac. The accompanying hot sauce/condiment bar provided for a lot of fun variety throughout the entire experience. 

The burrito is no lie a foot long (that might be a little bit of a lie) - huuuuge. And i ate the entire damn thing. It was that tasty. 

I. Hate that i don't live closer to this love, they dont make burritos on the east coast the way they make em on the west :(

Don't forget to check-in for some additional savings!
author: Ariel J.

description:
Ordered a carne asada super burrito and checked in on Yelp. Left with a satisfied tummy of 'rito, chips, and a whole lot of salsa (there's a long bar of salsas in the back) all for less than $8!

Solid spot for Mexican food. Not the best burrito I've had but definitely good enough for me to come back when in the area! Also, the interior was a lot larger than I expected and cleaner than other taquerias in the area. That's a plus!
author: Carissa G.

description: Good, very good.  Great... I don't know but very consistent and that is better than most places where it's a hit or miss.  Vegetarian so I've had their burrito, super veg taco and cheese enchilada.  Burrito is okay but the taco is very good.  The enchilada by itself is okay but paired with a taco, it's amazing.
author: avi a.

description:
Prepare to have a new favorite burrito place in the mission (or in the country). I've frequented most of the main burrito places here, and this one outshines the others in every category.
The burritos are large, carefully crafted, and delicious. The salsas are unique and tasty. The chips flow FREE-ly. Do yourself a favor and get the burrito super.
The menu, while initially complex, is well organized and extensive, complete with a vegetarian section. 
Speaking of - their grilled veggie and chile relleno burritos are the best of their competitors.
The place is well maintained and looks newish and clean, which also makes it stand out above the rest. The service is excellent.
author: Abi S.

description:
This is one of those spots where you'll need to know the ordering process and exactly what you want or else you'll be stared down by impatient employees. The burrito here is enormous, even without making it a "super". Did I crap my pants at a baseball stadium afterwards?

No. But I could have.
author: Eric L.

description: Good Food! Line may seem long but goes fast! We all got burritos, steak, shrimp, and a mix of shrimp and steak.. alot of places dont do refried beans this one does and does not disappoint... will return!
author: Elena B.

description:
I ordered for delivery through Seamless/Grubhub. After two hours I called to check on the order and they said they had no record of the order. I was however charged for the order and not been able to receive a refund as the restaurant will not verify the unsuccessful delivery with Grubhub.

DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM PANCHO VILLA!
author: Will H.

description: They have a bad habit of putting very very little meat in my super nachos when I order them through UberEats. Everything else tastes good but them knowing that I didn't come to their restaurant personally to eat inside or buy to-go, they know they wont have to answer why I get such a shitty order of Super Nachos w/ meat every time I order through UberEats.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
This place has an awesome salsa bar, it looks pretty clean and a crazy efficient assembly line for Mexican food. Well actually the salsa bar is alright. Most of the sauces are not that spectacular as i love extremely hot salsa and none of theirs are that spicy. 

I would recommend getting a burrito and making it "mojado" or wet as their enchilada sauce is amazing. The place is cheap too so it is definitely worth the price!
author: Neil P.

description: This was my first meal in San Francisco 25 years ago and is still one of my favorites. I love that I can walk down the line with them while they put together my burrito or tacos. I can see them grilling everything fresh, and they have so many choices! They have a taco happy hour where they're discounted, and I seem to forget that every time I'm there during those hours and get a burrito.
author: L. M.

description: I give a 2 star because the food is great. But the lady who takes the orders literally always gets the order completely messed up. Every single time. Also while i was orering my food 2 seperate co workers of hers approached her about messed up orders. My visit before today she messed up my order along with the customer behind me. Every single time. Its like she has no care of what you ask for, and dont ask for anything super special because that just confuses her. She is the worse person to take orders. Makes no sense. For me unfortunatly i will no longer go here. I shouldn't have to worry about getting the wrong stuff everytime.
author: Tammara D.

description: Been here probably about a 100 times. Amazing salsa bar and tacos. Super awesome staff. Enjoy this gem.
author: John C.

description:
Delicious super burritos and generous portions of side dishes. We ended up getting a super burrito along with the beef nachos. The nachos are absolutely a must. The pickled carrots/peppers they give you also pack a punch and they're generous with giving out free side items, which isn't like most places.

Definitely a top Mexican joint in the mission. Just be prepared to wait 20-30 minutes in line!
author: Albert K.

description:
That salsa bar though! I love places that let me get my own lime, onion, cilantro, and salsas. I love to douse my tacos in salsa verde and lime juice. I got two steak tacos and a side of black refried beans and they were both delicious! I took off one star because the steak didn't have the flavor I love from an authentic taqueria...it tasted great, but healthier than I'd want at a Mexican restaurant. The beans were amazing! I also had a churro and left a very happy lady. 

The price was also great for the amount of food that I got! I would definitely go back.
author: Arelys V.

description:
In two words: amazing burritos.  Another word: zoo.

This place makes a mean guacamole dip and vegan burrito using Garlic Mushrooms.  The place gets CROWDED, so be prepared to have to vulture yourself a table.  Oh, and enjoy the loudness of not only the patrons but the cooks and kitchen equipment.  Enjoy watching the army of organized professional Latin order-takers and cooks in action as they move you from one specialized server along the assembly line to the other, each responsible for some part of your order: the first one does your taco/burrito/quesadilla order, the next one takes your drink order and extras, and the last hombre takes your money, scoops up your nachos, and give you a number.  All payment types accepted.  I love their diverse sugar-fortified juices: tamarind, watermelon, pineapple.... and their assortment of stereotypical Mexican beers. 

But then there is the long wait for your order as you are squeezed between the salsa bar and the litany of other people, other hovering waiting customers and salsa bar dippers you bump into, squeezing-by and excusing yourself for being in the way.  There is really no place to stand which gets very annoying FAST.  The order always takes longer than you initially thought which is why it is a good idea to get your nachos and guacamole early and scavenge a seat away from a tiva-wearing granola hipster so you don't pay attention too much to the glacial order fulfillment pace.  If you sit down, the server will find you by calling your number while walking between tables.  Otherwise you have to endure the standing there in everybody's way routine.

Whenever I walk out of there there is always a sense of relief as I exit back to a calmer world.   The food is great but tiring.  Just getting the server to get the details of the order in that noise is tiring.  Then waiting for the food more so. Is it all worth it - well, yes... every now and again, especially if you have someone in from out-of-town.  By the time I am out of there I am exhausted and my burrito food coma comes-on strong and I am ready for a nap.

If only the place wasn't such a zoo.
author: Khash C.

description: Best prawn tacos I've had in my life! Also there's a reason they've got a bunch of awards for their salsas...
author: Olya S.

description: Food is good. Ordered super burritosb meat nachos, guac and chips, and churros. We received everything but the churros. Called like 20 times and no one answered. We would like a refund for the churros we did not receive.
author: Jaclyn W.

description: I'm from sacramento and i'm jealous that we don't have a mexican restaurant that sells sauce as bomb as this place! i've only been here once on a whim and i'm in love with their green sauce. they've got the right peppers in it. i ordered their enchilada combo plate and it was perfect!!!! I honestly didn't expect it to be THAT GOOD. everything is even better with the green sauce! it's ratings are definitely accurate! I will definitely return any time i come to sf!!
author: Sophia D.

description: I love this place!!!!!!! My mom and her friend take me here every time we are in the Bay. It's so good. Best I can get outside of San diego
author: Gage M.

description:
This is one of the places I bring visitors when they're in town because it's very classic Mission. And California Mexican food is just sooo good. 

There's usually a line on Friday evenings but it goes by pretty quickly. I want to say you won't be waiting more than 15min. 

Service is quick and efficient - one of those places you're overwhelmed like ahhh did I eff it up and tell the wrong person I wanted extra corn and now the entire line wants to kill me?! 

The menu is super huge...probably too huge. But there are plenty of vegetarian options including some tofu ones that I haven't tried cause.. I don't think Mexico is big on tofu so I'm not sure how good it would be. I usually get the Super Vegetarian that comes with rice, beans, blah blah blah. 

The prices are awesome. Everything is less than $10. 

Salsa bar is amazing and award winning don't miss it! 

And the agua frescas (particularly the watermelon one) is SO GOOD. Save some for a mixer later ;)
author: Aria S.

description:
Mexican food is my jam.  I love me some Mexican.  Give me some beans, rice and cheese--  I could eat that all day errrrday.  So when it comes to finding taquerias joints, I have pretty high expectations.  For $8.50, I couldn't wait to get into my Super Burrito with grilled chicken.  

After taking my first bite, I knew it was only okay.  Living in San Jose there are plenty of other spots that taste so much better.  Don't get me wrong-- it had all the fixings.  Sour cream, spanish rice, guacamole, sour cream and salsa.  But it just didn't make me say "omg this is frickin delicious."  Nope.   

Tip:  Do the yelp check in offer and get $2 off a super burrito.
author: Lorie N.

description: Love the vegan options here like the tofu ranchero burrito !! Always busy but worth it
author: Marta V.

description:
My favorite Mexican place to go to in the Mission because of: The Sauce Bar
The selection and quality of sauces they have here is really outstanding.  My favorite is an orange colored sauce that has great flavor, kick, and creaminess.  

Along with a great selection of sauces, the freshness of ingredients, cleanliness of the restaurant, and large selection keep me coming back every time, even with such great options for Mexican food nearby.  

A good tip is to check-in on yelp to get a % off on the super burrito, which I take advantage of every time.  My go to is the shrimp super-burrito.  I also really like all of the juices they offer.  My favorite are the watermelon juice, melon juice, and the horchata.
author: Patrick J.

description: I'm from Texas where they actually know Mexican food. If you can settle for dry fajita and not getting your order right, this is the spot for you. I really wanted this to be good Mexican  food, maybe it will be better another day.
author: Nicolas G.

description: I'm so picky with my burritos or tacos but this place is amazing . Great shrimp burritos ! I recommend you
author: Isabel W.

description:
I ordered two tacos to go and a strawberry drink. They came in a plastic container. I was excited to try this place out. When I opened the lid and grabbed my taco everything fell apart. The tortillas were very soggy and just came apart. The carnitas(pork) was a bit red and i believe not cooked enough. It was quite salty. On the other hand the lengua was tender and juicy, the strawberry drink was refreshing, and the chips and salsa were on point. The place does get busy but orders come out really quick. I wouldn't come back here again. La taqueria doesn't compare.  

Tip: order for here
author: Brian C.

description:
Ah, the Mission District of San Francisco. 

This was once a neighborhood for Latino immigrants and a hub for expressive bohemians. Borrowing from each other's experience and artistry, they created the resounding culture that is the Mission District today.

The murals are still around, and so are remnants of the sound and music that defined the Mission. But you look around and see that they are sandwiched by $4 lattes, Kale smoothies, and gluten-free breakfast. Holy smokes! Has the Mission gentrified into a new playground for those sweater-wearing, software-programming hipsters?!?

Today I'm sitting down with Holden Caulfield at Pancho Villa Tacqueria. You may remember Holden from your high school literature class as a judgmental teenager upset with the world. Well, he hasn't changed much. Holden handpicked Pancho Villa for our meeting place because he claims it is part of a group of diminishing authentic eateries in the Mission. The appetizing smell of meat that hangs over the air convinces me that this is a good choice regardless.

(So Holden, what makes Pancho Villa authentic? What is authenticity anyway?)

He pour a healthy dose of green salsa onto his Chicken Quesadilla as he answers.

"The most superficial, yet undoubtedly reliable indicator of authenticity is the lack of hipsters working in this establishment."

I look over to the counter and realize at once that there are no hipsters to be found. Not one fedora. Holden smirks and continues.

"Authenticity cannot really be replicated, right? Or else it wouldn't be authentic. And I'm sure you've had better Mexican food than that delicious Al Pastor burrito you're holding because the Chef probably went on a Mexico pilgrimage to find out all there is to know about Tacos. I mean he knows exactly the right temperature to cook the meat and the exact amount of toppings to bring out the most flavor. Golly, he knows more about tacos than a majority of Mexicans probably."

He bites into the Quesadilla and lets the string of melted cheese linger from the tip of his mouth as he goes on.

"But at the end of the day, authenticity to a Mexican person is what grandma makes. Forget all the taco bullet points on the Chef's Macbook Pro because authenticity is whatever grandma decides that day. She might not even know half the stuff the Chef knows. And to me, anyone trying that hard to replicate something is well, kinda phony."

And there it is, Holden's favorite word. Phony. I can't help but smile.

(Okay Holden, but what's wrong with phony? This authentic burrito from Pancho Villa is unbelievably juicy and amazingly delicious, and so is that "phony" pork belly taco I had a couple of weeks ago. What is the problem?)

"The problem is that phony pork belly taco costs $10 a pop. Look, I am all about borrowing from other cultures and transforming it into something new, and maybe even something better. It's what makes America great."

Holden pauses and opens up his receipt to show me his whole Quesadilla only costs $10. He resumes.
 
"But people have to realize that the community they are borrowing from do not have a strong presence in the 6-figure Silicon Valley circle. And if you have an ethnic restaurant with prices that are generally economically unrealistic for that particular ethnic group, then what the hell is that? It certainly IS NOT embracing that culture." 

(It sounds like we are getting into the topic of gentrification. The Mission was a rough place to be at 10 years ago. It is now a thriving and bustling neighborhood, and I'm sure even Pancho Villa is benefiting. Can't we give the hipster some credit?)

Holden shrugs as if forced to agree.

"Yes, they deserve a lot of credit. And yes, I do love the Rebel Within and I may very well be addicted to Earl Grey ice cream and all, but for Chrissake they're driving out the community that makes the Mission the Mission!"

(But the increased rent prices is just Supply and Demand.)

"And I love it when economics come into play. I got axed from more prep schools than you'd like to know but I still remember what Externalities are. The people who are using Supply and Demand to justify evictions are neglecting costs that may not be measured right away. I mean, how the hell can you measure the cost of stripping an entire neighborhood of its essence? How would you measure your sadness if Pancho Villa's deliciousness got gentrified away?"

He pauses, letting his argument linger with me like the taste of the fresh guacamole in my burrito. 

"I think it's great that the hipsters are economically revitalizing the Mission and all. But instead of just living IN the community, it'll be great to see them live WITH them community."

(And what do you propose they should do to accomplish this?)

"I don't know. But if these guys can figure out how to preserve all my net activities to data-mine me, they can figure out a way to preserve the culture in their neighborhood."

We laugh in agreement.
author: Ringo M.

description: REALLY LOOKING FORWARD TO COMING HERE! Heard great things. I heard they're super borrittos is the best around
author: Bryce S.

description: Unbelievably slow even when there's no line. All Pancho Villa cares about now is food delivery app orders while is locals wait forever. Completely understaffed! I don't need any more overpriced burritos with canned green peas in the rice anyway...
author: Chris R.

description: My go to place for delivery! Always on point with correct orders, quality food and speedy delivery. Highly recommended!
author: Jeramiah W.

description: Great food, great people I recommend this place to everyone. I call them before stopping by because I was super hungry and I order a carne asada burrito to go even though they messed up my order I will give them 5 starts because every time I eat in my food is delicious. Super big portion and they are pretty fast.
author: Fernando G.

description: Generous, fresh, hot. We liked it a lot. Got delivery - pronto - but I neglected to order salsa, so there was none. The little side salad w/lime made it all perfect. Next time will make the trip down the street and hit the salsa bar.
author: Donna R.

description: The last couple times I've come here, it's taken unreasonably long to get a burrito- I think because of all the orders from delivery apps. It's just not worth visiting in person and being put at the bottom of the priority list.
author: Maia B.

description:
Large servings, decent prices, good tastes. I like this place. It's a fairly large restaurant with lots of employees on staff so you'll have your food prepped fast, too.

I've tried the super burrito and 3 tacos deal. Both were good, but I'll be returning specifically for the 3 taco deal. The tacos were really fantastic, even though they were made of just meat, beans, and salsa. Maybe the star quality is in the salsa? My meat choice, lengua, was just okay when I tasted it by itself. It was actually a little bit over cooked and past soft, crossing over to "mushy". It's okay. The taco as a whole was larger than the sum of its parts.

Great salsa and toppings bar to the side. Fresh ingredients all around! Many cheers to that! 

I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Mimi N.

description: Most of the time, I come to San Francisco, bring my friends and family to this place to eat and Pancho Villa Taqueria, never disappointed my friends and me. I would recommend this place, for sure.
author: Larry F.

description: Despite my 1 star rating I love the food here, I have loved their food consistently for 12 years. The bad news is that they need some help managing the the excessive delivery orders. I stopped in last night and it took 50 minutes to order and receive a burrito. It would have been faster for me to hang out at a bar nearby and order it online. They seem to prioritize the online delivery services over the customers ordering in person. When you're in the mission no burrito is worth waiting 50 minutes for. I hope they are able to read this review and think about ways to solve this problem. They are a treasured local business and just need some help navigating this new technology.
author: carolyn a.

description: Bomb tacos. Bomb quesadillas. Bomb burritos. Super inexpensive for good quality food.
author: Elena C.

description: Let down by the service. 30+ minute wait to get our food. I understand place gets busy, but when people who ordered well after us were getting their orders it becomes suspect. No special with their food.
author: Joshua C.

description: guacamole was watery (strange).  burrito had very little meat. probably the rudest delivery service I've encountered in SF.
author: Jess W.

description:
It really hurts me to write this review. I've lived across the street from Pancho Villa for nearly five years, and it's my go-to place. I really do love the food there, and as someone in the neighborhood, it was great to have a quick place to grab a bite to eat. At all but the busiest times, I was able to order and receive my food in about 10 minutes.

A year and a half ago, with the proliferation of food delivery apps, this became impossible. They fill so many orders for apps that it now takes 30 minutes or more to receive your food once you order. So I switched to ordering ahead using an app and picking it up myself. Tonight, that finally failed me: they didn't even start making my food until I asked them about it, well after it was marked in the app as ready for pickup.

Pancho Villa is a great taqueria, but they need to either staff up, expand, or take fewer orders from apps. If I can't get quick and reliable food there, I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Bradley P.

description: Great Mexican food and affordable price. The only issue is it gets too crowded during dinner time.
author: Anu S.

description:
One of the staple taquerias on 16th street, people flock here in numbers as they provide a consistent quality and variety of menu options in a pretty effective made to order assembly line. While most people probably gauge a Mission taqueria based on the quality of their carne asada burrito or tacos, I think Pancho Villa does carnitas best and you're better off ordering tacos. There are better places to order a burrito but if you order pork tacos, especially during happy hour, you'll be well satisfied since they're packed with flavor.

If you wish to change it up, fish/pescado option are available too and also being able to order fresh, non cold pressed juice for less than $10 is now a bargain in SF!

Clean restaurant & prep area, although there's such a high volume of customers coming in, the tables could be cleaned off faster.
author: Steven C.

description: i may have posted before.  this used to be my go-to place (since they first moved in decades ago) but never again. things (today's food was sadly disgusting,   customer service terrible! and prices too high) have changed for the worst ever since the nice manager was hit by a stray bullet several years ago. after several several attempts at forgiveness and promises of improvement, i'm done.
author: sweaterhead x.

description:
Order using Order Ahead.

Jump off BART, swing by PV, your order will be waiting for you.

Scoop up your fav salsas.

Head home, switch on NBA TV. Let the feast begin.

My faves here are their whole wheat veggie burritos, the burrita bowl, and the enchilada dinner.

Yoomee
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Who's had this problem before? You're in the Mission and you're craving Mexican food (must be the air there), but you don't know which one of the countless taquerias to try. Pancho Villa should be at the top of your list. I came here for the first time in a few years and I was happy to see everything was just as I remembered - fast-moving line, good atmosphere, and authentic Mexican food.

You can get a super burrito for about $10 with tax and have the option to pick your type of meat, beans, and salsa. I was STARVING so I probably could have eaten 1.5 of those, but typically one should be more than enough. They also have a complimentary chips (where you at, Chipotle?) and a salsa bar.

Tips:
- They accept credit cards
- Tables are usually all taken during peak dinner hours so consider taking out
- I waited 20-minutes for my burrito after ordering around 7 PM on a weeknight so plan accordingly
- They have a bathroom
author: Jordan H.

description: First time here with high hopes given that this place has many good reviews. I ordered my carne asada burrito and i got a huge chunk of inedible fat that took over half of my burrito, I had to pull it out. So burrito was okay. I also got a churro and I got a cold churro that was soaked in grease. That's all you taste when you bite into it. Their agua frescas on the other hand are really good! Their horchata and melon water were really tasty and refreshing. Honestly I wouldn't come here again for the burritos, maybe ill try something else next time!
author: Esmeralda J.

description: Absolutley love this place! This is a must stop for people visiting from out of the state or country for a delicious burrito. You really cannot go wrong and be sure to indulge in their fresh salsa bar
author: Ryanbradley N.

description: This place is shady outside but the guard calms you down a bit. You order at the halfway area. I got the three taco combo and you can choose from meat or seafood. I got carne asada, carnitas and shrimp. The asada was super dry and not enough sauce. Carnitas was good and salty and surprisingly the shrimp was good too. It was a basic Mexican place and nothing too special.
author: Amy H.

description:
Great option if you are craving Mexican food! The place was packed even at an off hour. There's some seating inside but you might have to wait for a table.

I got the carne asada super burrito ($8.50) which was huge. It's packed with meat, rice, beans, sour cream, guacamole, salsa and big enough to share with 2 people if you're both not that hungry. The super nachos were equally great and had a giant serving size.

Overall I would recommend trying this place out!
author: Linda X.

description: It definitely takes longer now to get your order ready because of online ordering and delivery service. It took about 25 minutes to receive our order which consisted of a regular burrito and beef fajitas but when they delivered to our table it made up for the wait. I've been coming here over 25 years and never been disappointed. Delicious.
author: George B.

description:
There are countless taquerias in the Mission, and I think each one has its own star item (e.g., Taqueria Cancun's super tacos, Los Coyotes' asada/pastor fries). At Pancho Villa, the items with prawns are definitely their stars. Big, juicy grilled prawns. And they don't skimp on them either.

Four stars for the steak & prawn super burrito, and the prawn tacos. And probably every other prawn item that I haven't tried yet. Their free chips and expansive salsa bar makes everything better too. But seriously. Just get the prawns.
author: Sara L.

description: So awesome! My favorite burrito in the city. Place is run smoothly and food is delicious. Made with love, I highly recommend!
author: Liz A.

description:
This is a good burrito place in San Francisco, where there is no shortage of la taquerias. 

We got here mid afternoon and it was pretty busy. The line was to the door. They have a pretty extensive menu. They have some seating which is limited since it's a busy place.

I ordered chicken burrito supreme, which comes with guac, sour cream and all that. The size was big and I didn't think I was going to actually finish it. My friend got the supreme chicken taco and liked it. The fresh juices are excellent! I highly recommend the watermelon one, it's very refreshing! 

There are tons of taquerias on Mission, you can't go wrong with at least trying it.
author: Yukta R.

description: Ay Caramba! Tacos are muy excellente aquí. Best in the mission in my opinion. There's a reason why there is always a freaking line, but no need to worry it moves fast.
author: Yohan K.

description: Sorry! Loved your place for years. Just arrived in town and ordered delivery. Never the same in the store....but...no salsa or napkins?  For my favorite Mexican Food? You ask what kind if sauce we want! I love your salsa! Look at the awards on the wall.  I'm so disappointed...$45 and NO salsa!!!!!
author: Jim K.

description:
Out of the infinite taquerias in the Mission, Pancho Villa's not the best, but pretty good.

Super tacos - So much stuff in them that it would almost make more sense to just fork and knife the tacos! The carne asada is a tad dry, but they're very generous with the guac and other toppings, so it makes up for the meat a little bit.

Super burrito - Flavorful and gigantic, but as with the tacos, the carne asada is kinda dry. I have also had a few experiences where the tortilla is torn in the middle though, which is a little annoying.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I don't like giving bad reviews. :-(

I ordered dinner for delivery, because I'm staying at a hotel and I'm tired from traveling today... so I made sure to add napkins and a fork to the Special Instructions as hotels don't normally provide these.

Right after ordering, I realized I forgot to add a drink to my order so I called them to add one and they kept answering, hearing me out, and then hanging up on me. They did it like 5 times. Then they just stopped answering. 
Getting hung up on isn't fun...

The food got here pretty quickly, but I learned that the delivery was a separate company so I'm not sure if the restaurant should get credit. 

The burrito was cold and not really appetizing. 
They didn't give me a fork or napkins, despite specifically asking for them. I can't eat a chile relleno without a fork...... so I'm trying to eat it with some tortilla chips that they had included (for free). And I'm using the hotels tissues as napkins.

What a bummer. 

The delivery guy told me that this place is usually really busy, with people lined up around the block. So, I guess they're doing something right.
author: Jenny S.

description: The quintessential mission burrito. Blows El Farolito out of the water. Classic California Mexican food like what I remember from when I was a kid. Not fancy but really good.
author: Cody H.

description:
The roommate and I were super lazy the night we got back from Vegas. Thanks to Postmates, we got Mexican food delivered to our place.

*Enchiladas carta: chicken asada ($6.95)
*Super burrito: carnitas, rice, beans, cheese, guacamole, lettuce, tomato & hot salsa (no sour cream) $8.50, Wet (+$1.49)
*Super taco: carne asada, meat, cheese, guacamole, lettuce, tomato & mild salsa (no beans, no sour cream) $4
*Fish guachinango taco: fish, lettuce ($3.35)

Tacos: $3 each
*Al pastor, roasted salsa (no beans)
*Lengua (no beans)

I got the four tacos and they weren't very good. The carne asada was hard and chewy. The fish taco was kind of bland. The al pastor dry. The lengua was tender though. The roommate thought his enchiladas were bland. And he asked for his super burrito wet, so it came with a side of enchilada sauce which we were charged for. Kind of weird, but okay.

Their salsa selection was excellent though. And our postmates driver was great since she brought us a bunch of different salsas. Too bad the food was so disappointing. I love tacos, but most of the meat was dry and bland. Not worth another visit.
author: Elena N.

description: I always love this place although they said is in the bad neighborhood but is not bothering me!  Yelp.com said this place is not clean, so no review to view. Well, this place is good to us and we never get any food poison!  They always has good servers or bus boy to help customers, always very friendly! I love their combo dinner, their food is good enough to me, always fresh, good portion.  Most of the time at dinner time, they have two or three musicians sing or play music, is free entertainment, I love it!  However, they love to come over to your seats and ask for donations.  Last time, I almost give but my family get upset for they interrupt our dinner at the wrong time, so we didn't give (sorry).
author: Kitty L.

description:
Loved the salsa bar - there were approximately 10 types of salsa plus they have some marinated veggies as well on the bar!!!

The cheese quesadilla was great and slightly crispy when I warmed it up at home. The small taco salad was huge! Great portions! Tofu salad with black beans was delish - not salty. This place accommodates vegetarians for sure! The tamarind juice was tart and slightly sweet. Great staff. Long lines but quick. Very entertaining to look at staff while they prepare or cook the food. 

Go!
author: Kitty D.

description:
Get: fish tacos. chicken tacos. carne asada! //drool
Don't get: lengua tacos (meat too soft meh, overcooked)
Respect: the amazing salsa bar with 1029398492 kinds of salsas
Surprise: side of grilled mushrooms or green onions
Secret: $1.5 tacos and $3 beer 3-5pm mon-fri
Dress code: old t-shirt bc its going right in the laundry after all dat smoke
author: Maggie G.

description: I just watched a cook burn her finger and take a tomato out of the dish to relieve her finger and put it back. I went here for the first time, will never come back. This is a safety concern for my health
author: Laura P.

description: Regardless of the low inspection score, Pancho Villa is the best taqueria in SF. I've lived here my whole life and this is the only place I enjoy. They have a wide selection of meats and a huge menu. I always order a burrito or nachos, and they're delicious. Not to mention their agua frescas are fresh and tasty as well. I'll be back again.
author: Sonia R.

description: Went to this restaurant 2 years ago with best friend from Europe and we enjoyed a hearty lunch! Went again last night and it was the same. The super burrito is huge!
author: Faryal Z.

description:
Carne asada plate!!
Carne asada tacos!!
Quesadilla!
Pretty much everything here is sooo good!
author: Candice L.

description:
My hubby told me this place was pretty good, so I finally got to try it last week for lunch. We made it right before the lunch crowd, thank God, and I ordered a taco salad with shrimp. I wanted to order a super burrito, but needed something a little lighter and the salad hit the spot. The  outer tortilla shell everything came in was nothing special, but the grilled shrimp were amazing and not over-cooked. The pico de gallo was super fresh and the black beans and rice had nice flavor, and the portions were perfect. I wouldn't change anything about the food.

The layout was weird because the salsas are in the very back, so it gets jammed up easily. I also don't get why you have to tell one lady, who is standing at a computer/register, your order and then get a receipt to pay at the next register. I guess it's so you can get your drinks and chips there, but it's weird and didn't flow well from what I saw. It's not a huge deal though and the food more than makes up for it. I'll be back.
author: Steph L.

description:
Ehh overhyped, red snapper burito didn't have much flavor. Lines too long and some obscene guys talking about butt sex, really didn't make my food any more enjoyable.

The end!
author: Donnie R.

description:
I've been coming to Pancho Villa for over ten years.  After my experience there last night, I feel really sorry for the employees here.  Let me explain: There were only three people ahead of me in line.  I ordered ONE baby burrito to-go.  Guess how long it took? FORTY FOUR MINUTES! Yep, 44 minutes for one baby burrito. The employees here are clearly overworked. Had they warned me it would take this long I would have never placed my order.  It made me late for meeting a friend afterward and it was a stressful experience. 
The owners have obviously decided to put profits ahead of customer service and their employees' well being.  They're accepting WAY too many online orders.  There were bags and bags of orders getting stacked up on the shelves meanwhile in-store customers and stressed out employees were getting the shaft.  

***Edit: One thing I forgot to include in my original review is that when you use online apps to order your food for pick up and choose to leave a tip, that tip doesn't necessarily go to the workers!  I used the Eat24 app to order food from another restaurant.  When I picked up the food I asked the employee if they get the tips and they said NO.   I was really angry when I learned this because I had left so many tips before thinking it would go directly to the employees and not the owners. So, if you do use an online app, always leave your tip in cash in the tip jar onsite or hand it to the employee who hands you your food if there's no tip jar there!***

There was a huge crowd of customers waiting for food for what seemed like forever.  Right after I finally got my food, another customer starting yelling at the poor guy behind the counter that he wanted his money back because he was tired of waiting so long.  Shame on you owners for being so greedy.  Pancho Villa was so much better in the old days when the person you ordered your food from was the person who prepared it.  This always guaranteed that once you ordered, you'd always have your food within 5 minutes. Things really went downhill when they started their new system of taking orders from just one person and then the army of people behind prepares it.   The online ordering system has made things even worse. I recommend that if they want to keep accepting online orders, they return to their old method of taking in-store orders where the person you order from makes your food. This would prevent problems like last night happening and make me want to keep coming here.
author: Mike A.

description: The order I am reviewing is for a group/delivery order. It was made with specific instructions days before it was meant to be delivered. Nothing was right, it seems like they made everything the way they wanted to make it with no regard to the customer who was paying. And on top of that, they didn't even include the entire order...that was paid for beforehand...so we got ripped off! I don't want to say that their food is bad because honestly I don't really know yet, all I tasted was raw onions! But I will say that the staff needs to have a lesson in customer service/appreciation!
author: Lizzy D.

description: After reading the "poor food safety report" on the yelp website I was aboout to rate this business with one star but you know what? Screw the food inspections. The flavor, taste and variety of items at this place is what makes it delicious and worth a stop. I have eaten in gross subpar places and I am still alive and well. This place is Amazing!
author: Aldo R.

description: Do not order from here unless you want stomach issues the following morning. I should have trusted the food safety warning yelp issued. On top of that, my delivery order included zero salsa for my chips & burrito and I clearly asked for it in the notes. As a taqueria, it should be standard to throw in a couple of salsas for every delivery order even if it wasn't asked. You've failed me Pancho....
author: Pratul L.

description:
Great place for a late night burrito after a night out in the mission, no frills.  You go in, tell them what you want, get a receipt, and then pay at the register.  I had the carne asada burrito.  It was the perfect fix after a night out, seasoned and not soggy. The guacamole seemed diluted and had tomatoes in it.

The salsa bar looked less than desirable, so I skipped that. The bathroom was a hot mess, but with the volume and crazy people coming in on a Saturday night, it's par for the course.
author: Monique S.

description: Good salsa bar, food is fresh. But am tired of paying almost $12 for a super burrito that has no guacamole. they always pull this stunt. and i say i want it hot and they make it bland. used to be in my top 5 mexican taquerias but not frequenting again any time soon.
author: Kay C.

description:
There's no shortage of taquerias in San Francisco, or the Mission for that matter. Among the closest to my work happen to be Pancho Villa and Los Coyotes. In all honesty, I try and avoid both because I've been disappointed the few times I've visited either taqueria. Nevertheless I'm always open to try them every once in a while to see if they've improved. My most recent visit was this past Monday during the lunch rush.

I was surprised at just how busy Pancho Villa was, but given the assembly line infrastructure in place, you can expect the wait to be minimal. I do wish they would have paper menus near the entrance because the menu board is obstructed from the door giving you little time to decide on your order once its your turn. 

I typically always go with tacos but this week I decided on trying their torta. The Mexican sandwich consists of your choice of protein along with cheese, lettuce, tomato and salsa. I added a side order of rice and beans at $1.50 each for a half pint. The total came out to $9 and some change after taxes with no soft drink.

10 minutes later my order number was up and I was handed my order and filled up at their salsa bar. Once back at my desk, I unwrapped the torta and it looked a little sad and beat up. Although it wasn't the most visually appealing torta, it still had a chance. After a few bites, my conclusion was that it was okay but not great. The bread was toasted nicely and had plenty of melted cheese and the pollo asado was surprisingly great. The lettuce and tomato didn't do much, but luckily I had plenty of salsas to try and add flavor.

The pinto beans and rice were fine and completed the meal. For $9 I was satisfied: a nice sized sandwich, beans and rice and chips and salsa. Pancho Villa isn't at the top of my list when I think of San Francisco's taquerias but when it's 2 blocks from your work and you have no lunch, it'll do just fine. 

Ambiance/Decor: 2/5
Food: 3/5 
Service: 3/5
Price: $
Overall: 3/5

Pros:
+ All the usual staples: appetizers, burritos, tacos, nachos, quesadillas, etc.
+ Torta sandwich with your choice of meat ($5)
+ Generous portions and reasonable prices
+ Great for lunch or late night
+ Fast and efficient service
+ Lots of seating
+ Beer available

Cons:
- Food is average at best
author: Alexander E.

description: Giving this place 3 stars. Good, not great. Two bucks off burrito is awesome. For me it comes down to meat, beans and salsa. They were all middle of the road.
author: Lorenzo R.

description: Walked into this place and just knew it was legit. Authentic Mexican cuisine at its finest. You can see everything cooked and prepared right in front of you. So many options, so many choices. I had the super vegetarian burrito . Fresh squeezed lemonade and churro. Muy Bueno! They also have a fresh salsa bar with complimentary  chips. Sweet. This was some of the best Mexican food I've had.
author: Candace A.

description: I got the 3 taco deal with the additional toppings but something that threw me off was they charge $1 for EACH topping. I would have appreciated a heads up. The tacos were pretty filling and they give you side nachos with your purchase.
author: Kathy D.

description: Visited from Florida and I must say... thank you so so much for the real horchata! Also, the carne asada is a must try!
author: Jessenia O.

description: Best neighborhood taco spot in the mission IMO. Great busy vibe. Friendly service. The tacos are delish and the beans are very well done-- as are the salsas.
author: Urban S.

description: I live in Brooklyn NYC and trust me when I say that we have no places in NYC that can match Pancho Villa.  When we come back to visit San Francisco, Pancho Villa will be our first stop!
author: Robert K.

description: Absolutely horrible food...Not overall but completely overated....Yuck lettuce in a burrito....Small amounts of meat...Bland flavor and the wait is almost eternal on certain days....Decent but you can find better around here for certain....The salsa bar is pretty great though....still not enough to give it more than 1 star
author: Idi W.

description: I grew up in Southern California about an hour from the border and now recently moved to the Bay Area. I've been to Pancho Villa every time I come back up north to visit. I believe this is the best Mexican restaurant I have been to in California. If you are looking for authentic, quick, quality food than please come here. Staff is friendly, and the menu has everything you can possible want. The line can be very long and wind down the street but the hour wait or so is worth every bit
author: Dash G.

description: I tested few taquerias but the burritos here are really good. Better than in a lot of restaurants in SF
author: Stacy H.

description: I've been coming here since the 80's. Used to be that you order your food with the person preparing it directly and then follow your food down the line where you pay at the end.  No more! The new process suits the take out services but sucks for those dining in. It took us 40 mins to get our tacos and burrito.  Poor guy next to us waited about an hour and the other table who was there way before us still didn't get their enchilada's after we left.    The place looks really dirty now too.  I'll not be recommending this place to visitors anymore.
author: Eva W.

description: This place is very popular because each time I go its always full, but the food is very tasty and the service is quite quick. I really am a fan of their natural aguas frescas. Have to try the strawberry !! super thirst quenchers.
author: Liset O.

description:
This is still my favorite burrito in the city - it is literally perfect.  I love the carnitas and the lettuce they put in it!!

The horchata is refreshing and so good you might need a second one ;)
author: Rachelle P.

description:
I love this place! 

Huge variety of items to try from burritos and tacos, to full dinner plates that come with heaps of food that I think I would have to eat over a two day period to finish all of it. 

I usually get the taco special (3 tacos) and that is plenty of food for me. Sometimes I get the baby burrito (but I make it super because I want all of the other extra yummy toppings) and I can barely finish it. If I know I won't have time to cook that night I get a super burrito and that is enough for lunch and dinner. So. much. food. 

I also love love love their salsa bar. Many salsas to choose from and they also have lime wedges and radishes!! 

The many different agua frescas from the traditional horchata and hibiscus to tamarind and guava. So delicious! and don't forget to get a churro for dessert (get a stuffed churro if they have any left! you won't regret it). 

The only reason I don't give it 5 starts is because it gets super noisy. Super super noisy. If I'm there with a friend I can't really keep a conversation without walking out with a soar throat because we have practically been yelling at each other. Especially when they are chopping the meat. The guy with two huge butcher knifes chops away and the bang bang bang coming from that area is deafening. It's also really difficult to get a table and, most likely, you will have to clean the table yourself because the people before you were to lazy to clean after themselves.
author: Ezekiel G.

description:
My husband and I came to the mission hoping to get the real "taco" experience and we were not disappointed!! 

I had the vegetarian taco and the tofu taco and some tamarindo to drink.

A live mariachi band also added to the fun playful atmosphere with cheap flavourful food.

Highly recommend!!
author: Sonia G.

description:
One of the disappointing things I run into when I'm out at Mexican taquerias is trying to find enchiladas. Most places either don't carry them or they come as a full on dinner serving with beans, rice, salad, and costing in the range of $10-12... not something I'm aiming to pay when I'm swinging by for lunch and just want something in the range of a $6 burrito. Pancho Villa, on the other hand, is one of the places that does carry enchiladas a la carte, which comes with a small salad. You get two enchiladads (meat or cheese options) for a reasonable price of $7, which is a good serving size for lunch! I was absolutely over the moon when I was able to order exactly what I wanted and even more happy when it was delicious.

The restaurant itself was quite busy when we were there but the line moves quick. Ordering is done at the counter, then paid for, and a server will bring your food out to you since it will take some time for the order to be made depending on other orders ahead. There was a really good range of veggie options, including tofu, so vegetarians and vegans could easily find something worth checking out.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Absolutely amazing! I can truly say this is REAL and AUTHENTIC mexican food. I had the super burrito, horchata and churros (the ones with cream inside) and it was great!!!!
author: Jaritssa O.

description:
Fast, courteous, excellent service with a smile!!! I got a burrito, cookie and guava. All of it was delicious!!! 

And a free plastic bag in SAN FRANCISCO!!
author: Nae F.

description:
This place is legit, and even offers Yelp discounts (that $2.00 burrito was such a nice surprise!!) We stumbled into this place (which is always popping with people, might I add) as a post-yoga work-out meal (yea, yea, healthy is sometimes overrated and sustenance is highly necessary!!) The line was long (but not always a bad thing), and gave me a change to figure out what I wanted. One of the cool things about this place is the veggie and seafood options. They have salmon and prawn burritos (a rarity, night I add). They have a pretty awesome salsa bar. We went for a prawn and salmon burrito, and both were super tasty (I couldn't finish mine, but that's what I get for ordering a prawn super burrito at 10pm in the evening). But it's all good. It was well worth the calories and the wait in line!!

Likes:
-deals galore! Make sure to check in when you get here the the latest deal
-great options for veggie/pescatarians
-salsa bar!

Dislikes:
-long line (but then again, this isn't a bad thing)
-sticky tables (but understandable to a certain extent, given the high turnover of eaters)
author: Tracy T.

description: Tasty, close to Bart, good prices. I got 3 tacos for $7. Got Chicken, Carnitas and shrimp. Paid extra for shrimp. Juicy and flavorful
author: Victoria H.

description: this place goes. best salsa bar in SF straight up. Also quality to price is insane. Everything is simply good. Highly recommend the 3 taco deal. Their prawn burritos, and their dinner plates. Enjoy.
author: Adam M.

description:
My food arrived 40 minutes late (1 hour 40 minutes total), cold, tossed around, incomplete, and not according to my requests. All I asked for was sour cream on the side and I paid for extra sour cream but there's none in site. I ordered and paid for two bottles of coke and received one warm one. 

Never again.
author: Krystal Lauren S.

description: I ordered three tacos, and 2 burritos. I asked for one shrimp/al pastor burrito and they put carne asada. I don't eat beef; it was low quality. My mom didn't like her beef tacos, either, and they put the wrong salsa on them. The shrimp part of the burrito was good and so was the spinach tortilla, but the beef was awful. I had delivery and they delivered in a timely fashion which I appreciated, but I wouldn't order again.
author: B A.

description:
We came for lunch. We're just glad we came early (before 1230 noon) because it got busy after.
The food was delicious. The price was affordable.
Parking is not so bad either - but I guess we were lucky because it was in Mission Area.
Recommended!
author: Rokayah H.

description:
If you're in the 16th and Mission area during lunchtime, Pancho Villa is one of the better options around to find a burrito. It offers great bang-for-your-buck to casual diners and hungry men alike, as a casual lunch spot with big burritos for under $10. And when I say big, I mean it. 

While it's usually jam-packed at lunchtime, don't be alarmed: the line moves fast and the seats turnover quickly. Other than that, it's a pretty standard Mexican joint with California-style burritos and all of the usual classic Mexican dishes.

Obviously there are lots of Mexican food options in the Mission, and this one is by no means the best. But it's a solid option if you're in the area.
author: Brian S.

description: This is my favorite burrito place in SF. I've been coming here my whole life so maybe that's why I'm biased. It's usually pretty busy, 5-10 min wait. But that's an advantage because that means you're always getting fresh grilled meat. I like the super burritos and quesadillas the best. My parents like their combination plates as well. Go during their happy hour and get discounted tacos.
author: Rico H.

description:
I order the super quesadilla every time.  I need to branch out but I cannot deviate from what is already too delicious!!! 

Also not over priced or silly pretentious
author: Sfclint O.

description: Decent prices, alright food, horrible timing. I placed an online order for a simple rice, beans, and cheese burrito and they had it ready 50 minutes later. Save yourself the hassle and go to Los Coyotes.
author: Mariela J.

description: The food is surprisingly ungreasy, even if you order it Super. You can stuff your face with burrito and still feel pretty good about yourself. My first visit, I ordered the steak and shrimp burrito, but the beans drowned out the flavor. I got just shrimp without frijoles the time after and liked it even better. The salsa bar is ridiculous, so take advantage.
author: Huey N.

description:
I LOVE, I mean absolutely adore the Pancho Villa location in San Mateo. Their food quality and service is 360 degrees to that of the Mission location. 

I spent my youth eating there and when I go back to visit you will definitely find me going to SM pancho villa! I have NO clue how the food could be SO different! It's saltier, instead of natural flavoring and more unsanitary and the people are rude.
author: Maddy B.

description: This place was just ok. I feel it tries to cater to the white populous. I've never seen a salmon burrito in my entire life. Lol it's laughable. I wanted to try the prawn taco but my wife ordered me the spicy prawn plate which came with Spanish rice and black refried beans. The prawns were more like shrimp and they split the "prawn down the center but left the shells on. Which I found difficult to eat. The black beans and rice were delicious though. We also ordered nachos with carne asada on top. But that didn't happen either. They got the order wrong. So it was basically chips refried pinto beans and cheese. Which I might add were delicious as well. The horchata was delish too. I would have liked to give it more stars but getting my order correct is a big part is the experience. So a solid 3 stars is all they earned from me.
author: George R.

description: Delicious food, low prices, fast service, friendly staff, and did I mention the delicious food? The fajita steak Super Burrito and the cheese quesadilla were both truly excellent, very flavorful and the burrito was STUFFED full. And I loved the array of salsas available! The free side of chips was a nice surprise. Churros weren't warm & gooey, but still tasty - and at $1.50 I can't really complain!
author: Hannah K.

description: I would recommend ordering the tacos instead of a burrito here. My Especial burrito didn't contain that much meat vs other places. My co-workers tacos looked good, but he insisted this wasn't his top choice. Overall not bad of burrito for San Francisco.
author: Brian J.

description:
Fast service
Over priced. Horchata was $3.81 and same for a refill..I've had bigger cups for cheaper, so disappointed in this. I would've bought a churro if a refill wasn't as costly.
Food was good, but not delicious. My asada tacos were kinda dry, so was my friends enchiladas.
Chips and homemade tortillas were tasty.
Not bad. 
Oh and you can get all you want limes, salas, toppings
author: Eunice M.

description: Excellent burritos! Service was quick and the place is pretty big so there's never a huge wait.
author: James D.

description: I would rate this a 0 if I could. Service honestly is pretty bad. I asked for half and half meat and the girl who took my order seemed so annoyed, she rolled her eyes at me in front of me. Rude service and food is decent. Never again will I come back to this establishment where they treat customers with such disrespect. Not my fault she woke up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.
author: Francis D.

description: Extremely poor poor service here.  They blast the TV so no one can here one another.  And were closed down by the health department.  Good luck treating customers like you don't need their business.  It does not work that way.
author: M L.

description: Pancho Villa is the best place to get a quesadilla or burrito in San Francisco. They have the award-winning salsa bar. I always come here when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Wes H.

description:
I was really happy when I walked in at 5 and did not see a long line.  I needed to be somewhere by 5:30, so I only had time for a quick bite.  I was not so happy when it took 15 minutes for someone to deliver my two super tacos to my table.  I noticed that people who were waiting for their to go orders got their orders before I did.  I finally had to flag down one of the servers and asked her about my order.  She looked at my receipt, went to the kitchen and less than two minutes later, my tacos were at my table.  

The tacos were okay.  I had to eat them quickly as I was running out of time.  How can you enjoy your food if you have to scarf it down?  I'm not sure if I'll be coming back to this place.  While the food is cheap, I'm not sure that it's any more special than our local taqueria in San Leandro.  Plus, my two tacos took 15 minutes!!!  I've been here before when it's really busy and it didn't take them 15 minutes to get our order fulfilled. Not sure how they overlooked my food ticket. Luckily, I made it in time to my event!
author: Hazel C.

description: Food is delicious, wait time is moderate, location is big, servers are alert and attentive. My favorite here is the CHILI RELLENO. I am on a low carb diet, so I omit having the rice, beans, etc. It is also reasonably priced that I ended up always ordering four of this CHILI RELLENO each time I come here to eat and then bring it home. When I crave for it, I just take off one order from my freezer, reheat it in the microwave and it's good to go! Never liked this menu elsewhere than here. There is a lot of cheese in it and I just go nuts eating it, salivating for it. It's addictive but worth every penny of your drive to PANCHO VILLA!
author: Pizzicatto C.

description: This place is awesome. My sister and I ordered a burrito and quesadilla and split them both. The burrito had steak and prawn, the quesadilla chicken fajita. Both were flavored well. We both were pleased! I honestly have no complaints on the food. The place does get really crowded. We went on a Sunday around 5pm and the line never died down. I recommend this place!
author: Patricia J.

description: Love Pancho Villa food is good and fresh. Try to avoid coming during lunch cause the line can get long. Steak, shrimp and chiken plate is the best.
author: Armando Y.

description:
I've been here two times, both times had the super burrito w/ carne asada. Can't say anything negative  about it. It was delicious both times. 
Good salsa bar, good service. This is one of the top Mexican food spots in the mission for sure.
author: Fernando B.

description: This place has bomb burritos! Price is ok and the staff is amazing!! My husband and I went in for the first time and we were a little confused as to where the line started and I was trying to talk to one of the employees who was ignoring me then three other staff members including what I think was either the owner or a manger help me, take my order and ring it up for me! It was a very good experience. Totally going to be a returning customer!
author: Gracie T.

description: I love how fresh everything was! If you're looking for good burritos in the Mission district, this is it! My husband and I shared one and got 3 tacos with rice. The chicken on the taco taco and the rice weren't super flavorful so I wouldn't suggest that, but the super burrito with steak was AMAZING! And I see why their salsas are award winning! Just be careful if you're not into spice-have someone else try them first for you. Wash it down with one of their fresh aguas! We got the pineapple and the mango-great way to finish it all!
author: Dominique G.

description: They have a really ignorant Latin young man working at the register. he is so very ignorant I just left there and he makes me never want to come back it's so sad that they hire These people that only care about their own & not about everybody! that's not customer service I'll take my business elsewhere! It's so sad because I've been coming here since a child!
author: Nae F.

description: So disappointed in this place! I ordered close to $45 worth of food from this place (plus tax and $5 tip to the courier it cost over $50!) and everything had to be thrown out! Got a E. Super Vegetarian Burrito, Taco Deal (3 chicken asada tacos), Super Quesadilla with carne asada, regular chicken asada burrito, and chips and salsa. The food was sooooo salty--my guests and I couldn't even eat the mild salsa provided because it was sooooo salty! I had considered ordering from my regular taco place--Nick's Crispy Tacos (which is somewhat expensive) but hadn't been to Pancho Villa for many years and decided to gamble on the place. What a waste of money! I'm wondering if anyone else has noticed the salt they put in their food (seriously not edible and I'm a person who uses salt on food). It wasn't just like one thing was salty, but all the food was, except actually the chips. What a bummer. I wish I could get reimbursement from them. What a waste of hard earned money. Ugh. Frustrated and cash poor in SF....
author: Anne R.

description: Really yummy super burrito, with really well cooked Spanish rice. Check in for a $2 coupon. Crunchy veg and different fresh salsas at the salsa bar. The portions are huge and easily enough to split. Horchata is really grainy and is pretty starchy, but it's not too sweet. Wish it was a little lighter! Overall, really friendly staff but had a poor experience with another customer harassing us.
author: Jenny Q.

description:
I may live 15 miles from the border to Mexico and hence have eaten at a plethora of taco joints, but I'll be damned if this place doesn't serve some mean tacos that would give some of the San Diego local places I frequent a run for their money.

When you first enter, you'll notice a long line of customers and an awesome salsa bar - free spicy carrots?! Don't mind if I do! But that's besides the point, come here for the beef tongue (lengua) or the grilled salmon tacos. Each taco is loaded with meat and perfectly garnished to the T. Seriously, I can't even... Juicy tender lengua all on my lengua. The portion of the salmon was pretty big, consider I had to eat it separately from the taco.

High ceilings, brightly lit interior, and a lot of tables, you're guaranteed to find a seat. On the plus side, the agua frescas were pretty tasty - freshly squeezed mango juice/water is icing on the cake. Will be back on my next visit to SF!
author: Christina T.

description:
Microwave ovens....all your food is Nuked before they serve it to you!

Yesterday, as I waiting in line to place my order, I observe 2 employees placing food orders, Nachos, Combo Plates & Tacos, in 2 separate microwave ovens. I was completely horrified, my jaw literally dropped!

Shame on you, Pancho Villa Taqueria, for using Microwave Ovens on customer's food! It is a great shame for any Restaurant to use Microwaves but for a so-called Mexican Restaurant to use Microwave Ovens is Criminal!

The Microwave Ovens are located behind the register on the bottom cabinets (against the wall).

if you like your food to be Nuked (Microwaved), this place is for you!

Eat at your own risk!
author: JC M.

description:
The atmosphere is busy, yet relaxed. It might seam a little chaotic when you look inside, but the noisy crowd that is seated around small dining tables is a sign! A sign of amazing tacos and burritos..

We were three people and we ordered far more than we could manage to eat. The menu is put together in a way that you can order one plate to taste several dishes. We had more than four different plates of tacos and burritos filled with amazing ingredients. The amount of food you get is just great! Noone will leave this place half full. 

They also have a wide selection of drinks. My favorite Mexican soda: "Jarritos" were present in five different flavours! Yum! We had a good time in taco heaven I can recommend this Taqueria for anyone who is hungry for mexican food! I'll be back for sure!
author: Maria S.

description: Came here on a Friday night and took literally 25 minutes to get a burrito. As in I stood by the register waiting on my food for 25 minutes. Not fun. Then, when my bean burrito came it had about 5 beans. I got halfway through it looking for the beans when I gave up and took it back to the register. To be fair, they made me a new one pretty fast, but the second one had zero black beans. Was this a misunderstanding or an eff you? Maybe they thought I said I didn't want ANY beans? I pretty clearly said I wanted MORE beans. Now I'm sad and beanless.
author: Julie B.

description:
Walked to this place because I saw the great yelp reviews and was craving some Mexican food while I was out in california. While in line (which moved quickly) I found a yelp deal which was $7 for a $10 meal, which I obviously purchased. Though the line moved quickly it took a long time to get the food, which was more frustrating as the tables were full. While we waited we checked out the salsa bar which was awesome. Probably 10 different types of salsa. A+ salsa bar. 

The tacos were good. Love me some carne Asada.
author: Dani L.

description: The Aguas Frescas are fantastic, I love the strawberry. The carnitas taco was great, the Chile Verde pork and shrimp were just okay. The salsa loves up to its legacy, pretty darn good
author: Moline D.

description:
Pros: THE SALSA!!! The roasted red salsa is literally my life. Also the burritos are super well wrapped & if you tell them to make it spicy, they throw in some delicious fresh jalepeno slices. The super carne asada burrito is my favorite burrito in the city~

Cons: When it's packed, it can take a long time to get your food + if the security guard isn't around, sometimes you'll get hassled by homeless people asking for your food.
author: Lianne K.

description: Hands down the best taqueria within all of the Mission District and San Francisco itself in my opinion. The burritos are a little pricey compared to the neighboring restaurants but you definitely get what you pay for. My go to would be the Super Burrito with Pollo Asada and Extra Sour Cream. This hits the spot everytime! Also, don't be afraid to ask for their extra crispy chips they usually give a fat load. A little tip is to also ask for mild salsa along with the chips. Perfect combo. Trust Bruh!
author: Faiz J.

description: Their carne asada is so so good. I only eat it here. Everywhere else is just a disappointment. I used to live in the Lower Haight & was always on the #22 Fillmore. Lucky for me, Pancho Villa was on its route. I almost always get the carne asada super burrito with refried black beans: riquisimo. I've had the plate with carne asada & shrimp: also very good. I've been eating their carne asada super burritos for 35 years. Whenever my daughter is home from NYC, she makes a trip to Pancho Villa for one.
author: Supa D.

description:
Love this place because I can order one dinner meal and be covered for my next 3 (disclaimer: I am a small person with a stomach to match my size). Seriously though the portions are great. The carne asada is delicious too! 

This place gets quite busy so at times it can be hard to find a table, but if you take your order to go you get a lot of chips to go with it! Woooo
author: Katherine B.

description:
Get the taco trio for $7! Carne asada and black beans with extra cilantro, limes, onions, and salsa from the salsa bar in the back. The tacos are amazing and aren't drenched in oil and grease. The meat is so tasty! Get a small bag of chips with your order but you can always pay extra for a side of them. 

I always get agua frescas ($2/small) when I eat at taquerias and opted for their guava one. You can taste the freshness of the guava and towards the end, you start to sip up the guava seeds. No artificial guava syrup here!

Seats are plentiful and usually don't have a problem finding one. Sometimes there is a performer that goes around singing and playing his instrument.
author: Lauren K.

description: This food is good but their delivery just sucks! For the 2nd time tonight Pancho Villa simply did not complete our order through GrubHub. We have tried calling and so has GrubHub and nobody can get through. If you're too busy in store to fulfill online orders, then take yourself off GrubHub! We waited 2 hours and now we have to fix up some Mac n Cheese for dinner. You guys are awful! And the fact that it has happened multiple times, come on, geez!
author: Travis P.

description: The best burritos I've ever had.  High quality Mexican food and fairly priced.  Time for all of us to "Get Beaned"!!!
author: R J.

description:
I am from the southwestern US, and we have a LOT of Mexican food. This place is at least as good as many places where I live. In fact, if we had a Pancho Villa, I'd be there at least once a week. When I am in SF and I want Mexican food, there is no other option. In addition to being open late, they have a wide variety of options for the vegetarians, pescatarians, and omnivores. 

Just check out the salsa bar. The variety that you see there is a clear indicator that you're going to get something good at this place. 

I usually get a burrito with some kind of meat in it. I've had the salmon, chicken, carnitas, and carne asada so far. Each of those has been fantastic. This trip, I tried a quesadilla and fish tacos. The super quesadilla was a nice change from the burrito since they're a little less heavy (the burritos can easily feed 2 people). The fish tacos were very simple: battered white fish, deep fried, and served in a tortilla with some shredded cabbage and sauce. While I haven't had everything on the menu, everything that I have had has been great. I will usually find a way to get to Pancho Villa whenever I am in the city, which says a lot since parking around here can be very painful.

Be sure to try the aguas frescas. The horchata and watermelon have both been great choices for me.
author: Doug B.

description:
Bomb.com, after visiting mission Dolores, we walked to this location. It was recomend by a relative that lives in SF. 

This place has fresh, homemade, delicious Mexican food. The kitchen is literally at your sight. They practically cook everything in front of you. If seems like this pace always has a line to order, but worth the wait. 

The price of everything is super reasonable. Food, drink and a churro for desert, for 3, we payed $45 including 20% tip. Not bad! 

If you want real Mexican food, this is the pace. They have award winning salas, you should try them ALL!
author: Jeanette R.

description: Best burritos around, but be prepared to wait.  There is always a line, but that's because the food is good!  You can opt to order delivery, but then you miss the salsa bar!
author: Alison S.

description:
this spot brought me back to life amidst a long sunday funday. 

i made the newbie mistake of rolling up during prime dinner hour, and paid for it by waiting in what seemed to be a forever line. legit, i was in line for 30 mins. i also changed my mind about 7 times on what i was going to order because everything on the menu sounded so DAMN good! again the line was long, which made me question their efficiency a bit as there were a TON of ppl working on the line. 

first it was a burrito, then it was tacos, then it was the carne asada and prawns platter (a local spoke very highly of their prawns, said i must get). when i got to the register, it was a game time decision. sick of waiting, i order what i thought would be fastest, the 3 taco combo plate. i i got 1 verde pork, 1 chorizo, and 1 prawns with rice and beans all spicy. i also got one chicken enchilada along with a large order of chips and guacs for my wasted friends to munch on back at the bar. 

while waiting for my food, i gleefully loaded myself up with to go salsas from the glorious salsa bar in the back of the dining room. so many choices, and as many as i wanted, yesss! when i finally got to enjoy this glorious mexican food, it was like playing salsa roulette. which one is going to burn/ not burn my mouth?! 

i may be biased because i was so hungry, but man those tacos were great and the enchilada made for a yummy breakfast the next day. two complaints- i ordered a lot of food and they gave me a small bag of to go chips. i obvi asked for another. there was no to go utensils or napkins in the bag. shame on me for not getting them myself, or checking.
author: Christina G.

description: Great place for a lunch burrito. Had the spicy super carna asada burrito. Huge, well seasoned and appropriate portions of rice and beans in the burrito. Good deal. Gigantic collection of salsas. Would repeat.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Kinda weird. My partner didn't trust it, because he's of the belief that authenticity cannot be attained through an assembly line system of burrito compilation. It turned out that he was right and didn't much enjoy his burrito. 

My cheese quesadilla was stuffed full of pico de gallo. Way too much of it. I had to shake it out. Otherwise, it was tasty. 

Other than those things, SALSA. ALL THE SALSA IN THE WORLD. Delicious.
author: Julia D.

description:
Had a to-go order, saw a cockroach on the wall, and told one of the employees about it. He casually grabbed a paper towel and didn't try that hard to kill it, so it actually just fell out of the paper towels and scurried on the floor. 

I showed him that he didn't actually kill it, and he just washed his hands and went back to whatever task he was doing. 

So yeah, not cool, won't be coming here again.
author: Tiffany S.

description: DO NOT ORDER FOR DELIVERY. Waited an hour as quoted, got an update from eat24 that everything is on schedule, called another hour later and apparently the order doesn't exist. I do NOT blame eat24. This is an internal problem and I think their 4+ star rating is bullshit. To the management here, do not offer delivery if you do not plan on delivering.
author: Traci L.

description:
Amidst all the hype in the mission, I have a Go To spot for a quick solid burrito. It isn't ground breaking or earth shattering, but sometimes I don't want to wait in a crazy line in a jam packed location. 

Pancho Villa has a larger location with more seats and cooks so you aren't waiting for days. Then again maybe this is only a perk when eating Mexican food sober. 

Super cheap food, great frescas, and a plethora of options. Come here for a quick dirty bite and some chips and awesome salsa bar to boot. It isn't anything special, but it does the trick every time.

Check it out. Gracias!
author: Joseph L.

description: Delicious burritos and is THE place you have to go to for all Mexican food. Gracias para la comida.
author: L T.

description:
Sometimes I forget to be grateful for what I have. But then I carry home a box of 3 for $7 tacos from Pancho Villa and am immediately reminded of how blessed I am to be a part of this planet.

This place is terribly inefficient. I waited somewhere between 30 and 40 minutes today just to receive my tacos, and the line wasn't even that long.

But I will overlook this and return happily (probably within the next few days) because 1) their carnitas are tender, juicy, and delicious beyond belief and 2) the have an epic salsa bar.

Seriously, though, these tacos are amazing. For me, the highlight of tacos is always the meat, and Pancho Villa does the meat so well. I tried the carnitas and carne asada, and both were incredible (though I will say the carnitas were better). The ratio of taco filling:tortilla were just right to showcase the meats, and man, I was so full afterward.

Pancho Villa, I love you!
author: Kelly R.

description:
I ordered my food via Caviar and got the nachos and chicken flautas... and it was all soggy and cold.

The tortilla on the flautas was coming off and barely held as I bit into it.

The nachos were breaking off and it wasn't even crispy anymore.
