I gotta applaud them for the large serving though, but the food didn't make the cut for me and was highly disappointed.
author: Aj C.

description:
I am so disappointed in this place!!!!! There are some great reviews on here that simply aren't true! I ordered a baby burrito with steak, added sour cream and guacamole! The meat had no flavor what so ever! I was playing a tug of war with the meat because the pieces were so big. 

My friend for steak nachos and to my surprise there was no cheese and lettuce! Since when do people eat lettuce on nachos. 

Overall it was a complete bust and a waste of a cheat meal. I was better off doing to the burrito truck.
author: Sunshine S.

description:
Got the Al Pastor super burrito. So good. The steak in the steak burrito was a little dry.

The set up in a little weird. When you walk in, you order with one person and they give you a receipt. Then you go to the cashier to pay. I guess this makes things faster when things are busy.
author: Mariko F.

description: I've been ordering the same thing here for almost 10 years. Crispy steak burrito. Today They wouldn't make it. They were not only jerks when I asked for it, they MADE me wait for the manager to be a jerk as well before they even let me pay for my lunch. This was one of my top places, until today. It's sad because it is many of the same staff.
author: Bow A.

description:
Great good, quick service, helpful staff. Prices are just right and the food is so yummy !! 

The flan was so good we each got a second slice to go home
author: Jaweria S.

description: If a burrito died and went to heaven, it would be in the Pancho Villa Taqueria.  Probably the best burrito that I've had in my life.  Been here twice now.  Killer salsa bar.  Cheap.  Fast.  Awesomeness.
author: Noel Y.

description: Got the super burrito with al pastor. It was... ok. The rice, again, tastes exactly like sad, Minute Rice. The meat was pretty fine, but it didn't blow me away. Good chips.
author: Jen A.

description: The food is very tasty and the restaurant is clean. The staff were extremely nice, and the salsa is out of this world!
author: Smrithi B.

description:
I am very sorry to have to do this....

I am a 20 yr residence of SF ...

And I have never ever had such bad Mexican food !!!

Hands down... this is the worst!!!

I ordered from DoorDash which is another nightmare....

2 quesadillas- COLD... cheese not melted tasted sour no flavor 

Dinner combo- enchiladas tacos... -   Cardboard wound taste better- horrible!!!!

Shrimp garlic tostada- my stomach still hurts.

Guac- no flavor
Even the salsa and chips were bad....

Avoid 

So sorry but had to post!!!!

Awful awful awful....
author: Dr. Octagon O.

description: One of the best burrito spots anywhere. The burritos are huge and you get a lot for not a lot of money. The salsa bar is fantastic. The friendliest staff. I love that they have vegan options. It really is delicious. My favorite place to go for a burrito. Can't say enough good things about this place. It can get busy at rush hour lunch and dinner times but it is worth the wait.
author: Randy R.

description:
The quality of food served here is grotesque. Soggy burrito with Luke warm meat. As I took a bite of my chicken burrito, a chicken bone stabbed the side of my mouth causing me to bleed. WHAT IF IT HAD BEEN LODGED IN MY THROAT INSTEAD?! 

Bottom line: I will never be eating from here again.
author: Cody S.

description: This place is pretty good and they tend to hook it w/r/t guac and etc. I tend to go for their tacos (take your pick, they're all good) with a side of rice and beans. Go ahead and order "make it a dinner" to go so you get guac, salad and chips too. Oh and order online, the line can get pretty long before closing on weekends.
author: Alex R.

description:
Came here a couple of times (sober/drunk) and both times, felt the same about this place. I do appreciate that they have agua frescas, and they have an ample Mexican food selection. However, something about the meat itself just doesn't taste right. I think it's not well marinated  and has an odd after taste. I will try the churros next time. 

It's a place to get your quick-fix if you are craving tacos on the more "authentic" side (a.k.a. you don't want to go to Chipotle).
author: Mayra E.

description:
I usually LOVE eating here, your quesadillas are BOMB and your super nachos? To die for.  I just hope this review sheds some light on something serious about food allergens.  I know you guys do your very best to not cross contaminate your meats, chicken and seafood when cooking.  You guys are literally in view of everyone who's waiting in line and I can understand the chaos of a busy rush hour.  But tonight I literally spent the past hour spilling chunks at work.

I ordered off postmates and got myself some super nachos with chicken asada and mild sauce.  Did I mention I love your nachos ?  UGH lol  But yea tonight in particular, I wish I had seen that pair of shrimp underneath all the sour cream and guacamole.  I mean it was an immediate reaction, my throat got itchy almost immediately after I swallowed and then came the night of misery :(

I am not allergic to ALL seafood, just shrimp in particular.  I know right ?  People often tell me that's like the worst thing haha

Nothing wrong with the service or the restaurant specifically, just with how the food is sometimes prepped.  Better to be preventative about something than to have it be a disaster, it could have been a lot worse :)
author: Allan M.

description: The restaurant and food are excellent but the morning- afternoon male cashier is super rude and unprofessional I been coming to this restaurant for the past 20 years but I am thinking seriously not to come back or just come at night.
author: Luly D.

description: Food is fine enough. But it's definitely not a quick or organized stop. 25+ min for two tacos. Plenty of places nearby that can do just as good in quicker time. Plenty of seating though if you want to come in and sit eat.
author: Joe V.

description: This place is great if you're hungry.  I have been grubbing at this place since the 90's and still look forward to my food from Pancho. I have their super vegetarian nachos and super vegetarian grilled burrito. Really fills you and hits the spot. Great place, I have them on speeddial to place an order and i am in and out in no time.
author: Chris W.

description: My go-to when in the Mission District to get tacos, but my favorite dish is the steak and prawns quesadilla! They also have good vegetarian options (chile relleno burrito) and one of the largest selections of agua fresca flavors! It's kid-friendly with high chairs and they even bus your table afterwards, so we leave a nice tip because of the mess our little one makes on the floor!
author: Thao T.

description:
Okay let me break this down real easy-like.

Cheap tacos. Cheap Beer. Open late. Lots of seating.

In the middle of the mission, super convenient. Let the deliciousness ensue.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
This place is SO FREAKING GOOD!!!!! If you're a Mexican food fan, you MUST try this place when you visit the Mission District!!!

I came to Pancho Villa Taqueria for lunch one day during the week, walking in around 2pm. Even at this sort of "off" hour for lunch, the line was out the door. Well worth the wait though. I ordered their Super Burrito, which came with beans, rice, cheese, your choice of meat, guacamole, sour cream and salsa. The burrito is HUGE too. Your order even comes with a side of chips. Total was about $9. They also have your choice of soda and beer if your heart desires. 

My food was amazing. One of the best burritos I've ever had. So flavorful and delicious. I was trying so hard to finish my whole burrito, but could only manage to eat about three fourths of it since it was so big. 

Service here was great. The noise level here is high and the workers don't speak English very well, so sometimes it is hard to get what you want across, but they make it work. 

Overall, I really loved it here and would come here again next time I'm in the Mission District!

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: I grew up on Pancho Villa and it was great to see it had not lost its charm & authenticity! I ordered one of my favorites, the super carnitas burrito with everything! I paired it with one of their fresh fruit drinks, the melon which is made from cantaloupe. I also added some tortilla chips so that I could sample from their vast hot sauce salsa bar, ohhh nellie! My favorite was the sauce blended with avocado. The whole meal was an experience! It will continue to remain a fond and favorite spot!
author: Analisa K.

description: Awesome food here! It takes great and is very affordable. If you are looking for good, cheap, food in The Mission District, this should be your stop.
author: Glen R.

description:
This place used to be 5 star amazing, but in the last year or so they have gone dramatically downhill.  They don't seem to be able to handle the volume since they started taking delivery orders, and as a result the food quality has become inconsistent and the wait time insane.

As I write this there is a warning on yelp about a poor surprise health inspection. I loved this place for years. This makes me so sad.
author: Rami M.

description:
The exterior of this place, displays an appealing and bold attention to go in and see what's up!

This Taqueria place in the Mission has history, a lot of people during peak hours, a full salsa bar, plenty of selections from the menu, spacious seatings and live music - depending on the time of day!

I ordered up their Shrimp Tacos and it was mouthwatering delicious - especially squeezing some lime wedge juice on it and pouring some salsa all over that yummy mess!

With the live band, strumming their guitars and gravitating from their energy, it was an enjoyable, well spent time here!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
FOOD:
This is one of my favorite places to take out mexican food. I really like the prawn burrito and the shrimp inside is really good!!! That's the only thing I've really tried from here and I always get the same thing.

SERVICE:
Fast service, little to no lines.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? Yes!
author: Kelley Y.

description:
Just ordered for delivery from here. Totally forgot to take a pic beforehand, sorry! 

Ordered steak fajitas. It was filling and pretty good but definitely not the best I've had. They gave me a ton of beans and not as much rice. The steak was good but they didn't cut it up all the way so it was stuck together and I had to pull it apart which was a bit annoying because I didn't have a knife on me. The sauce was ok and the veggies weren't as great as I've had at other places. The chips it came it was fresh and crisp though! The whole wheat tortilla was fine. 

All in all, I think I have to go here again and in person to really give a worthwhile review.
author: Lucky N.

description: This is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have visited around Napa. We stopped by after wine tasting and was pleasantly surprised how great all of the food was! I'll definitely come back again.
author: Sean C.

description: We stopped in for a quick bite late last night. The line was super long and apparently it was a slow period. I imagine this place when its busy has a line out the door! I went with the taco plate which came with way too much food. I recommend it if you are eyeballing a variety of things from the menu. They have beer too! Don't forget about the amazing salsa bar! Its got every salsa under the sun!
author: Daniella B.

description: Some of the best mexican food in the city! Must check out!
author: Jay M.

description:
Looking for reasonably priced mexican food to share amongst your friends? This is the place!

For three, the nachos, tacos, and chips were more than enough. Everything was delicious, especially the chorizo taco. Come a little early if you can as there was a line out the door when we left.
author: Jenny S.

description:
This is hands down my favorite mexican-style food restaurant.

There is always a line, but the line is served quickly, efficiently and politely.

Staff is friendly and helpful. They explain what is in any item you ask about and they tell you what your options are for that item clearly and concisely.

At night there is a friendly guard by the door who gets the door for everyone going in and out.

The portions are on the generous size of generous.

The food is prepared fresh, the ingredients are fresh and the establishment is squeaky clean despite serving hundreds of customers per hour.
author: Nobidy h.

description: Love this place it's clean you can actually see what they put in your food and how they make it which is always a plus for me because I don't like to go to Mexican restaurants where I can see them making my food. Every single dish they have is good I have it to try something I don't like from here. Wonderful selection of drinks. I also love their salsa bar. Their food is a little more expensive than other places but it's worth every penny to know and see what goes in your food.
author: Michele T.

description: For a local taco chain, this is surprisingly good. Super fast to get your food, cheap, and delicious tacos.
author: Nitesh Y.

description: It's only worth it with the two dollars off for the super burrito. Seriously, It's almost 10 dollars!!!
author: Samuel B.

description: Went to this place with my brother who lives in the Mission. This is one of his favorites!! It was definetly delicious!!! The line was a bit long but totally worth it. You get to see them make all the food in front of you, and there are over 15 employees working at a time because this place is always crowded. The line was long but the food came out quickly once ordered. Their burrito was delicious!!!! Would totally recommend. One of the best burritos in SF!!
author: Zander S.

description: I was there to meet my mom for late lunch but because my mom is an older looking woman they were trying to take advantage of her. She ordered a quesadilla and noticed that the bottom pieces looked to be bitten into already when she hadn't eaten that bottom piece yet. When she approached the manager and explained the situation, he accused her of lying about it and gave her rude responses. When i got there she was visibly upset and had lost her appetite so i went and spoke with the manager and he gave me the worst attitude that a person in charge could have towards a customer. He would repeatedly tell me that he trusts his employees which really had nothing to do with a refund. He would also yell at my mom in an inappropriate fashion, telling her "Quieres tu dinero? Te lo doy" in a sarcastic tone and distasteful manner. This happened today, January 5th 2017 at around 3:15 pm. I hope some action will be taken. I can assure you my mom and i had money and had no need to try and extort money from the restaurant.
author: Karlie R.

description: Only come here if you bring 45min to get ... a simple taco. They urgently need to make their service more efficient. It simply takes for ever...
author: Axel B.

description: The most authentic as it gets. Order at the counter and they bring it to you. The interior is not very clean and basically looks run down, but I guess it fits the place. The menu is huge though, only down side. I had  shrimp taco and beef taco and guac which was great! My husband had the steak place which he loved. Salsa bar with many fresh salsas, lime, cilantro, etc. food is 5 stars, cleanliness is a 3.
author: Michelle S.

description: Horrible place to go the food taste horrible and the service horrible.  I went for the first time and i told the lady is my first time here I asked her what kind of meat they have she answer very rude. At this point i was thinking to turn and leave. To make it simple to her i saw some tamales i ask what kind they have she told me chicken and pork then i ask her if they have corn  she rudely told me no only chicken and pork. I ask for a chicken and they serve it cold and the taste was horrible! For sure not going back there!!
author: Rosie M.

description: Ugh - I just got back from SD and wanted a burrito to compare to the one I had a week earlier. Let down. Soggy, cold, overstuffed of rice, and a b
author: Peter S.

description: Waited 30 min for 6 tacos cilantro and meat only, no flavor what so ever, the hibiscus water tasted like water and sugar only, there is no way that was natural. You have to add salt and as much sauce you can to get flavor on the food. Not coming  for sure !
author: Marcela M.

description: This place has a large interior with a lot of seats. They have so many varieties of salsa here. The waitresses call out the order numbers as they walk around to the tables. The super burrito was dry and there was minimal sour cream. The beef was crunchy and I could only find it in one half of the burrito. There were a lot of beans. The spiciness comes from the slices of jalapeños at the bottom of the burrito.
author: James S.

description: Really quick service, and huge burrito that will last you for two meals. The burrito especial was indeed very especial. I could taste the cheese and the guacamole was very fresh. Also lots of salsa-- load up and eat them with the free tortilla chips they give you! And don't forget to check in for $2 off any burrito. Mine came out to around $6+!
author: Katherine L.

description:
Winner winner Mexican dinner! 

I ordered from here through DoorDash and my burrito was heavy as hell. 

I love all the salsa and drink options and also how you're able to choose what kind of tortilla you want your burrito to be wrapped in. 

I don't care if the chips aren't made in house or if the chicken is dry. The chips were addicting and if you're going to order chicken in your burrito... You got issues. My lengua/shrimp burrito was effing delicious and the meat was not dry at all. 

Would definitely come back here again, I bet the food tastes even better hot and fresh.

P.S. - I know I said I'm El Farolito faithful.. But who doesn't love themselves a side bitch every now and then? Stay sexy Pancho Villa. You good in my book.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
My buddy and I were meeting for dinner before a Toastmasters event and, being a San Diego native, he chose some delicious Mexican food for dinner.  Fortunately Pancho Villa Taqueria is really near the BART station so it's only a half block walk from what is effectively skid row in the Mission.

I ordered their chorizo super burrito, a favorite of mine, and something I order whenever I go to their San Mateo location.  As expected, it was delicious and they've got a fantastic salsa bar to boot.  My favorite was definitely their avocado salsa, which had a slight creaminess to it.  Since the chorizo is usually cooked to order, it took a little longer than normal to get my burrito, but I enjoyed the chips and salsa in the meantime.

Service was quick and friendly enough, and it gets busy in here fast.  Getting to the salsa bar can be kind of a challenge because the workers are constantly cleaning and filling the salsas, which is great but they definitely get in the way.  Prices are mid-range here and a super burrito is about $7-8.  However, it's definitely one of the better places in the area and a location I'll definitely be back to.

Food: 7/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description: I went here because I heard really good things from a friend. I got the carne asada wet burrito. It just wasn't that good. The sauce on the burrito had an off taste and the burrito fillings didn't taste fresh either. The burrito was HUGE so I took some as leftovers, but I never had any desire to finish it. The two impressive things about this place are their extensive agua fresca and salsa selections. If you want a good burrito, there are many better places nearby.
author: Brittney N.

description: Beware of FOOD POISONING here. Absolutely atrocious ingredients. Will never go back after my experience with their burrito that made me and another person sick.
author: Laurie S.

description:
Wet burrito:  Check.
Flavorful meat, refried beans, and rice:  Check

Those are my only two checkboxes for Mexican food. Simple pleasures done right.
author: Karen K.

description:
I'm going to be crucified for this, but Pancho Villa has one of the better burritos in the area. Sure, they don't have lines as long as Farolito or Cancun's, but that's OK! More for me.

I just love how fresh and so clean (clean) they are. The natural lighting is a nice touch too. I also love how they throw in some spicy salsa into your burrito too.

However, they kind of skimp on the meat. Why you gotta be like that Pancho?
author: Casey S.

description: Got my oder wrong when I ordered through delivery. I ordered two wet burritos. I got two regular burritos. I ordered 2 large drinks. I got 2 small drinks. No napkins, no salsa, no utensils. The driver was too lazy to come to the door. I had to walk outside. The hustle wasn't worth the food tub.
author: Sean V.

description: Terrible!  I am a SF local and have been to this restaurant before.  Wasn't great in the past but wasn't terrible until now!  The beans had a bad taste.  The carnitas was HARD and literally could not be eaten. The flauta was disgusting it tasted days old. The Chile rellano tasted like it was frozen before. The churros were rock solid even the children wouldn't eat it.  Avoid!!
author: Amanda C.

description:
This place is fantastic for lunch or an easy dinner during the week! The food is authentic mexican and the pricing is fantastic (sizable portions). I recommend going in for one of the combo dinner meals (carne asada and garlic prawns), served with guac, beans, rice, tortillas, & a spread of toppings.

I plan to visit this place regularly!
author: Rudy S.

description:
Quality inexpensive food. I like the Prawn Burrito. The prawn was juicy and pretty big. The Chicken Salad was good too. I was surprised on how tender and tasty the chicken was. Very nice. The Quesadilla Super was also delicious. Just the right amount of cheese and salsa. They also had varies types of sauces and salsas to choose and some of them pretty spicy.

Stamped Approved.
author: Zuhadi Z.

description:
Very nice Taco place - and one of the few late night options in San Francisco.

They are busy, fast, efficient and tasty!
author: Noam Y.

description:
This review is for the Super Burrito Carne Asada & Shrimp...

Burrito was very dry.
The shrimp was over cooked and shrinks down very small. I was expecting plump and juicy shrimp!! The carne asada was dry and shriveled up. I was expecting that popping steak flavor that makes your eyes roll! Very small drops of salsa throughout the burrito, requires constant salsa pouring. The flavor was not there at all, the only flavors were from the salsa I was pouring in every bite. Very disappointing. 

I do not recommend this taqueria.

Ohh, but if your from out of town OR just moved to SF and want that Mission street burrito experience, come on down!!!

Real burritos are made at El Farrolito.
author: Mono L.

description: Went here earlier today, I have to say I love their refried beans, + got to c my favorite Maria, & Jeremiah--he's on the register.  Best beans ever...
author: Janet C.

description: I always get the carneazadaaaaa  super burrito per usual, but this time i tried the prawns and carne quesadilla and it was bomb.commmmmm!! This is my go to spot when ever I'm around 16th mission.
author: Ruthie V.

description:
First time trying this place today and I cannot wait to come back!  

I have heard so much rave about their burrito so I figured why not go all out and try the Steak & Prawns burrito- OH MY GOODNESS.... I think it's one of the BEST burritos I've ever had!!!  The prawns and steak were cooked perfectly, tons of flavors; and I got mine w/ spicy salsa!

I went here around 1:30PM and the line was still out the door, so I suggest coming here later for lunch is a must; even then we waited about 15 minutes for 2 burritos.  In terms of location, it is conveniently located outside the 16th BART station, but this is one of the worse BART stations. 

Overall, this spot is hands down one of the best taquerias I've been to!
author: Katie N.

description:
This place is always a hit or miss... Mostly miss for  us considering we get sick after.

We ordered burritos from here last night. We're both vegan so there was no sour cream, cheese or meat of any kind. After eating his entire burrito, my husband felt sick shortly after and lasted throughout the night. I felt a tad bit nauseous and in the morning had a horrible tummy ache that had me running to the bathroom all morning. This is the second time we've gotten sick after eating here.
author: Reese E.

description: Great value for the price. The burritos are really well made and have good volume. The environment is on the cleaner side compared to other taquerias in the Mission and the restaurant is fairly spacious. The meat is made fresh and the oil / surfaces are clean (as far as I can tell). There's also a nice variety of food, although I usually just get the super burrito with pollo asada. The salsa bar is a nice plus as well.
author: Eric L.

description:
If you're craving some delicious Mexican food, this is the place to go. I ordered two asada tacos and one carnitas. They had so much flavor and the green spicy sauce was perfect to put on top. My boyfriend ordered a burrito (I believe it was the super/supreme one or something like that) and finished it all and loved it. 

Although I loved the food, I wasn't a big fan of the service. It seemed super rushed and the cashier was really rude. My hands were full and I couldn't get the chips. I was trying to figure it out and just then he cashier went over me and called over to my boyfriend to help me. The lady behind me realized how rude it was and told the cashier she was in no hurry and it was fine. 

Despite the bad incident, I would still go back because the food is so good. Hopefully I'll have a better experience with the service next time though.
author: Ruby F.

description: This place has never disappointed me. One of the best Mexican food in the city! Their salsas are out of the world...
author: Dipanjan G.

description:
Food is awesome, no issue at all and one of the big fan of their food and regular customer but since they mashed up my veggie order with chicken and when i contact them employee were really rude on the phone so BEFORE ORDER AND EAT CHECK YOU GET WHAT YOU ORDERED.
mashed up everything but food is awesome, staff sucks :( :(
author: Sid R.

description: Very good food! Came here with my husband after a hard nite at work! Love the neighborhood !
author: Pooh W.

description:
Can't decide if this was the best burrito I've had in my life. If was pretty damn good. That price can't be beaten lol
Just wish the area was a little nicer and a little more room inside.
author: Allen P.

description:
I got a super burrito and LOVED IT. This burrito isn't the biggest burrito in the world, but it packs a big punch! The flavor in the super burrito was amazing, I'll definitely be back.

Minus one star for charging for salsa, then only packing half of the small container with actual salsa......
author: Gieselle A.

description:
Great burritos, easier to call in for pick!
They always have a person that can't take an order answer the phone which I personally find super entertaining. Every time.. Haha always delicious, always there and just a great munchies meal.
author: Tyler G.

description: I glad to come back last month for another go. I loved my food and ate a burrito with carne asada. Thank goodness I didn't have problems after that. Is been almost a year in a half that I made my first review and now coming back for another review since I ran out of options to eat around  SF , my grandma and I order to go. Keep it up.
author: Emily L.

description:
Oh man, everyone's talking about the tacos, burritos, and savory food here? Yeah, it's okay stuff but let me tell you about the real deal:

1. SALSA BAR. Full on most amazing salsa bar ever. Seriously, I didn't even know it was possible to have salsas in that many colors, but there were yellows, greens, oranges, shades of reds... our table was an amazing array of salsa tastings. 

2. The filled churro. With custard. Isn't that fact alone that they serve that here enough reason for you to order? But really, so good and so genius.
author: Sally C.

description: Very busy place! Large menu. The service is cafeteria style but runs quickly and accurate. I ordered a Super Burrito that is a size of a football and the taste and flavor  is delicious. The salsa bar is a plus, offering a variety of salas and peppers to compliments the large menu, something for everyone and various temperatures. You also can purchase various Mexican style "Frescas" drinks, I got the Horchata and it was delicious. The drink was sweet but not overwhelming sweet and the consistency was like whole milk with rich cinnamon flavor. Pancho Villa din not disappoint this first timer and I will be returning again.
author: Andrew C.

description:
This was my first time here and since I was a block away, and I checked other reviews on Yelp,  I decided to try it. It just so happened when I checked in there was a Yelp special of $2.00 off a Super Burrito.  Coincidentally this is exactly what I was hankering for. 

The place was buzzing and the place was busy.  There were a lot of people behind the counter so I thought this would be a quick in-n-out meal...NOT.  Despite there being about (6) women preparing the orders, (2) guys cooking and (2) women tending the register, it took eternity for my food to arrive.  I could tell this wasn't going to be good when a woman standing beside me was waiting for over 30 minutes and still others about the same or longer. I didn't understand why it took so long since there were so many people walking to and from behind the counter. 

The food, on the other hand, was ok.  It wasn't super great.  I've tasted better and I've lived in different cities in the Bay Area. I ordered a carnitas super burrito and a small aguas Fresca-cantaloupe. When I finally took my food home there were large chunks of carnitas in my burrito.  Usually the carnitas is properly chopped without any fat or large chunks. 

Maybe this was just my first bad experience. I'm willing to try the place again...but not right away.
author: O ..

description:
I walked into Pancho Villa Taqueria while walking around The Mission district of San Francisco looking for a new burrito place to try opposed to the normal taqueria I frequent.

FREQUENCY: This was my first time ordering at this establishment.

FOOD: I ordered a spicy chicken burrito which was pretty good. It's tough rating burrito in The Mission because the best burrito in America can be found there. It wasn't as good as some of the others I've had in the area but it was still delicious. What really made this location stand out to me was their salsa bar. They had more salsa than I could hope to try in one sitting. I actually want to go back just to try more of the salsa. Next time I'll probably try something else like a quesadilla. Again this burrito wasn't bad, it was very good, I just have a regular spot I go to that I think is better.

DRINK: I didn't order any drinks while at Pancho Villa Taqueria so I can't speak much to what they offer. I'd assume it's the normal drinks you can expect at a taqueria like soft drinks, water, or beer.

ATMOSPHERE: Pancho Villa Taqueria had the standard vibe for a taqueria in The Mission. Tables are usually filled with people having conversation and there's music playing in the background. I did takeout so I wasn't around long enough for the atmosphere to really stick.

STAFF: The staff was friendly when taking my order. Since taqueria's serve in a fast food like style you don't really spend much time talking with the staff.

PAYMENT: Credit cards or cash were acceptable.

If this taqueria were located anywhere else in the country it would easily get a 5 star review. Unfortunately it has some steep competition being located in The Mission district of San Francisco. I do think I'll be back to try more of the salsa's and would recommend it to anyone looking for some good Mexican food in the area.
author: Christopher D.

description:
I. don't. get. it. 

There are so many other amazing Mexican joints that are off the charts within one square mile and why Pancho Villa gets so much attention is beyond me.  I got a chicken burrito. It was completely dry and lacking in flavor. Also, it costs more for less food. Sure they push their fresh and family friendly vibes, but it just cant compare the the bombastic  party in my mouth that I can easily get at other burrito joints around here.
author: Priti K.

description:
so close of five stars but minus one for wet burrito. I don't like when my burrito is dripping wet. It soaks the tortilla and gets all messy. I like having the sauce and lime wet it up. 

You walk in and wait in line. While waiting they make you more hungry by cooking everything right in front of you. Boy oh boy it looked so deli. 

I think the reason my burrito was super wet was because I ordered chicken and the chicken is soaked in the juices. I like juicy chicken but... I'd rather have no extra juice. Just my preference. 

Then you tell them what kind of burrito/ plate, you can change the type of tortilla to spinach or whatever you like, the meat and then wait again to pay. 

While you're waiting for your food( only takes like 2 minutes) you can walk per to their sauce bar and seriously, try em all. My fav was the verde (green) sauce. Orange was creamy but no spice. Red was okay but not really spicy and verde was perfect!!! At the bar they also have cilantro and onion. You best believe I went to town on that!!!

Real good place to try out. If you don't like wet burritos, I recommend not getting the chicken.
author: Lynn C.

description: This was my first meal after arriving in San Francisco and I am so glad it was. Everything was cheap, huge, and delicious. Only negative is that it was insanely hot inside with no air conditioning or fans.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Pancho Villa is located in a somewhat sketchy part of the city and is definitely one of the hole-in-the-wall type of places. There is a security guard at the entrance, which sets the precedent for the type of area you are in. This guard was actually really nice and did his job superbly, escorting a vagabond heckler out of the restaurant without causing a scene and also helping the staff out by cleaning the tables here and there. Back to the food though. The pricing here is super friendly to your wallet and it helps that the food is super delicious too. We were here for dinner on a Friday night and the place was very busy. Initially we had tried to order delivery through Eat24 and Grubhub, but both of these apps were not allowing us to order from here. We think that Pancho Villa ceases app orders during peak dining hours since they are already too occupied with the crowds. They were sporadically taking direct phone orders, so it can be hit or miss for that. I am glad we came in to dine here though because the smells in the air of the restaurant make the food taste even better. I shared the chicken fajita dinner plate, then we also ordered the vegetarian nachos, and carne asada dinner plate, as well as an XL fresa juice (strawberry juice). I did not try the juice, but heard that it was delicious. Getting the food to the table is a bit tricky since the place is so noisy and the ladies working here don't have loud enough voices to shout the order number over the roar of the diners. Even though there are 15 people working the shift, it is wise to stand near the end of the ordering line and wait for the food. It took about 15 minutes for them to get it ready, and we definitely got skipped over in line by the easier orders. It was all worth it in the end. They did give chips while we waited and the salsa bar they have is pretty legitimate. The green salsa had a kick to it, so be careful if you aren't one for spicy food. The meal itself was very tasty! I really liked the chicken because it was the right texture and seasoning. The Mexican rice was also very tasty and I ended up eating it all. Other stuff that came on the dinner plate was beans and a small salad. All of this ended up being plenty of food for two people. We did have to purchase one extra tortilla to finish up the fajitas though. Overall, an absolutely worth it taqueria to eat at in SF. Not a first date kind of place, but definitely a place where you go with people who appreciate hefty portions of delicious food at a fair price.
author: Vats A.

description: Great food. Whenever I'm in the Mission, I stop by and scarf down a taco. So one day, I'm sitting at home seriously craving a super veggie taco. Luckily uber eats delivers, so I order. I kid you not, it took over TWO HOURS to get my food when the original delivery estimate was 38 min. I can shrug off a 30 min delay, but an hour & 22 min? Completely and totally unacceptable. I even called uber eats to get them to check in with Pancho Villa. Even then, it took an additional half an hour to leave the restaurant. Don't order out. Clearly they don't care about you getting your meal in a timely manner.
author: Pooja B.

description: I've only ordered this place on UberEATS and the chille relleno burrito is AMAZING! One burrito will definitely fill you up. I recommend choosing your chile relleno burrito with refried beans and green salsa.
author: Frank F.

description: Just ok. Doesn't compete with the other top 3-4 spots in the mission imo, but is super convenient to my house and to Bart which I can appreciate. The carne asada seemed undercooked and overly pink. Still tasted good, but nothing compared to the La Taq dorado style I had a few days later. I'll probably come back, but might not do the super burrito again..
author: Steffan P.

description:
Authentic Mexican Taqueria with Delicious Vegetarian Tacos and Aguas Frescas!

I ate at Pancho Villa Taqueria for lunch on my first day in San Francisco shortly after arriving on July 28th and LOVED it!

Pancho Villa is a casual, cafeteria-style Mexican taqueria located on 16th Street between Valencia and Mission Streets in the Mission District. You order along an assembly line and choose your taco ingredients and toppings as you walk along the glass counter to the cash register. The large menu with a variety of traditional Mexican meals and dishes is situated on the wall behind the counter.

I ordered the super vegetarian tacos and they tasted very authentic and absolutely delicious!
The tacos were loaded with toppings including cheese, guacamole, sour cream, rice, black beans, lettuce, tomatoes and onions (the staff were generous with their servings of each ingredient) and I also received a small complimentary order of tortilla chips and salsa, as a starter. The fresh and fruity aguas frescas juices were also very tasty and refreshing. The prices were very reasonable and inexpensive.

There was also a large salsa bar with a great selection of various sauces and toppings for the tacos.

Pancho Villa was busy with lots of people and there was a line-up but it moved fairly quickly and the tacos were well worth the wait! The staff were also friendly and the service was efficient.

This is an excellent place to eat an inexpensive and authentic Mexican meal in San Francisco's Mission District!
author: Brittany T.

description: Let's start off by saying how HUGE the super burritos are! Even more HUGE if you opt for the savory sauce + cheese. Ordered myself and my friends a carne asada & al pastor burrito via UberEats and I was more than happy with our order. Definitely worth the $10 for a HUGE authentic Mexican burrito. Depending on how hungry you are, one super burrito is enough for two people.
author: Shela D.

description:
TLDR: Get the Steak and Shrimp Quesadilla, you will be happy. Convenient Location (close to Bart). Wait in person takes some time so consider using services like Eat 24/ Grub hub. Will definitely come back here again!

This place has the best Steak and Shrimp Quesadilla. The shrimp is really good and a perfect compliment to the steak. Haven't had a better quesadilla than this before. If you're eating it the next day, if you pan fry it will taste great too. They also have shrimp tacos if you really end up liking the shrimp too, which were quite nice as well.

I also tried:
- Fish taco: pretty good
- Steak taco: not bad
- Super Quesadilla with Steak: The Guac/ sour cream/ etc... is too much. Just get the Steak and Shrimp Quesadilla.
- Guac and chips: Guac's pretty good, chips are so so.
- Lemonade: a bit more sour than sweet but not bad.

Great Location! This place is just two blocks from the 16th and Mission Bart station!
author: Derrick C.

description:
Whatever I said before; table that for a second. I stand corrected.

Do expect much from the meats, and in particular, the lengua. It is sublime.  
I don't think I've had tongue this tender before. On top of the melt in your mouth texture, it's pretty darn well seasoned too. It made for a most delightful taco. 

Now I still found the carnitas a little dry, which would have made Pancho Villa 5-star amazing, but man on man that lengua. Now that I've had some, I'm absolutely sure I'll be back, and with good regularity, for some amazingly tender beef tongue tacos.
author: Jon L.

description: I've been coming here since I can remember. Born and raised in the Mission I've come across a lot of Mexican restaurants come and go over the years and Pancho Villa is a place where the food is great, but the service has been declining over the years. If I had to rate the food alone, this place gets a solid 3.5/5. Not to say this is "authentic home made Mexican food" but I can't lie and say this place isn't ok. I feel part of this is because the price is right. Nowadays you go to a Taqueria in the Mission, they'll charge you $10ish dollars for a REGULAR burrito while Pancho Villa has you covered for around $7. All these Taquerias became greedy since the Mission is getting gentrified with all these Hippies & Yuppies making good money, that they'll pay anything for some Mexican food. But that's what I appreciate about Pancho Villa, they've been pretty solid with prices, I guess depending on what you get. My go tos are Spicy Shrimp Dinner, Carne Asada Dinner, and Burritos/Quesadillas. They also have a very good Salsa Bar, around 10 or so different types of salsas catering to everyone's taste and heat tolerance. But these past years or so is when I really started to realize how rarely I've been coming back to this place, and here's why. They are literally busy all hours. At this point it doesn't even matter what time you come in for some food, it's always busy. Even when it's not busy, it takes about 15-20 min to get food in your hand AFTER ordering. So you're looking around 20-30 min of waiting for some food as soon as you step inside. That's ridiculous. And the weekends? It's awful. Everyone is here since there's about 15 bars around this area that it makes sense for everyone to gather around and get some food. But the real issue is, is that they started to do the whole order ahead business. Ever since these companies like Caviar, UberEats, etc. They get a ridiculous amount of orders coming in from all these apps, including the huge number of customers that come in person. I've also noticed that they seem to make the delivery orders a priority over the actual customers coming in. Kinda messed up but that's business for you. Shows you what money does, and how sometimes an app that seams like it's doing you a favor as a customer is actually hurting a really good business not in terms of sales, but that used to have great service all around. I still support Pancho Villa but it'll never be the same.
author: Greg M.

description:
I live nearby and it's my go-to taqueria. Being from San Diego I'm tough to please when it comes to Mexican food. 

Good: salsa bar and shrimp. Namely the super shrimp burrito. Spinach tortilla. It's solid, but no lettuce please. Never should there be lettuce in a legit burrito lol

Bad: almost everything else. I've tried it all. the nachos, tacos, quesadillas. They're not so much bad as just meh. 

Ugly: the wait times. This place is always mad busy. Put in your order ahead of time. Lots of Anti-gas meds afterward. Sometimes it worth it though.
author: William V.

description:
Fatty-fresh mexican food.  90% of the time I order the pure carne burrito and it takes me straight to burrito euphoria. Ive tried most of the dinner plates and they are sooo good and sooo authentic. All food is cooked in front of you (see that its fresh), salsa bar is huge and give slightly oily but light corn chips-delicious!!. 

They also deliver!
author: Denniz S.

description: This place is amazing! Have had the super burrito a few times now and just as good every time! Tried the pulled pork today, so good!
author: Sara N.

description:
This place is DOPE.

I usually get their 3 taco deal all al pastor. The price and portions are great.

Try their salsa verde! It's the perfect amount of spicy. 

Their homemade tortilla chips are also awesome.

Give this place a try :)
author: Courtni W.

description:
One of the better burritos I've ever had.  I got what I think is called the Super Burrito.  I got it delivered via UberEats so it wasn't fresh off the grill, but that didn't matter.  Everything about it was spot on.  I should have stopped half way through but it was sooooo good I had to finish it all.  

Only time will tell if that was the best decision, but right now I'm all about this place!
author: Mike M.

description: Childhood fave! I grew up in SF and frequented this place a lot!  I'm now in the EB and still regularly travel to SF for work and pleasure.  Good Mexican food is hard to find in the EB. When I'm in the mood for amazing Mexican food, this is the only place that satisfies my craving.  Consistently delish!  Never disappointed.  Don't be intimidated by the long lines.  They go fast.  And, hey....it's worth the wait anyway!
author: Kim J.

description: I've been frequenting this taqueria for 25 years.  It is my go-to place for a solid good burrito.  They are consistently good, quick and inexpensive.  I've tried almost every one of their offerings and except for the carnitas which I find greasy, I have not had a bad bite.
author: Hadas R.

description:
We re not rushing back here.  we were the last to get our food because "the prawns have to be cooked".
Remind me not to leave tip until after our food comes out.  Good thing we had 50 mins on the meter
author: Alice X.

description:
PANCHOO VILLLAAA!  It's 10:30 on a dark Thursday night, but mission locals choose this place for a late dinner after work.  The neighborhood could seem a bit sketch at first, but everyone minds their own business.  What matters is: not only do they open until late, they provide free chips, too! The best part is... the food is good!  They provide a variety of authentic Mexican food, sauces (orange, green, salsas), fresh fruit juices (ie. watermelon), and Jarritos.  They even have mini wedding cakes!

I ordered a super quesadilla with pastor (bbq pork).  It was filled with a bunch of substance.  Got my guac, sour cream, lettuce, tomatoes, melted cheese--more than I imagined to be in a quesdilla.  I'm salivating as I'm describing it.  Not bad at all, especially if you're trying to avoid rice and beans for the night ;)  The rest of my party ordered burritos: meats vary from carne asada, chicken, or even vegetarian (tofu, no meat!).  The cashier ladies are very fast and efficient.  The men are also working quick to prepare the food.  Just stand by the door and smell... mmMmm.  The seating is a bit cozy during busy hours.  Come prepared to EAT!
author: Janet T.

description:
Great spot for delicious food at a reasonable price.  The dinner combos are a great way to try something new...

Will definitely go back again soon.
author: Gary O.

description:
WORLD CUP QUALIFYING PRE-GAME MEAL DINNER

Before Tuesday's match between USA and Mexico I came here to eat. The reason I came here wasn't reading Yelp reviews, but the Examiner's review that this place served the best prawn tacos. I was hoping they have a TV so I can watch the USA-Mexico game, but they don't have one. Besides the prawn tacos, which I ordered two of them, I also ordered the salmon taco, lengua taco, and the homemade guacamole. I agree with the Examiner's review that the prawn tacos are really good. What makes them special is they butterfly the shrimps which make the shrimp chunkier in the taco. The prawns had a buttery taste to them. The salmon taco is what I also recommend as they are tender and juicy. The other items where ok. If they have lengua as one of the meat choices then they should have tripitas and cabeza. Since this place is close to Bart it a good place to grab a quick bite.
author: Gerald R.

description:
This is one of the bigger and busier tacquerias i've seen in mission. I've been here a few times; but the last time i went with friends, there were no tables :( Some cleared up eventually though so no problem

I like getting the carne asada or carnitas burritos here. Meat burritos here are great after bars and usually what i crave. (If you're brave enough to try spicy, don't forget to get a drink or ask for a cup to get water ;) lol.) For that, it's in a good location near mission and valencia bars, and easy to get home after since it's near a bunch of MUNI stops and 16th St BART station. 

Comes with free chips, like most other tacquerias. There's a salsa bar at the back that's fun to explore to try different and new flavours. 

Overall a good place. Sometimes I think the cleanliness of the restrooms could be better; but if I'm just rating the food and service, it's fab
author: Bianca C.

description: Still the best burrito in town, but they no longer have real utensils, just flimsy plastic junk. & no more free chips with your order.  More popular than ever, long lines of mostly millennials go right out the door onto the sidewalk.  I much prefer to take the food home than eat it there; it's often pretty hard to find a table, and even when you can, it's noisy and crowded.
author: Lawrence S.

description: I wish I could rate no stars. This place sucks! I went in to order to go I ordered a salmon and prawn burrito on a wheat tortilla. 25 damn minutes! Really! The cashier kept saying oh it's because you ordered grilled shrimp. Gtfoh that's bull crap and so is Pancho Villa! I promise I will NEVER GO BACK! I cancelled my order and got a refund!
author: Louise J.

description:
Got a surf n turf burrito and fell in love. MMMMM good.
Lost a star because of the wait and the cashier that wouldnt look you in the eye.
author: Russ H.

description: So I was with my family in the city and my mom is from the area so she recommended this place. I'm from souther Cali, so I'm really particular about Mexican food. If you've never been here then you need to go. The food was amazing. They carry anything and everything. From burritos to tamales and anything in between. I order the super prawn nachos and they amazing. They were big pieces of prawns and all the good fixing. I was super stuffed after sampling off 5 other people plates and their food was amazing as well. I'll defiantly be back whenever I'm in the mission district l.
author: James T.

description:
Always crazy busy with long lines, but goes by pretty fast. Waiting for the food however can feel a bit long. But the food & service is amazing!
Whenever I'm in the mood for a taqueria I go here. I always get a carne asada super quesadilla and it is the best thing in the entire world. Totally worth it.
author: Jenise M.

description:
I was actually really excited about trying this place since I love Mexican food and take pride in my favorite taquerias in town. I decided to let go of my favorites for the night and try a place that was really popular that people raved about.

Off bat, it felt weird inside to be completely honest. It felt super bright and clean, and everyone was dressed like I was at a food chain restaurant. I decided to move past visuals and not judge and still go ahead. I ordered super tacos.

I'm extremely disappointed. My tacos looked like a salad with more lettuce and shredded carrots than any other ingredient. It was cold, and quite honestly tasted plain and generic. 

My friend ordered a super burrito and experienced hers to be cold, open and not contained in the foil, beans not flavored, and the al pastor tasting horrible. Not to mention they messed up her order and gave her ingredients she didn't ask for and took items out that she specifically asked for. It was so bad she went back and returned her burrito for her money back.

In general all the items and weird proportions of ingredients, mostly veggies and beans.

This is not to say this place is disgusting or it didn't use to be good. Maybe we went on an off night. All I know is that I didn't want to finish my meal.
author: Cassidy A.

description: DO NOT pay for a side of guacamole and chips. They water down the avocado so you are basically having avocado salsa that you get free at most taco places. It is NOT Guacamole. What a ripoff.
author: M. M.

description: One of the worst tasting Mexican food that I've had in my life, and I'm Mexican! I've tasted it all and I could barely keep this food down. Literally the whole thing went into the trash can.
author: Denise C.

description: Went here with a friend a week or so ago because we saw the good reviews. We step in and go up to order and the lady helping us wasn't the most patient or polite with us, but we shrugged it off since we figured it was just a busy day. When we go up to pay, we asked for 1 drink and the server was confused and billed me for two drinks instead of one and she tried to refund our $15 order and have me pay again but some how when i checked my bank statements the next day it said I was charged $90 and i had to call my bank. The food overall was good, I got the carne asada platter and my friend got a burrito but unfortunately that burrito gave him awful food poisoning. All in all, not a good experience and I would not recommend this restaurant. My friend ordered the flan which was really good and I got the churro which didn't seem very fresh, but it was still ok!
author: Brenna S.

description: Really delicious burritos. They are huge so I got the smallest size and still wasn't able to finish it. The delivery was also pretty quick
author: Lisa D.

description:
Ahhh....finally a CLEAN burrito joint! I know everyone loves El Farolito, etc. but those places are dirty :0 Pancho Villa has a bit of a Chipotle feel...I feel like it would be more efficient if they made your burritos while you order but alas...

This place has legit vegetarian/vegan burritos. I opted for the most basic - beans, rice, lettuce, salsa - but next time I'll be more adventurous and order one with mixed vegetables. The beans, rice, and tortilla are solid and overall the food feels filling and fresh without leaving you feeling overly stuffed/greasy. You can tell that fresh ingredients are a priority here.

Possibly one of the best things about Pancho Villa is their salsa bar. There must have been 8 different types of salsa there along with other various toppings. It's a great way to customize your burrito and it's all free! I recommend skipping having salsa on your actual burrito when it's made so that you can add the specific one you want later on. 

Lastly, food is cheap here. I believe my basic veggie burrito was less than $5. It's great to find a place that prices food accurately - i.e. why would a beef and veggie burrito be priced the same?? Vegetarians actually won't get ripped off here.
author: Sarah S.

description: Coming from someone who loves only Taco Bell and chipotle (fake Mexican food), I have to say this is the best authentic Mexican food place over ever eaten at!!!!! Love the tacos, dinner plates, and most of all the salsa bar!! Workers are also very friendly, would highly recommend
author: Lilian B.

description: I generally love this place, but there was no cheese in my quesadilla the other night. Luckily the rest of the ingredients are so good that it was still yummy. But still, not an ideal quesadilla.
author: Audrey M.

description:
I have several favorite burrito joints in the Mission, and this is one of them. Other than the fact that different places have different recipes and different kinds of atmosphere, there's no reason to not go here all the time. They are clinically efficient - you think Germans are efficient? Watch these folks work sometime. Sometimes the service seems slow, but that's because half the Mission is there at once. So sometimes there's a wait; but I have never had a bad meal there in 25 years. Some Mex places don't have seafood at all, they have salmon, prawns, and snapper; in any combination you can imagine.

Also, there's the salsa bar - they win the CA state fair salsa competition nearly every year - ribbons on the wall for you to see - and it's all there for you. They must have a dozen different kinds of fantastic salsa plus various vegetable condiments. I always cheat and take some extra stuff home.

And then, they have art as well: a constant rotating display of art on their walls, sometimes excellent.

AND, they have a 'happy hour' Taconomics - tacos and beers! (I am never there that early though)

I recommend a salmon taco, a garlic/mushroom quesadilla, a beer, and if you have a gigantic stomach, a churro (mexican extruded pastry). They give you chips; try some salsa.(most of it is HOT so watch out!)(ASK for which ones are mild!)
author: Steven B.

description: Probably my favorite burrito restaurant in the city.  Great  chilled verde pork and chicken, carnitas is very tasty and not too lean.  The seafood is also excellent. Portion is very good too.
author: Peter L.

description: I am truly disappointed regarding the bad health inspection score as the food is soooo good. I hope they get it together or I will discontinue my visits
author: Gwen S.

description:
Pancho Villa is my favorite Taqueria EVER!
Every time I come back home after being abroad this is my favorite place to go. As a vegetarian I often order a veggie burrito, or quesadilla with beans and cheese. Always very happy with my meal. The lines can get long, however so I usually call in advance and order take-away. The service is always fast, and great value for the money. I would highly recommend to any and everyone!
author: Ronni M.

description:
This has got to be one of the cleanest and delicious burrito spots in the mission.
I stumbled upon this place.
It's an open kitchen so you get to see how they prep the food.

People who works there actually wears a proper apron and seem to care how the food is presented. (Even though it's a 9 dollar burrito)


The steak snd shrimp burrito was amazing! I loveeeed it.
Will definitely come back again!
author: Alui L.

description: Got the super burrito with chicken fajitas. The rice was alright and the salsa was pretty good. Only gave it four starts because it didn't blow me away and the wait was long.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Got here early to place orders before the rush today!  How long does it take to prepare a salad???????
I've waits now for 40 minutes with other patrons coming in after me arriving and leaving with their more complicated orders!  I've never had this type of service here before but they need to get it together!  They get a 0 for service today from a long term customer!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
My Mexican experiences in San Francisco have been hit or miss, mostly miss. I thought Pancho Villa Taqueria might tip the scales toward the hit category, but even with all it has going for it, I've got to drop a deuce on it.

On paper, PVT has a lot of things going for it:

1) Lots of fans; it was bumpin' on a Friday evening
2) A huge menu with lots of vegetarian options
3) A great salsa bar
4) Homemade agua frescas

However, that's not enough for me to dole out any more stars to PVT. 

At first I was confused at the two lines when I walked in; one quite long and the other not. The long one is for food; if you've already called ahead or are only drinking, you can skip it. Otherwise, queue up. The other line is for drinks and payments.

I ordered the vegetarian burrito b - beans (black), rice, cheese and salsa. I opted for hot salsa; from my burrito's innards, that appears to be the hot pico. I also ordered an lime agua fresca. As I waited for my food, I took my little complimentary tray of chips over to the salsa bar. The bar is quite impressive, but I wish there were signs noting what the different salsas were and their heat level. The agua fresca was good too, but I prefer mine more tart.

When my burrito came, it was a tight little foil tube; not much bigger than a paper towel tube. I was very excited to sink my teeth into a tasty burrito, but that excitement was extinguished very quickly when I realized how bland my burrito was. The taste of rice and jalapenos was so overwhelming that it's all I could taste. I muscled through most of the burrito, eventually throwing in the towel because it was boring and I was full. Normally, if a burrito is good, I will eat til my stomach hurts and then eat a little more (sad, I know). To add insult to injury, it was the burrito that kept on giving; something in it went right through me.

Bottom line: No bueno.
author: Mary T.

description:
The burritos here were ok. I ordered a super burrito with carne asada and there were too many beans in the burrito.  They have a good selection of salsas, but some of them I found to be too vinegary.  

I didn't have any issues, but my friend had some gastrointestinal problems after our lunch date.  So many burrito joints in the Mission, so little time... I probably wouldn't return.
author: Bella L.

description: Food here is delicious but customer service is the worse. I'm a frequent customer here and I always place my orders over the phone for pick up. It is important to mention that almost every time I place an order, they always make a few mistakes but not a big deal. Today I placed an order of 4 burritos as I always do every friday. I called it in and the lady at the register took my order, and told me to be there in 15 minutes. I got there on time just to find out they never took the order and they didn't even had an idea of what I was talking about. I requested to speak to the manager to explain the situation and to my surprise, he was even worse than the person I spoke before him. He was very rude and condescending. Since I'm a regular customer, and this is not the first time they make a mistake with my orders, I asked him to at least compasate my time with a free beverage, which he stated "no sir, we are not here to give out food for free" keep in mind that I'm a regular customer who orders 4 to 5 burritos every friday. Maybe they will ignore this review but I just wanted people to know what kinda service they offered to their clients.
author: Dean A.

description: My dad used to always bring us here after church, and I can still stay it's still one of the most consistent places to eat in SF.  I have to go out there yesterday and I knew before I came back to Antioch, I had to get my burrito and it was awesome. Along with the salsas, OMG brings me back to my childhood. Keep doing what you doing I will always be a customers for life yayay!
author: Andy D.

description:
With over like 50 taquerias in the Mission District alone (lol), I needed to find out what set this place apart from all the others; even El Farolito off 24th st/Mission which is ALWAYS packed. However Pancho Villa is equally ALWAYS packed, if not more. Last time I went was about a couple weeks ago I think. The burritos are pretty good and I can actually taste the sour cream better than other places, but the chicken was still pretty bland for me. I haven't yet found a decent taqueria with tender juicy white meat chicken that's not too tough or dry. 

The place is pretty big and there's always a line throughout the day every day it seems. The seating charts could use some work. There shouldn't be any tables right near the door. People and their 25 kids/guests like to block the aisles and not be mindful of those who want to go around to the register for to go orders, or go to the bathroom. Other than that, pretty solid place for burritos. And I love burritos so lol. I'll have to try other items soon.
author: Marquis A.

description: My favorite local taqueria.  I always go for their pork choices, the chile verde pork is especially good!  Would also recommend you try out all their sauces in the back.  They've won numerous awards for them and it really adds some zing to the food!
author: W L.

description: Hell Yeah!!! :) One of my favorite burrito spots, if not my favorite Burrito spot in SF Mission and the Bay Area.  The food is so good here!  The salsa bar is too legit 2 quit!  So many different types of salsa to choose from.  The Orange and Green are the best in my opinion.  Mixed the two together and you just created magic!  :)  I always go out of my way to get a burrito whenever I'm around this area.  One of the things I miss about working in this area.  Beware, parking sucks here!  But, Pancho is worth driving around for 10-15 minutes looking for a parking spot.  If you can bart in, that's better.  The churros are good, too!  Pancho is definitely in the top 3!
author: Ryan K.

description:
ordered a super burrito with refried black beans and they gave me regular pinto beans. 

this is the third time in a row they did this. 

I guess they cannot speak American english.
author: Dean N.

description: Got the carne asada super burrito on fast bites delivery and it was really tasty the salsa was really mild so I needed it spiced up a bit and the side of sour cream helped amp up the flavor. Have since ordered their burritos for delivery multiple times and it's always tasty. I just wish when I ordered salsa it isn't the pico de gallo and there's a way to order really hot salsa for those of us who like heat
author: Piper W.

description:
Cheap but mediocre. I guess you get what you pay for.

Management, try switching from Iceberg lettuce to Romaine. It will make a big difference.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Pancho's is right off the 16th street bart stop, so it's definitely convenient for a quick bite. Lots of workers constantly churning food out, lots of smells permeating the air.

While I thought the super burrito we got was pretty good, I was definitely underwhelmed compared to some of my other experiences with Mexican food. I think it was the cold lettuce that took away from the heat of the meat. AT thought it was good, though, and he seems to be pretty picky about Mexican food. Another downside for me was that they don't give you chips--you have to order them on the side.

The pluses: there's a security guard at the front who stands guard and opens doors for patrons. The salsa bar is great--I got some of everything and mixed and matched them.

I might be back at some point, but for me it wasn't good enough that I'm willing to stop searching for a better Mexican place. The search for the best Mexican continues...
author: Julia N.

description:
Consistently good burritos, tacos, and enchiladas. Great salsa bar!

What I like is that everything is fresh, simple, and good. 

It does get busy so there can be a wait, but it's worth it.

Clean, convenient parking in building next door or across the street. Convenient to StageWerx theater and music venues.
author: Daniel W.

description:
One of our favorite Mexican spots in town! The food is authentic, always fresh and the unlimited condiments bar is the cherry on top. My go to is the white fish bowl and the fresh watermelon juice.

Hi Gary! - My husband had a prawn burrito once and although the prawns were good he felt there weren't enough in the burrito.
author: H K.

description: We wait in long lines at this restaurant as EVERYONE who has been here can say. When we got our chips we wanted the normal plastic tray not a tiny paper tray. She said no. I am upset at the service, but the food is delicious.
author: Rachel C.

description:
While dining on a burrito at Pancho Villa with two former co-workers, one of whom was also a (former) lover, the other made mention of the ladies they had just brought to this establishment the previous weekend. Aaaaand appetite gone, feelings crushed, jealousy simmering right up to a gentle boil.

Despite the awful social circle I used to roll around with, I was able to test out a bunch of great SF eateries in my greener days. Pancho Villa being one of them. That shizz is delicious.

Large portions, fresh ingredients, love me some Carne Asada Fajitas and any burrito on the menu. Spacious and clean, the line speaks for itself, and let's not leave out the blessed salsa bar, always stocked and full of variety, which, as we all know, is the very spice of life.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Very solid burritos. The carne asada is done very well, it's a huge spot, service is excellent. Big fan. The other foods are eh, but get carne.

For the mission, open late, can't really go wrong.
author: Chuck N.

description: This is such a great taqueria in the city my super wet burrito was probably about one of the best I've tasted and that says a lot because I have tried quite a few! Definitely will be back when in craving Mexican food
author: Ellie O.

description:
In a large brightly lit space on 16th Street, Pancho Villa Taqueria is the McDonalds of Mexican food in The City. 

With a enormous menu board, it's easy for diners to be overwhelmed: appetizers, salads, tacos, burritos, and whole dinners can be had. For this review, we will concentrate on the gold standard of measuring taquerias, the carne asada burrito. 

Of all the top Mission burrito joints, Pancho Villa Taqueria offers the most burrito customization options by far. Diners have choices of meat (carne asada, pollo asada, carnitas, al pastor, spicy pollo, pollo chile verde, pork chile verde, tofu ranchero, lengua, steak fajitas, and pollo fajitas), beans (refried pinto, whole pinto, black whole, and black refried), tortilla (flour, whole wheat, red chile, and spinach), and salsa (mild or hot pico, molcajete stone ground, fire roasted arbol chile, and pastor roasted). 

A regular burrito ($7.00) sports your choice of meat, rice, beans, and salsa. The deluxe ($7.50) adds cheese. The especial ($8.00) will get you guacamole. The super ($9.00) scores you sour cream, lettuce, and tomato. 

With a steamed tortilla, the carne asada burrito was sizable, but not overwhelming. Ordered spicy, it was quite piquant, but slightly dry, needing some salsa to give it the right consistency. Good sized chunks of steak were plentiful and there was a good mix of ingredients in each bite. 

A small portion of chips is complimentary with your burrito, perfect to sample the award-winning selections on the large salsa bar.

Pancho Villa Taqueria also offers a myriad of drink choices, including sodas ($1.00), Mexicoke ($2.50), and Aguas frescas ($2.00, $2.50, $3.00, and $3.50) as well as domestic ($3.50) and Mexican ($4.00) beers. 

The line can sometimes be long, but it moves quickly. Service is fast, efficient, and polite. 

While not in the same league as El Farolito, La Taqueria, or Taqueria Cancun, Pancho Villa Taqueria puts out some seriously good burritos.
author: CJ G.

description:
A no frills, but high on taste lip smacking good time location.

There is a large option of hot foods in the front. So many delicious looking choices. But we came here for tacos. And tacos is what we got.

Our group got a mixture of chicken, beef and fish tacos.

The fish tacos were over flowing with fish bits ensuring each bite was full of flavor. No objections here!

This place also gives you nachos with a very large selection of salsa to chose from in the back. There's more than enough choices for your tacos, your nachos, or if you order a specialty large nachos like us you fight your way to finish such a large monster.

Over all fun place. Not a fancy setup, but that's great if you are looking to just eat and hang out with your friends with the option to frequently order more small bites along the way.
author: Jerry K.

description:
Here's my rant , I hate it when they put corn in the rice, I was craving a burrito for the whole night . I called in an order stating no rice. 

Got the burrito and guess what they put rice in it .
author: DOM d.

description: anytime, you get a chance to eat some GREAT food out of the mission, you are doing good.  PVT is another location that is great to taste and dine in.  Good food, great flavor, good environment, big place.  All of your typical dishes plus more.  Looking forward to my next visit to PVT
author: Nic C.

description: Pancho Villa was definitely a solid Mission District Mexican food experience!  It's pretty hard to go wrong with a tortilla and some yummy meat inside.  Everything here seemed very fresh and delicious.  As we were eating, I constantly saw the chefs cooking the meat on the grill and refilling the meat tubs with fresh meat to make new food with!  I ordered a beef super burrito, which was pretty good, it wasn't really anything to write home about, but it certainly was delicious.  The reason for only four stars is because it was very yummy and hit the spot, but it was also pretty typical.  I wouldn't really say it was completely extraordinary and I did actually get a couple gristly bites, but I can't really blame the restaurant too much for that.  I had to spit out a couple bites because they weren't really chewable, but that could probably happen anywhere.  Their selection of salsas made a really nice addition to my burrito too!  I practically poured a drop of new a different kind of salsa on every bite!  Overall delicious, but honestly it's nothing SUPER incredible.
author: Kevin K.

description: Stopped coming here over a decade ago because friends got food poisoning here (judging by the alert on their yelp page that is apparently an ongoing issue.). I have been back a few times lately and food was as consistent as I remember. I've never really had any problems here. The only issue is ordering for dine in I had to repeatedly check back at the counter for my food because I did not hear anyone call numbers or try to brig my food out. I eventually found it sitting at the counter when I came back to the register. Besides this food is decent and they are very busy at dinnertime. If you are new to the area this might not be the first place to try in a neighborhood full or great Taquerias. My short list of best Mexican places in the Mission: 1) La Taqueria 2) El Farolito 3) El Toro. Pancho Villa is adequate, with a convenient location.
author: Kevin S.

description:
This is my review of my order from September 5th,2015.

I never had Mexican delivered before so I decided to try this place out based on the reviews.

I ordered:

3 Can Soda  $ 3.00  
1 Jarrito  $ 2.35  
1 Nachos  $ 5.45  
1 Flan  $ 3.75  
1 Alfajor  $ 1.50  
1 Deluxe Burrito  $ 8.00  

Okay first off the delivery  man was very nice. Now to the food.... There was one item that was missing: 1 Flan and I paid $3.75 and they still charged me for it!!!!!!!!!!!!! Instead they substituted it with a Churro,ugh. I never liked churros tbh.Too sugary.

So party foul on that one.

Now onto the Deluxe Burrito...It was okay,nothing special imo. Honestly I had better tasting burritos elsewhere. Plus it looked a little small for "deluxe". The filling tasted good though. Plus I couldn't even taste the hot sauce. What no extra hot sauce on the side either? 

Onto the Nachos... Tasted okay but the presentation was not that great imo. Why do I have to pay seperate for things like olives??? I miss the old days when you ordered "Nachos",it came complete. The beans tasted nicely cooked. Sour cream looked weird,but tasted okay I guess.

Jarritos was good. Soda can tops were dirty.

2 and half stars.
author: Isabella A.

description: I got $2 thru Yelp on a super burrito. We didn't get guacamole, cheese, or sour cream as promised.
author: Lina H.

description: Pancho Villa Taqueria is a bigger, drunker El Toro.
author: Amy C.

description: Excellent and authentic. This has been my favorite burrito spot since I was a kid and they still live up the hype! I always get the steak and prawn and the meats are seasoned deliciously.
author: L. W.

description:
After a long day with work and political meetings, my colleague and I were looking for a place to eat near the Mission PD. 

We narrowed it down to two spots. We checked out the first spot first, and figured that I've eaten at that restaurant (from another location) before. It was an OK place but not too exciting. 

So we walked to Pancho Villa's and once we walked in, I again realized I've been there before! I remembered (with help from the delicious smells) that I had some bomb burritos from here once. We were sold. 

My friend and I both ordered Dinner combo #3 not knowing that it comes in huge portions. When the order arrived we were like, "Daaamn that's a Hella lot of food!" 

The carnitas weren't dry, the prawns well marinated, tons of mushrooms, and the rice was just right. I finished the whole thing except for a bit of the refried beans. All downed with the help of an horchata. 

Thanks for a delish meal and good prices!
author: Anna W.

description: The food is always good and the service quick. The chicken avocado salad is INSANE, and their carnitas is killer too. Don't order ahead on any of the apps they use, though-- it will take you 10X as long to get your food as the people in line. You're better off just queuing up!
author: Taylor R.

description:
Came in waited in line for 10 mins 
To be told griddle was off
I drove 5 hours to taste camarones al chile de Arbol 
Guy didn't care 

Bad bad bad

Not to mentíon that I have been coming here since 1989
Never have I experienced such this 

I am a Mexican person dealing with another Mexican workers 

How typical is that !!!!! 
We descriminate our own
author: Victor L.

description:
BEST TAQUERIA HANDS DOWN. 

If you are even thinking of going to that trashcan La Cumbre, do yourself a favor and walk around the corner and eat a real burrito that won't put your health in jeopardy. 

Every time I come here it's packed--you know they are doing something right when on a Tuesday night they have a line out the door and they have shirts and hats for sale because people love it so much. 

Food is always incredibly fresh and the flavors are beyond compare. The pollo asado (grilled chicken) is my personal favorite because it's actually made ON A GRILL. Many other taquerias will boast of grilled chicken but they don't actually grill them. You can see everything being made fresh, so you know it's done right. 

The line may get long and the wait slightly tedious, but it's worth it, trust me. Order a large Jamaica agua fresca for the wait.
author: Bianca U.

description: Huge, tasty burritos and a distinctive facade. One of the better spots I've been to in the Mission and quite the convenient location!
author: Michael S.

description:
After a night out drinking, my friend and I were hoping to grab some $1 tacos but found that the check-in deal was no longer available so...we shared a burrito.
