$8 or something, I don't know. The burrito was okay sized. Kind of small compared to other $8 burritos I've seen. It got us pretty stuffed though, but I think that's because we were full from beer.

Okay flavors. I liked adding the orange-y salsa they had available in the back. I actually really like their salsa thing in the back because they give you tons of options...including limes and cilantro which are both things that I obsess about. There's a guy in the back who regularly cleans it and checks up on it. I think that's nice.

Anyway, this is a good place to go when it's late night and you want something to eat really quick.
author: Sofia R.

description: The food here is so delicious and the salsas are one of a kind! The only bad thing about this is that the restaurant itself and the bathrooms are a little bit dirty. If you want really good Mexican food this is the place to go! I got the carne asada Super Burrito and it was so bomb! I highly recommend it.
author: G A.

description:
This place is getting worse and worse, 40 MINUTES TO GET AND ORDER !
The order was simple 4 Carne Assad burritos two Carne asada tacos 
The cashier checked on the order several times but not real effort on finding on how come they made the burritos and not the tacos and left the order half way.

Then I was commenting to the guy that it was already over half hour that I made the order and I wasn't the only one in the meant time they were giving orders over 30 number from my order. The guy with a condescending tone simply said you want to wait for the tacos or I can just refund the order that's it!

We know how a business can be when is busy but seriously no way that this should happen.
author: SF E.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner we had a super burrito with a strawberry juice drink. The food and strawberry drink were da bomb. However the cashier was rude forgot to give us chips and rushed our order. I don't know if it is because my significant other is AA I hope not but I definitely don't like how the service was. I just like the food that's it.
author: Joanna M.

description: If I could, I would give it negative star. I placed an order through Eat24 and the estimate delivery time is 45-60 minutes. An hour passed and the food is still not here. I called them and they say the order is just ready and is about to be delivered. They said it's going to be another 10 minutes. Another half an hour later and the delivery is still not here. Call them again and they first said my food just went out, then they changed the story and said they didn't know and hung up on me. I contacted Eat24. They said their guy went there to pick up but the food wasn't ready. I can understand you are busy but if you can't handle the volume, you shouldn't have picked up the order. I would never eat there again!
author: Loki C.

description: Stopped by here last January. What a treat it was. The salmon burrito was a true delicacy.
author: Tim O.

description:
I love their salsa bar, foods taste great..... but I got a serious food poisoning from their shrimp taco........ Other than that, I like the place. Next time I'll try something without seafood.

I went there on Nov 8(Sun) around 8-9PM with 2 friends. I had a shrimp taco and a cup of pineapple agua fresca. I started to feel sick around 11pm, I think. 
One of my friend had a quesadilla with shrimp but she had no problem at all.
author: Maki S.

description: I came here on a Friday night for dinner -- I ordered the super steak and prawn burrito with a Corona on the side, as well as some guac. The line was quite long, but it moved along quickly. The restaurant had a pretty large salsa bar (for free!) which was definitely a plus, complimenting the free chips nicely. The burrito itself was really good! Because I don't get sour cream in my burritos, I usually find most burritos to be a tad bit dry, but this place made it perfectly. Also, they give you 2 dollars off any order with a super burrito if you check in on Yelp. Overall, it was a good experience and I will be coming back again!
author: Peter W.

description:
Do not order delivery from here. 

I have not been to the restaurant in person, but the delivery is terrible. See below my review for similar reviews to this. My take: 

1. Missing food
2. Food is all jumbled together and messy
3. Food was late (close to 1.5 hours despite the 40 minute estimated time)
4. Manager was rude and did not do anything for me after I called. 

If you don't believe me, I uploaded a picture of my "two taco dinner order" which contains only 1 taco and looks like a prison meal.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Came in around 12:30am and the place was still buzzing with people. We didn't have to wait long at all because the line moved so quickly. 

This was my first time here and I ordered the super quesadilla. The portion was really big I could only eat half of it. Tasted GREAT. We also ordered chips with salsa and the ingredients were very very fresh. 

I don't know if this is a normal thing or not but there was a Mexican guy walking around playing his guitar and singing to everyone eating. It was really nice and we gave him a few dollars. 

I would come again for sure
author: Emily E.

description:
Drunk. Sober. People gotta eat. Then we die and go to salsa heaven.

The service is one of the most efficient burrito assembly lines I have ever seen. 

I have food envy every time I eat here, whatever everyone is eating looks good. But I can't change, I always get the same: carne asada super burrito.

It's a delicious burrito. The meat is good quality. I still think it's weird to put shredded lettuce on something that's warm inside...and what horrible leftovers would that make...but you won't have leftovers. 

You're going to eat the WHOLE burrito. 

If that doesn't sell you, where are my sauce people? They have a million, perhaps more, salsas.
author: Sarah S.

description:
In my opinion when ranking the quality of the burrito you must also consider the quality of the wrapping.  Nothing worse than a loosely wrapped burrito.

These guys do an amazing job in wrapping them. Its borderline artistic.  The aluminum is wrapped so tightly it is mirror like.
Not to mention the taste is very fresh and very authentic.
I usually try to stop by whenever im in the city!..
author: Carlos Q.

description:
Pancho Villa, why hath thou forsaken me? I was expecting so much more based on the reviews.

I should have known better, though. After dining at such amazing LA-based Mexican spots like Guisados and Salsa & Beer, every other Mexican joint becomes bland, sloppy, and a complete let-down.

You call dry beans, end-of-day rice, and mystery meat acceptable contents for a burrito? I'd give a mighty bellow of a laugh were it not for this burrito spackled to my insides! 

And the "award-winning" salsa bar? What kind award is it and who is giving them out exactly? Can't be recent or from any reputable organization.  

On the plus side, the quesadilla and pork chile verde taco were both actually pretty good relative to the crap burrito. 

Horchata was definitely meh. For $3, I better be getting liquid gold or reduced-price refills.  

I'm really starting to get an idea of how lame the Mexican cuisine is up here.

I hope I'm proven wrong at some point.
author: Aren A.

description:
This place is always generally busy due to its location so the set up is a bit different in that you don't get to see your burrito made often. I don't really like that if you are ordering double meat or something different. You can not tell if it is actually occurring.

Salsa Bar - Everybody can agree their salsa free has a large variety and generally is pretty good ( they have won competitions according to medals on the wall)

Yelp Deal - Definitely get the yelp deal. It is $7 for $10 and has been going on for at least a year.

However I have had problems with this deal couple times. Recently they made a huge scene over the fact my order was only $9 and not above $10. Demanding I order more things. What kind of BS is that? Legally there was nothing in the terms of service that stated this. So it was more of a upsell move. 

Best part was that even after 5-7 minutes of huffing and puffing from the worker and manager, oh my burrito was not even finished.

Burrito itself was mediocre. Often the more packed and busy places seem to be the crappiest.
author: Nathan A.

description:
This is my kind of place. No frills, a ton of food options down an assembly line, and an eclectic crowd of San Franciscans. You're getting a great value in terms of portions. But the quality of food in questionable. I get the sense that they're not using fresh or organic produce, so maybe it takes away from the authentic taste of Mexican food? Because it didn't 100% hit the spot in the way that I thought it would.

But with that said, this is delicious food. And the prawns are MONEY. Whatever combo/platter you get, get the prawns. Don't be boring. You will not regret it.
author: Mandana Y.

description: Can't really review a place when you call for delivery through Grubhub and they delay delivery so that your food had been sitting in their car for an hour.... a two hour delivery is unacceptable when they are a few miles away. Canceled & disappointed.
author: H L.

description: Came down on the weekend and i saw the line so I know the food must be good. Ordered tacos and the super nachos and it was more food than I could handle for a reasonable price. The horchata is good, the carne asada was slammin', but the carnitas was ok.  Definitely a new favorite! The menu is too much to take in, in one visit, soooo much to choose from. Can't wait to try the salmon next time.
author: Ish A.

description: I orderer a super burrito with chicken meat, whole beans (pinto), and spicy. The burrito was thinner than your average taco truck burrito, but it made up for it in flavor. I deviated from my regular beef burrito (carne asada) and ordered the grilled chicken. I also, love that they have wheat tortillas for those of us looking to cut down on the calories. Overall, I give the chicken burrito a 4 out of 5. I've eaten my share of burritos, and this place is darn good! Also, there condiment bar is plenty-full and plenty of choices of your typical, likes, radish (rabbanos), and chiles. They have about 5 different salsas to chose from, aaaaand they're actually spicy (picante)!
author: Jesse G.

description:
Kudos to Pancho Villa!!!

When you walk in, you can see the bright sign's, people busily helping customers and people cleaning everything - there is always somebody cleaning something. Impressive.

I had to try the Spicy Shrimp plate: comes with a good amount of shrimps cooked in their shell (props for that), your choice of beans: pinto or negro, spanish rice, your choice of tortillas: flour or maize. It's very pica!!!
$10.25 for a packed plate of food is choice and could be split for for two light eaters.

Tip: wander to the back area and load up on fresh sliced radish's, various salsa's -the green is spicy hot! two diff. kinds of red salsa, mild and hot. fresh diced cilantro and white onion, even grilled serrrano's for your pleasure.

Four stars and recommended.

Customer service: excellent.

The roaming mariachi singer is creme.

I can see why there is a long line of people.
author: Bert K.

description:
My friends and I tried this place after a passerby heard our conversation about finding the best burritos in the Mission. He told us to come to Pancho Villa because they had "the most extensive salsa bar [he had] ever seen." And he was very right, it is definitely the best salsa bar I've ever seen.

The service is fast and simple, which was great for us because we wanted to chill out at Delores with our delicious burritos. And the quality of the burritos is perfection, I can attest that these are the best burritos I've ever had. And you can't complain with the price either. Their aqua fresca bar is also one of the most extensive I've ever seen, so there's a lot of options to choose from.
author: Jacqui A.

description: my absolute favorite! Veggie burrito E with a spinach torilla - YUM!! magical experience of deliciousness
author: Ashlie S.

description:
One of the best carnitas burritos I've had in a while! A gustatory and textural delight. My one qualm is that the chips are a bit too oily for my tastes, but still delicious.

UPDATE: I took a bag of chips home and the oil soaked through the paper bag, causing them to all fall out when I picked it up. Too much oil, honestly.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
Big
Space with 
Salsa bar
And the Mission
Prerequisite of large burritos friends.
author: Justin L.

description: Lines can get long and so can the wait for your food, especially during happy hour when their prices drop for tacos ($1.50)  from 3pm to 5pm, so I wouldn't go here if your looking for something quick on a lunch break but other than that they've got decent food for a cheap price!
author: Janelle W.

description:
Hands down good food! Enough said!

I can't give it 5 stars though because their Horchata wasn't they best I've had. They also accidentally switched my order with another customer and the mystery couldn't be solved because the employers english was non-existent, so that was a little frustrating. That doesn't affect the quality of their amazing food though!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Ordered delivery.  It came late. Did not receive several items I ordered. The dessert I ordered opened in the bag, causing half my order inedible.  I called the restaurant and management pretty much said, that's not their problem and it's not their responsibly,  due to the order coming from an outside delivery service. Which I do not understand, because they are the people who bagged the items to send out through the delivery service. 

Payed over $75 for this order which included 20% tip and $5 delivery charge.  

Disappointed.
author: LT T.

description:
Been coming here for years and the food is always excellent.

Wide range of offerings, and lots of protein choices, even for vegetarians. Their chile relleno is the best.

There may be a line, it may get hectic, and it gets loud, too. So what?

Wait until you bite into some good, honest, well made food....

que bueno, enjoy!
author: William M.

description: Best tacos I have ever eaten! and great price and quick service. It was really crowded for 11 at night but makes sense, its delicious
author: Carmel G.

description: Alway's a 5 star review, but the refried black bean were burnt Tonight. Had them in my burrito & got a side of them too. Very disappointed. Need to taste before serving. Quality control!
author: Linda L.

description:
I feel like the burritos could be bigger, but Pancho Villa makes a consistently good quality burrito.

The salsa bar is definitely fresh and delicious.

I prefer La Cumbre around the corner but this is still a great place to eat! Not the best in the Mission, but you can't go wrong.
author: Doug R.

description:
How magical, this place looks just like the one in San Mateo. From the ordering line, down to the layout, and the seating. They really just want to make sure you feel at home no matter which one you're at.

As usual, there is some good food to be had. I've always liked their burritos, and they have a great selection of meats and veggies to choose from. The best thing I like about this place, is that there are a lot of vegetarian options. It is tough to bring vegetarian friends to Mexican places sometimes, but Pancho Villa never fails.

Oh, and don't forget their salsa bar at the back of the restaurant. Remember to ask for chips (they come free with food order), because they sometimes forget to give you some.
author: Alice C.

description: My favorite taqueria in SF! The fact that there is always a line speaks for itself. Everything I've tried here has beyond satisfied me, they give you really big portions for what you pay so it's worth every penny. Love the tacos and quesadillas, but the burritos are my favorite thing to get here.
author: Jen W.

description:
Solid taqueria with an awesome salsa bar. To order you line up where the food's being made. Saw Yelp has a $2 off a Super Burrito when you check in so it only came out to $6.50! My husband always orders their Carne Asada and Grilled Shrimp plate which is about $14 but you get TONS of food. 

They also have lots of agua fresca flavors and give you a small tray of chips with each order. Seating can be a bit competitive depending what time you go so jump on a table when you see it or if someone looks like they're leaving!
author: Allison R.

description: best carne prawn super nachos ever everything is very fresh here always
author: Carmin W.

description: Great food. I had a salmon burrito and it was very good. The Aguas frescas though.... I got the strawberry agua Fresca and it was the best thing ever!  Not too sweet  just right. Definitely coming back here when I'm in SF next time.
author: Michelle V.

description: Good food, but the wait time is TERRIBLE! For a to-go order, waited nearly an hour from order time to finally getting my order. No apologies or offer of a discount from the staff for the trouble. Will NEVER EVER patronize this business again! There are many other great taquerias in SF. Oh, did I say this place is TERRIBLE!
author: Kathy A.

description: Well worth the wait. Back home our burritos look like sloppy over-wrapped tacos, bunched in foil. Pancho Villa produced a perfectly cylindrical, easy to peel foil tube, just the right size for chowing down on (not around or scooping off the plate). And the flavour, it was spectacular. Of the multitude of burritos I've had while visiting SF, Pancho has so far, been the very best burrito I've ever eaten. I'd challenge someone to tell me a better burrito (and share that location, because I'd be running there, as you should be running to Pancho). And get the spicy sauce, it's worth the gamble.
author: Josh C.

description:
Wait wait wait. You can put anything I want in my burrito? Excellent! 

There are a couple of places like this in the Mission. They get an A for the salsa bar. The salsa were fresh as there was a constant line of people getting their burrito on. So many salsas, so few chips but that is ok. I don't want to fill up on chips when I have a shrimp burrito coming my way. 

It was an above average shrimp burrito. I don't know why this always happens to me but I always start on the wrong end of the burrito. 

You say what? There is a right side to start on a burrito? I say yes, the side with the meat (or shrimp) on it of course. I always take my first bite on the end with no meat and always think, am I being ripped off here. But oh my god was I wrong. So many shrimp in This burrito. 

Plenty of seating, free salsa and chips and a parking structure near by. What else do you want in SF for a burrito joint?
author: Angel G.

description:
It's not like this place needs any more stellar reviews (if you don't already believe almost 2,000 people, I don't know what's going to convince you!) but Oh. My. Goodness.

Their chile relleno super burrito is the greatest thing that has ever happened in the history of taquerias. With their added salsas? OM NOM NOM. Do your mouth a favor and try this place. Lots of veg/an options and a surprisingly great drink selection. There's usually a long line and it can be hard to find a table sometimes during peak evening hours, but it's worth the wait!
author: Ricky G.

description:
We were back in San Francisco after having moved away three years ago. In desperate need of an authentic mission burrito, we went to Pancho Villa.  

The new way to order your food is terrible.  Instead of just telling the server what you want and they make it,, now you tell someone what you want who punches it into a computer and gives you a receipt.  You take your receipt to the person who collects your money.  And then you find a table and wait.  We probably waited 15 minutes.  What was interesting is the place was not very busy for a Saturday night. 

Once we got our burritos they were good and the spicy tastes of carnitas and jalapeños brought back memories. But this wasn't the fat burrito we remembered. It was no longer three inches in diameter. Now it was maybe an inch and a half wide. 

For all of the choices to find a mission burrito, we will try another next time.
author: Ed J.

description:
Pancho Villa...my love.
I live in the East Bay and have come solely into the city to eat at your fine establishment..you are just THAT good. You're open all the time, your staff is just oh so friendly (and efficient!), and the food is just more muy bueno y delicioso than I could describe!

Perfectly assembled burritos, cheesey melty, super stuffed quesadillas, and a sauce bar filled with all of the best sauces! I kid you not, this place is amazing and although it's packed just about any time you come, the line moves quickly, the food is made fresh, and you can always snag a seat inside to enjoy your meal. Order some horchata or agua fresca with your meal, so refreshing and tasty! Their menu is quite extensive and whether you're feeling carnivorous or vegetarian, they've got it all. 

I have made plans with friends around coming to eat here, it's really good, you need to try this taqueria out. Best taqueria in the Bay (in my opinion)....if only they had an identical location in Berkeley I would frequent it even more.

Mexican food noms to the max. Go here and make your taste buds happy!

ps- hit up the sauce bar, I mean it...especially try the creamy bisque like tomato sauce. Put it on your complimentary nacho chips or all over your food. It's versatile and a delicious addition to your meal.
author: Akvile D.

description:
tl;dr OK at best. Find something better.

Went once in person and wasn't very impressed. Ordered again via UberEATS and was similarly disappointed. Both times I had the carne asada super burrito. The food is on-par with wack bay area "Mexican" food but I won't be eating there again. If you want good Mexican food, go to SoCal.
author: Dorian P.

description:
There are several Mexican restaurants in this area, but we decided to start with this one because it looked fairly busy (so we thought it was a popular joint). 

The food was average. I got a regular chicken burrito, which was a little too dry. It wasn't horrible, but I would definitely try something different next time (maybe a supreme burrito or something more saucy). The variety of salsas however, was greatly appreciated. All the salsas were well done and they hit a large range in the spicy pallet. The pricing was quite reasonable for the amount of food we got.

The service was great, and efficient. The people were very nice. We didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes for our food, especially since they give you chips & salsa to keep you occupied in the mean time. Would probably try at least one more time.
author: Adi P.

description:
One of my absolute favs in the Mission.  And I can take BART so I don't have to deal with parking.

They now offer DELIVERY THROUGH EAT 24.  

Finally I can get decent Mexican Food in Nob Hill.
author: Salon O.

description:
Their burritos lack dimension.

This is no longer my favorite place even if it's in the neighborhood.
author: Lisa T.

description: This place came in clutch with its late hours and quick service. After getting the tacos, I know why it was so packed even late at night!
author: Maurisa D.

description: oh my god YUM. So many good (spicy!) salsas. And thin crispy chips. I got the tofu burrito and it was awesome because the rice, beans, and pico de gallo were incredibly flavorful and fresh, but next time I'd skip the tofu (bland, didn't add to the other awesome components of the burrito, but creds for even having a tofu option!!) and stick with rice and beans. Or rice, beans, and guac. mmm. While you wait in line you get to see burrito assembly behind the glass which is v exciting. Great vegetarian/vegan options. So cheap and sooo good! I am one happy burrito lover.
author: Cathy J.

description:
Great place if you are from out of town and want to try good mexican food in SF. 

Very fresh meat and their salsa is award winning.
There's always a line so be prepared to wait a few minutes. But it is well worth it. I enjoy how they make everything in front of you. And take requests for special orders very well. Shrimp and steak burrito is the best.
author: Ceverino R.

description:
Needed to find a quick and decent Mexican joint and decided to come here on a Sunday afternoon. As soon as you walk in you get hit with the smell of grilled meat goodness! The place has plenty of seating, very high vaulted ceilings and plenty of staff to get your order through quickly. There's a HUGE menu of choices to pick from and you'll definitely have a hard time looking for something you want while feeling rushed to order quickly since a line forms quickly behind you.

I went with the prawn burrito for myself and the watermelon agua fresca. I think the burrito was a little small but was very tasty. I expect to be full after eating a burrito and I was still pretty hungry afterwards. However, it's only around $8.50 for the burrito so it seems like a decent deal. I've gotta check out the carne asada next time. 

There's a pretty good and clean salsa bar that has everything you need. Everything looked fresh and tasty and the staff does a good job of keeping it all look presentable...because you know how EVERYONE spills salsa all over the place when pouring into those tiny plastic cups. 

All in all, good place for Mexican food. Quick service and accepts Visa/MC/Discover. I'd come again!
author: Sam L.

description: Their steak and shrimp burrito with "hot" salsa was great with a few of my own tweaks. Carnitas are a bit dried out. Al pastor fell pretty flat for me. Their guacamole salsita is  Definitely a go to for a burrito but not a fan of their other dishes.
author: Sergio G.

description: The best Mexican food in SF. The burritos are amazing! The line moves quickly, and the food is served within 10-15 minutes or less.
author: Lyndsay A.

description: This is still one of my favorite spots in the Mission. Prices are great and the freshness cannot be beat. I'm a big quesadilla fan and I have dreams of the prawn one - sometimes add steak to the mix. The new-ish system of printing out tickets is a little disconcerting - I used to love walking down the line as the plate was assembled, but I suppose this is more efficient. Good early, good late.
author: Robert M.

description: Such good food! But the employees aren't very helpful. I asked one of them what their favorite meat was and they replied with "idk"
author: Adriana S.

description:
Make your own Burrito. Love it!
You can see all the ingredients you want, add a Horchata then hit the salsa bar. In less than 5 minutes your in Burrito heaven.
author: Frans R.

description: Love this place. Always busy but they've got it down packed. Good food good service and it's clean. Happy hour is awesome as well.
author: Alex S.

description:
Excellenté!!!
Perfect place for a taco or a burrito or a quesadilla or an enchilada or just chips and an insane variety of salsas! Yes just their salsa bar gets a 5 star!
I've tried a few places in the Mission and do have a soft corner for my downstairs, open till late night, taco joints! but Pancho Villa is by far the best place all around. Lot of variety on the menu, pretty efficient arrangement (even when it's busy), good service and a nice and extra (I MEAN EXTRA) lively place to sit and eat.
Especially love their Fish Taco and with the 3 Taco Deal makes it perfect to combine it with other meats which they have a bunch to choose from. Also have a few selections of domestic and mexican beer and many non-alcoholic drinks.
They even have a Happy Hour, although its only from 3-5 pm!
So if you are in the Mission and craving for a quick bite, this would be my go to place!!!
(Oh, FYI.. they have an open kitchen.. so be prepared to walk out smelling like grilled Mexican Food.. :P )
author: Vikram C.

description: This place always seems to be crowded so you know it must be good. I love this place because they have a bunch of vegetarian options. The last time I went I got the grilled veggies burrito. With rice beans veggies and salsa. Normally at a Mexican place its really hard to stay healthy but I don't feel completely horrible after eating here which is a plus in my book! Will come here again especially if I'm looking for a quick bite to eat in the area.
author: Eileen H.

description: Good stuff!  Only thing I dont like when I last went, the specials changed and generally the prices went up.  I think the burritos were about $11 (??))).  Dont worry about parking, just take Bart to 16th street.
author: Tianna W.

description: A number of meat and food options if you aren't in the mood for a burrito. Their salsa bar is amazing and almost everything is cooked live in front of you. Definitely recommend the spicey prawn dinner meal if you are in the mood for some seafood!
author: Ridhi S.

description: Burrito here is good! Super burrito is about $9 with tax and is very filling and full for a guy. Last time I come here because my fd work around here. I ordered chicken super burrito  and the chicken here is well grilled, tortilla is thin and nice. Very great place for lunch if I work here. Steak, pork, prawn and salmon looks good to me although I didn't ordered. If you cannot choose a protein, pick super combo then you may choose two protein!
author: Jacques S.

description: Their portions are large, and the quality is very good for the price. Parking is really difficult to find here, but when I do make a visit, I am rewarded with some tasty food. Quality and service has been very steady for the past several years.
author: A L.

description:
Simply one of the best Mexican food joints in San Francisco.  Everything I've ever eaten here is delicious, and I've pretty much covered the menu with the exception of organ meats and brains!

The restaurant is spotless, the workers are friendly, ingredients are top-notch and again, the food is fabulous.

I don't know why I ever go anyplace else.  My amor.
author: .Hon H.

description: My fav taqueria in the city! Whenever I'm in the area I try to make it a visit . They have an awesome fresh salsa bar.  The flavor & the way they cook their food is done well. I've never been disappointed with them and I'm a pretty picky, opinionated foodie person when it comes to restaurants. They're always busy but manage to bring your food to your table with decent timing.
author: Ruby V.

description:
A great place to grab a burrito before an afternoon in Dolores park! 

The pros-big portions, lots of salsas at the salsa bar to choose from, inexpensive, quick service. 

There was somewhat of a long line, but it went by pretty quick!
author: Marilyn M.

description:
I was the excited to eat here after seeing all the positive reviews. I ordered a super vegetarian super quesadilla in a spinach wrap. 
 I started eating it , and it tasted good. I enjoyed it, until I found a piece of hair cooked into the quesadilla. After that, I lost my appetite. 
 This experience makes me question the cleanliness of their kitchen. 
 After this experience, I refuse to return.
author: Merisa R.

description: Pretty dang tasty, make sure you get here early to beat the lunch crowds.  Any time after 12 pm on a weekday is dicey.
author: Wesley H.

description: My education and introduciton to the Mission style burrito and taqueria was first La Cumbre around the corner and here at PVT when I was still a college kid. Admittedly I have a greater love of Cumbre's divey atmosphere, giant mural and such but the food is comparable. It's just hard when a Mariachi is blaring his trumpet in your ear when you try and enjoy your food.
author: Kim N.

description:
I had an early lunch here as this was the meeting spot for my group before heading out to the Carnival festivities on a Sunday.I was undecided on whether or not to eat there, but I had some time to kill so ordered a baby burrito with chicken and hot salsa, and a small horchata. 

The baby burrito should be re branded, as it is not small but what I would consider a decent size burrito. It was good - there were some fresh bell peppers and/or jalapenos (?) that took me by surprise, but otherwise it delivered as promised. The horchata I got was not great, which is unfortunate because I love me some horchata. It was really chalky and not refreshing as I hoped.

I'd try them again
author: Candace R.

description: Catered this place for work once for a Cinco de Mayo Celebration and it was really good. We went to pick up the food.
author: Jane Z.

description:
Pancho Villa is my go to burrito spot in the Mission. I literally have a burrito line in my personal budget thanks to them! Food is always fresh, and the line moves quickly. If you're short on time, they're hooked into several mobile apps so you can preorder, pickup, and be on your way immediately.  Also, the restaurant doesn't take American Express, but the apps do! 

At the counter they only give a tiny handful of chips, but to go burritos get a massive portion. I'm finicky about taqueria chips, and these are some of my favorites. 

In case it's not obvious, I typically get my burritos to go.  The menu has a ton of choices. My usual is a special burrito with black beans, whatever protein I'm feeling, mild salsa, and a spinach tortilla. Yes! They have different tortillas! Then I get multiple cups of the orange tomatillo salsa from the bar to drizzle as I go. Yummmmm. 

The only reason I'm knocking off a star is the price. It's not cheap. After tax I'm paying about $10. There are definitely cheaper places for burritos, but none with as many menu choices, as central a location, or such friendly staff.
author: D D.

description: $2 off the super burrito with a yelp checkin and a $8 taco special (3 tacos). The tacos were full of tomatoes and meat. You also get a sElf serve salsa bar with a ton of variety. One of the best bangs for your buck.
author: Trish M.

description: If you can find parking, this is some of the best tacos I have ever eaten from this taco and burrito place! Even the aqua Fresca is delicious! The salsa bar is usually amazing and with many choices. I love the tomato with jalapeños! We always order a full pint of guacamole to eat with our tacos and chips! Always consistent and delicious! I recommend the prawn tacos and fish tacos. If you like spicy salsa - look out it's super spicy! Definitely a favorite of mine!! The only drawback is the limited seating. The place can get packed! But it's a great tacqueria!!
author: Olivia T.

description:
The food was pretty good. The carne asada was the best I've ever had - bursting with flavor. The chips were also very good. The beans and rice were average. The guacamole wasn't great. The salad wasn't great. The salsa selection lacked pico de gallo.

My biggest complaint was the hygeine. There was feces on the floor of the bathroom. The guy in the servery was using his bare hands to move salsa between bowls.
author: Brennan R.

description: Breakfast burritos are amazing. Every menu item can be made to order. Salsa bar is on point too. Lots too choose from, the fact that they're award winning doesn't hurt either.
author: Shon M.

description:
Poncho Villa, what happened to the old days when your food tasted great. You had the food one would dream of. The days when the lines would be out the door and you would over order because everything looked and smelled delish!

Stopped by today with my husband and children and to my dismay it took 30 minutes to receive 4 burritos and two tacos. I counted around 7 or 8 staff...5 of which weren't doing anything. There were no more then 6 other patrons dining. The food arrived luke warm, dry and without taste. My son said the taco truck by his school was better. The burritos were so small compared to many years before. For the price you charge the food should be better (hence, like before).

2 stars for the care you put into creating your salsa bar. That was the highlight. 

Poncho Villa maybe the management is newer or your costs has significantly went up on running and maintaining this establisent. 

Not trying to be so negative but Poncho Villa please get back to your roots of serving great food.
author: Stacy L.

description:
I like coming here when there's no line. I also like that a security guard opens the door and greets you. Sometimes, I like to pretend I'm not in the mission and he's not keeping the homeless bums out, but I'm actually entering the W hotel and being greeted by a chic doorman. 

Anyways, their green sauce is AMAZING! Most places make their green sauce mild, but this place puts the flavor and the bang together. Add some onions and you have the perfect mixture for chips. This place is also way cleaner than most joints in the mission so that is much appreciated.
author: Angela L.

description: This place has really gone down! We ordered #14 steak and garlic prawns. Both the prawns and steak had no flavor. The steak was prepared in a sloppy manner by being dumped onto the grill without marinade or anything. Years ago in the late 80's the garlic prawns were delicious, but no more.
author: Donna B.

description: The Burrito were good and decent prices! Hard to find parking and long wait but I will come back again!
author: Wendy L.

description: Agua de sandia!  Get your watermelon juice. Don't miss the refried beans!  The prices are the best surprise. The open grill is aamazing. Traveler or resident, you will find the best American-Mexican food.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Order for pick up and your food will be ready to go in ten minutes as promised. It drives me crazy when I place a phone order and given a wait time only to show up on time and the order is still not ready. 

The super veggie has everything you'll need: beans, rice, cheese, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, lettuce and tomatoes. No need to add in extras. Ingredients looked and tasted fresh. 

And the price for that super veggie? $6.25. Not bad for a solid, good burrito. Nothing is worse than paying $8 for a burrito that doesn't even have all the proper fillings. 

One gripe though - it got kinda watery at the end. Spin the lettuce a bit more and I'd rate them a five.
author: Esther A.

description: I may have gone on an off night... My Supreme asada burrito was supremely bla.
author: David F.

description: Clean, fast good food ! Super burrito enough for two  great salsa bar  will go back again
author: J P.

description: I go here just for their fish and Shrimp burrito. Always fresh and exactly what I expect. The salsa bar makes the burrito taste even better
author: Prabhnit S.

description:
my favorite burrito place ... in the world!

great california style mexican food and love the salsa bar
author: Dredge K.

description:
If you are going out for tacos in the city, there is no better place.  DOn't mess around, head straight out for Pancho Villa, and enjoy the whole scene.  There ain't no TV or juke box in here, and for good reason: The Trios (often Norteños, with accordion) and duets and solo guitarists stroll in here and play and sing their hearts outs for your enjoyment.  You can put a dollar in the hat they pass around.  Hey if there's a piper, then we can pay--it's worth it.  This is live entertainment, and how much do you pay for a movie?

Check out the salsa Bar.  Note a whole wall full of awards for best salsa at county Fairs around the bay area.  Take your pick of onions, Jalapeños (roasted, ah, so delicious! or en 
escabeche,
meaning pickled in vinegar with carrot and onion),
bunch of different salsas from mild to wild, lime, radishes, everything to make your food just right, and you get to load on as much as you want.  

I like the fact that they got Tofu Ranchero, for all the vegetarians, as well as chile relleno (it is meatless, though not vegan, and it's really Sabroso), they've got fish tacos and Camarones
al mojo de ajo, huge plates of nachos with all kinds of fixings, fiesta plate that really seems little incomplete without the Piñata (to quote José Antonio Burciaga) but is good none the less, delicious agua fresca, oh, so much to choose from!  That is how it should be.  

This place has been right on 16th by Valencia for at least 24 years now, and i'm sure it
will be there 24 years more.  The line going down the street at noon says it all.
author: Atiteca S.

description:
I was excited when I saw this restaurant on Caviar since they offered lengua and so many Mexican restaurants do not.  I ordered a burrito and 2 enchiladas.  I had planned on having the burrito for dinner and the enchiladas tomorrow.  The burrito was pretty much inedible because it was so salty.  So I decided to try the enchilada, that too was overly salted.  Had to toss both items, what a waste of money.  I will definitely not be going back here.  I will stick with my usual La Corneta lengua.  I so wanted to like this place too.

Pancho Villa Mgmt:  I ordered from Caviar on May 3 at 6:42 pm
author: Genie G.

description: Visiting San Francisco for the first time. Asked locals what to check out- they recommended this. So glad they did! The food is fresh and the line was out the door. I ordered tacos. Delicious. My dad ordered an enchilada- I tasted it- the best enchilada I've ever had. Also- they have plenty of salsas to choose from.
author: Lillian Y.

description: The best burrito in all of San Francisco is the steak and prawn super burrito at Pancho Villa.  I like to call it the Surf N' Turf.  It's also not the most well known, which means that the lines are better here too.  Overall the quality of the ingredients are great and the salsa bar seems like it goes on for miles.  Don't tell anyone though, I don't want this place to get too crowded.
author: Adam S.

description: Best burritos in San Fran. Go to el toro though. Same owner and menu, except they have lesser wait times and it's less crowded.
author: Vihan J.

description:
You know it's good when...
- you walk in and smell grilled meat. 
- you see grilled meat. 
- a long, quickly moving line
- a lot of other people eating delicious looking food
Check. Check. Check. Check. 

I wasn't super hungry when I came here, so I ended up with a baby burrito. I was initially going for some tacos, but the sight of the carne asada on the grill totally won me over. And the place smelled awesome (like grilled meat!).  But I am so happy with it. The tortilla was so soft and the flavors worked together really well.


The restaurant itself is bright with a lot of natural lighting. I think it's also one of the few places in the city that allow busking - so expect some entertainment while you dine!
author: Lydia N.

description: so far the best burrito, tacos, and chile relleno I have been served in the Bay Area - and the chips were good... and open late!
author: Greg B.

description: Great food at a very reasonable price considering it's SF. Small dinner area and long wait but well worth the large portions! Will be going back again.
author: Cory S.

description: Love these burritos. Lengua and carne asada ones are my favorite. Chips and salsa are delicious too. Great prices. Highly recommended
author: Allan M.

description: They have a great selection with their massive menu, though the food isn't anything spectacular.  Not good, not bad, just decent.  The massive selection on their menu might be worth a four star review if it wasn't for the fact that they have enormous lines throughout the day.
author: David M.

description:
Naturally I finally try this place when I have only 3 days before I move away. Ugh.

Had burritos and tamales and guac and beans delivered after a long day packing. 
I can't say enough about how perfect the chicken is in the burrito I had. Perfectly cooked, not dry at all, and NOT that cheap chicken with bits of fat and grossness. No, this was the whitest, breastiest chicken I've ever had in a burrito in SF. 
All ingredients seemed fresh and everything was tasty. 
I'll make sure to visit whenever I'm back in the city.
author: A S.

description:
After playing my set at Slate, I occasionally find myself in the mood for food from a proper taqueria. With so many in the Mission, I can spend my whole evening narrowing it down to a couple, but within convenient proximity and taste comes Pancho Villa.

It's been a while since my last visit, but I was again reminded why I decided to come back. I'll always keep walking past Los Coyotes, but a pollo asado super burrito from Pancho Villa never disappoints. By the way, I always skip the lettuce. Who the eff gets lettuce in their burrito, anyway?!
author: Kevin G.

description: I am giving this place 2 starts just for the fact that they have the worst customer service. The guys there are so rude. Even when we were at the register the cashier forgot to put an extra water to our order. On the other hand, the food is great, but the food didn't taste as good just because of the bad customer service given by one of their employees. They should be more friendly and kind with their customers. I will come back another day and I hope they give me a better experience next time. The food save them from losing a customer. Overall, the food was delicious.
author: Jairo G B.

description:
I like the fact the the management staff pays attention to the reviews!  

Btw, this is still my favorite taqueria!
author: Holly D.

description: Food was dank!... It just took a while to get the food because there were so many people!
author: Isaac D.

description:
Me gusta mucho!!!

The salsa verde chicken taco was sooo good!!! 

And so were all the salsas in the back.
author: AnneMarie W.

description:
They've got the skinniest super burritos around, but they're good. 

The advantage that this spot has over others is that it is bright, clean, and speedy. 
Other spots can seem a bit dingy, so if you want a nicer place to have a burrito then I'd say this is your best bet.
author: Theresa D.

description: Always the most courteous staff and great burritos. But this is not a food or service review. All through the Mission there are people who are suffering from mental challenges. Yesterday, there was an agitated woman who barged in the restaurant and appeared to be upset with a friend and was giving the staff a hard time too. Her behavior was disturbing and erratic. Rather than confronting the woman and making her leave, the staff was patient, accommodating and delivered her order as requested. They answered her questions and, in the end, helped this woman smile. The staff at Pancho Villa practiced patience and understanding rather than confrontation. Add that to another reason to get your burrito here. Enjoy the best salsa bar in town as well.
author: Todd R.

description: Pancho Villa happy hour from 3 to 5pm on weekdays is legendary. I come here once in a while when I've been too busy to take a proper lunch break and promptly gorge on 4-5 chicken, carne asada, and pork chile verde tacos with black beans, all for $1.50 each. Their chunky tomato salsa is amazing, it has a very smoky taste to it, with huge chunks of tomatoes and peppers, sometimes I manage to use 1 cup of salsa for each taco when I'm in yolo mode. The full time security guard at the door is a good management touch to keep the place nice and clean, while the mariachi guys are always welcome to come in and take the party to the next level. Great vibe at this place!
author: Mark Y.

description:
Good, not the best, and a bit pricier than expected.

The sauce station makes me question hygiene, again, and the food took longer than expected, even though they had a full staff working behind the counter. At least they accept credit cards?
author: Diana K.

description:
What's not to like about this place? One of the most popular authentic Mexican restaurants in the mission.  They are always crowded , so don't be intimidated by the long line.

Just have your friend grab a table for you while the other orders for both!
author: James H.

description: Our family tries to come out here to eat at least once a month. Their beans are creamy and homemade. I cant ever get enough of this place!
author: Josephine A.

description: Best Burrito so far that I've eaten since moving here over a year ago. I had the grilled chicken super burrito. Great fresh flavors. There are many salsas to choose from but not very spicy. Will come back and try more.
author: Kuya J.

description: It's nothing special. I've had way better. With my friends to check it out since it's raved about. We got the carne asada burrito, steak and shrimp wet burrito and (i forgot which) sandwich. The wet burrito was just okay.. There was no pizzaz. More like oh. Okay. This is a big burrito and it looks delicious. But the taste? Nothin. The sandwich too. I didn't try the carne asada but heard it wasn't great either. The chips are whatever too. I'd say the only thing that were actually good here were the salsas.
author: Yvonne N.

description: So let me just say this I have been eating here for over 15 years and today of all days I spent $33 for 3 HORRIBLE ASS burritos. They were DRY AS HELL!! It's a SUPER burrito which means it should be super JUICEY with all the fixings!!! It started to lose the friendly finesse anyway and now it's just one big assembly line with NO love in the food so I'm done I will drive all the way to Las Palmas atleast their burritos are WET & FAT
author: SHRONDA J.

description:
If I could give minus stars I totally would.  I originally got hooked on Pancho Villa in San Mateo.  So Im thinking....mmmmmmm sounds good on National Taco Day!!  I know, I was surprised too!  I ordered 2 grilled salmon tacos and one carnitas taco plain with salsa on the side.  One 1/2 pint of rice and 1/2 pint of green salsa.  

Never EVER have I had such gross tacos in my life!  The fish tacos....the salmon was in tiny little pieces with that gross brown stuff your're supposed to cut off AND THE SKIN!!!!!!!!!  They were supposed to be plain...SO NOT........my salsa was on the side but on the taco with the grossest totally greasy and old looking salmon bits with the brown and skin still on was also some non descript white sauce...pretty sure it was greasy mayo with a few pieces of the nastiest hot lettuce Ive ever seen.  It ruined the chance of me every eating said icky salmon as a taco because the non descript white sauce and ewww hot wilted sick looking few pieces of lettuce had totally made the tortilla soggy.  Carnitas Taco.....GREASY GREASY GREASY made the tortilla inedible and very soggy.  
Side of rice........I was expecting fluffy mexican rice.  NOT!  It was, AGAIN, really really greasy and looked a day or two old with the brown hard bits mixed in.
I did get all three salsas on the side.........for whatever that was worth.  Green salsa was good.
author: Holly D.

description: Amazing, authentic Mexican. Salsa bar = awesomeness. I go here for the quintessential mission Mexican meal. But I'm from NYC so I don't RELLY know what I'm talking about. Was here 10 years ago and this year. Loved it both times!
author: J Z.

description: Very busy joint. Food was okay. Ordered a supreme burrito, shrimp burrito, and nacho supreme. All lacked meat. Was filled with lots of beans, rice, and veggies. Hardly any meat in all 3 items ordered. Will not return.  Gave it 3 stars for customer service and all the sauces was very good.
author: Linda M.

description:
STOP READ THIS COMMENT****
 In my opinion this place is over priced and complete crap... no flavor in the chicken, asada just had a bunch of fatty pieces in it. Really thought this place was going to be a gem oh well, we will see what other mexican places sf will have in store. 

Ps. If your from so cal you'll be confused as to why there is beans In your tacos. Or am I the only one??? 

Oh and the only plus was the Aguas Naturales! ! Even tho the medium cup looked sorta small.
author: Cassie S.

description: Finally have found my go-to for Mexican. The super carne asada wet burrito is amazing and HUGE. Seriously this could feed 2. They have really good salsa too! I like the roasted salsa and hot salsa the best.
author: Chelsea L.

description: Order your food 1 hour before you want to eat and you still may have to wait a half hour before you can pick it up. These guys have the most inefficient system for collecting money and preparing food.
author: Masood S.

description: Came in today and ordered a Super Burrito. I usually order tacos, but felt like a burrito today. It was less than super. It was salad in a tortilla with some carne asada hidden in there which really just looked like a shadow. I took a bite and it was salad.  Second and third bites revealed some rice.  I figured they loaded one side with all the meat, NOPE! I asked the girl at the counter and she said, "yes that is a Super Burrito." Ok, where is the meat? (showing her my salad filled burrito) She told me that they only put one spoon (must be a teaspoon) of meat in a burrito. Really? Wow, their tacos have the same amount of meat as their burritos? Disappointed and in disbelief that the girl would look at this burrito and defend a salad dominate Super Burrito. I will be including a picture of this sorry excuse for a Super Burrito. On a side note, the salsa bar was working today.
author: Nanci Y.

description:
Somehow I haven't reviewed Pancho Villa's yet, but the line to the door and super fresh prawn visible through the window on the grill should be speaking for themselves as a 5 star joint.

Some of the options are similar to normal Mexican restaurants, so you can count on getting what you want.  The salsa bar destroys any other salsa bar. The creamy green sauce and orange sauce are my favorites, but they are all good.

They also give freshly made chips with your order and have a happy hour with discounts.

Now to the food, their prawn tacos and burritos are amazing. I've also had good luck with carnitas and carne asada.  I'm curious to see that some people had bad experiences, since my 10-15 trips were all major winners, I'm wondering what happened.

This is the place you bring people to if you want them to get some good Mexican.  I've done the others, and Pancho Villa just comes out on top.
author: Brian L.

description:
By far one of my favorite taquerias.  This place is so clean and the food is delish!  Lots of selections of meats and different dishes, and everything is cooked to order right in front of your eyes in their open kitchen/grill.  It's nice to see your meat being cooked and everything being prepared in front of you, so you just know for a fact that there is no shadiness.  These guys are a little stingy as far as fillings go, and if you dare ask for extra anything you better be prepared to pay for it.

Lots of seating and a big open space means that this place remains safe, clean, and available to anyone at any hour.  Very well lit too.

Amazingly clean bathrooms too.

Oh, and the food is definitely delicious.  More meat would be nice, but the flavors are all there and the salsa bar has quite a bit of variety, so it's sure to satisfy even the most discerning burrito diner.
author: Robert K.

description:
I used to come and get the pura carne burrito, which is a meat burrito without any of the rice and beans fuss, with  guacamole.   I usually ate half and had the rest for another meal.

So imagine my disappointment when I got my skinny  skinny pura carne.  I guess they realized they weren't making enough money on it.  I ate the whole thing, it was so skinny.

:(
author: C L.

description:
I got steak nachos $7. I have mixed feelings about this place. The food is ok (not great), affordable, and quick but the service is not great. When I ordered and paid for my food I interacted with 3 staff members and each of them glared at me and had a bad attitude when they were speaking to me.  As I was eating I noticed that other customers were having the same experience. 

Since this taqueria is in the mission I would expect it to be better. There are so many taquerias in this neighborhood with delicious and affordable food that there is no reason for me to come back to this one.
author: Amanda F.

description: Excellent burritos.  Many choices, generous portions, great array of award winning salsas.  The line moves quickly and it's certainly worth the wait.
author: Matthew K.

description:
What's not to love about this place?

Clean----yes
Great food----yes
Affordable---yes

hmmmm  maybe the parking can be difficult.

Actually the parking is one of the main reasons we haven't been here in years.

On our recent visit this PV location was much nicer than I remember.

They've taken great care in keeping the place super clean.  The empty tables are cleaned immediately. The tables and chairs are wiped down and the floors are gently swept of crumbs, etc.  

The serving counters are kept spotless by staffers wiping up any spills.  
Best Salsa bar ever!

There is something for everyone including tofu rancheros.

You can get items a la carte, as a combination with 2-3 items plus beans and rice.

You can get refills of chips.

There are ask 4-5+ flavors of ague fresco and fresh juice choices.

Prices are very affordable.

Staff is friendly.

The bathroom was super clean despite its heavy use.
author: Rinky N.

description: My favorite spot for Mexican grub in San Francisco. I always end up getting the shrimp and steak burrito. It's so good!! It's usually my mom and I who swing by here, and we love the salsa bar they have. It's good salsa! Not watery like other places, and packs a lot of flavor. There can be a bit of a wait since this place is so popular, but they know how to keep the line moving. For everything you get for the price you're paying, I highly recommend this place. Taking it to-go might also be best. I've never actually dined-in, so I can't really give too much insight on that, but take-out is always consistent. Our food is always hot, ready and delicious!
author: Kristina S.

description:
Pancho Villa, based on the recommendation of friends, had the distinct honor of being my first 'Mexican in the Mission' dining experience, and I cannot wait to return!

In exploring the Mission, the number of choices you have when it comes time to score some awesome Mexican is downright overwhelming.  While I do say do your homework and trust the people who have walked the path and know the good places, I'm guessing you likely can't be steered wrong in this awesome neighborhood.  

The line never dwindled, and the employees have their customer service running like a well oiled machine  - I was very impressed!  As you wait in line, you can see all the beautiful marinated meats grilling and check out various fillings and salsas for whatever meal you choose.  I decided to play it safe and went with the super burrito with carnitas and black beans.  It comes crammed full of all the goodies like sour cream and guac, and is grilled on the outside for an awesome crunch.  A Mexican Coke in a glass bottle (real sugar! YES!) and chips and salsa from the nearby bar completed my meal, all for less than $10.   Despite being busy, we did score a table in their bustling seating area and absolutely chowed down.  Up there with the best burritos I have ever had. 

I cannot wait to return to Pancho Villa and the Mission - so much delicious fun!
author: Terri N.

description:
Still the greatest authentic tacos. 
And reasonable on top of it. Good service great salsa and overall a great place for Mexican food. I have been coming here for years now. Almost 20 years and its still just as good as when they started .
I had the 3 chicken taco special with guacamole.  Very filling and under 9 $ with tax.
author: David A.

description: We ordered through Seamless. The meat was not good at all. It was all fibery and chewy. The guacamole was ok. The chips would have been better from a bag.
author: Leo W.

description: I've been coming here for 24yrs now & I always leave happy. Their food is always consistent & never bland. It's affordable, it's good, & they are very generous on their portions. The steak & prawns super burrito is my all time favorite. There is literally steak & prawns in every bite :) YOU GUYS FREAKIN ROCK!!! I'll always be one of ur repeat customers. Thanks for always keeping me happy ;)
author: Maria P.

description: Back to 5-star for Pancho Villa.  Didn't realize I had my old low rating but they've adapted to that ticketing system they installed four years ago so I am well overdue to update my review.  Still love Pancho Villa the best since I can get black refried beans in my burrito which is harder to find.  And their green sauce is so bomb!!!
author: Gene X.

description: Great burrito wide selection of Mexican food. Very authentic Mexican food. I was visiting in the business district and very happy I made it out to the mission district I would return on my next trip.
author: Tracy F.

description: Shared the chicken and steak burrito but nothing blew me away here. They have a wide selection of salsa here which is fun! It was packeddd during lunch on Friday so be prepared to wait or call ahead of time! Def a decent burrito spot in the Mission but hate to say that it's not my fave..
author: Michelle L.

description:
I ordered a lengua super burrito, which was fairly good except for the fact that it had maybe six tiny pieces of meat. No exaggeration. I just got the usual mixture of rice, beans, sour cream and guac in the first few bites. No biggie. I figured the good stuff was further down the burrito. Nope. Literally six pieces of meat. 

However, the salsa made up for it. Every type was exceedingly good. Good enough to make me forget about how I got ripped off with the burrito.
author: Wade C.

description: 5 stars for being the worst food ever a disappointment to mexicans everywhere. The only thing i liked was the chips and guac but i can buy that anywhere...... Never again pancho villa!
author: Trisha D.

description: This my favorite Mexican Food in The Mission.  The line is usually long but the staff is friendly and efficient.
author: Justin G.

description:
Very busy place. Every staff member is nice and the serving portion is large. Rice, beans, chips are good. I wish their carne asada was marinated more. I don't think it was marinated.  The one downside is, this restaurant is not clean. Their bathroom and salsa bar are filthy. There are garbage on the floor. If you want a quick, cheap bite to eat, this is a place you should consider.  However, if you would like to enjoy your meal in nice and relaxed environment, this is not a place to be.  I don't think I want to return to this place anytime soon.

The date of this visit was 8/6/16.
author: Eri F.

description: We found this place using yelp and had high hope due to the excellent reviews. Not sure what all the hype is. Food did not taste good at all. The chicken was dried out and didn't have much flavor. Will not be back.
author: Ted T.

description: Service is super quick and they always get my order right. Carnitas are always tender and juicy. Burritos have good even distribution of ingredients. Lots of good salsas to choose from too.
author: Danielle H.

description: This place is EXACTLY what I was looking for, while in The Mission, recently! There was a long line, and I was happy to wait every second of the 15 minutes it took to get through. You can see the magic happening as you wait, behind the counter, with a hoard of employees, feverishly working to make your tastebuds happy. MEAT MEAT, SO MUCH MEAT being cleaved all over the place!  I was in meat and fast Mexican food heaven!  Try everything. It's all good.
author: Mark B.

description:
Did I order the wrong burrito?  Well, a few weeks ago, I went to Pancho Villa for the first time.  I saw everyone ordering burritos, so I figured, OK go for the burrito.  I got a super chicken burrito hoping that it would be delicious since everyone seemed quite content with their burritos in hand.  My friends had told me that pancho villa is "da bomb" so I was expecting a lot out of the burrito.  

I got my burrito and went to pay, and the lady at the cash register gave me some chips (like 5 chips).  I'm used to going to burrito places where you can scoop as many chips as you can so I was a little disappointed that they only gave me 5 chips.  Well, that was OK I guess... because the salsa selection made up for it.  They had this pretty good creamy, sun-dried tomato-tasting salsa...it was pretty delicious.

But, that was as far as what I considered delicious as my burrito was a little disappointing; the burrito's rice was soggy and the chicken was dry.  Perhaps, I ordered the wrong burrito but I figured you can't mess up too much on a chicken burrito.  I'm used to having my chicken being a little more wet, but chicken is easy to overcook.   Similarly, I'm used to having my rice being a little more dry--instead of being wet and soggy.  The textures of the chicken and rice seemed to have been switched.  

As I ate my burrito, I was wondering what the big hype was about Pancho Villa.  The burrito wasn't "awesome" as people had told me or as I had expected.  I don't think I'll come here again for their burritos.
author: Matthew L.

description: Shellfish allergies beware: Asada and Shrimp are cooked Together with the Same utensils!! No warning signs. If I hadn't seen it for myself I would have ordered an Asada burrito and stopped breathing right in the restaurant. I don't care how the food tastes, this is extremely unsafe and irresponsible.
author: Desire S.

description: This is an extremely legit taco spot. While I have been to better taco shops in my time, this was a much needed respite from the taco wasteland that is South Carolina. After years of toiling in acrimonious monotony that I have become accustomed to, I finally am content. Taco heaven? Perhaps not. But, to this weary taco seeker something close to nirvana.
author: Michael W.

description:
Best Taqueria in San Francisco !
It passed the test of time and after 10 years still the best salsa sauce, the most friendly staff, the best value, efficient line, satisfaction guarenteed !
author: aline d.

description: Was excited to try burritos in the mission district.  Saw the yelp reviews and thought we were on to a winner. Long lines also seemed like a good sign. Unfortunately the burritos were just OK. They were large but nothing to write home about. Little disappointed.
author: Miles B.

description: A little pricey, but the atmosphere is just what I like in a taqueria- nice and grimey, haha. Very close to BART in the mission and, even better, the salsa bar is great. They also have lots of vegetarian options, a must now that I"m dating a veggiehead. The piles and piles of carne asada on the grill were absolutely delicious. I'm a fan.
author: Samir K.

description: Happy hour tacos from 3-5 for half off...need i say more?! I come here way more than I should, but working down the street makes it the most economical and filling place for a quick bite on-the-go.
author: Yumna B.

description:
Best Mexican food in SF, hands down.

Always packed, good prices, and the best salsa that has won hella awards! It's always packed, but luckily there is a lot of seating that gets cycled through pretty quickly.
It's located in the Mission district (a block up from 16th st BART), which if you're from out of town is a strange mix of homeless folks, hipsters, drug addicts, honest hard workers, and a little of everyone else sprinkled in there.

The food is real, tasty, straight up Mexican food, not that organic current trendy hipster ish-- the REAL deal! The carne asada anything (tacos, burritos, quesedillas) are amazing, and the pollo asado is a close runner up!
author: Melissa B.

description: So I had a Yelp check in deal for 1.00 tacos and the manager Migel said that they can't honor it because the taco now cost 1.50 SMH so what's the point of having Check in deals on yelp ????
author: Napoleon A.

description: Quality food at non San Francisco prices (SF is unnecessarily expensive). One of the better SF taqueria's around, throw in the price and the Yelp check in and it's hard to beat. It's a huge location for SF which is nice. The location is horribly ventilated, you won't be choking or anything but it's clear. Food gets outs quick and the salsa isn't bad. More than a few good choices, burritos are great, especially with red sauce and cheese melted on top. Enchilada dinner plate is great as well.
author: Virel P.

description: Excellent Enchiladas (2) well loaded. The Mushroom quesadilla was excellent too with clean taste. Good service where the food is brought to you. Very reasonably priced.
author: Ayaz L.

description:
You really just need a staple like this when you're visiting the Mission. 

Cheap, consistent, and delicious Mexican food. I've had burritos, quesadillas, and tacos here and they're all fantastic. I especially appreciate that when you request "spicy" it's actually closer to being spicy than most other taquerias I've been to. 

The salsa bar is definitely plus - my favorites are the habanero and avocado salsa. Look up to the wall right by it and you'll find the labels for all the salsas.
author: Alice H.

description: Best carnitas in the world!!!  Love, love, love their food. Sadly, their restrooms are a disgrace. I hope they remedy this so that the experience is 100% fabulous.
author: C S.

description:
Pancho Villa's HH is AMAZING!!!!!

This is the best place to go to in the city for Mexican food during happy hour. The price is just toooo awesome -- $1 tacos and $2 beer Monday - Friday from 3-5pm! For the dollar tacos, you can select a from a wide variety of meat: carne asada, al pastor, carnitas, chorizo, chicken, etc. As usual, the tacos here are topped with tomatoes, cilantro, and onions. But if you're the type of person who likes to drown their food in sauce, don't worry because they have an awesome salsa bar located towards the back of the restaurant. As for beer, they offer pacifico, corona, stella, sierra nevada, etc. Such a good $2 beer selection, don't you think?! 

Overall, the food here is good and the portion is just right. If you're not a fan of tacos or just don't feel like eating tacos, don't worry because there are plenty of other dishes here for you to try like quesadillas, burritos, nachos, seafood dishes, and rice plates. 

Definitely need to check this place out during happy hour. It's not too far from the bart station too!
author: Thuy T.

description:
I love this place!! It's my go-to Mexican food spot. I still haven't found better..... ;) 

Vegetarian burritos are amazing and oddly enough have broccoli in them?
author: Diandra J.

description: It could've been the alcohol talking from being in the Mission but the baby burrito I got here one late night was awesome. It was just the most perfect little baby burrito I've ever had. Nothing crazy fancy - just some carnitas, rice, beans and mild tomato salsa. That's all you really need. Workers were super friendly and you could tell they were used to the hoards of people standing in line. Burrito was out in a jiffy :)
author: Leina K.

description:
I live in the marina and don't always want to make the trek to the mission for authentic Mexican food. 
 I Ordered from Order ahead tonight and got my food within the hour. The food was perfect, flavorful and had the adjustments that I asked for. 
I will definately be ordering from this restaurant again soon. Thank you for such great service and awesome Mexican food.
author: Tim L.

description: I live for their food. I have moved to NY. First stop off SFO. Best burrito in the bay....seriously though....BEST BURRITO IN THE BAY.....Cancun is 2nd
author: David G.

description: My husband and I ordered Pancho Villa for dinner one night - we had it delivered and they forgot the salsa and botched my burrito but the flavor was still great, guacamole was good and my husband liked his enchiladas. I'd definitely be willing to give this place another go, except maybe dine in next time : )
author: Megan V.

description: Amazingly delicious food. Def get tacos with steak/meat + try all the diff kinds of salsa they have to offer. Their nachos are also fresh, large, and crispy.
author: Ronn G.

description:
Very good mexican restaurant - always fairly busy. 

I like the 3 taco combo- it gives you a good sampling and certainly filling. I like the carnitas the best - good flavor. The burritos are pretty good as well - generally pretty stout and not overly priced - again the carnitas are my favorite, but the spicy chicken is pretty good as well.

Definitely worth a try.
author: Tom C.

description: My favorite place to take visitors. Perfect place to grab some burritos/tacos to-go, and walk over to Dolores Park to people watch. I think the stand out ingredient at this place is their cheese. For real, they have delicious cheese. Really makes their vegetarian burrito shine.
author: Brittany L.

description: Annoyed that I found this place so close to moving out of San Francisco. Easily the best Mexican food in the Mission. They're known for their award winning salsas and if you think you are manly enough for their spicy sauces then you are wrong. Many protein options including great vegetarian / vegan offerings, chicken many ways and other more exotic affairs. The Super Quesadillas are a drunk girl's best friend.
author: Amaya B.

description: As good as it gets clearly describes this place. Before I came to SF people kept telling me to get mexican food in mission, but couldn't give me a name of a place. Well, we randomly chose, and are SO happy we did. This was super delicious and HUGE. The only problem was that the line was insane, even in the middle of the afternoon, and it took forever, but it was absolutely worth it. We went for the burritos, which were a great choice, but I'm sure everything here is great.
author: Emily G.

description:
Great taqueria! Fast and fresh food. Very clean dining area. Awesome salsas and burritos. It gets really busy during lunch rush so try to beat the crowds by going a little earlier or later.

This is my favorite burrito place in the mission.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: The line here was ridiculous! It went all the way out the door. Food portion was huge. We took the leftovers home and ate it for breakfast the next morning. If you're looking for casual spot, this is it. Servers were extremely friendly and let us sample different things
author: Ran Dan P.

description: The food was amazing couldnt go wrong with anything.. Ordered a few different plates and all was good.. Prices were good and the ambient was cool too
author: Karla P.

description:
Being on a discovery quest for the best carne asada quesadilla in the city, I ordered just that! 
It was a good sized quesadilla, the meat was good. Unfortunately I ordered it to go and ate it only about 30min later so I think it would have been even better if I had eaten it right there on the spot.
author: Romain D.

description:
Taqueria Cancun is better, but I do like that they have combo plate options. The spicy garlic shrimp is pretty delicious, but the steak, chicken, and salmon were a bit dry and not flavorful enough. 

Get the restaurant.com coupon for $4 for $10 (min spend $20). They take credit card I think, and I love that they all speak English fluently!
author: Jess C.

description: I LOVED this place. Now, it's gone to shit. I decided to order (using yelp eat24) delivery service and not only was my order wrong but the main food item (burrito) was missing! I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and thought maybe the delivery guy didn't look to see if it was my order. Nope. I called the restaurant, explained my situation, then they out the phone down to see what happened. What they didn't realize was that I am a fluent spanish speaker and I could hear them talking clear as day. The woman was explaining to someone else that whoever put in the order didn't put in the burrito so they were the ones to mess up, not the lady. After waiting for 7 minutes someone talked to me, and not once did i receive an apology or an explanation. He just told me that they would contact eat 24 about getting my money back, which is not what i wanted. I explained that the delivery of this food was very important and actually the only reason I even ordered the rest was to cover the minimum of the delivery fee. Three hours later still no food. They have been nothing but rude every single time i call. Do not trust this place. Also they have a VERY VERY low score on their health code which if i would have known before I would have not ordered. Just to clarify, this was not eat24 fault, if anything they have been the only helpful ones in this situation.
author: Lexii U.

description: This is my boyfriends favorite!! I like it, good price, fresh food.. the spicy salsa is actually spicy too. I will say it is a busy place so if you are trying to run in real quick just know it's not going to be that quick, 15 minute minimum. decent amount of seating. oh and they have cream filled churros! yumm..
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I had the veggie burrito here. great size and excellent ingredients. 

the chips and salsa are on point! seriously! the red sauce was my favorite. 

friendly staff and excellent atmosphere.

definitely have to return and try the veggie menu.
author: Edwin G.

description: Exceeded my expectations, considering the area its in.  Hands down BEST BURRITO I've had in the Mission.  The burritos are huge and you get free chips.  Definitely my new favorite burrito spot.  Theres also a wide variety of salsa.
author: Caitlyn D.

description: Pretty average in terms of Mexican food. The guy at the sauce counter is super friendly though!
author: Amie L.

description: This place has good food that competed with all the other mission taquerias. It has tons of seating and stays open late which is awesome considering that's not the case with other places. THEY SERVE TOFU WHICH IS GREAT~ I love burritos but don't like eating meat if I can help it so if you're vegetarian definitely check it out!
author: Sarah C.

description: Great burritos and great drinks. They aren't all that expensive, and I've even ordered a group order with them and they included a whole big bag of chips for us. The place feels a little like a cafeteria, but it's always consistently busy even right when they open. And just like any good mexican place, you can see them grilling everything on their flat top while you wait to order.
author: Kevin S.

description:
The best thing about this place is that it's not over salted or over spiced.   Everything is very good.  I loved all the different salas.  I literally would just pour salsa over every bite that I took. 

The nachos were amazing and the burrito was really good.  The downfall--the taco was not good.  They overstuffed it-which is usually a good thing-but it was literally impossible to pick up and it was just too wet and gooey and the flavor was only good because I added the salsa.

I would DEFINITELY come back though and just skip the tacos.
author: Aly A.

description:
Located at ground zero for the Mission 16th st betw Miss & Valenc. this place gets  some heavy foot traffic. I think the best thing about it is they have so many vegetarian options.
There were a bunch of freshly roasted chickens so I thought I'd a do a full on super burrito.
They have many bean and filling options, spinach,wheat or corn tortillas too. I was not really impressed, my roll up was good but nothing great compared to other taquerias up near 24th.
