They give you a few  homemade chips pretty average too.They have a nice salsa bar though
lots of choices there from peppers to every type of salsa you'd want. The wait was long.... 25 mins. on a Saturday at  1:30. Good not great all around.
NOTE :  a YELP Check in here will get you $ 2- off , at least it worked for me. 
You do the ordering in one line, then pay down the line. The menu is extensive. Prices in line with other taquerias around. Interior fairly spacious, but you may end up eating with strangers if you are just 2  and the bathrooms were pretty clean too.
author: Aaron Z.

description: I got a spicy chicken taco and a chorizo taco. Both were tasteless - the chicken especially. And how do you even make chorizo tasteless?? The salsa selection was abundant and decent, but I don't think you can dump a bunch of sauce on meat that isn't good to begin with and call it a good taco.
author: Kelisha M.

description: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. Very casual take out with seating if you want to eat it there. They are very fast and the food is so cheap and so delicious. It really does not get better than this. Super burrito is my absolute favorite and their churros are perfection.
author: Ryan N.

description: Came here the other night as it was the perfect spot for my friend and I to head to after some  night drinking (11pm).  We came on THE WRONG night, as it just happened to be the night when staff was training brand new staff. Needless to say, our vegetarian nachos (seriously this should not take any more than 5 minutes to make)  took 48 minutos to make! We were wondering what the hangup was as it was not crowded and everyone else seemed to pass us. After, 40 minutes I went up to the cashier with my receipt to inquire about this, he then told a worker to work on it. In all fairness, he did apologize and said it got lost while they were in the midst of training folks. When I did finally get my nachos, I was surprised that it was just OK as I had to doctor it up with their salsas. Probably will not come back here for a long time. There's better spots out there.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Like all other Taquerias in the mission-- they give copious amounts of food at a cheap price, quickly. That being said, I felt that Pancho Villa was not nearly as good as Farolito, La Taq, Cancun, or El Papalote. The flavors didn't stand out as much. They didn't have quite enough meat to really balance the rice and bean filler. Also, I thought their carne asada was tougher than usual. 

That being said, their salmon taco and prawn taco weren't bad. Lots of fish/shrimp in the taco, along with a nice light sauce that provided unique flavor.
author: Neal C.

description: Best burrito I had while in the Mission district. The food was well priced and was delivered fresh and quickly.
author: Joshua H.

description: $8 steak nachos, clean fresh and fast! Right off bart too. Next time I'll get the burrito as that was what most people were getting.
author: Mike M.

description:
Flautas - soggy, but tasty. Chicken was relatively dry in the middle

Pollo Asado Dinner - the chicken was delicious, as was the tortilla. Black beans with cheese is a must have. Rice was good. 

Try all the salsas! Chips were also tasty
author: Tim D.

description: Mexican food delivered for Friday night dinner!! It was very quick and tasty too Price is reasonable!
author: Des L.

description:
By far my favorite taqueria in San Francisco. Three words: refried black beans. It's genius. I'm often stuck debating between refried beans vs black beans; Pancho Villa offers me the perfect compromise.

I grew up eating Pancho Villa's super vegetarian burritos (from the San Mateo location). Went to the Mission spot for the first time on Saturday night and was pleased to discover that all the flavors are still there. Also, where else do the staff all greet you with smiles? Everyone is so, so friendly and every single plate of food was freaking delicious, from the jumbo shrimp taco salad to the quesadillas and, of course, the terrific salsa bar (tip: get the salsa verde).

5 stars forever.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
When I mentioned to a friend that this place came highly recommended, they responded "you need to cut that person from your trusted friends list".  LOL

Sorry all you PV lovers, but this place did not cut it in my book.  I feel it is probably a long time spot here in the mission right next to the BART so it's built up it's reputation and is always packed.  But honestly that doesn't make it good.

You know there are places that have good avocado, and these some that have the crappy watery kind that you know won't sit well in your tummy.  Well this is the latter.  All the while everything is slathered in heart attack worthy sour cream too.  

The tacos had me running to the bathroom in just minutes.  Honestly it was that bad.  The only thing i liked about the food were the chips and the pico di gallo.  That was quite good.

If you're veggie, or if you just like food that looks like food, I recommend El Toro at Valencia & 17th.  They're still the best I've found in the Mission.
author: Sean S.

description: The fact that this place even has a Baby Burrito warrants five stars from me. Add to that the fact that they don't pull a face when you order it -- I'd give 5.5 stars for that. The whole "this burrito is too much food! I'll just take the other half home!" thing doesn't work for me. They're never good as leftovers -- you know this! Pancho is bright, bustling and has better "ambiance" than most of the taquerias in the Mission. And the food is absolutely solid. Love it.
author: Simi D.

description:
The portions are great, the operating hours are accommodating and the food is great.

If you're craving a good chicken burrito, and not one of those with grilled chicken breast chopped up, which tends to be healthier albeit dry and somewhat flavorless... you should go for the chicken they have that's wet in sauce, that's the type of chicken for burritos that I grew up on, where it moistened the rice and was tender.

Also, the pork is very flavorful and tender too.

When you have a late night craving for food and can't decide if it's pizza or something else... this is the something else, I'd always consider indulging in...
author: Rick S.

description:
Two Words: Happy Hour.

This is the best deal in town Monday through Friday from 3-5 PM. The Prawn and Salmon tacos go for around $1.50 (usually around $4 each). The meat tacos go for $1 and are also a pretty slamming deal, considering how much they give you in each taco. 

It does get kind of crowded closer to 5, so you might have to fight for a table. The seats are concave shaped but in an odd manner, so I'm always shifting around while eating my taco. They should probably head to IKEA to get some new seats. 

Also, if you go late at night, for pure entertainment I just sit there while I eat my tacos and watch the security guard debate with all the homeless people trying to sneak their way in. They never get in, but they always try every night..
author: Henry W.

description: I ordered take out from this place last night because I was craving a quesadilla and was too lazy to go get one. It was super soggy and gross when it got to me and I ordered a churro and green salsa too and neither of those things came with my order. So moral of the story is if you want a quesadilla get your ass off the couch and go to el farolitos like a respectable person.
author: Erica V.

description: The last three times I got my grilled chicken burrito and chips, I got sick--the three consecutive times! I just wonder if it was their chicken (chicken meat starts decomposing rather quickly). I know it can't be their sauces, because the last two times I had them without any sauce or salsa, I still got sick. So, ever since I stopped ordering chicken and I have been ordering beef or pork, I haven't had any more problems of the sort.
author: Raymond F.

description: Food is delicious hands down. If you come on a friday/saturday night it's better to call your order in. Lines can get really long. If you check in you get 2$ off super burrito!
author: Aaron W.

description:
I live nearby and have been eating here for years and years and more years!!! These place is
always so good. First; The restaurant is CLEAN! I mean CLEAN! The quality of the  ingredents
is always fresh, and they seriously practice good hygiene!! Second EVERY THING tastes so
darn good! And the prices are reasonable.
author: Peter F.

description: Ugh this place is dangerous!! It's conveniently located next to the yoga studio I attend. This place is probably one of the cheapest places to grab dinner. Two tacos and a side of rice came out to about $7. The carne Asada and spicy chicken were soooo well marinated and the rice was really good too. This place has an amazing salsa bar! def a good find in the mission
author: Samantha S.

description:
I have been to many Mexican restaurants in the Bay Area, but no one has the great food and salsas that Pancho Villa has. Always fresh and clean. It's the most authentic Mexican food you can have in SF
Great food over all.
author: Alfredo C.

description:
All the positive reviews for this place reaffirm my assertion that people in San Francisco have flawed taste buds.  This might be the worst "Mexican food" i've ever had.  My buddy said he was going to open up a Yelp account just to educate people about proper Mexican food.  I'm telling you, don't go to Pancho Villa.  

The best comparison I can come up with is Del Taco.   Pancho Villa is a shitty Del Taco.  Hopefully that gives you a better understanding of how terrible the food really is.
author: Prashant C.

description:
Review is for delivery. 

Shrimp nachos - oh man. They don't skimp on anything. The roasted salsa is where it's at. 

Salmon taco - the only thing stripping of a 5 star. Minimal salmon and lacking flavor.  

Chicken quesadilla  - seriously one of the best I've ever had. Chicken was fantastic and the balance of protein/cheese? Was. Per. Fect.  

Al Pastor burrito - gone in 60 seconds.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
The best taco deal is three piled-high regular open-face tacos with beans, meat & salsa for $7 (else $3 each; can do many more variations for a little bit extra). Also a good deal is a medium-sized horchata for $2.50. Free chips with orders, and a plentiful condiments stand was a positive. Getting stuffed, and the bill totalling $10.40 is a decent deal ITTET.

A huge negative was the ventilation. Even with their high ceiling, a big air vent, the the ventilation was below par - your clothing will smell of oily-smoky meats (according to the security guard, they keep the front door closed because the outside air would only rush in and trap the inside air, wait, wha?). So, unless willing to suffer the odor, or if you enjoy smelling like it, I'm suggesting getting their tasty foods to-go. Speaking of which, the small containers for to-go salsas and condiments are only half the size of the ones seen at other taquerias.

Plenty of seating and near the 16th Street BART and MUNI Metro stations.
author: Peter L.

description: Thought I'd give this place another try for old time's sake, but Pancho Villa  has become just a festering  breeding farm for online app orders.  Don't even bother walking in the door.  Over 20 minutes wait for a burrito while watching a Waiter.com dude walk out with a full bag is beyond absurd.  This is what I despise about the Nouveau Mission.
author: Joe B.

description:
Pancho Villa is the best Mexican food in SF, possibly the bay area. It is clean, fresh and so delicious. The orange salsa at the salsa bar is the best salsa I've ever had, I take the remainder in my cup as a shot if there is any left at the end of my meal. I thought it would be habenero because of the color but I'm glad I didn't get scared off by that and tried it, its more of a smokey chipotle taste. All of the salsa are to die for, I noticed the guacamole looked phenominal too but I told my husband I'd never order it because there's already too much salsa to be had with the chips, the guac would take away from that. With my garlic prawns I was given a pile of glorious spanish rice, creamy smooth refried beans (they also have refried black beans which I hope to try, but the pinto are so good I don't know if I can stray) chopped fresh tomato, cilantro and mild (prob rinsed) white onions as well as HALF an entire beautifully ripe avocado. The garlic prawns still have their shell, legs and tail which I fancy because I like to eat them whole as well as some delicious garlicy mushrooms. The chips are fresh, always hot, made in small, frequent batches. They have every type of agua fresca, including Jamaica which I love. The watermelon was great, no sugar added. There is nothing not to absolutely love and adore about this spot.

ALSO: How can people say that El Farolito or Taqueria Cancun are better than this spot? Those places have fake store bought over salted corn chips!!! Also the fool who gave this place 2 stars because he says it's too bright but that the food is really good should be kicked off of yelp.
author: Emma H.

description: This place is too bomb!!!! burritos on point & horchata....wow!!! My fiancèe and I ate here twice while in san francisco, it was that good. both times place was busy, which to us means its good but we never had to wait too long to order or get our food. we will definetly be back to eat here when we're back in San Francisco.
author: Ana P.

description:
Somewhat underwhelming. 

I wasn't as crazy in love with this place, but the food is good. its a real production -they are churning out a huge amt of food each night.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Tasty spot, usually very busy, but staff work incredibly hard to get food out quickly! Good location in a busy spot of town. Would highly recommend for a burrito.. Same owners as el toro so a very similar experience
author: Jack O.

description: When I lived in the city years ago, this place was my go to place for Mexican food.  Since I have been coming up every other weekend for work, I decided to swing by for a late lunch.  Still the same as I remembered,
author: Chris J.

description: My favorite place in this city to get a burrito and salsa. Been coming here since I was a kid. My dad used to live next door. I eventually moved across the street from here- and loved it. The food is and always has been perfect. It's sadly becoming infested with the gentrifying hipsters taking over the mission- so standing in line listening to their usually drunken first world problems is no longer an option for me. I usually send my kid in. They make the best salsa verde. I get a  pint a week. Always. And drink that down in two days. Get the Jamaica mixed with lemon lime aguas Fresca- make it an XL or you will be disappointed when you have a small empty cup and are still thirsty. The staff here has been mostly the same for years. And I love them all- always make my burrito how I like it. I miss sitting in there and having the musicians come and sing while we eat- they still do it- I just don't like eating in there anymore. It gets really loud when the dinner crowd comes in. If you come to the city and want some real food from a clean place you can trust- go to Pancho Villas.
author: Tracy R.

description: The spot for late night drunk food. The super burritos hit the spot. The carne asada meat is perfectly seasoned. The hot and spicy salsa adds a great kick. This is the place to get nachos when the craving hits late night.
author: James C.

description:
Best Burritos and Tocos in the Mission. 

It's a medium size burrito however the ingredients are fresh and the best from the rest!. Their Carne Asada ............... YUMMMM!


*North-Mid and Easterners should not be allowed to Yelp on Toco-Burrito Shops unless they have lived in California for a year and eaten at-least 10 different  locations. (You guys have destroyed "The Burrito Universe" by giving 5 stars to horrible establishments that don't deserve it).
 

Toco Bell and Chipotle do not count.
author: Abel S.

description: 5 stars for feeding drunk people delicious burritos at midnight. 3 stars for lunchtime takeout disasters. They have a bunch of vegetarian options, which is awesome, and the menu says they don't use lard - so you could easily make things vegan, too. It's best to come outside of the lunch crush when the waits get long and they mess up orders.
author: Rachel M.

description: The staff work in perfect harmony to create the best taqueria in San Francisco.  The place is so clean and the operation runs so smoothly, that I've never had a bad experience here.  The steak & shrimp burrito is amazing & their salsa bar can't be beat.  THE BEST.
author: Nick C.

description:
A work colleague from New Orleans was in Town and we decided to meet in the Mission as he has friends who live in the neighbourhood and he craved a good Burrito. I think we came to the right place!

Before arriving off BART, I did a few Internet searches for Taqueria recommendations. One personal fave is Burrito Eater at:

http://burritoeater.com/main.php

The Reviews also reminded me of the joke about 3 Jews and 4 different opinions. Every post I read about had their own fans and passionate points of view.

I made a list, checked it twice, and I felt pretty good that we would easily find a place that had no naughty and was all nice. However, it was all for naught as my colleague's friend immediately led us over to Pancho Villa.

The Mission's big-daddy megataqueria comes complete with door-opening security person, big crowds, and strolling musicians that were well worth a modest tip. Later when I was wandering around and looking at the nearby Taqueria La Cumbre, I thought that I've probably been here before. After all, Pancho Villa opened in 1982 and I moved to the Bay Area 2 Years later. Has it really been that long?

I really enjoyed my Super Chile Verde Chicken Burrito, a wide variety of really interesting salsas, fresh chips, and of course watching one of the cooks energetically applying the meat cleaver next to the grill. Yet I wasn't wowed mostly due to the slow speed that the food came out and the fact that the Burrito "stayed" with me well into the night. Maybe I'll go a little less spicy the next time.
author: Eric B.

description:
After long  walk at the Golden Gate park
etc.. Me and my girl we did a walk around the park.. We hit the point where only a good Mexican food could replace the burnt calories.. We decided to come to Pancho  Villa burrito place..
I'm very picky about my calorie intake, but the burrito from Pancho Villa was one the best burrito I had in my life and I had eaten at this place heaps of times.. all the ingredients were very fresh, not to salty or greasy.. 
They also offer free side dishes as a compliments to your food.. 
As we know you're what you eat.. Take a look at people who works there you will notice, no one is fat.. Even the owner looks pure lean and that means the food is pure healthy.. 
They score 96 on their  cleanness. It is very important in our dining experience...
Get the especial burrito with light cheese and  guacamole ...
author: Pedro D.

description:
My favorite burrito place in the mission.  Mainly because of their yummy salsa verde.  So spicy, but so good.

I always order the grilled chicken super burrito and their meat is very good quality.  Always satisfies my craving for Mexican food.
author: Ladan G.

description:
I am just going to say that this is the best Taqueria in Northern California. Just like that, nobody is better than PVT!
I have taken family and friends to eat here for the last 22 years and nobody has ONE complain about the food or service.
You are greeted with smiles and served with tasty food!
author: Juan T.

description: Still my favorite and featured on Food Network http://www.foodnetwork.com/restaurants/photos/best-cheap-eats-restaurants-san-francisco.html
author: Amy S.

description:
Spanish review:
Es bueno. Me gusta el burrito con pollo. Ellos tienen muchisimos salsas.

English review:
It's good. I like the chicken burrito. They have a full salsa bar.
author: Tony A.

description:
Been coming to this place forever it seems . I appreciate the doorman who keeps out the aggressive homeless this must be said the Cali-Phony attitudes in the Mission can be much too liberal thus unsafe and Pancho Villa Taqueria is a safe space for families to enjoy tasty Mexican food in a historic setting.

Now to the food. Their prawn burritto is my current favorite burritto. My husband loves the chicken burrittos so much that he buys in bulk  we freeze it and reheat in the oven fresh as hell.

The place is a slice of old school San Francisco cross cultural not just techies not just homies a real slice of the city.
author: SF T.

description: I seriously love this place!! I come here so often the people that work here already know me. The super burrito is around $9 but it's totally worth it. It comes with guacamole, sour cream, your choice of meat, rice, pico de gallo, salsa and god knows what else. It's my favorite! Also, the super tacos!! And super nachos, it's heaven in a box. Really good and super affordable. And lastly try their Horchata, it's really good and not very sweet.
author: Mayra A.

description:
Great authentic Mexican cuisine - the burritos and tacos are the best I've had in the San Mateo area.

There will often be a wait, but the line moves quickly.
author: Nick D.

description:
Got 3 tacos.
Pork, beef, chicken.
Good, ok, yum.
$7 for the lot.
Decently sized, very filling.
Green salsa = good.
Spacious inside.
Didn't especially stand out, but would go again.
author: An Y.

description:
My First Bite Was Heaven!

Yes definitely 1 out of 5 of the Top 5 taquerias in the city of San Francisco hands Down! 

Fresh fresh fresh ingredients daily

An In & Out fast Trip

Nice restaurant

Sometimes a little mariachi band

Over all Great Food...

5 delicious stars
author: Anthony J G.

description:
I love this place... its crowded but people eat fairly quick and 
you find a seat sooner or later.. 
they have tons and tons on the menu.. !!!!!!!! 

the best tacos.. burritos.. Mexican dishes.. 

tons of aguas frescas.. churros con crema!!


and even tofu tacos/burritos ..etc for those vegetarians.!

LOVE it I will be back!
author: T. C.

description:
Had some great burritos here! The size is comparable to many other Mission taquerias which, if you're not aware, is too much you assume you can handle. A bit more pricier than other locations around the Mission, but extremely filling.

My favorite is the al pastor burrito. The pork here is very succulent and works well with all the other components. 

At all times of the day, this place is packed! Whether it be in the morning, afternoon or even before this place closes, the one thing you can always expect is a line almost going out the door. Seating is plentiful and workers come around every 2 or so minutes and clear out the tables.

All in all, this is a great place to grab a snack before walking down Valencia or Mission to do some sight seeing or grabbing a quick lunch/dinner. Parking can be quite hard to find, espeically if you're looking to find free parking spaces, but if you park maybe 2-3 blocks away, it won't be that much trouble.
author: George Z.

description: Excellent, fast Mexican food that doesn't make you too full or feel like you're indulging to much. Very satisfying. Churros are delicious, as is watermelon agua fresca. I got a super quesadilla with carnitas and it was excellent, my boyfriend got a burrito and he enjoyed that as well. Everything was super reasonably priced too. Great value. Highly recommend!
author: Hadley B.

description:
Love. That simple.

My friend took me here when I visited SF a number of years ago and I dreamed of it regularly after that from my home on the East Coast (fat kid thing to do, I know). It's so tasty and inexpensive.

I was recently back in SF and had to stop by here, and it did not disappoint. I'm completely hooked and will come here on every future trip to the Bay Area as well.
author: Erin K.

description: Loved the salsa! I got the super burrito...definitely going to get two meals out of it! If I lived here I know I'd be back.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Literally baffling how bad the service is at this place. They have like 25 people behind the counter at any given time and it took half an hour to get 2 tacos
author: Jeff C.

description: Well that was kind of disappointing too much sauce everywhere and not enough flavor I'll try it again but the Camaron burrito was ehh at best
author: Laura G.

description: This is the spot of Burritos in the mission. There's always a line but the time waiting flyer by.  Yum!   Be prepared to order as they get a little huffy. It's part of the charm. Their Fruit juices as delicious.
author: Marti C.

description:
Great prices and good value - had two super vegetarian tacos and they filled me up. Fast service and great for takeaway. 

Just a $1 tip also gets you smiles and wonderful service!
author: Katheriin L.

description:
I came here with a couple friends to get our grub on before a concert sometime last year.

My first thought about this place was, "wow, this place is packed." The line was extremely long and I knew right when I walked in that this place that the food must be really good. 

They have a large variety of foods here. The thing I like about the most is how big their vegetarian options are. They also have seafood here too! I also like how neat they cooked the food compared to other Mexican restaurants. The cooks make sure not to have any bits and piece of meats in vegetarian dishes (which is a huge plus!) to ensure that the vegetarian dish is, well, vegetarian.

The portion of the food is quite big for how much you pay. I got a burrito and couldn't finish half of it! But then again I never finish my food.

I like this place overall. The only thing I didn't really like were their chairs. It felt like my butt was sinking through the chair. BUT THEY STILL GET 5 STARS!
author: Anna H.

description:
Our choice of Pancho Villa as our first San Francisco Burrito Experience was not calculated. 

We had just arrived in San Francisco, fresh off the plane (ok, that's an oxymoron), and we were wandering around the Mission, a bit zonked. 

First stop: we went into a cell phone store, to buy a phone and all that boring stuff. We asked the AT&T guys which place had the best burritos in the Mission, and they all vehemently disagreed with each other. It was getting heated. The loudest guy told us to go to Pancho Villa, and his walking instructions made slightly more sense than the others' so we headed there. 

So ... let's just say this review is not a comparative study. We can only evaluate this single experience and we do not have a lifetime of burrito-eating in San Francisco to weigh up the flavours.

All that being said - we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Pancho Villa. There were musicians in the corner, and a cafeteria style serving line to get our food. It all happens quickly, and there isn't much time to make decisions. As usual, I went for the fish tacos and the bf went for some enormous meaty burrito with everything on it. The ingredients were all very fresh and there is a huge range of sauces and condiments and toppings ... actually that was kind of the best part. 

You get to see the meat being cooked in front of you, and they have coke in glass bottles. The place was pretty busy but we managed to get a table. No, it's not the cleanest establishment (though I wouldn't call it dirty either), and it has a fun community vibe.
author: Jesse A.

description: I got the salmon tacos and they were really not good. Had to return it for the vegetarian tacos which were great - but it is pretty hard to mess up on a vegetarian taco. The salsa bar was massive, but biggest doest always mean best.
author: Debbie R.

description: This place can get packed with a line out the door and takes a little while to get your food. Lots of seating inside though. Got the burrito and can say it's really nothing special to anywhere else that I have had. I've had better at other places though. Good thing you can use the check in and get a discount. Sauces are mostly spicy. I was mixing them to create a better flavor. Chips were ok nothing special. I will check out another place when I'm in town to compare
author: Leonard I.

description: Awesome carnitas burrito with refried beans and a lot of salsa choices to choose, I'm so happy with this place, I can see the process on how they grill the meat and stuff.
author: Gabriella S.

description:
I ordered the carne asada super burrito, chips and guac, and a churro for delivery. But since they got my order wrong, what I actually got was a super burrito (definitely beef, but it didn't really seem like carne asada to me), two bags of chips, and a cookie of some sort. Lame. It also took quite some time for my food to arrive.

The good news was that the food was decent tasting and the delivery guy was nice. But I feel ripped off and definitely won't be ordering from here again.
author: Emily F.

description: Two words why I often choose Pancho Villa: Baby Burrito.  I've had my share of burritos the size of my head and they go down fine but later seem to turn into bricks in my stomach.  The baby burrito is the perfect size for me--even if I'm famished.  And for $5.50 you can't beat the price!
author: B N.

description: Nothing special about this place. Same ol Mexican food. What made me give 3 stars was the fact that They serve salad with dinner portion but make you pay for dressing... yet they have a salsa bar that's free... Go figure.
author: Joe C.

description: Ordered the burrito. Just ok. Chicken was a little dry. Salsa and chips were just standard. Nothing mind blowing
author: Daisy B.

description: Love this place! They have cheap and delicious burritos and tacos. The service is really fast, even when the line is out the door. The seating isn't ample or comfortable, but the price and qualify of food make up for that. If you want to avoid the lunch rush, you need to get there by 11:15 or so during the week.
author: Diana G.

description:
Beware, the happy hour special only applies to meat tacos!! 3 - 5pm guys!

I ordered the prawn taco and the super taco with steak. The prawn was grilled nicely, it was chewy and not too fried. The super taco with steak was so savory. The meat was tender. Also, chips are free with your order so get your salsa fix on!!
author: Virginia Y.

description: Carnitas burrito. Very simple. There was a lettuce and tomato salad, sprinkled with bits (seriously bits) of carnitas and beans, smothered in sour cream and salsa and wrapped in a tortilla. Not good. Hard to screw up a burrito but it oddly happens quite often. Not impressed and I won't be going back. AND we had to wait a while AND it wasn't even crowded so I'm not sure why we had to wait. I gave them one star because I had to and because I had a Negra Modelo while I was waiting and that was delicious and refreshing.
author: Raphaelle C.

description: Awesome veggie options
author: Clinton C.

description:
This isn't fair. I've been blessed by the burrito gods they call, El Farolito and Taqueria Cancun. 

I wanted to "Mex it up" (Zing!) and try a different spot to see if maybe I could add a third challenger to these burrito wars. Pancho Villa was surprisingly large and sat many people which I liked. Their salsa bar was also more comprehensive than the previous two, however, when it comes down to it, it's all about the food.

Pancho served up a pretty good chicken Super Burrito and I liked how they added lettuce in there to give it crunch and freshness. Unfortunately, it doesn't quite match up flavor-wise. The meat was a little bit more bland than I would have liked.

Pancho is good, but I think there is better.
author: David P.

description:
Pancho villa is your basic Mexican taqueria...fresh ingredients, super fast paced, a bunch of agua frescas, great salsa bar, and sometimes you'll catch some good ole mariachi. 

The place is usually clean...and they are pretty giving with the tortilla chips.  Prices are affordable...

One thing that really bothers me is when a taqueria throws together a chile verde burrito but doesn't drain the juice whatsoever...so by the time you bite into your burrito, you're pretty much wearing it. Ugh!  Yeah, that happened here.  Haha.  

They have an awesome happy hour with $1 tacos...nothing was super memorable...but good enough to come back again.
author: Jen W.

description:
This place is really awesome. 
Been there to eat some burritos and haven't been disapointed! Good, fresh, big portions and cheap. How could it be better!?
author: Quentin A.

description:
You go to Pancho Villa for the SALSAS. If you're looking for the best taco or burrito in the Mission, Pancho Villa is the wrong place. Their food is fine, but you should really be going here for the extensive salsa bar.

It's in a busy spot and it holds a lot more people than most of the other Taquerias in the Mission. I don't mind busy, but I'm really not a fan of crowds. Somebody stole my chips when I was there.

If you haven't been there for salsas, it's worth the trip. If you're looking for the best Mexican you can find, you don't have to walk far.
author: Marcus C.

description: Food is fresh, delicious, affordable.  The pico del gallo Salsa is the best! The only thing I don't like is the loud hammering when they are dicing the carne asada... and the hot climate on hot days.  They could put a an or air condition the place when it is hot outside
author: Lisa V.

description:
Their al pastor burrito was really good. I enjoyed it. Their horchata was a little grainy, but it had good flavor. 
I also appreciated their salsa bar. Warning: The green salsa is HOT.
author: Rich P.

description: Having just been served the worst Mexican food ever, I was reminded that I had not yet given Pancho Villa a review. What can I say? Panch Villa, in my opinion is the best Mexican food in the Bay Area and the best value! Their tamales are incredible, as are the burritos. I can honestly say, we have yet to have been served a meal here that is anything less than spectacular! Do yourself a favor and give PV a try and don't forget to take advantage of their Yelp deal, if you can.
author: Carrie C.

description: One of the most famous taquerias in San Francisco. After years I tried one more time this burreria. Same mediocre food. I ordered a vegetarian Tofu Burrito and was nothing special, actually was bad!! I found a better Tofu options in Las Estrellas or La Tortilla. The size of the burrito was perfect for me, small and very thin. For another costumers this can be a problem. The salsa bar is good but no different to similar taquerias, if you are looking for something unique you must try Tlaloc in Financial District. I'm still don't understand the popularity of this seudo-mexican restaurant. Burritos are not Mexicans, and even the quesadillas are just a american version, nothing similar to Mexican quesadillas!!!
author: Arturo R.

description: I love this place, and often pick up a salad or vegan-ify a burrito here after nearby yoga. Super clean, efficient, with good service, and the "fresh ingredients, no preservatives" advertising totally appeals. The sexist image on the website, though, is disturbing: http://sfpanchovilla.com/
author: Shendi X.

description:
just so good.
amazing salsa bar
lots of options
no way you walk out unsatisfied
author: Joseph Rebelo R.

description:
We stumbled upon this place when we were craving for burritos and saw that their Yelp review seemed to had a lot to offer. Clearly, our expectations may have been a little higher. This place is very spacious and clean. The menu has an easy to read font and large letters which makes it easy to read. My boyfriend was so excited that they offered refried beans behind the counter. When we ordered, the lady with red rim glasses told us they ran out when we clearly saw about 1/3 of the refried beans left. Apparently, she told us it was for something else. After we ordered, we saw two of the workers diluted the refried beans with a clear liquid that looks just like water and just stirred it. Afterwards, the same lady offered us the the refried beans and said it was available again. We politely declined and thanked her. 

As for the burritos, they were just mediocre. The rice was dry and the burrito was very lightly flavor. They have a  semi-clean salsa bar which is nice. It was worth a try but I don't think we will be back.
author: Karen T.

description: I don't crave Mexican food often, but when I do I drive across town to get their BBQ burrito in a spinach tortilla! It's cheep, tasty, and run by a very nice crew! It has a casual setting and is decorated quite festively. They have large portions, and are willing to accommodate modifications of your choice on the menu. My only deterrent would be the bathroom, Is not the nicest.
author: Lana S.

description: Wildly inefficient. Too many cooks spoils this experience. The food is ordinary compared to any of the several other taquerias on the block and never worth the wait. I guess if you're from out of town and scared to step off 16th street its safe but a total time waster.
author: Jody J.

description: I'm not sure if it's because we ordered online or not, but the order that we placed and requested was incorrect. The meat was a bit undercooked, and the burrito we got unraveled right away. We were really hungry but we couldn't eat the food, we'll be going somewhere else.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
You know, I've been here a couple of times and I think it's pretty good. It's always busy, regardless of the hour of day, so expect to wait in line a few minutes. That being said, the dishes are at least prepared fresh.

I've tried the fish tacos and the carne asada nachos. I've yet to try the burrito, which is probably what it's more known for. There is a nice selection of salsas at the salsa bar in the back, and the chips are thin and crispy. The portions are also gutbusting, which usually ends up being my downfall because I have no restraint. I'd probably enjoy it a lot more if I split the entree with someone else. The nachos were literally a large enough portion for 3 people. Did 3 people eat them? No, I did.

Overall, I think this is a decent place and I would take people here if they wanted to try some of the mission classic food. I think some of the smaller places a few blocks away are just as good or better though.
author: Brent W.

description:
OK - so here we are yelping our way around the mission always exploring looking for the best Mexican food.  Pancho Villa Taqueria came on the radar and we tried it

SO - yays it's roomy and really clean - the kitchen is right up front and they have a large menu.

I tried the prawn burrito as recommended in other reviews - decent but nothing special

My partner tried the chili rellenos- and OMG, it was *so* noms! (it's like 5AM now I should *never* yelp about food this early!)

regardless - chili rellenos - in our continuing quest for the best rellenos in SF, this, the Pancho Villa Taqueria relleno, is the current leader

PS they have watermelon augua frescia when most places don't - bonus points :)
author: Tetyana S.

description: Cheap, delicious Mexican food in the Mission.  You know this place is good bc there's no shortage of Mexican food in the mission but this place is always full.  You order you meal (I chose a burrito), choose your meat, choose your beans, and wait.  Food is ready fast.  You can eat it inside the taqueria or get it to go.  My burrito was delish.  Big and full with substantial portions of chicken, beans, salsa, cheese, etc.  I left stuffed for days!  They also give you a free side of chips and you can select a salsa from their salsa bar.  A cheap, filling meal option in the mission.
author: Amanda M.

description: Like most of us we all probably have various favourite mexican spots. I myself am one of those who love to go to many spots for my burritos. But this place is something else I had one of their chiken  burrito and it blew me away i usually like to try the underdogs of food but this place definitely deserves all of their awards and it should a must have for mexican food fanatics new to the mission. I will definetly keep go8ng back and recomending them to everyone until the day they close their doors. ( touch wood)
author: David G.

description:
You can't go wrong with Pancho Villa's. 

If you compare their prep/cooking area to the surrounding taquerias, their's is the only one I would dare eat off the floor of. They are meticulous with keeping everything clean. 

The only place that comes close to these guys is La Cumbre around the corner on Valencia
author: Leo V.

description: I made the mistake of ordering food through Caviar at this place. It took forever! The poor Caviar guy was waiting and these folks claimed they had "production delays" and the food just did not come. I mean they make like 15 things at most, what production "delays" are we talking her? Jeez!
author: Rocking V.

description:
Ok...the food here is pretty standard taqueria fare for the Mission. But why so damn overpriced ???

A dinner for 2 here gets into the 35 - 40 range !

the food is just not that impressive to me. Not very tasty and somewhat bland. I have definitely had better in SF...This place cant hold a flame to Farolitos or El Buen Sabor...I think even Los Coyotes is better.

Food aint bad...just not worth it in my opinion.
author: Mario W.

description: The food is great, and they try to get you through the busy line fast, but it is best for take-out. There is always a long wait, and they do not honor coupons or offer any good discounts like they used to do. Good for take-out, but be prepared to wait.
author: Katherine N.

description:
**VEGETARIAN REVIEW**

Im obsessed with Pancho Villa.
I had a binge at one point in my life when I went there AT LEAST twice a week if not three & I look back at this time in my life with great positivity and nostalgia :O).

I would like to say I have had a LOT of burritos in my life. Burritos really are one of my favorite foods & I eat them almost weekly & HANDS DOWN Pancho Villa has the BEST vegetarian burrito I have EVER had. 
I wonder and I wonder what makes it more special, I have honestly tried AT LEAST 40 veggie burritos at different places in the Bay Area over the last 10 years, & I concluded is that it's because of ...

 A. the freshness of their ingredients. I believe that that fact alone just gives every component of the burrito superior taste & when they all combine together it's like angels sing :O)!

B. Their salsa bar is just perfect.
 I'm a salsaholic....if you catch me in a bad time in a semi private situation I CAN be found drinking salsa....so you can imagine how ecstatic I was to find a FULL salsa bar equipped with QUALITY SALSAS OF ALL KINDS at Pancho Villa! 
You can find me at my table with about 6-8 salsa containers just for my burrito and you can also find my table after and see that I have finished them all... 
(The orange salsa is DIVINE btw...it's like edible, delicious crack really...not to make that horrendous reference but I can imagine my taste buds having a parade when I eat it...GORSH I just wish I could know how to make some for myself!)

C. I just love the atmosphere of here...It's crowded...right in the heart of the mission. I love to people watch here & I just love when the mariachi people or someone with an acoustic guitar comes in and sings way too loud. 
THANK YOU PANCHO VILLA FOR EXISTING YOU REALLY DO, EVEN IF A LITTLE, BRING HAPPINESS TO MY LIFE.

PS. I would also like to add that Yes I have tried every sensationalized burrito place in SF.
author: Zhenya S.

description:
To paraphrase a quote from Rambo (Part I) - I always thought I "could eat things that could make a billy-goat puke..."     I have traveled the world, eaten the most exotic and mysterious foods and have only food poisoning only a handful of times.   

A Pancho Villa Carne burrito w/ mushrooms, ordered yesterday at lunch, did the job on me.  I'm hating Pancho Villa 24 hours later and counting...   

Beware of this restaurant!  I suspect they're getting lazy, promoting unsanitary conditions and not caring about delivering a high quality product.   There are far too many other good Mexican places in the Mission - pass on Pancho Villa.  This place is on my 'No Go' list forever.

- Rambo
author: Ron K.

description: This review is strictly for ordering delivery. I've never eaten at the place but I'd thought I'd order through eat24. Got the taquitos and Baja burrito and a drink. The delivery took over an hour and a half, everything was cold soggy and gross and they forgot my drink. May try it again at the store next time when it's fresh.  I'll update my review if I do..
author: Ryan O.

description: BEST BURRITO I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE HANDS DOWN!! I almost never order burritos because I'm just not a fan but the burritos here were life-changing. Very spacious restaurant and DEFINITELY worth the wait from the lines.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I used to eat here 20 years ago when I worked at a wire service. It was great then and great now. What I've noticed is an expanded and  more modern menu.

I had shrimp tacos and an amazing salmon taco. Came to about $7.50. I don't think I've ever had a salmon taco, nice and fresh. First-class chow at affordable prices. It's cafeteria style and no frills plus you get a little live music.
author: Michael S.

description:
I love coming here whenever I'm down for some good ol' Mexican food. My favorites include the prawns seafood dinners and tacos. The portions are extremely filling and good enough to last you all day. Their salsa bar is always stocked and there's even an attendant standing nearby to ensure some type of ordinance for all us crazy people attacking the salsa bar all at once. For shame.

Entertainment is occasionally provided. Once I stopped by and was pleasantly greeted by some live Mariachi music. 

It's insanely popular and is always packed so be prepared to stand in line for a little bit. 

Definitely a great place to get really good and quick Mexican comida.
author: Ann S.

description:
In which the Dream team goes to PV for burritos: 

"ARE YOU READY FOR THIS?" 
"I'm so effing ready." 
*munch munch munch* 
"OK This is a GOOD super vegetarian burrito."
" Dude, it's hitting sooo many spots right now."
"How many spots right now"
"SOOOO many. SOOOOOO MANYYY."
"Which ones?!?
"Oh... the good ones."

Sometimes you just need a super burrito to celebrate making it through another week. Solid 4 stars.
author: Emily D.

description: One of the best soft shell tacos I've ever had.  Love the atmosphere here.  This seems to be one of those places where EVERYBODY goes.
author: Julie G.

description: One of my favorite to go place to get pura carne burito (all meat). You can choose the meat from chicken, beef, or pork. This place is almost always crowded after 5p with young people. Parking can be hard sometimes especially during weekend. Try to come during weekday after 8pm and you should be able to find parking more easily. The service is very fast and the price is reasonable. You can get free refill on the nachos if you eat in. They also have salad, condiments/sauce bar where you can pick your own salsa sauce with different degree of spiciness. I also find their aqua fresca quite refreshing especially the Guava and Mango even though I wish that the price would be a tad cheaper.
author: Bibi B.

description:
Pancho Villa? You and I have been through so much together, over the years. I've tried to love you, through all of your unnecessary and just plain, weird changes. I gaze longingly at the ribbons that proclaim your many, decade's-old awards for State Fair salsa and , well...I really did gaze longingly. 

WHY DID YOU CHANGE THE ORDER & MAKE A BURRITO DEATH MARCH LINE? WHY DISTILL DOWN TO A SINGLE REGISTER WHERE EVERYONE IS FORCED TO ORDER WITH THE ORDER LADY & THEN SHUFFLE UP TO THE CASHIER AND PAY WITH NO INTERACTION WITH THE FOLKS ON THE LINE!?!

 I KNOW I'M YELLING, BUT WHY!?! IT'S WAY TOO SLOW, DUDE!

Pancho, you made me wait for 35 minutes, in line, ON A SUNDAY AFTERNOON, to ORDER A BURRITO through an order clerk. Darling Pancho, you are a TAQUERIA, and frankly, dear, not a very good one, any longer. I've always been happy to pay a little extra to you for just okay burritos, but darling, I will not stand in line with a bunch of angry, frustrated people to get the same burrito I ordered a month prior in under 5 minutes.

You've become greedy, Pancho, and I don't like it. It's over. Get your shit and get out!

P.S. The folks on the line smiled whistfully at me, as if to say 
"Goodbye, old friend! We'd like to awkwardly greet you like we always have. We'd like to know if you want hot, or mild, but we can't! Pancho won't let us!" It was a tragic moment.

P.P.S The cashier was harried, PISSED and said she was going to "speak to the owners." I have her back, Pancho, so watch it!
author: Tough C.

description:
Good salsa bar..  fresh fruit drinks, guacamole.   No use of lard.
Mediocre portions compared with others in SF.

Been coming here for 10+ years.
author: David H.

description:
Pancho villaaaaaaaaaaa!

This place can get very busy, especially during lunch hours.

Great burritos and tacos. This pancho character has created some sort of afflicting drug into the food here, keeps you coming back for more.

They have these cookie thingamajigs that are deadly (same drug in these), I could go here and just have these cookies to replace my meal!! After having just one I got back up and snagged all the remaining ones!

The workers are very knowledgeable and friendly, anything you want in a burrito that's not on the menu and you see the toppings they will do!

The only thing I would give criticism to is the cleanliness of the place. Noticed some crumbs on our seats after they had already been wiped down but the quality of flavor this spot has obtained will keep me coming back.

Go pancho!
author: Alan S.

description:
This place earns two stars for being so disorganized and inattentive in addition to having extremely average food. Three friends and I ordered and paid separately, which was an ordeal in itself since apparently you can only really add things to burritos instead of taking them away. I didn't think "beans, cheese, avocado" was a hard order but it boggled at least three minds. They have about 20 employees all milling about wasting time and space instead of an assembly line. We sat for half an hour with no food, and they seemed confused and annoyed when we tried to get it sorted out. When we eventually harassed someone enough to put our orders through a SECOND time (since I guess they disappeared into the abyss?) they of course fucked mine up. It clearly wasn't worth saying anything, but it's just not that hard.

The mission is full of good or passable food. Skip this place.
author: Alex S.

description:
Americans only eat we don't eat too taste.

I am  not a huge mexican food eater I can eat mexican  food twice a year

I haven't  been too Pancho in  many many years  over fifteen. I moved away,  but was in town this week  and decided too stop in *bad decision*

When I come too the City this was the place too go. It used too be very good  the food always full of flavor. I would  get the carna asada, shirimp, a chicken combo fajitas  include rice and beans w/ tortillas simply delicious. 

Now not so much now, I hate too be Debbie downer but when I pay almost eleven dollars for a SUPPER BURRITO I expect it to be SUPER and with all the fixings not scraps..

Ok,  husband placed his order he repeated 3 times  too the  female  cashier and had her repeat it back (knew this was a bad sign don't understand the food order  usually not good.. . he order a SUPER  chicken burritto NO RICE, black beans,  and cheese.  I order carna asada w/ prawns SUPER Burrito..

I received  my order first came quickly,  but nothing SUPER about this burrito. Where's the beef? more like beef crumbs, lettuce, sour cream, *no tomatoes * was non existent. I always open up my burrito to see how it looks and if done correctly and getting what I payed for but plenty of RICE..

Now,  husbands order arrived WRONG w/rice had to send back.

Remember when I said if cashier cannot understand your food  order food  is usually nasty  Well, I was right. My SUPER burrito was tasteless. The chips of carne asada was just meat no seasoning, rice blah, shrimp tasteless.  I want my food too have flavor and different taste flowing through my mouth not take a bite and everything taste the same.

Last, the security guard was disgusting at the front door 5/09/15 @ 10:37 pm. This little disgusting man while I was  eating my food taking my first bite, grunts, snorts and spit up phelm in the recycling blue bin by the front door where he was standing spoiling my appetite even more . I don't want too see somebody hacking while I'm eating he should have went too the restroom..

*I reported him too the young tall man that was the cashier but I believe he didn't do anything. Oh well!!

Now, not only was  the food not my cup of tea but if your employees are doing disgusting things like this in front of  customers just imagine what their doing behind your back

Food is not always about being BIG it has too taste good no matter big or small. ..
Never Again!!

Back too the Crab House!!
author: Yvette M.

description:
I know, I know.  We all have our own special Taqueria and most people will not go anywhere other than their favorite.  They all serve the same food too, which is unique.

Where Pancho Villa succeeds, IMO is cleanliness, quality and consistency.

Each time I have been here, which is many as I used to live around the corner, I have NEVER left disappointed.

The bright green salsa here is to die for. I don't even know what is in it!!

This past visit I ordered; my go to Mexican coke, 2 tacos with black beans, one chicken one Al Pastor, I think they were under $2 each!

My husband ordered a burrito Al Pastor.  We both looked at each other from across the table, rolled our eyes and fought back the tears of many memories here. How we miss The Mish!!!  

With a changing neighborhood full of wonderful Taquerias, you simply cannot go wrong at Pancho Villa.  I just love watching the all woman workers, dressed in white, blue and red hustle their way around gossiping in Spanish.  THIS IS HOW THE MISSION SHOULD REMAIN kept playing over and over in my head.
author: James S.

description: Best salsa bar on the nation!! They have my favorite orange salsa, 3 reds, 1 or 2 greens and lots of other goodies to take as you please. Great grilled fish tacos for oh so cheap! Grilled green onions are a specialty here as well.
author: Kate R.

description: Ordered the tofu ranchero super burrito, but I wasn't completely satisfied. There are a few vegetarian options so I'll definitely go back and try some of the others. Also I ordered a pretty terrible flavour of Agua Fresca but that's my fault because I didn't even know how to pronounce it. Will definitely give it another shot. Well worth the price.
author: Shubh J.

description:
Hands down best super quesadilla I've ever had. The place is fairly cheap, priced at similar points as most Mexican taquerias. However, there are multiple things that stand out about this place compared to the typical Chipotle or Qdoba. 

1. The quesadilla tortilla actually had a crispy, flaky texture and wasn't too heavy. 

2. Beef filing was well seasoned. 

3. Cheese was right amount and not covering up other flavors. 

Restaurant is big and has open seating - great for impromptu big group meals when you don't have time to make reservations. 

I did give four stars because there were musicians playing live Mexican music and they would play right behind us and then ask for very direct tips which made it hard to hear conversations and was very annoying. Place is pretty clean.
author: Viroopa V.

description: No trek to the Mission would be complete without a stop into one of the many taquerias. They're simply the best this city has to offer. This was my second visit to Pancho Villa, this time equally as delicious as the first. Menu options are endless. Burritos are legit. Enough said!
author: Brianna M.

description: This place is not authentic, the burritos are good but if you can't make a burrito then you cannot call your self a Mexican restaurant. The tacos are awful. Long line and long wait for foot, not worth it
author: Elba A.

description:
The taqueria boasts the best salsa bar in San Francisco bar none. Of the eight fresh salsas I've tried here, I have yet to narrow down my favorites to less than four. The yearly salsa awards from past to the present hanging on the wall pretty much sums it all. I'm convinced the little village of Pancho must be where salsa originates from.

Not many taquerias in the Mission offer prawn tacos, which I discovered I have a particular weakness for thanks to Pancho Villa. Pancho Villa prawns are shrimp-sized, but cooked perfectly on the griddle as ordered and generously stuffed in each taco. Two tacos at $3.50/each will satiate most, but if you prefer a different kind of presentation there's also prawn quesadilla and burrito.

I'm not crazy about their meats. Although they offer a lot of different kinds of meats done in different ways, the quality isn't consistent and often dry. If you have to go the meat route, either choose based on how the meats look when you're there, opt for something simmered in sauce like salsa verde, or go elsewhere.

From the street, this brightly-lit taqueria appears like an institution compared to its smaller competitions sprinkled throughout the Mission. It is in fact run like an institution. The line moves quick, the salsa bar is always clean (same with the bathrooms and tables), and there's usually a door man to keep the many questionable people  found hanging around the nearby BART station out. 16th & Mission may be icky, but I feel safe at Pancho Villa eating my prawn tacos, tortilla chips and 4 different salsas at anytime of the day.
author: Rina W.

description:
I've eaten here a couple of times and each time I remember leaving with full satisfaction. This place is always busy, it seems, but the lines move across pretty fast.

It appears that everything is made fresh here. From the beans in the burrito, to the chips, and sauces. They all taste quite authentic.

The price is creeping up but people are still coming back and again. I will too.
author: Gen L.

description: Visiting the area from out of town and was not disappointed by the food! Portions are generous and prices are reasonable, but the reason for one star off was that as I was about to purchase the $7 for $10 Yelp deal, the internet suddenly gave out so the establishment immediately became cash only and they would not have been able to honor the Yelp deal. If I had pre-purchased the deal I would have just been out $7! Since we're from out of town there's no other time I would have been able to use it. Good thing I had cash on hand; unfortunate for the people behind me who had ordered and had to abandon their lunch.
author: P W.

description: I've been to just about every "this place is my favorite " burrito-mexi place in SF. Seriously.  In my experience, from my humble beginnings in 1988, starting with liking El Faro near 19th & Treat (hey, u gotta start somewhere). After over 20 yrs of San Franciscan tutelage, Pancho Villa is the best. The grilled meat is the killer for me. My husband is a grill master and I am serious about my grilled food. The food is always consistently fresh & tasty. The meats and prawns are seared just enough while maintaining juiciness.  For dinner Ill pick up the plates. For lunch, I go for the burrito. I love that their burritos aren't soggy. The flavors are separated with each bite. I especially love that I can walk here from work!
author: Evelyn K.

description:
as Eminem raps, "my salsa makes all the pretty girls dance and want to take off their underpants, my salsa", i'm pretttttty sure that he is referring to Pancho Villa's salsa. 
This is the kind of place where addictions are born and cultivated to the point where eating mexican food anywhere else in SF will not be able to relieve the withdrawal symptoms.
author: Tuwie N.

description:
Yeah, it was good and all, but I was expecting something a little more from the food after all the hype.  The atmosphere and aromas are very nice when you walk in, but you must then quickly make food choices in a hurried line from an oversized menu (too many choices and it does not guide you through the ordering process) hanging on the wall.  It felt a little like being pushed through a cattle shoot.

I had three tacos - carnitas, carne asada, and chicken.  All of them were good, but not great.  The churos at the end were a little lack luster as well.  The guacamole was well done, and you can order it by the pint - an excellent option more places should adopt.

While it was good, there are many other great taquerias in the area to go to.
author: Jesse F.

description:
best burritos ever . love the prices alll the other places jack your money.
there chips are homemade and best quality .

nevermind the snobs review . take it from a real down to earth person this place is worth the long line wait. worth every 7$ for my burrito offtop!!

brst quality ! period.
author: Mrs.Real H.

description:
I've eaten at Pancho Villa's over a hundred times, and have always had the same consistently good experience, always excellent service and delicious food.
I like being able to see the beef being cooked before my eyes, it adds to the experience!
No complaints about the price.
Money well spent.
author: Ernie A.

description: Fantastic food, cheap and fast, huge portions. Atmosphere wasn't great, sort of like sitting in a cafeteria and super crowded, but it was fun to people watch. Definitely worth a visit
author: Anon Y.

description:
After suffering the mediocrity of the overrated Alcatraz tour, my ravenous tourist appetite demanded more burritos.  At the recommendations of some locals I had inquired from, Pancho Villa was tossed out there, in response to the inquiry "where can I get some ridiculous, baby-sized burritos from?"

Pancho Villa is conveniently located within a easy brisk walk off of the Market/16th BART stop, and even a tourist like myself was able to find it with ease, and not look so much like an obvious tourist doing such.  Upon arrival during a weekday lunch period, PV apparently has its own security guard up front who doubles as a polite and courteous doorman to hold the door open for guests.

The interior was bright and festive, and whether he worked at the restaurant, or just wandered around the Mission, singing wherever allows him to do such, there was a guy with a guitar trying to croon some Latin tunes.  Ordering is fairly simple, I ordered the biggest burrito I could think of, with steak in it.  Add the horchata, and lunch was  hair over $10 for me.

Servers bring the food to you, and my first impression upon seeing my burrito was that it looked too, well, neat.  It was like a perfect tubular shape, and looked perfectly parallel.  And it wasn't as large as I thought it was going to be; my first burrito in the Bay was from La Tapatia in SSF, and it was a big messy delicious monster.  Pancho Villa's burrito, wrapped in its wrinkle-free foil almost looked like a slice of a pipe.

Regardless, burritos are burritos, and I tore into it and began eating.  The flavors were definitely good, and you could tell the ingredients were fairly fresh.  I killed the rest of the burrito in less time than I thought it would take; whether I was just hungry, or it wasn't as large as I thought it would be is really unmemorable.  The chips were nothing special at all, and I opted to not waste any space in the stomach for future tourist eating.

It's a convenient location, easily accessible by BART, the staff was friendly, and the service was good.  The food itself was good, but I think it was built up to be more than what I had experienced myself.  With about 3-4 other taquerias within a 2-3 block radius from Pancho Villa, it's hard to say that I would go back so soon, if I ever go back out there again, but for what it's worth, it was a positive experience, and a solid business to get some good food from.
author: Danny H.

description:
Excellent cheap food! The beef tacos are the best. Pair it up with their award-winning salsas and you get a cheap, fast, and filling dinner. And Mexican food is not even my favorite.

They must have about 5-6 different types of salsas, but the green spicy one is my favorite.  I even saw this guy pack up 10 to-go containers worth. 

If you have a sweet tooth, then order the flan.  It's not made at the restaurant, but ordered from somewhere that the cashier lady doesn't even know. I wonder if where this secret flan hiding place is? Hmmm...Regardless, it was still good.
author: Moua L.

description: The carne asana burrito was a little disappointing, kind of tasted like taco meat. The burritos are huge though, and you get free chips and salsa. They have about 6 different types of salsa, and they're all bomb. I would come back, super drunk.
author: Adam T.

description: I discovered this place by using Yelp. I had the super burrito and used the coupon, absolutely delicious and I had enough left over for lunch the next day. The salsa bar is amazing and I loved that there was cilantro!  I would like the salsas to be labeled as it is rather a guessing game. I brought my Mom and 2 sisters here yesterday to celebrate our January birthdays and we were all happy .  our dinners. They had the #2 and I had the #1 which is Chile relleno ,flautist and enchilada , salad and beans and rice. The chili Rihanna was fantastic. I would like the flauta to be separated from the rest so it didn't get soggy. The garlic prawns were supreme as was the guacamole! We will definitely be back! Great value also very clean. What a great find!
author: Kelly P.

description: This place blew my mind. Chicken burrito was a lot of food and amazingly delicious-- it was gone within moments. Staff were super fun even though they were hugely busy. Great experience.
author: Brian C.

description:
Before my negative review, let me say that the staff are courteous and do their best.

Pancho Villa is really overrated, and it's annoying to think that anyone uses this as an example of food quality in the Mission.  All the other reviewers are right who say it was great before, but the quality dropped years ago.

I think the proximity to BART is getting this place positive reviews that it just doesn't deserve -- neither on quality, ambience, or service (they have easily enough staff to roll your burrito off the line around the time you're ready to pay, like so many other counter-style taquerias, but instead they give you a number and your food takes five minutes longer for no apparent reason other than backup that exists only because they made the poor decision to use a number system).

Walk 3 blocks to better goods and you'll be glad you did.

Let me explain what I really mean just so you don't think I'm being negative for no reason. Pancho Villa puts all the right things in their burritos, it all looks good behind the counter, but when you get down to eating, their cooking just isn't that good after all. If Mission burrito and taco reviews were actually well balanced and not thrown off by BART locations and other factors, Pancho Villa would get two stars. The food is not "bad", it's just not worth money either.  You get a full stomach but wish there had been more taste in the experience.
author: Eric O.

description:
The boyfriend had a carne asada and chicken plate. I'm not usually a fan of such a simple plate, but he gave me a taste and I must say both meats were cooked perfectly. His plate began to be more appealing than mine!

I got the dinner combo #1 (enchilada, flauta, & chile relleno). I had no complaints about any of it! The only problem being that they really packed the food on and I couldn't finish it all! Is that a problem though? I definitely got two plates out it. 

There is a happy hour mon-fri 3-5pm, which includes $1.50 tacos and $3.00 beers. We will definitely be back! 

Oh..and they get a complete 5 stars because they have $1.50 churros! That was the icing on the cake for me.
author: Christal M.

description:
SOO good and quick.  Very large portions and coming from SoCal, the food is very comparable.  I ordered the super burrito with carnitas and chicken with all the works, so good and tender meat and nicely seasoned!  We also ordered nachos, can't go wrong with that either.  You know this is the spot when there was a line of at least 10 people continuously and we were there for at least an hour!  

Parking is a pain though, so beware!
author: Kristina G.

description: We got some super burritos delivered to us today through Postmates. It was my first time trying out their food. I ordered the super Burrito w/Carne Asada and refried beans. And damn.. OwO ..it was sooo goooooood!!!!! I love that their super burritos are the perfect size and that they added lettuce to it. Everything about it was on point!  We also got some chips and some red salsa sauce. The red salsa sauce was hella good!! It was really fresh!  I definately want to try this place again!
author: Carmina D.

description: I have been coming to this place for more than 15 years. This is a no frills assembly line operation that serves basic taco/burrito fare. There is nothing gourmet or deconstructed here. The wait for your food can be long but worth it if you're starving.
author: Mario E.

description: Excellent food for excellent price. It's always busy no matter what time or day of the week you go which attests to the quality of food this place offers. I also love that they have SO many vegetarian options. The salsa bar is the best, and the one that sets the bar that other taquerias must live up to (and none other do).
author: Hiral H.

description:
So I was there a couple of weeks ago on a vacation trip to San Francisco. A friend of mine back in LA recommended me this place since she is often around town. So a couple of friends and myself went to this place in the Mission. I have to say that their customer service is great, their system of ordering is efficient, and everyone is happy. I so heard that this place don't use preservatives or anything, so this was one of the reasons that I had to try this place out.

Out of all the places I have been in the Mission, this seemed to top it off. I have to say that their Carne Asada was BOMB!! It was delicious, and their salsa is great. After all, you can clearly see all the awards they have got at the California State Fair. My friends had the same impression when they ate their tacos and tortas. Overall, our visit here was fabolous, and at reasonable prices. I truly believe this place is worthwhile while on vacation, or whether you are a local in the City by the Bay, this is one of the truly best in the area.
author: Ismael M.

description:
Hands down, my favorite taqueria.  The meats are delicious.  My favorites items are the baby burrito, chicken & prawn salad, and watermelon agua fresca.  

One issue with to go orders, this is the second time my husband ordered an $11 super burrito that was missing the salsa, guacamole, and sour cream.  It was more like a $6 dry burrito.
author: Sonia K.

description:
fyi! veggie burritos are not vegetarian! 
hot and spicy prawns - amazing! they have the shell on but you can eat it!
grilled veggies burrito h - delicious but misleading - rice has chicken stock - not vegetarian!
i love the salsa bar
amazing food but gotta dock 2 stars cuz im not getting laid for weeks if my girlfriend finds out she had chicken stock
how is that shit vegetarian if its made out of chicken

edit: got home and receipt and phone order were FLOUR tortillas, but i see CORN tortillas which i HATE in the bag. fuck.
author: Matt N.

description: Can't go wrong with their burritos, tacos and nachos. I get vegetarian and all of their veggies are fresh and delish!! My fave is to do a super burrito or super taco with whole black beans and mild salsa. Super friendly staff and low prices. Can't beat it!!
author: Mac C.

description:
I ordered the fish taco and my friend ordered the salmon taco.. BOTH of which we scarfed down within a span of 5 mins. They were SOOO gooood. Not sure if it was because we were both super hungry.. but it was just sooo delish. Probs one of the best fish tacos I've ever had.

Downfall though is that I had to wait like 15 ish mins for the food which is usually long for a taqueria but it's okay.. the wait was worth it!
author: Krystal O.

description:
Love me some Pancho! One of my classic go-to's. When you're not in the mood to be experimental, and you want a solid, bad-ass burrito look no further.
Get rid of the florescent lights, and make the decor as interesting as your food for a 5 STAR experience.
author: Mo R.

description:
I ordered a baby burrito thinking it would be half the size of a regular burrito, but it came out to be almost the same size as a regular burrito! 

The salsa bar has more varieties of salsa than any other place I have ever seen. 

No need to get back in line for drinks and desserts. Mexican cookie was pretty good.
author: Grace T.

description:
Spacious and clean compare to most taquerias in the Mission. The line moves fast since they got like 10 workers behind the counter.

- My favorite is the pollo asada plate. It comes with crispy flavorful chicken, rice, tasty guacamole. 

- The spicy shrimp plate is good, but I don't love the chili sauce so much, it has a fake taste to it. So maybe I'll order this dish sans "spicy" in the future.

This place is definitely my favorite taqueria in the Mission!
author: Novalina N.

description: Got an amazing veggie burrito here at 11pm on a random Monday night but that's what makes the mission and its remarkably easy quality burritos such a hot ticket. We cruised here after exiting th 16th and mission Bart! Plenty of protein options like red meat, poultry, fish and vegetarian!! Don't knock the veggie options, in SF in general but here they did not disappoint. Fajitas and chick b tacos Are good we have a few of those to go once we left. Ample room to sit and eat and still easy enough to get food to go if in a rush! Would love to see them add Cajun to the fish and then we can try new things from their menu
author: John R.

description: Your food is good and the price is right. However your delivery drivers never want to actually bring the food to my door.  Very annoying.
author: Ryan W.

description: This is my go-to taqueria, sober and drunk. Granted, it's down the street from my house, but it's great. I typically order the carne asada super baby burrito, because it is still fairly large but I don't kill myself with a food baby. It's also like $7 for the most filling meal ever + chips forever. The meat here is delicious and not crappy quality, and the veggies inside are fresh. Check out the salsa bar to munch on while you wait for your food - it can get pretty busy here!
author: Lauren G.

description: Larger establishment right in the heart of burrito district. High ceilings, sumptuous aroma and atmosphere. Consistently fresh and well-seasoned. Easy and quick for takeout but eating there is awesome, especially in the evening when there's often great, live mariachi adding to the ambiance.
author: Tyler L.

description:
Every.  Single.  Time.  Every time I'm within driving distance of SF, I have to beg, plead, and bargain with my friends to come here.

Sure, Oxnard is within driving distance.  So is LA, right?  Right, guys?

Seriously though, whenever I eat a burrito ANYWHERE, I compare it to these.  It doesn't hurt that they have beer, and it definitely helps that their salsa has won awards numerous years, but that's not why I go there.  STEAK AND SHRIMP BURRITO.

Now I'm getting all teary-eyed, because I'm currently 2,876 miles away...   I can't convince anyone that its within driving distance.

Also, the pupusa lady who randomly sets up a few doors down is pretty badass.  If you're drunk, you can probably stomach a pupusa AND a burrito, but that's some god-tier gluttony that should be reserved for special occasions.
author: Brett D.

description: This was an excellent recommendation for authentic Mexican food. Cooked to order. Located in The Mission district. Known for their salsa bar and it did not disappoint. We loved all the salsa choices as they offer an extensive selection. Well priced.
author: Anna Maria M.

description:
The two stars is for my recent takeout orders. Not sure if it's due to them being somewhat busy - not exceptionally busy. Came in on a Friday evening- again not that busy. Got home & they forgot to put in a dish that was ordered. What a pain! Didn't bother to go back after driving all the way home! Stopped in again on a Sunday - not busy, but there were large orders in front of mine. After waiting over 20 minutes & then hearing all these numbers being called after my number (the large orders before mine were even called!). After calling a number well after mine the worker saw the lock on my face & asked for my number. Well....after telling him he checked & sure enough they forgot to make the food!!! Wow!!!!

Don't will be back for awhile. Always check your order before leaving & check to be sure they didn't forget to make your order!
author: Suzi P.

description: I wasn't overly impressed with the steak burrito. It wasn't rolled very well so there were sections of only avocado and sections of only sour cream. Definitely better places in the are!
author: Jessica P.

description: Reportedly one of the best taqueritas in the Mission area by my local friend, and by the throngs of people waiting in line and dining, this is a favorite hot spot. I ordered the prawn super burrito. The rice was a type of spanish rice, and was underwhelming - I would skip it next time. The prawns were plentiful and not overcooked. The burrito overall was HUGE enough for 2 meals for some. The salsa bar was outstanding, with many options of flavors and levels of heat to suit everyone's tastes. I went in after 1 pm and it was packed, but the line moved quickly. I also had the horchata, it was not the best I've had - it was grainy.
author: Carole R.

description: Huge portions and best guacamole ever. Would've rated higher but big mistake on to-go order and didn't realize until home. Otherwise very good. Beware it's crowded but that's a good sign.
author: crystal s.

description: This spot has delicious burritos and the food is pretty consistent.  This place is always busy and the service can be slow at times. If you're in a rush, it's better to order online.  Overall, it is one of the best spots to get a burrito in SF.
author: Dee S.

description:
You'd be hard pressed to find as many vegetarian options at a taco shop that doesn't include the words "Gracias" or "Madre" anywhere around town. Which means -- when it comes to actual Mission-style taquerias (and not intentional vegan replications of Latin American fare), it doesn't get much better than this.
