I wish they would work on the salsa selection though, I'm not sure who was giving out the awards for their salsas, but apparently we don't agree on what constitutes good.
author: Justin R.

description:
Pancho Villa is one of those places that I believe you have to go to to really claim SF as your city. It's a staple and must be visited: sober or completely obliterated or somewhere in between. I keep coming back for two reasons. 

1. Continuity: I always know my burrito will be packed and tasty, add guacamole, por favor
2. Efficiency: As packed as this place always is, they know how to get it done as you asked in a few seconds time, gracias mis amigas

It's also probably one of the best places to people-watch after 11pm on any given night.
author: Meredith R.

description:
Get the three taco combo.  Two green pork and one chicken.  Go to the salsa bar and pile on the chopped onions, cilantro, and lots of fresh lime juice.  That's it.  Enjoy.  

-1 star for the parking and access.
author: Ellie C.

description: Gotta say this place has decent food, but the service was painful.  25 minutes for 2 burritos.  Granted it was a busy Saturday, but their priority was clearly on fulfilling a bunch of phone and Internet orders, not the orders of the masses waiting in line and milling about waiting for their food to be delivered.  Staff not polite.  Plenty of other great choices in the area ... not going back :-(.
author: Peter C.

description:
Rating it a litte over a 3.

Srry, I'm new to the taqueria's since I'm only a visitor however; did enjoy my late night post celebratory meal here.  A little intimidating at first since it looks like a Mexican dining hall but food was decent.  A little sketchy/ghetto yet a smile from me.
Tacos were super filled with meats and devoured them all within 2 seconds...

Im ready to hit up other taco trucks in the SF area.... bring it.
author: Jeong K.

description: There was a wait and It wasn't worth it. I've experienced better a lot better. even better in SF which is saying something. Right across the street they have marginally better burritos not by much but they are better.  The place was clean. Thats something right?  No need to worry about getting your elbows moist with spilled sauce. They actually make you pay extra money for cheese in the burrito.. Only In San Francisco.. I swear to Christ.
author: Vinny T.

description:
3-5pm happy hour= $1 tacos!

I usually get one of each: asada, carnitas, prawn, fish, & chicken
author: Nate S.

description:
Ok, let's just start off with the fact that my car was vandalized on Sunday and I went over to my best friends house and whined to her about it. She felt really sorry for me and keep in mind she was very hungover. She peered into my eyes and said those magical five words that make me melt everytime..."Let's go to Pancho Villa!" 

I slow-motioned high-fived her and we skipped to my car (three feet away) and headed over to our FAVORITE Mexican joint. 

You can smell the yummy steak from outside and there's always a Mariachi band playing some fabulous traditional Mexican music. So I turn to my buddy and she's like "what are you gettin'?" I learned early on from my girl who lived in the neighborhood that you always get the steak quesadillas...and that's what I ordered. My buddy ordered the chicken quesadillas. The Mild Salsa is soooooo amazing!!! It cures what ails you every time. You have to get whatever you order in a to-go box, because it's too much for one sitting...YAY leftovers!!!!! 

Let's talk about how awesome their to-go containers are....so nice and you can re-use them :) SCORE!!!! 

So let's re-cap.....Awesome food (the best in the city, hands down) + leftovers that rock + amazing salsa + fabulous to-go reusable containers....how can you go wrong. 

I must also talk about the staff...they are on their game...everyone is friendly, helpful, and good at their job and they appreciate working...you can tell. :) 

So basically my Sunday went from awful to awesome in about 5 min. :) 

Thanks to my friend for taking me here and to Pancho Villa for hookin' up the goods!!!! :) SLURP!!!!
author: Tina C.

description: Best Mexican food I've had in Northern California. It is super fresh and flavorful. They have the most amazing salsa bar and they have cheap beers for happy hour. What more could you want?
author: Zohreh A.

description: The folks at Pancho Villa know how to make a taco and delicious salsas. I've eaten here a ton (sober and post a night on the town) and I think Pancho Villa is the best Mexican place in the Mission. Tons of tasty options, great happy hour from 3-5, nice fresh tortillas, tender meats.. I'm a fan!
author: Danielle F.

description: My goodness, I died and went to taco heaven. First off our timing couldn't have been more perfect, we got there just as Happy Hour started!! $1 Tacos!! $2 beers! What an awesome way to take a break from walking around the Castro/Mission area. I was feeling greedy so I also bough an agua fresca and a chicken tamale. OH MY GOODNESS. Can you say a-freaking-mazing?!?! The tacos were super authentic and super delish. Don't even get me started on that tamale...to this day I have dreams about that tamale. Damn...prolly the best tamale I ever had and it was only $3!!! They also have a salsa bar which is a great addition to your dishes. Next time I go back to San Fran, I'll be headed straight here first.
author: Maria G.

description:
It's Pancho Villa, and it's still the best taqueria.

I only get a carnitas super burrito, no rice. Muy delicioso!!!
author: Joshua C.

description: Everyone raves about this place but as a vegetarian, I'm not impressed. The flavor of the beans and rice isn't exciting at all. Since that's about all I eat, it's either good or bad and for me this place just isn't for me.
author: Lisi G.

description:
Sunday Streets on Valencia meant it was going to be a Mexican food kind of day.  I've frequented Pancho Villa several times and so had my boyfriend so we felt comfortable knowing what we were going to get.  I got two fish tacos and he got the shrimp burrito.  I thought my tacos were good although my boyfriend was unimpressed.  It was neat how they wrapped the tacos up so it was almost like eating a mini burrito.  My bf got the shrimp burrito with refried beans, which he never does so it was a "treat" for him.  I though it was just a carb fest with the beans, rice and just not enough shrimp in the burrito.  I do like their salsa bar but the measly amount of chips they give you doesn't allow you to fully enjoy it.

The security guard is nice and will open the door for you and will also clear the table after you eat.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Perhaps I was expecting too much, but I wasn't impressed. 

I got the Al Pastor burrito and it left a lot to be desired. The rice was bland. The lettuce was cheap. The meat was forgettable.
author: Dave F.

description: I am homesick for a Pancho Villa Super Burrito!   Simply the best burrito in SF.
author: Badger C.

description: This is a solid taqueria with great food -- I especially love the surf and turf plate -- and great atmosphere. The salsa bar is diverse, the servers are efficient and friendly, and it's located in a great part of the Mission.
author: Candi W.

description:
As of March,I went there the first time, the line was so long, that I can go to Mexico and come back and get my over-priced & least satisfied burrito. I don't see the hype about this place. 
I went there the second-time got into a fight and was arrested by the SFPD. It could've been Fajita-Gate2.They tell me not to comeback. That is fine by me!!! The burrito was not all that with the phoney awards posted inside. 
A false advertisement
author: Matt G.

description:
Our friend was bringing back my guy's laptop after cleaning it & we wanted to treat him to lunch.  Well lunch turned into lu'nner since our friend didn't end up showing up until after 3pm (he said noon).

My guy & I had been here before for a date but we haven't returned since we heard about stray bullets flying around in the immediate area.  I got a regular El Pastor burrito.  The pork was cut up kind of small but they still had good flavor.  Even though it looked really skinny, it was super filling.  I also got a small Horchata which had good flavor but it was too sweet & warm for some reason.

Each meal came with complimentary chips that were crispy & corny.  I sprinkled salt & squeezed lime juice on them so they tasted like Tostitos Hint of Lime; which I love.

My food/drink plus my guy's food/drink came out to $21 which is pretty expensive compared to other places like El Farolito (read my review).  Also, I ended up fainting & needing to go to the ER 20 minutes later.  Coincidence?
author: Karen S.

description:
I thought i tried good Mexican food until i visit this place! wow!

10 people standing behind order desk and preparing this excellent food, don't forget to try their "Aqua Mexico" and Horchata-its to die for

Try the Shrimp taco
author: Patrik D.

description:
I've rekindled my love affair with Pancho Villa's since they were featured on Groupon. I bought more than I care to admit here. 

Fun fact: My 92 year-old grandpa told me that the REAL Pancho Villa used to come to all the bars in Jalisco and buy everyone drinks. My grandpa was just a boy at the time, but my great grandpa would bring him along when he went boozing. Now that's what I call responsible parenting!

But what you REALLY care about is the food, so here goes. I've had almost everything on the menu over the years:

- Fish tacos are surprisingly good. The batter is crisp and well seasoned. They top it with shredded cabbage and their house salsa.
- They have an awesome deal for tacos: 3 tacos for $6. You must pick three of the same taco, but no matter what meat you choose you can't go wrong
- The enchiladas aren't great. That's because real enchiladas take a long time to make, so they cut corners here.
- Their Camarones al Diablo platter is hot as a MOFO 
- They have every kind of agua fresca known to man: horchata (cinnamon rice), agua de jamaica (hibiscus), melon, strawberry, pineapple - you name it. 
-  Their churros are good. They have regular 12-inch churros and 6-inch churros filled with custard. Get both! Go nuts!
- Sometimes guitar players come in and perform. I don't think they're hired by Pancho Villa,  though. They just come in off the street.
- Lines can get long in the evenings, but you can usually nab a seat without waiting.


Bottom line: Don't take your kids to bars. But DO take them, and the whole family, to Pancho Villa for delicious Mexican food!
author: Mariela D.

description:
From their menu: "No MSG.  No lard.  No preservatives.  No Bull."

Open until midnight, every night (5 stars right there).  I found myself here late on a Sunday night, on my way to Mitchell's Ice Cream... wait, huh!?!  OK, I got a little sidetracked on the way to Mitchell's, but every once in a while, I just CRAVE to be in the Mission, at the original Pancho Villa where the security guard doubles as the doorman and vibrant local artwork hangs crooked on the walls.

I LOOOOVE Pancho Villa.
author: Olma M.

description: Both times I have been to San Francisco I went to this busy little taqueria. The food was really good both times, and it is dirt cheap!
author: Stephanie S.

description: I love the concept of cooking it right in front of me. I got the chicken burrito and give it a B. The best thing about this place is the salsa bar! The fact that you have a full line up is AWESOME. I added the cilantro and onion with some hot sauce and I was good to go. A+ on timing and price.
author: Jess C.

description:
Hands down the best Mexican food I've had outside of San Diego/Baja California.  When you grow up three miles from Tijuana eating Mexican food once sometimes twice a day you can become a picky bitch about your Mexican food.  And since Seattle has shitty Mexican food I've learned to stop bitchy and just swallow the mediocre Mexican that we have.  So when I walked in to Pancho Villa I was hoping for good but expecting mediocre and I have to say I was more than pleasantly surprised.  

I decided on one prawn taco, one pollo asado taco with a side of rice and beans.  They kept telling me that wasn't a 'plate' and I had to get a 'plate' I told them I didn't care what it was, that that was what I wanted, make it and charge me what ever so they did.  I win!

Their salsa bar was great, very fresh and clean and constantly refilled.  The chips were goooood, fresh and salty and yummy.  My food was well magic in my mouth unfortunately it disappeared too quickly for me and I was left with no more tacos when I wanted more.  The prawn taco was my favorite of the two but the rice and beans were a great co-star to them.  I left wanting to go back everyday of my trip unfortunately I never made it back *sad face* but I'll be in San Diego in a few weeks so I'll get my fix once again.
author: Me H.

description:
This place is friggin huge!! Maybe it's the reason they charge so much... or maybe it's because they can get away with it with their *awesome* food. 

Now, I have to admit that I wasn't exactly sober when I came in to this place. I got the recommendation from a friend of a friend while lounging at Zeitgeist, and we decided to take the recommendation and do something about it. 

We were greeted with friendly people, who despite our less than clear instructions and their less than perfect English, managed to get us our burritos *exactly* how we wanted them.

Yeah, it was $23 for 2 meat burritos and one veggie burrito, but that's OK - this place rocks. Also, I have NEVER seen so many different types of salsa available - holy crap!
author: Andrew L.

description: this was the tightest burrito i have ever had and definitely the best one too. salsa bar is a key component. the meat smells for miles. im gonna make sure every burrito I have for the rest of my life is wrapped as well as this one was. keep it tight, pancho!
author: Becca W.

description: Shrimp burrito is my fav.  One of the main reasons I come here is the salsa bar!  Great variety and all you can eat.  Love hot salsa!
author: Cyprian S.

description:
(To the tune of "Farewell Angelina")

Farewell old La Cumbre
the taste of the crowds
have been stolen by Pancho's
I must follow them down -
The chorizo it sizzles
while the salsa heats slow
Farewell dear La Cumbre
after 25 years, 
to Pancho's I must go.
author: Marie K.

description:
So i accidently stumbled into this place because I was too hungry to care what I was eating. I didn't expect much, I saw a huge assembly line of workers grilling, cooking, scooping salsa--i thought it was the perfect place to grab a quick bite. 

I ordered the 3 tacos (chicken and carne asada). It was surprisingly really good. The chicken was really favorful and they really give you a heathy portion. When i tried to bite into my taco, it was so full everything toppled over :( 

But i think their salsa section is amazing, lots to choose from. I suggest the light green one and the orange one...

I am definitely going back.
author: Amy L.

description: Don't order take out. Fajitas, are not fajitas. They are a build your own burrito (ie, one flour tortilla comes, instead of several). Their salsa is not a traditional salsa that one would think of to dip chips in, it is chopped tomato and onion only. They cannot follow instructions (adding or subtracting something).
author: Meg M.

description: I really like their regular grilled chicken burrito and salsa bar... great flavors plus free chips.  It's a good Mexican restaurant in the area.  It's a little pricey for a Taqueria but clean and spacious.  My go-to spot in the area for Mexican food.
author: Angelique B.

description:
Not the best but I like their wide selection and quick, friendly service. Plus, what other taqueria actually has a security guard who doubles as a door opener?

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
I get more and more annoyed with their computer-oriented ordering system each time I go there.  It has been a few months since they implemented and everything is always so bottlenecked.

No longer can I just drop by for a *quick* delicious burrito on the way home from BART :(.
author: Chad P.

description: At first the portion you get seems small, but then as I started to chow down I realized how full of flavor my super nachos were. The horchatas were really good. The salaa bar was pretty amazing! It was a wonderful dining experience and I'll definitely be back.
author: Marilyn D.

description:
WARNING:  THE HOT SALSA IS REALLY HOT . . . AND BURNS TWICE

This is the real authentic burrito joint in the City.  The steak burrito is outstanding and I'm always impressed at the grilling and chopping that goes on by the cooks.  It's a treat to chomp on the burritos but I do need a knife and fork (sorry) to enjoy it.  Sink your teeth into one and it is tasty, juicy and all the ingredients come together.  

I do enjoy the chips and the varieties of salsa . . . had the HOT only once . . . it's REALLY HOT and BURNS TWICE!  That said, I go for the regular salsa which is truly fresh.  The taco deal sounds intriguing so I'll try that soon.

Having a groupon helps stretch the dollar.  Thanks PV.
author: Stefan L.

description:
I had the super nachos and the enchilada plate both with Bohemia beers   Both looked amazing.  

The salsas were hands down some of the best I have ever tasted.  You can see the awards on the wall from their salsa competitions.

The food was great, but they could kick it up one more notch and be the best.  One more notch is all that is needed.  One more flavor notch, maybe completed with adding some salsa to the dishes.

I think they need bigger salsa cups, but with salsa that good I can understand that they want to limit how much goes out the door or in the trash.  

For enchiladas I have had better sauce.  I think the key is to make the sauce authentic, simple, and rustic.  Like a basic sauce made from dried peppers.  I have had better enchilada sauce at other places.  Your enchilada sauce needs to be incredible.

The dining room is cool and large.  You feel like you are in Mexico in a way.  Great experience.  There was a guy singing and playing guitar there.

This place knows what they are doing.   Keep it up and keep innovating.  This place has a lot of untapped potential.  Keep up the good work!

Joseph
author: Joseph M.

description:
My uncle is a SF native and this is his favorite taqueria in all of SF.  Now I think he is a bit carried away, sure it's a good spot, but #1, I don't know.

Lots of options here.  What kinds of beans, what kind of tortilla, 700 kinds of meat to choose from.  LOL

Pancho Villa is mid-priced and I would say it's a fair deal.
Here is my receipt from 12/19/2007
Mushroom Quesadilla $4.95
LRG Agua Fresca $2.35
Subtotal $7.30
Tax $.62.
TOTAL $7.92
They gave me some chips and they have a salsa bar.  I was full.

One time across the street from Pancho Villa I saw a heroin addict holding onto a parking meter for dear life.  It looked like he was surfing.  His eyes were shut and he was mumbling very quietly and holding onto the meter with both hands to keep from falling over.  Holy cow this guy was high, I wonder how it feels to be that messed up?  

So I went over to Valencia St., looked at a couple stores and then ate a leisurely meal at Pancho Villa.  Came back to the car and the heroin addict is still holding onto the parking meter.  Holy cow, this guy is tore up, how is he even standing.

Keep your yummy tacos and burritos, I would rather go somewhere where I feel safer.  If a taqueria needs a security guard, that's usually because stuff has gone down there in the past.  If I end up at Pancho Villa these days it's because I am drunk and I am with someone who wants to go there.  There is a lot of good food in this area, but I really don't feel safe there.  

One good thing about Pancho Villa is that they are open very late...so that's cool.  It would be better if they were open 24/7, but what taqueria is besides Taco Bell?  I just called Taco Bell a taqueria, lol.
author: Cynthia B.

description: A damn good burrito that this place serves. I'm definitely going to come back here when I need a good burrito. It's one of the best spots in the mission for sure, and it's relatively cheap too! You'll get your money's worth for what you get; I got a regular sized carne asada burrito with a drink for under 8 dollars and that's all you need really. I was satisfied at how fast I got my food too, I didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes. It's worth checking out, oh and by the way they have churros!! I didn't get one but next time i'm making sure I get one.
author: Henry C.

description:
This used to be my go-to taqueria. I spent many a night in the late eighties eating here.

My taste has changed along with my patience for overpriced mediocre Mexican food. A super burrito for $8.50? You can kiss my ass!
author: Manny F.

description:
Two little words: SALSA BAR!!!! (so many choices, your head will spin)
Pancho Villa has insanely delicious and fresh burritos, tacos, nachos, etc. If you can manage to get there on a weekday from 3-5, you can hit HAPPY HOUR!!! $1 tacos can take you a looong way and gives you the chance to try a bunch of their delicious, award-winning salsas. I've had the chance to try a different selection of their meats than I would have normally done with the $1 tacos and have discovered I am a fan of chile verde pork!! Yay for new favorites!!!

Side note: This Pancho Villa's agua fresca are so worth it!! The San Mateo location was more watery tasting and less robust in flavor.
author: Rayna L.

description: Yummmmmmiest burrito in San Francisco.  Excellent quesadilla's too. Worth every penny.  Best freshly made salsa selection I have ever seen.  There are, like 10 different salsa's available buffet style. Pickled carrots and jalepeno's too.  All of it is really delicious, but my favorite is the light orange, almost creamy looking hot salsa.  Tortilla chips are sturdy, oily and thin... and you can taste the bit of lime in them. I have been eating here for about 15 years... always consistent, always great, fast service no matter how intimidating the line looks.  Incredibly efficient staff. Also fun and festive to be there when the mariachi band make their rounds through the tables. I almost always order the grilled chicken super burrito... but I have had the burrito with shrimp, and that was just as glorious as the chicken. Really one of the best places for food in SF.
author: Amphianda B.

description:
Been going to this place since the area's pre-hipster days and its always a solid choice (although avoiding prime mariachi hours is highly recommended). Extensive menu, extensive selection of Agua Fresca (watermelon is tops), free salsa bar, free chips - an all around satisfactory experience! 

Downsides - phone orders are a bit unreliable, the times there isn't seating, the unquenchable thirst that accompanies a meal here caused by all the delicious sodium...mmmmmm. 

Upsides - Taco happy hour where tacos are $1.50! Meticulously clean, convenient location/hours, Agua Fresca, relatively fast, consistently delicious.
author: Jody D.

description:
This place used to be better. At one time they used to have more selections of rice and their meat were marinated with a thicker cut. I went back for the first time in years and was pleasantly surprised and slightly disappointed at the same time. I thought it was real cool that they now serve tofu as a substitute for meat, and that their menu is now bolstered with a strong seafood selection: salmon, shrimp, fish, etc. Their salsa bar has improved, fresca is always outstanding and a must, and the churro was a nice finisher--yeah, I ate a lot.

I'm usually very happy with their burritos but opted something different this time. The meat on my tacos (lengua, pastor, and spicy chicken) were not as tender and tasty as before. Now that I have to pay more, I'm also critical of their salsa which could use more fresh chunky onions in order to compete with the trucks. My friend from the Richmond District liked his carnitas burrito.

These slight disappointments aside, it was an overall positive experience. The place is busy and festive so we were thoroughly entertained. The guy with the guitar is still there chillin' singing about Guadalajara, and a security guard is still on the premise to open the door for you. Without their delicious white rice with peas and carrots I'm not sure if I'll go back to their burritos. I might check out the seafood dishes next so I can get another perspective on the place. 

One star off for getting rid of my favorite rice and having unremarkable lengua.
author: Daniel L.

description: The $10 burrito was ok at best. It tasted soggy. I Tried to ask for more chips and was ignored. Asked another person and she ignored me as well. Asked another person and she basically said no. A Mexico guy asked for chips right after me and she gave him a huge bag. Kind of lame. Terribly service
author: David K.

description:
Okay, let's just put everything out on the table and be honest. I was only here because my favorite Mexican restaurant was still closed for vacation when I really needed my taco fix. So as a suggestion from friends, we ended up here at Pancho Villa. The $7 taco plate was good price for the amount of food you got, but it's just disappointment after disappointment as I tackled through my tacos. Here's why:

1. Carnitas taco: pork was way too dry and flavorless, I basically had to dump salsa on it to not choke on the meat.

2. Steak fajitas taco: was it just me or this tasted more like steak veggie stir fry with "ketchup"???? It's so weird and in no way was it Mexican to me!

3. Green chili pork: I actually tried this from my friend's torta (by the way it looked nothing like a torta but more like a submarine sandwich), It's the same tasteless pork with some spices from the green chili, blah

But I do give them props for having a pretty amazing salsa bar.

Eating these tacos made me miss my favorite Mexican restaurant even more (hint: amazing carnitas tacos, juicy and exploding with flavor). I guess this is a place for okay food if you're really empty in the tummy and in the wallet. Otherwise, there are other better places out there.
author: Joyce C.

description: Deeelish. Tons of choices (including vegetarian options) and just all around good eatin.
author: Greg E.

description:
+ :The huge selection of dishes and meats with plenty of choices for sides also. There is a great salsa bar with some great tasting salsas. It's open late, takes credit card and has a large seating area.

- :The meat I've tried (carne asada, carnitas) were dry and had very little flavor. Steak fajita is drenched in ketchup. 

= : I used to come here when I first moved to SF and it seemed pretty decent, but after having been to La Taqueria, the meats at this place just doesn't measure up. Pancho Villa does have a wide variety of mediocre food that isn't bad, but can't be rated anything more than mediocre.

Another thing was that I got the torta here and i felt cheated. When i got it, i was already very skeptical since it was wrapped in foil and was shapped like a burrito. When i opened it, it looked like a vietnamese sandwich with mexican filling. WTH?! it was the equivalent of ordering ramen and getting angel hair noodles in your bowl. if you're going to serve tortas you have to have it in the torta bread and not some random french roll.
author: Jerry J.

description: My favorite taco in SF. Just by virtue of flavor, portion size, and the delicious sauces. I had carnitas and carne asada (super). I'll be back.
author: Adrian A.

description:
A lot of my friends don't like Pancho Villa because it's one of the most commercialized taquerias. 

Regardless, you can't beat their $1 tacos ($1.25 super veggie) between 3 and 5 pm when you're broke, and who isn't these days?

I've been coming here for more than a decade and it is reliable.
author: Jen A.

description: This is usually a busy restraunt Monday thru Sunday... I occasionally come here for the shrimp tacos. Shrimp tacos were so famous they made it on the SF paper once. And this is the only taqueria I kno who serve a chicken and shrimp salad. Although the location of the restraunt isn't in a very safe location and it is usually difficult to find parking. It doesn't seem to stop me from comming back to eat... Inside is spacious and clean. They keep a security guard at the door. Overall this restraunt is great I recommend this taqueria over el farolito.
author: Michael S.

description:
You know, if you are a starving student like myself, and you want some surf and turf, then look no further than Pancho Villa. This has been one of my favorite taquerias since my first real dude friend had taken me out   in 7th grade until I was a  freshman in highschool. We used to be regulars here just as it would be the norm to also make a trip up to "double rock," (for  those of you who know !!!!! )  Either way, I would have tore up whatever it was that I ordered from good ol' Pancho Villa. Needless to say, this place has been servicing my appetite for a good number of years, and if I'm in the mood to eat at a taqueria, then  guaranteed, this would be  one of the places to quench my craving. 

   My staple  at Pancho Villla is a regular steak and prawn quesadilla. G..................D........................................................!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!This can cure any hunger ailment possible. The beef, so juicy and good. The prawns, so fresh and tasty.  Paring with this bomb- ass food, is the  thirst-quenching frescas of your choice such as: watermenlon, cantalope, tamarindo, mango, orchata and others I can't remember at this time. But to top off even all of those choices for dessert, consider the alfajores. And if you don't know what those are, I suggest you to educate yourself on these cookies. And for the guys especially, if you have a girlfriend that likes good dessert, you may want to take advantage of this opportunity to surprise her with them. You might get lucky ;  )
author: Granolia G.

description:
Had a super burrito with refried black beans and carnitas. It was pretty excellent. Though I enjoyed the salsa bar, I agree with other reviewers that some labels would help. I also wish they'd eliminate the little plastic tubs -- you can hardly dip a chip into them, and they don't hold much at all.  After trying all the salsas, you're really accumulating a lot of plastic waste.

I wasn't overwhelmed with the flavor, but it was certainly better than what you'd get at a common chain like Chipotle or Taco Bell. The agua fresca didn't thrill me much either; I'll take a Coke Zero or Diet Coke any day with my pseudo-Mexican food, thanks.

One thing though...what's up with the seats? They are some of the most uncomfortable stools I've ever sat on. Mission accomplished; these will turn over tables in a hurry. I'd rather sit on the toilet and eat than on these things.
author: Tim Y.

description: So delicious, super burrito was the tits. Salsa was the tits. Coke in a bottle was the tits, and chips were the tits. Only criticism is that the super burrito was a little smaller than I would like for $8.50.
author: Brett R.

description: I actually kind of see this place as the yin to El Farolito's yang. Both places are probably equally good, but different styles, at least in terms of the burritos. Farolito's taste fried, hot and crispy. Whereas burritos at Pancho Villa are warm, gooey and fluffy, if that makes any sense.
author: Zach M.

description:
We were in the City 4 Thanksgiving then we went 2 my favorite Mexican Taqueria n
we had my my special burrito with grille Chicken n grille Carne Asada with Sour Cream,Rice n Guacamoli.
author: Jean - Marc D.

description:
I'll say it: the burritos are just okay.

I'll say this too: the burritos make me constipated.

I come here once every six to ten months because the line is always huge and everyone seems to love it so. And then I take a bite into my burrito and I'm like, Wait. I don't like this that much. It's barely warm. Where is my sour cream? Mmm, that bite of spicy al pastor was good but it does not make up for the fact that there are not enough beans in here.

Regret. I'll see you in six to ten months when I forget I had this feeling, Pancho.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
In SF for a long weekend, getting great Mexican food was a primary goal.  On the recommendation of a friend and native, we headed to Pancho Villa  after a few hours of wandering around the city.

This place did not disappoint.  It's a fast-food, counter-order, take your food to a table kind of way, but that should not be a deterrent in any way!  They have it down to a science since so many people want to eat the delicious burritos and tacos and everything else on the menu!

I went with the burrito especial with carnitas, and it was nothing short of amazing.  At about $8, it was very reasonably priced, and the portion was more than I could possibly eat (even though I really wanted to eat every last bite).  The enchiladas and the guac were awesome too.  I had some fresh mango juice to accompany my meal, and it totally hit the spot.  Beer is also available.

Even though the place was extremely busy, we only waited in line for about 15 minutes, and had no problem snagging a table when it was time to chow down.  Thanks Pancho Villa, for a memorable Mexican meal!
author: Eve C.

description: If this place burned down, I would physically help them rebuild so that I could order a burrito from them after they reopen.
author: Chad T.

description:
Much better than the one on the Embarcadero. This one has real Mexican food with really good Mexican cooks running it! My super tacos were superica. Although, I really could have done without the large taco grease stain on my longsleeved white shirt on the underside of my bicep. I have no idea how it got there while I was standing in line at the counter, but I ended up smelling like a juicy taco all night.

A little free scent/smell - advertising for Pancho Villa was perhaps their strategy?
author: Alita M.

description:
Absolutely stellar taquería. The food is intensely flavorful and makes you leave doing the happy burrito dance.

Highlights -
     The first thing you pass while waiting in line is the grill piled high with simmering marinated chicken. Take the hint. It is by far their superlative contribution to the Mission taquería scene.
     The rice, bean, and salsa (spicy or mild) filling in the burritos is some of the most tasty around.
     The salsa bar is stocked with a great variety of flavorful salsas. Their salsa verde packs more of a punch than usual (which I like), and I love the salsa de chile de árbol. The fresh limes, cilantro, and jalapeños are a nice touch.

(Relative) Cons- 
   The carne al pastor and the grilled shrimp, while very good, are not as wow-inducing as their equivalents at El Farolito.
    They close at midnight, frustrating many a late-night food craving.
author: Patrick Z.

description: I can't understand how this restaurant could have gotten a single positive review.  The steak torta that I ordered had such an incredibly awful odor it's difficult to imagine it wouldn't permeate the entire restaurant.  It smelled like a rotting horse carcass.  Truly inedible.
author: Lev B.

description:
I wound up here with my friends after failing to find the El Toyonase taco truck.(LAME!)
My friend who moved here 9 months ago recommended this place instead.

My first impression was wow, there's a lot of people here!
On second glance I noticed that most of the people eating didn't seem like the mission locals. No big deal, it's probably still good although maybe a little less authentic. It sort of reminded me of a bigger more local version of Chipotle.

I ordered a super steak burrito, loaded it with all the goodies and picked out  a few salsas including the neon green one.
I really liked the choices in the salsa bar, including the fire roasted jalepeno peppers. The chips also seemed less than authentic, but who cares since it's all just a salsa delivery device anyway.

My burrito was good and tasty, and big enough to fill me up after almost 9 hours of flying.
author: Jeff G.

description: My friend and I ordered the spicy shrimp and garlic shrimp plates last night. The food was bland and uninteresting. We both woke up with mild food poisoning. So no, never again.
author: Meryl K.

description:
Whether you think they have the best burritos in the city or not, you have to love the Pancho Villa bust hanging on the wall behind the register. José Doroteo Arango Arámbula would be proud.  

As for the those burritos. Good, just not legendary. Grilled salmon was not expensive nor a steal, good if slightly below the average Mission slab weight. Wheat tortillas are available, as are black beans.

If Pancho Villa came back from beyond for a visit, I'd probably recommend elsewhere, but he probably wouldn't be disappointed visiting his namesake. And he's love the wall art.
author: Jason B.

description:
I've been all over the mission, and this is right in the middle of the pack, It's not spectacular, and it's not horrid, so I put it dead center of the ratings.

We had their Super Burrito (Carnitas) and simply wanted to try out the place. One thing they had was the variety of Salsa, that is pretty cool. I really enjoyed "The Orange One" (that's what I call it), that salsa was good! I believe it's bellpepper, probably roasted, but I'll stick with "The Orange One"
author: Eric A.

description:
Still a go to standard when looking for something to soak up the drinks from the nearby bars. 

While we all have our favorite burrito spots -- I think we can all agree that Pancho Villa is our Starbucks and you know its not bad.

Heck at midnight its better than the French Laundry.
author: G R.

description:
I was not that impressed with this place esp. after going to La Taqueria.

I got the spicy chicken, al pastor, and carne asada tacos.  They were alright.  This place doesn't seem that authentic.  

And my guacamole was kind of watery.

Bleh.
author: Grace C.

description: Excellent, no complaints. Got the carne asada super burrito, and it may be the best I've had.
author: J D.

description: Loved the 2 quesadillas we tried. Fast service. Fun place to eat. AWESOME salsa bar!
author: Madeline S.

description:
This is based off two experiences at Pancho Villa  over the last two weeks.  One was a 3-star and one was a 0000000 star. 

Visit 1:  My first time was on a slow Sunday night.  There were two employees and about 5 customers.  But there was nowhere to sit because EVERY table had plates, food and garbage left over from previous customers.  No effort had been made to clean anything even though the restaurant was almost empty.  

I ordered the carne asada plate.  The meat was pretty tender, spiced well and not tough.  Enjoyable but the side dishes weren't anything special.

Visit 2:  Saturday night - post bar - 2:15 am.  I am totally aware that working the after-bar crowds suck, so I give a lot of leeway to restaurants when writing reviews for this time period.  

BUT, this experience was beyond poor, even for 2:15 am.  There were five of us in our group and all ordered very simple items, nachos and enchiladas.  

Even though we ordered at the same time, our food came out at different times, spread out over the next 25 minutes.  The last person got their food about 45 minutes after ordering.  The food was bad.  The chorizo tasted awful (bland, greasy, really wet).  

I won't type everything out because it would take too long, but you get my point.  I promise I'm not a negative reviewer, but this one was necessary!
author: Kellan M.

description:
I went out for a random night of Bloody Mary bar hopping on a Wednesday night and one of my friends had heard about a good Mexican place within walking distance from where we were.  Either it was a bad night or she heard wrong.

The only good thing about this place is that they give you a good amount of food for a pretty competitive price.  I got a combination plate that included the a chicken enchilada, chile relleno, flaunta, and the usual fixings of rice, refried beans, shredded lettuce, salsa, guacamole, and tortilla chips.  All that for about $8 or so.

Unfortunately, it wasn't very tasty.  Everything about it tasted not fresh and had the texture of food that's been lying around for longer than should be.  The chile relleno's skin was tough to chew through, the chicken in the enchilada was dry and overcooked, and the rest of the food was mediocre fare.  I wasn't too pleased with the school cafeteria quality food here.  I think if anything, if you're really that hungry or just went out drinking in the area, then this could be a decent pick, but I wouldn't go here if you're searching for a fine Mexican taqueria dining experience.
author: David Y.

description:
I assumed this place would suck just because of the line style - ordering at a register, then waiting for your burrito? It just sounds wrong at a taqueria. But I was the one who was wrong.

First off, extremely tight burrito. Impressive. The salsa bar is pretty much unrivaled. Great selections, all the standards, and then some. Easily accessible by both sides of the bar. I love that creamy zesty orange sauce - name, anyone?? Deliciously spiced horchata. Fresh ingredients. Plenty of choices.
author: Brittany L.

description: Had an AWESOME burrito here while in town for work.  The salsa bar was incredible.  Amazing.  Wonderful.  Want to go back.  Oh, god, oh god, it was good.
author: Joe I.

description:
Dear Pancho Villa Taqueria, 
thank you for feeding me.

I walked in somewhere between a few rum and cokes and 12:00am. This place is great to fill your belly and refuel before heading back out on the town.Oh yeah, and they serve beer so you don't loose momentum. 

They obviously have a great fan base because the place was packed right up until they closed their doors. The  food was good, inexpensive and the service was quick. I munched on a carnitas taco and chips and then nibbled on my friends mushroom quesadilla. Let me tell you, my taco was good but that quesadilla was finger licking good. 

The highlight of this place was the table of guys sitting next to us singing songs from The Little Mermaid. Yes, everyone there is that drunk.

If you find yourself hungry after a few drinks in the Mission I assure you that you will find solace at Pancho Villa.
author: Denise S.

description:
3 taco deal and a papaya agua fresca YUMMMM

I ordered lengua, carnitas and al pastor on my tacos. I loved the tacos. The tortilla is very moist probably because they have such a long line all the time which means they have a high turnover with their ingredients. 

Lengua-tongue.. was cut up into pieces of steak.. it was really tender. I never had beef tongue before so i can't compare. 

The papaya agua fresca is delicious. it's a nice change from the papaya milkshake with pearls from the boba places

mm i think i'll have some tacos again tonight =D
author: Connie M.

description:
Loved my first nd only (for now) experience here! 

I came here recently, during their $5 Quesadilla Monday specials with some of my friends. Present were two who have came here before nd told the rest of us about it. During the trip to finding nd coming here, I almost walked past this place. It would've been embarrassing if i had did though because this place is HUGE. This ain't the typical Taqueria one would find commonly throughout San Francisco... No, most def. not. 

Inside, the place was packed nd why wouldn't it? Psh. There was a line next of people awaiting to place their orders. It took about 5-10 minutes until I had placed my order. My friend had told us to remind them about the special so I am going to tell you as well: REMIND THEM just in case. For example, they might try to charge you $8 instead of the $5 you were expecting to pay. However, the $5 only refers to the most basic of their Quesadilla in which one could only choose which type of meat nd mild or spicy salsa. If one wanted guacamole or etc, they would have to pay extra. Bummer =/. Oh! One could also request a different type of tortilla. 

When our number came up, a nice lady worker brought us our plates. How nice of her... We referred to her as the nice lady :] The quesdadillas nd tacos looked basic but they were DELICIOUS! Nd they're filling so some of us split/shared. Next time, I might just take advantage of their $1 TACOS :]

Most def. recommended.
author: Michael N.

description:
I've heard many a time that this is THE place to get Mexican in the mission (and the mission is the place to get mexican in the city).

While it's certainly not authentic mexican, it will definitely hit your mexican spot. You don't go there for the ambiance (and I would say they know this, but they hired a mariachi guitar player last night. Really? Why bother?) - it feels like a dining hall in an old folks home. Linoleum floors and fluorescent lighting, all the rest.

The food itself was pretty darn good. Whatever you get, order it "super" (lettuce, tomato, guac, salsa, and then I skipped the sour cream). The veggie taco was pretty blah, but the chicken taco was great. It comes piled high/you prob have to eat it with a knife and fork. 

And then I'll just echo what others have said - the salsa bar is probably the most legit part of all of this. Really solid selection of salsas. Would have been helpful to see a some labeling going on - maybe I would have gotten more adventurous that way. They give you a handful of greasy corn chips to get you started. Overall solid meal. I'd come back next time I need something quick in the mission.
author: Joanne S.

description:
YUMMY!!!!!! G-R-E-A-T Customer service!! D- LICIOUS  Salsa Bar!! FRESH-------------
FRESH---FRESH--------FRESH ingredients!!!!!! LOTS of choices. Friendly atmosphere. On 16th. St. between Mission/Valencia. Yes, it's me--PEARL (My Nick-Name on FB) They are consistently EXCELLENT!! How many places can make that claim?
author: Sabrina R.

description:
This place is OK. Definitely the second most overrated place in the city behind La Taqueria. The food is only decent. And I tried it once when I was drunk too, and it was still only decent. That's a bad sign.

Also the prices are just a little higher than every other place in the city.

The place across the street is way better, and more reasonably priced.
author: Steve R.

description:
My favorite taqueria in the city, plus cheap parking around the corner.
We once were able to park right in front, miracle!! Should have taken a picture!!  Anyway, grilled vegetable brrito, al pastor, fish taco, dinner plate.....yum.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Most true San Franciscans who grew up in or around the Mission knows iof Pancho Villa Taqueria, on 16th and Valencia.  I used to walked by Pancho Villa aeons ago when I used to attend Everett Middle School.

It's a great place for college late teens and twentysomethings.  The older thirty and fortysomethings like to come here too, but are weary of the crime around here.  It's a very rough and unpredictable neighborhood.  It seems that there's a lot of unnecessary staring contest alpha male behavior and catty beta female behaviour around here.  But still where can you find a better super vegetarian burrito?  The interior's focal point is the Mexican flag and to order you go in a queue of about 10-20 people constantly until it closes at midnight.

The seating traffic is fast and it feels as if you are in Mexico City.  The parking outside wasn't as bad as expected, but the probability of having your car stolen is very high too.  It's a very seedy part of San Francisco, but an area that you must visit and see.  Just be careful.  People will not yield as you walk towards them.  About 1 of every 3 men walk as if they are just that close to exploding and are vying for a physical confrontation.  Very contentious young people around here.

Inside Pancho Villa is like a cultural center.  Yesterday night, there was an exhibit of images by local Bay Area photographer David Klein.  Some interesting portrait shots and long shutter time art.  There was also a sort of Tibetan style duo playing music made popular in the 60s.

The burritos rule and the energy in this very affordable restaurant/San Francisco Landmark is worth the visit.

The vibe's grungy and debateably seedy, but there's a strong tradition and culture that has evolved in this establishment surrounded by boiling criminal chaos.

The free nachos are bland and not very good without salsa.

**Cultural/Anthrological/Cinematographical Tip**

Prior to coming here for a burrito, Netflix or rent the following DVD: "Romantico."  It is an interesting documentary about the harsh life of an illegal alien mexican mariachi guitarist/singer living in San Francisco and supporting his life and his family abroad in Mexico.
author: Tony U.

description:
Pluses:

Extensive Menu

Reasonable Prices

Delicious Strawberry Agua Fresca

Open Late

Food is made fast
author: Jen S.

description: Everyone's got their particular poison, but these are my favorite tacos north of 24th street. Open late, decent beer selection, good lunch prices, it's always a bit crowded, but I've always found a spot...and oh yeah, the tacos are amazing. Pico with kick and some seriously hearty meat. My only knock is that I wish they had more variants in their salad bar, but that's a small one. When I'm in the Mission and I'm craving tacos, Pancho Villa is one of my first stops!
author: Kevin B.

description: my go-to taqueria in the city, altho I do go to others, including across the street for the California burrito.  This place is on the pricey said, but it's worth the extra $1 for a burrito.
author: Gregory N.

description:
I got a groupon for $14 of eats and it was OK. 

There was a huge line which was interesting to see. There was even a young security guard to keep it all orderly. 

The menu was spectacular with everything from vegetarian meals with tofu to good old standards like a super nacho dish. The service was at a decent pace not unlike a Subway sandwich shop. I ordered the chicken dinner and a baby pork burrito to go. They were both healthy helpings of food. 

The chicken was well done if a little on the bland side. They do however have a fixings bar with all sorts of salsa to flavor your food. I used some salt and a lime wedge and it was all good. The salad had no dressing though which I didn't notice until I got to the table. The guacamole was the best and the dinner filled me up nicely. 

When I got home later that evening, I realized I was given the wrong burrito. I was really looking forward to the burrito that I ordered with cheese and everything in it and their baby was HUGE (I watched the lady make it but then lost track of it). Darn. I had to knock off a star for that. Sorry Pancho Villa folks. 

I recommend this place. And I think I'll go back and this time I'll check out the specialty drinks they have too.
author: lily l.

description: Little piece of heaven in the Mission!    Always happy to return to this place for seafood or carnitas tacos!  Yum!!
author: Dan R.

description: Got tacos to go, so maybe that's why they weren't as good. Super cheap and fast though. And free chips + salsa.
author: Lilian K.

description: Pancho Villa is my favorite Mexican place in SF. The epic salsa bar, mariachi band, and grilled fresh in your face counter result in the ultimate junction of mexi-goodness.
author: Michael K.

description: Good food, usually packed. I like Pancho Villas because when the screw up they really try to correct it for you and I really appreciated that when it happened to me, so I'll keep coming here. Also great variety of aguas.
author: Genesis G.

description: I have no complaints. Everything was delicious. Back in the day when I used to drink alcohol, I enjoyed that they had cheep beer on tap to wash down the spicy mexican food.
author: Matthew J M.

description:
Yay to Pancho Villa! I went in for lunch and was pleasantly greeted with candy store vibrancy in the kitchen. Beautifully near-neon colors of salsa, the rhythmic sound of carne asada and carnitas being chopped, and the part that really got to me was the last gauntlet before you order: the desserts and agua frescas! Churros and alfajores jumped at me with golden browns dustings of sugar that made me wish I had diabetes only to make it easier to turn them down. 

Happy, smiling follks behind the counter at the taqueria. The lady taking my order even got a bigger smile on her face when I asked for "super nachos con lengua." An astonished laugh when she repeated "lengua" told me that I was in for a treat. Gringos and guerros don't order lengua. But I know better. I got an horchata instead of the electric agua frescas. It was my excuse for not getting a pastry.

At first, I'll admit that I was just ok with the nachos I got. There was plenty of cheese, and I loved the thicker chips. But something was missing until I hit the middle. That's when I got kicked in the jaw with the heat from their salsa. There it is! I was really excited that they decided to put all the good stuff in the middle! Far too often am I left sitting in front of a plate of nachos wishing that not everything was on top, and therefore, eaten way before I ran out of chips. My horchata was one of the creamiest I've ever had without being grainy. I have very simple criteria for horchata: creamy, least amount of grit as possible, and the right sweet to cinnamon ratio. Pancho villa hits them all.

Needless to say, I'll come back.
author: Jay V.

description: Big fan of this fresh late night joint!! The employees on the line are efficient and friendly. The line moves quick and the food is delish! I got a chicken fajita burrito and couldn't believe how heavy it was... More for me. The salsa bar has everything you need to add an extra kick or topper to your meal.
author: abby R.

description:
I love this place, but the line is always SO long!  It's food is great, delicious burritos and that amazing fruit drink (I can't remember what it's called, sorry) but sometimes standing in that line forever makes me feel like it isn't worth it...
However, you gotta at least give the place a try.  I'll still go here, I just won't enjoy it.  I prefer to eat at home rather than there.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
One of our 5 stops in our taco crawl and my favorite.

There were probably about 30 of us waltzing into the taqueria. We suddenly created a stir at the restaurant and with bystanders walking by. People thought there was a special going on. Nope. It was our annual taco crawl which was organized by Brian A. 

I had the fish taco. Slightly under $4 but was bigger than most tacos. Fish was perfectly seasoned and buttery. It went well with the hot sauce. Tortilla was fresh and warm. Loved it!!! I had to order a beer which was the taco crawl rule. 1 taco and 1 beer per taqueria. I guess tacos and beer are a must just like peanut butter and jelly. After Pancho which was our second stop, I was full. I had 3 more taquerias to visit. Oh Lord! 

Try their happy hour specials on the weekdays 3-5 pm. $1 tacos!
author: Molly T.

description:
Their new order-taking process has made this taqueria TERRIBLE.

You place your order, then pay & wait for the food. 

Easy right? Except your order comes out WRONG every time. If you order a burrito w/o rice, it will have rice. If you ask to add avacado, it won't be there. 

And the new system takes a lot longer to get your food.  Total failure.

Oh, and why is a super veggie burrito $7? Last I checked, a tortilla, rice, and beans don't cost a lot of money. 

There are MANY nearby taquerias that are so much better. 

Avoid Pancho Villa.
author: andy o.

description: This place has some of the best Mexican food IMO.. Their selection at the salsa bar is hands down the best that Ive seen. My fave is the green sauce it always so good and has just the right heat to it. I really enjoy their carne asada burritos and Ive also had the quesadillas which are really good too.
author: Michael W.

description: I have been coming to Pancho's since I was little and for good reason. The food is delicious, the service is fast, and the drinks are unbeatable. Until you try their garlic prawn plate or the chile relleno burrito, you haven't had real norcal mexican. Make sure to grab a "Melon", which is their cantaloupe drink!
author: Elena L.

description:
The nacho plate conquered me the very first time I came here.
I vowed to one day get a rematch.
One night after 3 cocktails on an empty stomach, my dear girlyfriend said "hungry. bor-litto!!" to which my tipsy (_|_) said "yes please. im hoooongray" I had a grilled chicken quesadilla with guacamole , sour cream and rice. It was huge but i'm glad they chopped it up into 4 big pieces for me or else I would've attempted to eat it and cried as it fell apart or something. 

"Let's order separately" my dear gal pal said, "that way, we get more chips! heeheeehee!" Oh god we're so Chinese. "Okay!!!" I exclaimed.
I really wish we hadn't, because after that I headed over to the salsa stand.
 The salsa verde was EXTREMELY spicy for some odd reason... And it also didn't agree with the champagne I had earlier =( It made me throw up just a little and let me tell you, hell hath no fury like a little Chinese girl throwing up spicy ass salsa verde and tortilla chips. So back to the story...

So 2 liquored up little Chinese gals decided to stand in this looooong line and wait..and wait...

L: the hell is he looking at??
me: I donno.. maybe he's never seen liquored up Asian people trying to eat burritos before..
man waiting in line: I like mushu pork *continues glaring at a intoxicated susy effing c and her friend*
me: errrr...*glares back* 
L: *whispers* freaking gaijins..
man waiting in line: i like asian food.
me: yeah, freaking gaijins..

wait a minute, we're not Japanese right? wait yeah. I think I need another drink.. gaijins?! The hell does that even mean again?? Who cares, i'm not Japanese. Wait i'm Chinese.. mmm Mexican food..Oh yeah, I know what gaijin means.. hahaha
author: Susy C.

description: I usually come here for the dinner plates and tacos plus the salsa bar ! The orange salsa is like crack ! I see a lot of people giving this place 1 star ? I rate it 5 because the salsa bar the food is fresh, and it's clean ! Not to mention it's delicious ! I only go to the other burrito joints like cancun and farolito when I'm drunk because they stay open late !
author: Lisa N.

description: Just left their place MAD cause they could not get my order right.. Ok how easy is a super steak burrito no guacamole and a little hot salsa.. So I waited and watched my burrito cause I just knew the server did not paid attention.. Thanks for all the extra hot salsa I did not ask for and then thank you again for the guacamole. Let the person was took my order know it was wrong she rolled her eyes spoke in Spanish, I nicely gave her the ticket to my food back and exited stage left.. Never to return!! There are way to many place to have a good burrito in San Francisco I can take my money else where !!
author: Mae D.

description: The burrito was perfect. Their menu has such a large variety that it would take so long to order everything off the menu. I ordered a spicy chicken super burrito and was not disappointed. I love how they have a salsa bar but I wish they labeled the different kinds of salsa. I didn't ask for more chips, as some people have posted, but the meal was so filling I don't understand why you would want more. I'll be back, for sure.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Pancho Villa is one of those great Mexican restaurants that are in the Mission that you hear about whenever you tell someone you want bomb/authentic Mexican food in this area.

The food is really fresh, cheap, and really AMAZING. Their salsa bar is just epic, I realized I was piling up cartons of salsa before I even noticed all of the awards framed on the wall from winning at salsa competitions. Yes, they have participated in numerous salsa competitions haha. Their green salsa is by far the best in my opinion, but they are ALL really delicious. 

I went here last night w/ my two girlfriends and we all enjoyed our meal. To be honest I'm still full today from my burrito! Thinking about Mexican food right now is kind of painful, but thinking about this place also makes me want to go back the next time I'm romping around in Dolores Park and/or the Mission!
author: Dawn O.

description:
Food is ok and great value, but the restaurant itself leaves something to be desired.

For the price I think you can get better Mexican food.  That said, it is very reasonably price and you're not going to walk out of the restaurant thinking you were ripped off.

The fluorescent lighting is just terrible.  Why do they even allow restaurants to install those kinds of lights?  I don't need mood lighting, but when you're squinting something is wrong.

And I hope you like mariachi bands.  There were 3 that came in and out (same band that just made lots of rounds?) while I was at dinner.  I almost paid them to stop.  Yes, I'm a bad person.

I probably wouldn't go back, unless I was hungry, in a rush and happened to be standing outside.
author: Nic M.

description: I ordered delivery via grubhub trying to get my monthly Mexican fix. Delivery took 1 hour, but it was estimated to be an hour and a half to two hours. Ordered a steak burrito, steak quesadilla, and a fish taco. Plus they also gave me free chips. The chips were crunchy and fresh. The burrito was pretty good and the steak was tender. The quesadilla was freaking delicious. The taco was alright. Order came to be 23$ plus tip. Will order again next month.
author: Jason A.

description: I love this place. They feed such good, fresh food to so many people every day! I've been going there since the mid 1990s. It's my favorite burrito joint in the whole City. That pretty much says it all.
author: Richard H.

description:
I went back here after a 10-year lapse...I did this after buying two coupons via Groupon...

Bottom line, I am returning the other coupon...

Worst Mexican food in the city...avoid at all costs.
author: Augustus C.

description: Im mexican and what i really like to do is try mexican restaurants in the city. I try to give some advice to friends for the best mexican food in sf. I went to pancho villa and I was really dissapointmen. The meat is not good and burritos are to small and expensive. Salsa is really good and spicy! If you want real tacos cancun and tropisueno are good!!
author: Carlos A.

description: Steak and Prawn Burrito - SO DAM GOOD.  (regular is more than enough for one person, but go super if you are feeling wild)
author: Steven F.

description:
Not a bad place to stop by for a quick taco to start off your late night adventures =P

It's definitely a popular place, so its pretty loud and there is a line to wait when you walk-in, but it's okay, the line does move pretty fast so don't let that steer you away!

Me and my friends hit up the carne asada tacos and the super nachos (also with carne asada).  The carne asada was good, tasty, moist, and pretty freshly cut.  All the meat there was being cut right as we were ordering the tacos, so that's a plus.  The tacos included a good amount of meat too, but it was still a little pricey for me, a little over $3.  Perhaps I'd fare better during happy hour =P

The nachos were also pretty good, but what was even better was that we had a bunch of left over nacho fixings left on our plate, as most nachos have a low chip to topping ratio.  But the employees at Pancho Villa Taqueria were happy to give us more, and more chips.  I don't see why people are complaining about the little amounts of chips that you get, just ask for more!

And as everyone else said, the salsa bar is pretty good.  Don't know how to describe it, but the salsas are thicker and has more substance than what you usually see in salsa bars.  The fact that you pretty much have an endless amount of good salsa and chips is just awesome :)

One more note, my roommate from San Diego who is super super picky about his Mexican food gave the thumbs up for this place, that means alot!
author: Devon J.

description: Love me some Pancho Villa. Damn near perfect burrito, great service and usually pretty clean, which is almost impossible given its location. My only issues are the prices ( 2.50 for a bottle of coke?) and portion size.
author: Michael G.

description:
Let's ignore the long lines here because any good burrito place is going to have a long line near the BART station and near bars. 

I decided to go with the quesadilla with the spicy salsa. The quesadilla was soggy and not very good, the spicy sauce was pretty tame except for the random peppers they have in it. So you can imagine me sitting there eating my quesadilla and suddenly my mouth goes in disgust as the super spicy pepper burns my mouth. I appreciate spicy, but random peppers don't count, that's not proper spicy.

Their assortment of salsa is amazing though, might be good if your friends want to go there and you just want chips.
author: Rohan D.

description: Make sure they hear your order correctly!!! this is the only bad thing I have to say about this place (it can get loud and crazy in there late night with the sometimes responsible drinkers of mission ;)) One of the best salsa bars in the city that I have located. But it does have to be late and must have a few drinks in you.
author: Hobie S.

description:
This place is a vegetarian dream... Instead of having to make all kinds of ridiculous requests to modify menu items to be vegetarian, the menu already gives you veggie options for just about everything they make. I ordered the super veggie tacos with refried black beans-- and a Coke in a bottle... (One of my weaknesses: Coke made with REAL cane sugar =melty with happiness.) 

Add to this: a whole selection of aguas frescas (mmmmm watermelon), churos (deep fried deliciousness), alfajores (a bit too sweet for my tastes), five tortilla choices (wow), a rockin' (and award winning) salsa bar, and a location within walking distance of a BART station      =perfection.

Man, it's good to live in the Bay Area.
author: Jessica J.

description:
The best burritos in the Bay and they have a huge selection!! The are huge and somehow magically wrapped up in foil. Their salsa is the BEST and award-winning. The place is cheap and can have a fairly long line, but it does move quickly. The Aqua Frescas are also very delicious and they have quite a few off different flavors.
I love the ambiance when they have someone playing music inside.  :)
author: Lucia A.

description: This place is a well oiled machine. They churn out delicious, affordable food at an alarming rate and I'm delighted every time. Their carnitas especial taco with black beans is my favorite. Their watermelon fresca is also amazing.
author: Ryan S.

description:
For burritos, it's kinda on the pricey side but worth it. I went at 11:30 for Friday lunch. Not too busy, a few open tables. The line went quickly. It seems they ironed out the new cash register issues. I ordered the super burrito with the red snapper. Very tasty after adding the requisite cilantro, green salsa, onions, chopped radishes, etc from the well stocked salsa bars -one of the best I seen in the mission.   They bring the food to your table and they had an efficient busser cleaning the tables. They kept the place clean and tidy. 
Overall I give them 4 stars. I would go again to try the carne asada and cebollas plate.  It looked very good.
author: Ron P.

description: This used to be my all time favorite taqueria.  Even after moving to the east bay, I would bring out of town visitors to eat here.  Their food was second to none!  It had been a couple of years, but I found myself in the mission around noon.  In retrospect, the first red flag I noticed was that there was absolutely no line.  At the time I was just happy to be getting my favorite burrito from my favorite place.  I remember when the line went out of the front door, and meat would be cooking as I waited in line to order.  But this time the dry, almost inedible meat in my burrito seemed like it had been cooked well in advance.  I was so hungry that I struggled to get through as much of the failed attempt at a burrito as I could, but in the end it was simply not fit for human consumption
author: M K.

description: Solid place to get a decent burrito. Even with a full house they are very good about being efficient and getting you your food fast, not to mention it tastes great!
author: Nathan H.

description: I Love this place!  The food is fresh and delicious. The portions are huge, and fruit drinks are really yummy.
author: Lisa B.

description:
30 years ago I visited this location for the first time. Back then, this was one of the only, and best, places I went to. So it was an interesting process to bring my family back. Thanks to a special from restaurants.com, I got a $25 certificate for $3.

Food was OK...I can't say fantastic because the bar is set so high now. I really like this place because of the fast service and being one of the best, but the food was just that...OK.

I wish I had tried some of the tacos, instead we opted for the burritos. I'll come back and try some more items.
author: Scot B.

description: This place is on point!!! My boyfriend and I were from Seattle visiting my sister and she recommended this place. It was our first stop after arriving from the airport. I had the shrimp tacos and they were delicious! My boyfriend had the chicken burrito and it was so yummmmmm! I had to steal a couple of bites from him. Plus, the salsa bar is perfecto.
author: Joanne D.

description:
The good:
Delicious mexican food, hot salsa, fresh guacamole, and big portions!

The not so good:
Dimly lit, sometimes slow service, and the occasional ditzy server.

Overall, it's good for an "authentic" mexican meal!
author: Adelei W.

description:
Bustling and noisy atmosphere, but good food. Everything is on the pricier side, but I think it's worth it. Pancho Villa has a wide variety of items, delicious meat choices for the burritos, high grade agua frescas, and a copious free salsa bar. 

Plus, any restaurant with a security guard at the door must be doing something right.
author: Nik D.

description: I went once, and that was enough. It is clean and big, but the food was boring and overpriced.
author: Ameer N.

description: I love this place.  Fresh food, fast service, 96 Health Score and we had lunch for 2 with drinks on Saturday for $22.00.  I think it is one of the best places in the Mission to grab lunch.  This is part of the original eats scene in SF.
author: Joe D.

description: Steak and Prawn Burrito was excellent.  Guac side was excellent as well.  All ingredients tasted fresh.  Long lunch line but goes real fast.  Churro needs some work though.  Will return for sure but buy dessert elsewhere. Service was great.  Salsa bar selection a big plus!
author: Jose P.

description:
Visiting California from NYC means one thing, and one thing only: Finally, finally!! Some good, cheap, taco/burrito truck style Mexican delights. 

The line was pretty long, but it moved swiftly. The burritos were about $7.50 a piece, and big enough to feed a small family. The carne asada dish was great, except the meat was a little dry. The rice, salsa, guacamole and lime-y salad made up for the meat. Altogether, a really cheap and delicious meal. Oh yeah, I also love the brand of sodas they carry. Grapefruit soda goes down so well when you're shoving fart-inducing grub in your face!

Mmmmmmm.
author: Pam S.

description: A study in contrasts---last night I had the lamest burrito I've ever had- at Taqueria Los Coyotes--tonight across the street I had literally the best burrito I've ever had at Pancho Villa. right across the street. Got a carne asada Super burrito with no beans, no tomato, no lettuce and WITH garlic-sauteed mushrooms. I can't adequately describe the deliciousness of this creation. Every single bite was sublime - it was so flavorful and juicy - the rice was perfectly cooked, the meat delish, the guac was beung made before our eyes, the chip were so corn-y. And shoot! the salsa bar is diverse and containing too many salsas for one trip. Which is fine because I just found my favorite SF taqueria, after 3 years here, so I'll be back!
author: Swiss C.

description: Expect a long line for the late night crowd.  Food is always good, just be prepared for the wait and get your order ready when it's your turn.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Best vegetarian burrito option in SF. They have grilled veggies to add and tofu tacos. Their meat is not too greasy either. And their salsa is great! They have salsa awards adorning one wall.  Love this place.
author: Katie D.

description:
We were nearby at Bruno's (great lounge btw) and were looking for a place when I found this spot off of my my yelp app and I'm glad I did because this place has some really decent Mexican food.  God knows I love Mexican food like a fat kid loves cake and this place has got a great salsa bar to boot which boasts their salsa that's won like 20 years in a row at the local fair.  I recommend the avocado but they were all great.

If you like fresh juices then you will definitely want to stop by here as they have all the delectable flavors like strawberry and cantaloupe.  Whenever I get the chance,  I rarely can't resist the horchata of any Mexican place because I happen to love that "dirty rice water" as one of my buddies calls it.   I just wish you could get refills like some places *cough Las Vegas Taqueria* because I really never seem to get enough of the stuff.  But I really just like ordering it because of how it sounds.. Mas horchata por favor! (3 years of High School Spanish baby! ;)

As you can see in the photos, their portions are freaking no joke and you really get your bang for the buck here.   I ended up ordering a few items a la carte and one thing I must mention is that the chile relleno is really something you gotta try ;)  It's big and juicy and definitely better than most places. 

Another cool thing I need to add is that they have a really extensive menu on the wall with lots of pictures.  The only problem is that there are so many freaking choices that you tend to get lost because everything looks so damn good.  That's why I ended up getting a few items a la carte so that I could get a little taste of everything.  

Now if they could just build another one a little closer to me..

Van The Man Must Try : The chille relleno
author: Van N.

description: Was heading back to my friends and wanted a quick bite. I got the fish tacos and they tasted great. A lot of things looked great on the menu which makes me want to come back soon. The fish was really fresh however if you are looking to get in and out I would get something different because it took a good 10-15 minutes to get my food.
author: Michael G.

description: Best Mexican in SF! Totally underrated!
author: Angelina E.

description:
Hi,

Being Nocturnal, as I've mentioned before, it's hard to find a spot that serves meals late at night that aren't divey diners that are riddled with tourists or the aggressive disheveled man that reeks of pee who some of us call, "dad". 

My first trip to Pancho Villa was a cold night in San Francisco (which may seem redundant) and I was walking down Julian Ave (which is super dark and appeals to my phobia of bright flashing lights). I foolishly stepped out into the street distracting myself with whistling to the Fugees, as I had been most of the evening. Well a bus was coming and blared its horn and my casual nonchalance turned to my comfortable state of terror. I sprinted, as much as one can with my small stature, across the street towards the glass doors of Pancho Villa.
There was a rotund man who opened the door for me kindly, but the frantic state I was currently in only warranted a shrill scream from myself. The guy and I sat there for a moment just staring at one another. I went through my breathing exercises and finally walked in.

The room was kind of smokey and while I wasn't tall enough to see, the grill was surely littered with my animal companions. I tried not to cry, but let's be real. It had been a stressful night.
Many patrons stared but I tried to keep my eyes focused on the menu and not on the gaunt librarian-looking judgement factories (which seem like a regularity, as I've been back several times).    

I was pleased that they had a whole list of vegetarian burritos and, having tried several of them, all have been pretty delicious. "Veggie D" seems to be my "my jam" and, when my fannypack provides, a mexican coke completes my meal.

They are open to midnight, which is a big perk for me. I'd say if you are out late and grabbing a burrito to say hello, but I'd probably just scream.

-BatBoy
author: BatBoy x.

description:
Growing up in the Mission has given me the opportunity to try pretty much every taqueria you could think of in the neighborhood and Pancho Villa is one of them. I have to say that its one of my favorites - I take all my out-of-town friends here and recently just took my boyfriend, whom has never had a Mission burrito.

We both got super burritos, mine with carne asada, his with chicken. He loved it and of course I did. How can you not? Its AMAZING. Love their guacamole and pieces of tomato that they put in their burritos. I normally get burritos or tacos but I really want to try a combo plate next time.

I have also been to El Toro, another place I used to go to when I was little. Love their tacos! They were my favorite growing up.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
HOLY  SALSA  BAR!!!!!!

better than sex.  

(If I must critique, it;s always crowded and the women who make the burritos are pretty cranky......but its crowded because it's awesome, and the workers are just pissed because they are making burritos and not EATING them!).  

Forever my favorite.
author: Katy K.

description: Pancho Villa has it ALL. Everything I've had (burritos, chile rellenos, and chile relleno burritos!) has been super yummy yummy. They have an extensive menu, the food is prepared relatively quickly, and they're consistent. I wish they had a location in San Jose!
author: Natasha P.

description:
Solid food with an exceptional selection of salsas.  I'm a fan.  It isn't always my first choice, but each time I'm here, the food is delicious.

Quick, fast & friendly service.  A meal that hit's the spot.
author: Kathy H.

description:
OMG - shrimp and steak burrito is to die for! And they have a baby burrito option for those that want it. This thing was dripping out juices of amazing flavor. I didn't want to let the baby go when I was done with it. 

Very comparable to El Farolito. Damn, I love the Mission! Loved the live music in there too! Felt right at home...
author: Jeanne C.

description: A solid burrito, but it lacks the flow I've grown to expect from those in the Mission. Meaning, the innards don't merge to form a concoction of awesomeness. Rather, each ingredient acts in isolation, creating kind of a bland flavor. Not a bad burrito, but likely my lone visit given the neighboring competition.
author: Mark B.

description:
I would give this place 10 stars if it were up to me, but at the same time I dint wanna get people to hyped up!
