Pancho Villa, you can suck my balls. 

Your food is blah blah boring. I should only come here when I am drunk so I don't realize what I am putting in my body...

Clean the pubes off the toilet seat too, you nasty ass patrons..

i am actually quite happy, even if I sound salty and bitter.
author: danny e.

description: Great!  Best of the best burritos I've ever had. And the hot salsa is hot like hell - I like!
author: Jj M.

description: Delicious, cheap and lots of selection.  Both the shrimp and fish tacos were yummy.  The fresh juices are great.  This place is not about service, rather easy self service walk up.  The salsas were excellent.  Finish your meal off with a churro, yum!
author: Rachel K.

description:
I think the previous 3-star reviews are right on.  
I'm offended, as a Mission resident, that Pancho Villa gets so much e-ink.  By this, I mean sites like citysearch and local e-zines praise PVT as a culinary mecca that one HAS to visit.  Let's just call it what it is...an institution.  
If it weren't on my way home from the BART stop, I probably would opt for somewhere else, since there are so many decent burrito joints close by.  
However, I'm never mad when I have some carne asada and a horchata in hand!
author: Robby T.

description:
There's usually  line, but like an ER trauma room there's at least 10 people in the back of the counter to resuscitate me from dying of starvation.  The burritos are a good size also what we call... every man's fantasy.  I've had the grilled veggie burrito and al pastor.  Delicious and packed well like a bug in a rug and I never worry about drips.  

Great salsa selection in the back (I like the spicy green one) and pickled veggies are quite good.
author: Christina C.

description:
This is THE definition of great Mexican-American food.  I love their prawn and steak quesadillas.  Everything is freshly grilled and prepared right in front of you, and the aromas that infiltrate every nook of your nose hairs deserves it's rightful place in your memory.

They do have an annoying mariachi band play every so often, but it lends itself to a pretty ethnic experience.

Plus, the food here has never given me the runs like most other joints.

Oh yeah, portions are large and be prepared for long lines.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
I am giving 2 stars for the food and ambiance of Pancho Villa and 1 star for the hype.

I've been here a few times and have left nonplussed every single time, except once when I left with explosive...stomach aches.

The food is meh, the salsa bar promises variety, but delivers old tasting tomato products with questionable histories.The price is cheap, but so is every single taqueria in The Mission. It always seems packed though, and I started hearing stories about this place years ago when I still lived in New York. It's legendary, but I just can't figure out why.

In the words of Public Enemy, 'Don't believe the hype.'
author: Melanie D.

description: I have used Pancho Villa for catoring several times.  They are always on time.  Food quality has always been fresh and taste is delicious. I'll continue to use them.
author: Matt B.

description:
This place is so great. It's lively, bright, tons of choices for Mexican food and drinks (agua frescas? cervezas?). My favorite is the quesadilla. 

It's just too bad that it's hard to find parking or else I'd be here all the time.
author: Lorraine D.

description:
Alas, although our relationship with the Mission was full of anger due to the crack heads taking a crap near my car or little missy giving John Doe a bj in the driveway, it was still full of passion.  Since we left, as with all relationships, I can't help from being a bit nostalgic.  (Sniff sniff.)

Pancho...(whimper)...I m-m-miss you.  (whaling)  I miss your steak and shrimp burritos and en-chi-la-das. (biting lip)  I miss your aqua semi-frescas!  Ooooohhh!! (choke, choke, swallowing tears and composing self).  But, it's not the end.  No, we'll return.  Some (losing it again) day...
author: John L.

description:
Four stars for the best institutional/chain burrito in the city!  Pancho Villa's consistent excellence makes up for it being a slightly smaller and less original burrito than one finds at local hole-in-the-wall spots.

The massive salsa bar is a huge draw as well.  Try a little bit of everything.  You won't regret it!
author: Zachary S.

description:
If there's one thing I like, it's a good happy hour.  Luckily for me, there's more than one thing I like, and one of the other things is good, cheap, Mexican food.  

Well, Pancho Villa Taqueria, you've got these two likes of mine covered.  From 3-5 every weekday, I can get $1 tacos and $2 beers with a pretty wide variety of beers.  Now, maybe you're the kind of person who sees those prices and says, "Wow!  I could eat 20 tacos for 20 dollars!!"  

I'm not that kind of person.   I'm the kind of person who goes in with a friend at a few minutes til 3 and says, "We have 2 hours so let's get crackin on some beers!"  Eight beers and four tacos later, we're grinning from ear to ear.

True, the bus boy laughed at me when he was clearing our empties, but that's hardly going to slow me down.  

Was it the best taco I've had in SF?  No, but it was still pretty good.  More importantly, who cares when it costs a dollar and can be washed down with a (or eight) two dollar beer.

Gracias, Pancho Villa Taqueria.  


P.S.  What's up with your seats?  They were really weird and somewhat unpleasant.  I felt a little like I was drinking at a bus stop.
author: David F.

description:
Spicy chiken. Spicy salsa. Happy belly. Happy wallet.

I recommend NOT dressing up to eat here because whether or not you would like a souvenir from this place, you'll get one: the smell of sweet Mexican food. ;)
author: Jacinta H.

description:
I'm sorry, but I have to compare this Taqueria to every other Taqueria in the Mission and it just can't really hold up to other places.

The tortillas are steamed, not like there's anything wrong with it, but it's just not as authentic as many other places.

The burritos are pretty good, but I've had way better in many other places.  However, I do enjoy the different things I can throw in my burrito.  

Tacos and just about everything else on the menu are mediocre at best.  

I can't help but feel like the quality of the place has gone down since it become so popular many many moons ago.  Maybe one day it will be the reigning champion of Taquerias again, but today, it's just another burrito place.
author: Mike V.

description:
I would've really liked to give them 3 1/2 stars.

I like coming here for the burritos and ocassionally the quesadillas. The unfortuante thing is that sometimes it's so loud in here that the people behind the counter have a hard time hearing you. I've had 2 orders confused recently. On the last visit, they heard mushroom and shrimp versus mushroom and garlic. Not that I couldn't eat shrimp, I just didn't really need to spend the few more dollars on it. 

The aguas frescas are consistently good. I'm partial to the sandia (watermelon). 

The surounding street is really sketchy. And coming here for dinner you get to see some interesting characters. There are  also the roving musicians, which can be a nice thing. And I don't mind sparing them a buck when the hat comes around.
author: cyndi L.

description:
Great place to go for a burrito after a piercing.  Pretty standard stuff taqueria food. I think next time I'll get something with prawns in it.

The customers are truly unique - especially the guy who looked like the stalker in the movie Bodyguard with Whitney Houston.  He came in with his boom box playing his Spanish music.  Jenn C and I wondered - Does he play R&B in Soulfood restaurant and Chinese music in Chinese restaurant? Some people in there seemed to know him so I guess he was okay.

The place seemed to stay pretty busy but they move fairly quickly.
author: Shelley S.

description:
It would be untrue to say I'm just a fan of burritos and mexican food. Perhaps over enthusistic would be more cor5rect, but only if it included jumping around, making up rediculous songs, drooling, and/or begging and crying until my burrito craving was satisfied. 

I've tried them all, and have my favorites. I even make the 4 hour bus and train ride from santa cruz just to get me some good mexican burrito lovin'

THAT BEING SAID, this was quite possibly the best burrito I've ever had. I would go into the gory details, but would end up side tracking to 5 minute inhale of burrito, and maybe even the return trip the next day, for yet another...

The quesedillas here are also awesome, but somewhat difficult to eat.

also, late night burrito places are AWESOME, especially after a few drinks.
author: Allyson S.

description:
Bland, bland, BLAND.  I get the feeling this place is so popular because it is clean.  And not threatening.  

But boy, is it bland.  I wanted to like it, especially since they have a $1 taco special, but everything I have had here is tasteless.
author: C H.

description: Perhaps I've lived in NYC too long... my return visit to Pancho Villa Taqueria after a 6 year break made it taste like the most delicious burrito on the planet. I remember always feeling like this place was pretty good but nothing really different or special compared to other taquerias. However, if you go directly from SFO to the Mission and eat a burrito after 6 years of "Mexican Food" in New York, well, you too will award them 5 stars. My gf, a California virgin before our trip, looks like she's in heaven in the photo of her eating her first real burrito. Super chicken burrito all the way. Tons of veg options though too!
author: Ian J.

description: This is my favorite taqueria in SF, but has anyone else noticed that the new computer system results in you having to wait 20 minutes for your order?  I'm REALLY surprised and disappointed that Pancho Villa would do this to its customers, and I'm having to seriously think about finding a new favorite place.  Sad.  I would give this 4 or 5 stars, but I'm giving only 2 because of this deterioration in service.
author: Molly P.

description: I am a fan of the $1 taco happy specials from 3-5pm.  You really can't ask for anything cheaper than that!  I really enjoyed the fish tacos and would also recommend that you "super" them by adding guacamole and sour cream! Wash it down with a Latin beer and you're golden! The wait was worth it!
author: Laura P.

description: Finally stopped by here earlier on tonight.  There was a line but it moved along quickly and the place was packed.  It was a bit hot in there and a mariachi was slappin' in the back of the place, but I just stood there and marveled at the extensive menu.  Decided on a carnitas super burrito with everything on it and black beans...must say, this place has the best carnitas I've tasted in a long time [ever?].  Going back ASAP because I need to start trying all the aguas frescas!
author: Paige W.

description:
My boyfriend and I are burrito FIENDS, and Pancho Villa is my favorite.  I don't know what it is about their burritos (I suspect it's the salsa), but they're so damn good.

My favorite is their "super baby" burrito.  Burritos are notoriously large and nearly impossible to finish for me, and most "super" or "deluxe" burritos are larger with all the extra stuff they add to it.  I want a burrito with all the variety of fixings, but not in huge amounts.  Super baby was the answer.

Only downside is that you get mad food coma and are burping up carne asada for the next three hours, but man--totally worth it.
author: Desdemona C.

description:
A Pancho Villa's burrito is the burrito that moved out of the ghetto and over to Concord. It's an assistant manager at Best Buy. It's clean-cut and accessible, well-spoken and fairly articulate and just a little ostentatious. Nothing bad but you can't help but judge it a little. Loosen up! Relax! Eating at Pancho Villas is like sex with a condom; enjoyable and without risk but sterile and removed. 

It's an $8 burrito and if that's what you think is reasonable, then this place will make you see stars. Not bad but I like my burritos dirtier, less flashy and cheaper. Head to Farolito, El Castillito, Taco Loco or just about any taco truck and you'll see the difference. If those burrito joints are too funky, smelly or unpredictable for you, I guess some people are just MADE to have sex with a condom. Me, I go au'naturale. If the bathroom doesn't smell like piss and bleach, the place isn't my style.
author: Mario T.

description:
GREAT GREAT tacos!

Made a quick trip out to Pancho Villa Taqueria in Mission.
It was suggested by a good friend who is Mexican.

The line was long & the place was packed.
Stood in line for about 10 minutes, then it was my turn.
I had my food in hand from the time I walked in to the time I paid, in 20 minutes & it was PACKED.

2 Carne Asada tacos deluxe, 1 Carnitas taco & 1 Chicken Verde taco.
All were EXCELLENT!
Every single bite was delicious followed by the YUM GRUNT.
The Salsas' were all excellent as well. We were scooping the salsa up with our chips like it was a delicious soup.

I don't have anything bad to say about this place.
I actually can't stop thinking about it, hahahaha!

I do wish I had one near home, cause it puts my local favorite TACO spot to shame.

Hey Pancho, come to SoCal, we need you!...
author: Dan B.

description:
For anyone out there who doesn't want to quite consume a 2,000 calorie burrito, Pancho Villa has a Baby Burrito! It's still delicious and large and probably almost as bad for you as the regular and super ones, but hey, at least it's a start. 

Baby burrito with chicken equals excellent. They also give you chips and have a great salsa bar. This is a take out or order at the counter type place. Good & cheap mexican food.
author: Caitlin B.

description:
Always consistent, always a winner. Doesn't fully blow you away but everything on the menu is really good, and like I said, its consistent.

Big crowds but the line moves pretty fast as the staff has their act together.  Lots of customization and choices possible.  My go to is the Carne Asada, especial style.  The chicken verde is another sure fire choice.  I don't usually get their pork, I save my carnitas for other joints, but I seem to remember it being pretty good.  These are big burritos but they roll them tight.

What pushes Pancho Villa to a 4 star level is the salsa bar which is fantastic.  Missing the thick green goodness that is an avocado salsa but they have every other kind you want. Really solid hot red.
author: J.D. P.

description:
I wrote a song about Pancho Villa. Like to hear it? Here it goes:

"burrrrriiiiiitos are good. Buuuuurrrrrrriiiiitos are tasty. I love the superveggieburritowithasubstitutionoffreshavocadoinsteadofguacamole. YEAH!!!!!!!!!"
author: Dana K.

description:
So the last time my little brother came up to visit from Los Angeles, the first thing he said to me when he got into the car was "Pancho Villas. Now!"  I mean, for pete's sake, the kid from LA is screaming about Mission-style burritos before the little-man-in-the-orange-vest had time to blow his whistle at me for spending .24 seconds idling in the white zone.  Does a sister proud.

That said their food is tasty and pretty cheap.  They cater a bit to the hipster set with their spinach tortillas and lard-free beans.  But I'm not hating.  I appreciate the lack of lard and abundance of veggie options...but I still think spinach tortillas are weird.

Their salsa is great.  It totally makes waiting in that crazy long line worth it.  Oh and if you go on the weekend you might have to share a table with someone you don't know.  On the upside they might be cute.  On the downside your hair will reek of carne asada.
author: Carmen R.

description:
I believe that Pancho Villa can do better -- and I will order something else besides the Carne Asada Super Nachos next time. But it was truly disappointing because of the following reasons:

-Tthey ran out of guacamole, so they gave me sliced avocado on top. If they have avocados, why not make more guac? Hummm, puzzling.
- There was a thick layer of lettuce and tomatoes on top of my nachos. It was like eating a salad instead of nachos.
- WE COULDN'T FIND THE MEAT IN OUR NACHOS! BAD GAME. There were small miniscule pieces of beef, but they weren't very satisfying.

The lengua burrito we got was good, and the rice plate with chili verde was also pretty decent. Their rice is delish.

Next time I'm going for the gold and having the garlic prawns!!

Salsa bar was good, lots of variety and most of it looked fresh except for the one that looks and tastes like straight tomato sauce.
author: Alison T.

description: These guys are just the best there is. If I get within 10 miles of this place my mouth starts watering and I have to go. I have never had a bad meal here, ever!
author: Dan T.

description: Their burritos are okay.... definitely not the best...I can't say its that great either because seriously speaking, I was not impressed... at all. You can go to most taquerias and get a steak burrito that can beat pancho villa's carne asada burrito any day. Their steak lacks that char smoky flavor and the rice was really mushy. I do like the fact that they have different kind of tortillas.. that's about it. Will I come back? Not for a long long time.... and their burritos cost more compared to other taquerias around.
author: A L.

description:
Yesterday I came with a bunch of hungry college students to Pancho Villa. The whole time I was ordering, waiting for food, and paying in line kinda felt like I was at an elementary school cafeteria, but I was too close to starving to care. My super carne asada and shrimp burrito was $12 and I couldn't even finish it, no matter how delicious the spicy salsa was, how much free ice water I had, or how much live music was playing. It was SOOOO SATISFYING. Plus, they give a handful of free chips. (Although with all that salsa bar, I could've used a little more chip.)

I really enjoyed all the art on the walls. Apparently certain days the artist just walks around and chills there, which is pretty sweet.

Oh and if you don't remember who Pancho Villa is, I saved you a trip to Wikipedia: 
"Doroteo Arango Arámbula (June 5, 1878 - July 20, 1923), better known as Francisco or "Pancho" Villa, was a Mexican Revolutionary general. In his own version of his life at the age of 16 he shot an older man, the son of a big landowner, who had tried to rape Pancho's younger sister . After this, being pursued for murder, he escaped. During the following years, first living as an outlaw, then working his way up to a position as a division's commander, not many details are known."

Now you know!
author: Claire C.

description:
what i ordered... steak and shrimp burrito, cream filled churro and cantaloupe agua fresca.


...i've been to this place a lot of times in the past and it is still one of the best for burrito's in san francisco. the carne asada meat was good and the shrimp was fresh and grilled to perfection...and their salsa was as good as it ever was.

...the only question i have in my mind..., is this restaurant part of the mexican restaurant's conspiracy in the city to serve as bad torillas???
author: Gors P.

description: I like the food at Pancho villa Taqueria.  For me it is only good for takeout, because I am hard pressed to find parking.  So, I usually hover and have a family member or friend go in for take out.  Also, it can get smokey inside because the blower doesn't seem to take all the smoke from the grill outside.  My favorite is their Prawn Burrito.
author: Robin B.

description: BEST BURRITOS IN SF, PERIOD. !!! theres a reason there is a line all day, every day. For 20 years, I have enjoyed the quality, consistancy and friendly service of this legend. Never dissappoints.
author: Dave S.

description:
Happy Hour Beer and Tacos! 
(3-5pm?)

$1 tacos.
$2 beers.

The line was kind of slowish but the chicken tacos were pretty good. I got there at 3:06 pm and discovered Happy Hour makes the price right for a couple of beers and tacos. ( They got an extra star just for it.) The salsa bar is excellent with radishes, limes, and of course salsa.

I sat in the window with my two tacos and Negra Modelos and watched the world go by as the police arrived to help some guy who got his car window busted out.
author: Philip N.

description: Most salsa are spicy, beyond me. But you'll probably love it if you do like spicy food. Free to get a variety at its salsa bar. I ordered seafood taco and vegetarian taco, both good!
author: Susan S.

description:
Steak and prawn burrito....
Shoot yeah.
author: Brendan R.

description: I've been coming here for over ten years and it has consistently provided, fresh, fast, delicious, inexpensive Mexican food. I never eat burritos so cannot comment on that, but the quesadillas, super tacos and the diner specials are great. I love the flavor of anything coming from the grill, nice salsa bar. The uninspiring decor and cast of (oftentimes weird) patrons of all walks of life ad to the place's urban charm.
author: Jairo W.

description:
This is place is way over-hyped. It's okay, but not the best in the bay or even in SF.

I did get some good entertainment one afternoon in here when two undercover cops arrested a couple of guys in line and dragged them out to a mess of speeding-in cop cars and sirens.
author: Gregory R.

description:
So i like the feel of the bsy taqueria.  BUut lets face it this place is another starch burrito hell hole.  Listen folks, if you have never eaten a burrito outside of California, maybe you should just shut the F up. Because California is not the only place were immigrants from latin america live and setup Burrito shops. 

These burritos are very mediocre and again for the money and time spent waiting this is not really worth it.
author: Spanky M.

description:
I am forever a fan. 

I love Mexican food, and I love this taqueria. You can't go wrong with their shrimp quesadilla or the garlic prawns dinner plate--with grilled mushrooms!

They have a great salsa bar, and more than 5 fresh fruit drinks. 

The prices are decent for the food. Who doesn't love Coca Cola in a bottle from Mexico? They use sugar cane!
author: Misha F.

description: I love everything on their menu..but always end up getting the Tofu or Fish tacos. Their pickeled peppers/carrots are worth the long search for a parking spot. I recommend take out rather than dining in...the strong odor of pine sol there can ruin the dining experience.
author: Mimi T.

description: Really good burritos.  Big portions too--they'll have to roll you out the door after you've stuffed yourself silly with food.  The only thing I didn't like was that some of the aquas frescas were pretty watery when I went (especially the pina).
author: Karen W.

description: Just wanted to put a vote in for my favorite Taqueria in the city.  The food is good, the salsa bar fresh, and horchata refreshing.  When you go make sure you say thanks to the security guard who politely opens the door for you.
author: Aaron W.

description:
i went to pancho villa for the first time after a great workout with my bf because his cousin told him it had the best salsa in the city. i guess i agree with him but i thought it was just ok. 

pancho villa is clean and very well lighted place. i thought the salsa bar was pretty cool too

i ordered the taco deluxe which included cheese, beans, meat and salsa. the taco was pretty good and the salsa was fresh considering it was 11pm. i havent tried the quesdilla yet but i will defintely go back soon.

however, i still perfer La Corneta on 22nd st. :)
author: Carol Y.

description: What's the fuss? Okay, I do agree it's AWESOME, but only for what it is. There are so many other places I would rather go than here.
author: Jennifer P.

description: I come here often after work since 1$ tacos is pretty awesome. Add 2$ beers for happy hour and your work day worries are gone! Aside from happy hour, it's still a great place to get a burrito in the area!
author: Mars C.

description: I had a shrimp super burrito.  It was by far the best burrito I ever had.  And I usually do not eat burritos.  They cooked the shrimp right in front of me.  It was seasoned and cooked perfectly!  Planning on going back next week! :)
author: Ammala B.

description: If you're in a bit of a hurry or want to finish a conversation before hopping on the BART on the corner, this high-ceilinged and bright cantina is a good place to know. Very reasonable and friendly, good for a quick bite or a full meal with friends. It's got it all.
author: Carey G.

description: This place is just like the San Mateo location but even better. I found a spot right in front which was awesome and the food came out pretty quick for how busy they were.
author: Darius A.

description:
this place is inefficient and slow. it should not take 30 minutes to get a super burrito and a super quesadilla to go. 15 minutes to wait in a line that wasn't that long and another 15 minutes waiting for my food to be ready. i know you're not chipotle in the financial district but COME ON. 

oh and $18.62 for a burrito and quesadilla? really? this better be top of the line mexican food. it was not. not coming back.
author: Mei C.

description: This place by far has the best prawn tacos. I'm super picky about how I like my shrimp, and they have it down. Reasonably priced, and they're horchata is good too!
author: V V.

description:
Wow amazing. I got the chicken fajita burrito super style. I was in another world with each bite of amazingness. The corn chips are perfect and the have a wide selection of salsas at the salsa bar in the back.

Enchiladas looked amazing...may need to go back to try them!
author: dave r.

description:
Hand's down the best burrito in CA  (yes, yes I know, all my friends think that THEIR taquerias are the best...)

When I go home? I buy a few and take 'em on the plane back East with me. No joke. 

Just can't get a good burrito in NYC.
author: christy c.

description: always authentic, always popular with the mexican-food eating hipsters. sitting right in the middle of the mission. the food is good. burritos, quesadillas, and more. hipsters and punks keep on eating at Pancho Villa. Ay ay!
author: Denise C.

description: Great burritoes.  If their 'al pastor' was any better than it is... it might beat out farlitos to my my top burrito joint.  Always quick even when the lines are long and there's always a place to sit, even when it's bustling.   What better venue to check out indie rock acts like 'beck' ?? (Check the images if you're not sure what I'm talking about.)
author: Rudro S.

description:
Went here last night with friends. When my buddy said we were going to Pancho Villa's I wondered if it was connected to the taqueria of the same name in San Mateo. It was quite apparent to me that they were connected as we walked in to the restaurant. Both places are quite similar. The first thing that you notice is the appallingly bright overhead lights. It makes you feel like you're in some cafeteria. Next is the confusing way to order. There is no apparent location for ordering (no, order here sign). You just have to wait for someone behind the counter to notice you. 

The service here wasn't so bad (better than the one in San Mateo). But it still is a bit impersonal. The food was tasty, but my tacos were coldish. 

I visited the wash room, as is my habit. As I expected, it was pretty gross.

I wouldn't go back here. It's not worth it, even if the food tastes good (when it's warm).
author: J S.

description:
The security guard here is awesome! 

I also enjoy the burritos, which are basically 2 meals in 1 (yes, they ARE that big). 

I grew up on the east coast, so I don't know what a good taqueria should really be like, but this suits all my needs. Cheap, quick (relatively speaking), wide selection, friendly, clean!
author: kathy c.

description:
I had my very first burrito in here in the last millennium. And behold, it was very good.

Came back with a friend a bit later who didn't understand that you can and must chose the ingredients, like what kind of meat or beans you'd like to have. Not a native speaker, he kept answering with a gentle "whatever" to each and every question, long after another friend and myself had found a seat. The spectacle got better: one of the chefs approached with a long knife, pointing at my helpless friend at the counter and the food behind it. Eventually, he figured what his duties were - and good times were had by everybody.

Visited Pancho Villa again last Sunday and behold, it's still very good. Serious food coma included - and I bestowed a good part of my burrito on to a friend. Come hungry!
author: Roland A.

description:
Judging by the amount of rave reviews, I guess I'm delusional.  I grabbed some fish tacos from here the otra noche and they weren't something I'd ever come back for.

Maybe tacos aren't their forte, wait - wtf? it's a Mexican chain taqueria, they best understand taco manufacturing.

They don't have a lime or any kind of special sauce for their fish tacos, something I've found most Mexican taquerias do.  And rightfully so, the taste of the baked/fried fish is really brought out with a kicky little special sauce.

The tacos were so overloaded with beans, iceberg lettuce strips and pico de gallo that I could barely shovel it into my mouth.

I'm down with Mexican street-style tacos and the ensuing smelly mess it constitutes, but this was a bit ridiculous.  I had to fight to masticate.  If it's already dead, I really don't want to have to chase it around my paper plate, thanks though.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Well, it's got an extensive menu...that's for damn sure. Several vegetarian options - which I AM grateful for. Decent prices. It's not a mind-blowing, best-of-SF burrito...but it's a San Franciso burrito nonetheless. 

I think a friend called it the "Wal-Mart of Taquerias" last night. That's pretty accurate.

Loads of options. Loads....but, no bottled water?
author: Danyell K.

description: Seriously, we waited 20 minutes in line, just to split a burrito before our flight home.  I actually crave this place from 650 miles away.  We had a carnitas burrito, and it was exactly as I remembered, perfect.
author: Jane A.

description:
Note: I have been here once. I usually like to frequent a place more than that before I feel good about writing a review, but due to my experience and the overabundance of other taquerias in the area I feel compelled to write this. 

Carne Asada Burrito: It just wasn't that good (see La Pasadita, Chicago for the standard.) This may have been my mistake seeing as the shrimp and chicken that they were cooking on the grill as I ordered looked great, whereas the meat sitting in the metal container didn't. The salsa bar was great, and the chips were good, but I think all the reviews set the bar too high. 

Also, I hate that white/bright interior that some taquerias have...I wasn't at the stage where I wanted to sober up.

Value: Standard, if not a little spendier (by a buck or two) at $7 for a basic, add 50 cents for crema or cheese etc....plus $4 for a beer. Like I said my experience was one of meh.
author: Andrew K.

description: Really really good Mexican food. You can't  go wrong eating side by side General Francisco "Pancho" Villa.
author: Luis G.

description: I haven't stayed there to eat, just picking up and it is fairly fast when crowded. Kinda loud but that's OK since I don't eat in there. Good food and good service, which is what matters the most.
author: M Z.

description:
this yelp goes out for my chicken burrito, that i ate last week and i'm about to eat tmr! 
when theres a line the line goes fast, maybe i should come when it's raining and see what happens because I've never notice. but anyway! this place is good for people who a)trying to gain weight b)cheating on their diet c)need something savory! They even have a security guard open the door for you! but if your on a diet DON'T enter! Enter at your own risk because once you start eating it you won't be on a diet any longer! You'll gain like 2031729749203582389473289 lbs! but its so good you don't want to stop! like me :[ I've only had burritos here but nachos look chessylious! & their fresh made chips are a PLUS PLUS PLUS!
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
I don't know how many times I've passed by this place and thought, "ughh... this place just looks sad..."

but the other night, some of my friends told me to meet them there for dinner and all I could do was silently sigh. I mean it wasn't like some sort of culinary intervention where a group of friends tried to force-feed me something, but rather they, not really knowing the area, just randomly went there. anyway, the grub is pretty good. I had a chorizo burrito and it wasn't too salty or too greasy. The service was pretty fast, and the salsas were very good. all in all, this place gets a recommendation from me. it's not as cheap or as good as some of the other places in the mission, but given it's proximity to just about everything, it was a pleasant surprise.
author: Bernie L.

description:
a'ight, i'll roll up my sleeves for this one- the ever contentious issue of what burritos merit the enviable yelp 5 star rating.

Now surely trying to choose a burrito in the mission is about as personally difficult a decision as choosing which burmese restaurant rocks more-mandalay or burma super star- either way, you win really. but i digress...

Pancho villa gets top marks for overall taste/menu options. Sure, you can say prawns are gimicky, so lets stick to chicken or veggie options either are amazing, with the pollo asado chicken consistently being moist and flavorful. The refried black beans are super rare to find in the city, and once you've had black (refried beanz), you seriously won't go back...to those other bean options that is...the sum total adds up to burrito heaven....I just wish it was open tilll.........well, i just wish it never closed. nuff said :)
author: Tim V.

description:
AWESOME!!!!!

They have beers, the food is phenomenal, a must-do in SF every time!!!!

AND, right near all the party spots. Yee-hah.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Crowded ... hard to get a table.

However, it was a good filling burrito. They have refried black beans (nice!) ... and it's nice to see some different meat choices for the burritos (bbq pork and chicken fajita)
author: Alex C.

description:
Wow, this place rocks. What can I say. Every time I walk past, the place is bustling with people and there's a line for the food, and last night was no exception. I had eaten at a taqueria just the previous day, but I had some out-of-town visitors so I took them to this place, and everyone was very happy with the meal, including me. $7 for an avocado burrito and a bottle of Jarritos.

This is one of those places that makes me glad I live in San Francisco.
author: John C.

description:
Imagine biting into a warm tortilla stuffed with rice, guacamole, melting cheese, pollo asado, black beans and fresh salsa...You savor each and every bite, until you reach final bite that leaves you bittersweet, knowing there is no more burrito left. Mmmm...just thinking about the delicious burritos at Pancho Villa makes my mouth water...

Pancho Villa offeres a large variety of menu choices appealing to carnivores, herbivores and omnivores. The food is fresh, satisfying and authentic. What can I say? Pancho Villa Taqueria rules!
author: Jenny K.

description:
The burritos and quesadillas here are the best!  I much prefer Pancho Villa to El Farlitos which is far more sketchy.  I've seen way too many fights & puke filled bathrooms at El Farlitos to ever go back.

I think the prices are great.  My husband and I can eat here for under $20 including drinks and everything.  Plus, I can never finish my burrito and always have yummy leftovers for the next day.  :-)  They've got a great selection of salsas.....the spicy green one is my absolute favorite.

I usually stop at this joint BEFORE I start drinking.  It's my Friday night, after work, just got off of BART dinner before all of the partying begins.
author: lea m.

description:
Mmn.  They do it up right here.  I usually get a prawn or grilled mushroom quesadilla here, but the burritos and tacos are also fantastic, full of flavor and dripping with grease.  Vaguely grimy, with bad art on the walls and weird little chairs, but you can always find a seat, then hit the amazing salsa bar.  
(Pancho, when I first moved here and had no kitchen, you were always there for me, right across the street when I came home late at night.  Pancho, you saved my life.)
author: claire l.

description:
After a glorious afternoon drinking beer on Zeitgeist's back patio, we headed to Pancho Villa for some dinner. I have yet to find a Mexican restaurant in the city that I absolutely love but, for now, this place definitely wins. Even though the line was incredibly long, they herded us through swiftly and before I knew it was enjoying a perfect carnitas burrito. My friends had the prawn tacos and didn't stop talking about them three days later. I have a feeling that whenever I'm near the Mission, I'll find an excuse to eat at Pancho Villa.

Minus 1 star for the fact they only gave me about 5 chips with my burrito, the unlabeled salsa bar, and the security guard who swooped on the last 1/3 of my burrito about half a second after I walked away from it. I hope he enjoyed it as much as I did.
author: Lauren B.

description: Can you go wrong with a Burrito in the mission district? I dont think so. Specially when it comes to Pancho Villa. That burrito was so good that I did not want it to digest
author: Motaz H.

description:
good! cheap! close to the bart! ENORMOUS burritos! i had the super beef burrito. i ate about a quarter of it at first, then took it home.. and as i was carrying it, it felt so heavy. SO MUCH FOOD!
the only thing: usually is very busy, so it's not a great place to sit down and eat. 

but the food? A+. would eat again.
author: Jane H.

description:
I've been going to Pancho Villa for years and I've never found a better burrito! The salmon burrito is to die for, not to mention their pico de gallo (get the picante), and refried black beans. Seriously, how many restaurants even have refried black beans!?!

Don't be discouraged by the long line, it moves quickly (sometimes so fast I haven't even made up my mind), and is only a symbol of their ongoing popularity and excellence.
author: Bluey B.

description:
I used to chow (and enjoy) the burritos here years ago, but decided to go for the tacos during my recent visit.  I was super hungry, so ordered one fish taco, one carnitas taco, and one green salsa chicken taco, plus a Mango agua fresca.

Enjoyed the chips and salsa bar as I waited, excitedly, for my food to arrive.

Total buzz kill.  The fish was undercooked and slimy, and was the worst interpretation of a fish taco I've seen and tasted.  The other two were loaded with fillings, but those fillings meshed together (physically and gastronomically) like a box of random Lego parts.  It was like a bad first pass at tacos from a McDonald's Food Lab.

I'll go back and re-try the burritos, but never the tacos again.
author: Rob P.

description:
Tasty carnitas in an expertly tightly-wrapped burrito - these suckers are designed to be eaten with the hands, without fear of disintegration, all the way to the last bite! Thick, crunchy chips.

Carnitas is tasty, but in a "healthy" way and not in a "savory" way, so it tastes more like "restaurant" food than "joint" food.
author: Rob T.

description:
Delicious and reasonably priced!  I had the super veggie tacos, and they were great.  I wish I lived closer so I could try the many other dishes that sounded good:  they have a red snapper burrito, a salmon burrito, garlic prawn nachos, and other enticing things.

They have an admirable salsa bar, and the salsas are fresh and tasty. I would love to eat here again.
author: Allegra R.

description: A recent trip to this longtime establishment left me feeling nostalgic. My Mom used to take me here as kid growing up in SF. I will always remember their Carne Asada Burrito! It's such a standout and despite the long lines nowadays, Pancho Villa is worth the wait. Yes, Pancho Villa is one of many, many awesome taquerias out there in the Mission, but for the tourists in San Francisco, this is one I often recommend.
author: Leroid D.

description: The best burrito place in San Francisco.  My fave is the grilled chicken.  Large selection of the freshest ingredients.  It's the real deal here.
author: Lawree S.

description:
I had always hated Mexican food - ok maybe not 'hated' but it was certainly not something I would even consider when getting hungry.

So..I got dragged to this place and I must say..their prawn and fish tacos turned me around. Loved the salsa as well.

That the place is dirt cheap adds as well. Go now!
author: Rich S.

description:
I remember my only complaint being the price : portion ratio. So many Mexican restaurants deliver the double-whammy of huge portions at low prices, it's kind of shocking to find a place that fails to provide that.

Food wasn't bad though! I'd probably go back if my friends wanted to eat there.
author: Alex C.

description:
Oh the salsa. So good. 

I really like their chicken quesadillas... and standing in line and watching the cooks chop the meat up.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I've been coming to this place for the past 8 years since I've been in San Fran. The best prawn quesadilla by far. I love people who work there, they are friendly, always smiling --- what else could we ask for? Of course, good food and they have it! 

I also really enjoy their vegetarian options as sometimes I try to stay off seafood and meats for a few months or so. Highly recommended.
author: Katja S.

description:
Cheap and Good. Satisfy the burrito cravings. - BEWARE OF SEMI-COLD BURRITOS

Huge selection of Mexican Food. From tacos, quesidillas, burritos, and full meals it's all good. Service is excellent!

As much as I like Pancho Villa, I have to nitpick about several things. First off it's relatively pricey for what it's worth. It's about $7-8 for a super burrito and two tacos can cost up to $6.

My biggest pet peeve is that several times that I've gone there I got a semi warm burrito. The cheese wasn't melted and the meat was luke warm to almost cold- YUCK! I believe it's the fact they cook the meat beforehand and leave it outside before serving.
author: Bert T.

description:
If I could only eat at one spot the rest of my life, this would be it.  
Seriously.
Chicken Flautas.
Chicken Enchilladas.
Fish Tacos.
Check it, jerks.
author: Logan B.

description:
Great Burritos, Great Price, Great Service, Clean

I work like a block away so I can visit Pancho Villla 3x a week some times.  You can get different types of tortillas and customize your burritos any way you like.   Everything always seems fresh and it rather quick.  BONUS mariachis.

The best thing is the owner keeps a really tight ship so all the employees get their jobs done and the place is clean and there's always a seat available no matter how busy it is.  The wait is never really in excess either.  As far as Taquerias go.  Pancho Villa is top of the line.
author: John F.

description:
I'm laughing...laughing at you who decided that THIS was the best place for a burrito or quesadilla...HAVE YOU BEEN TO EL FAROLITO????!!!

Let me re-inact the type of place this is...
First of all...everyone here speaks english...WHAT??  I came for a burrito not for english speaking workers...that makes this more unauthentic...first strike in my book of mexican food...
Second...you sit on a chair of leather straps...I'm serious...What the heck... i thought my buttocks was permanently damaged after sitting in these chairs...and no backrest!!! dude we all came after we were wasted...do you mind? some of us barely stumbled in and cant sit right...strike two.
and finally i was very unhappy with my quesadilla, it reminded me of a gyro...where's all the grease adn stuff that kills you later on??  way to healthy, i dont think there was even cheese in my quesadilla...
EL FAROLITO destroys this place...
author: christopher h.

description:
I got here around 2:45PM on a Saturday. The line was FRICKIN LONG! I guess that means this place is really popular. 

I like their wide selection. You can get a variety of different types of tortillas. I decided to go with the whole wheat. Then I wouldn't feel so guilty about getting a Pura Carne Asada burrito with guacamole. It was good, although since I got it to go, it was cold by the time I ate it (my own fault). I would go back, hopefully next time it won't be a 30 min wait...
author: Nicole K.

description:
Disco Gold.

Huge food. Fair prices... and the security man opens the door for you. 

I like the vibe here. You find all kinds of peoples. 

I have called in large orders for pick-up and eaten in many times, and it is always consistent. 

Ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh, and I can't forget about their salsas. Award winning stuff.
author: Lee M.

description:
So far, I've gotta stay with only three stars.  I got super nachos which ended up being not that super.  I don't think there was any nacho cheese involved at all...which if I remember correctly would be a key ingredient in NACHOS.  They were really dry.  When my plate was finished it was like a dry  desert....a desert of refried beans.  And there was too much refriend beans!  Okay this is turning a review of my super nachos, but so far that's all I really have to go on for this place.  

Next time I'll go back to my classic super burrito that I get at all taquerias.  Yesterday I was just in the mood for nachos, and they let me down :(
author: Levi B.

description:
If by chance you are abducted by aliens and were just cold heartedly dropped off at say... 16th Street and Valencia...

You absolutely must visit Pancho Villa Taqueria. You know you're in for a treat when the security guard opens the door for you. You'll be amazed at all the selections and options to choose from on the big board above the grill and prep area. Burritos... Super Burritos... Dinner plates... all kinds of meat. Different kinds of beans and salsas. The line forms right in front of the grill. The smell of the sizzling flank steaks and carnitas is almost too much to handle. It's all good. It's the real deal, authentic as hell. There's good seating, tables all over. Don't sit by the windows... you might want to enjoy your meal. 

Mission District parking totally sucks! I suggest gathering a few volunteers, and coerce one of them to circle the block while you pick up the burritos. OR... 

If you can get the aliens to just hover right above for a few minutes for a taco or two, by all means it's worth it.
author: Rick V.

description:
Ok so the first thing you need to know about this review is that I am a San Diego native transferred to the Bay Area. And the second thing you should know is that because of this I have very high snobby holding-all-Mexican-food-in-relation-to-SD opinion. Sorry, but thems the truth. 

Now, you understand when I tell you this is the BEST MEXICAN FOOD I'VE EVER HAD NORTH OF SAN DIEGO. 

I'm 100% serious. I live in a part of the East Bay where the Mexican is dismal to say the worst, ok at the middle, and bourgie "healthy"  crap to say the worst again (Chipotle? Baja Fresh? Cancun?).

Ok, but hear me out. Those are some harsh words. But I live in the its-better-if-its-a-hole-in-the-wall philosophy. If you have to fancify your restaurant with schmancy pants "ambiance" or a cute little motto "No Trans Fats. No Can Openers. Blah blah" - you're TRYING TOO HARD. The food should stand on it's own.

And it does. The carne asada is cooked and seasoned amazingly and if I close my eyes maybe I can pretend that a warm breezy beach is only a 10 minute drive away and I can spend all day outside without the need for a jacket. Of course, then the bill comes and I am once again slapped in the face with the realization that I am in San Francisco (geez, I could get nachos for 5 bucks in SD). There's an amazing selection at the Salsa bar. And the desert is amazing! I had alfaros (the cookie things) for the first time ever and wooow that was a good end to an awesome meal.

P.S. It's also amazing because it's really just a quick walk away from the 16th and Mission Bart. I wouldn't try to drive around here for sure.
author: Diana H.

description:
Pancho Villa kept me alive some years ago.  Cheap, fresh, good, huge burritos.  I don't believe they have changed in 20 years.  It always gave me a reason to travel down to the Mission.  

Some friends think that the rice is just cheap filler, but I thought it was delicious.  Kind of like a side to the full meal that comes within the tortilla. 

On a sunny day in the city, there is nothing like taking a bus or two  and making your way to 16th to get one of these delicious burritos. 

It takes like...like...victory.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I don't get it! I'm on 16th all the time and this place is always always packed. I never go because if I'm going to get Mexican it's Puerto Allegre for me! 

Then one day after a four-hour tattooing session, my artist suggested i get some food quick. So my friend tugged me by the arm to Pancho Villa. The menu seems endless but I had plenty of time to decide because the counter staff was slow as molasses. With only 3 people in front of me, I still had to wait 15 minutes. Doesn't seem like a long time but a) I was about to pass out; b) there were three people behind the counter, shouldn't that mean those three in front of me would be taken care of pretty easily AND c) the two before me only ordered standard chicken burritos. So what could be so complicado?

When I finally got my food, it was pretty bland. Nothing to write home about. Hell, I should've just went home and made myself a quesadilla it would have tasted better.
author: Zinna R.

description:
I'm tempted to give every taqueria 5 stars... c'mon, burritos are awesome! but... I must be objective. So Pancho Villa gets 4 stars. It's delicious but arbitrarily not 5-star delicious. Or not arbitrary, but I can't exactly describe why it's not one of my favorites (I'd give 5-star delicious to a place like El Farolito, for example).

There's also something off about the atmosphere. It's a little too clean for a Mission taqueria. But I guess some people prefer that. It's also something like 10 feet from the 16th street BART station, so it's a popular place for those too scared to venture any deeper into the Mission.

So yeah... there's gonna be a line. Ahh, at least you get to watch the cooks making everyone else's food. And It really gets you craving that which awaits you at your journey's end.
author: Chris M.

description:
Ughh I love you Pancho. I want to write you love poems and hold your hand and stuff. It's my absolute favorite taqueria in SF. I found it when I started going to school here, and instantly fell in love. I always get the chicken suiza quesadilla with some tasty guacamole. I have no idea how they manage to keep track of my order since it's always pretty busy in there, but they do! It's awesome. Oh, and the pico de gallo is my jaaaam. So tasty! I swear, I could just eat the pico de gallo on its own.

It's kind of pricey, but tastes sooo good that it doesn't matter much to me.. I used to only go here on "special occasions" but lately I've been finding excuses to make everyday a special occasion. Not gonna lie. Probably going to go there at least 2-3 times this week.
author: Tabby R.

description: Menu selection is great! So many vegetarian options, so many choices for meat, beans, and everything else. The selection is actually the best thing that this place has going for it. Huge salsa bar! Larger selection of frescas than in most other taquerias. The standard food is comparable to most other places in the Mission. Conveniently located near the 16th st Bart.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Pancho Villa offers the best freshest burritos in San Francisco.  The atmosphere is great too, with a large open space and lots of loyal hip customers to look at!!!  Thumbs up!!!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Usually when I eat here, the "food ordering" goes like this:

Me: Hi, I'd like a chicken burrito with everything EXCEPT salsa...to go, please.

Order taker: You want that for here?

Me: No, I'd like that to go.

Order taker: What did you want to order?

Me: A chicken burrito with everything EXCEPT salsa.

Order taker: What kind of salsa would you like on that?

...and so on...it's fairly maddening, but I've come to expect this as a normal exchange. The only thing is that, until recently, the person who took your order also made the food (while you watched)...NOW, there is one person who takes the order and then you go sit down while another person makes the food (aka "eff's it up" and makes it different than how you ordered it, depsite how clear you have been when you placed your order).! Without exception, with this new system of ordering, I end up (1) waiting much longer for my food to be dropped off at my table and (2) it's always slightly wrong. At least when I was able to watch someone make my food, I could keep an eye on what they were doing (and correct as needed...which is ALWAYS needed). So, there you go. Prior to this new system ordering, I would have given it 4 stars (1 star being deducted for the super noisy atmosphere and having to keep a close eye on my order as it's being made). Now, I can only give it 3 stars for the reasons listed above, despite the fact that I find their food really tasty!
author: Dean O.

description: Deliciousness and reasonable prices.  Line was certainly lengthy, but to be expected.  Thankfully they had lots of employees working to keep the line moving.  The meal was enough for 2
author: Chris W.

description: Pretty good carne asada burrito and salsa. Their menu in the store is pretty much $2 more across the board from the menu online. Time to update friends.
author: Wes K.

description: This place is bomb!  Although I feel kinda bad for the workers doing their thang in a factory like setting.  Assembly line!!  But yumm.  Very satisfying food
author: Sunshine S.

description: After an urban hike through Golden Gate park and the Japanese Tea Gardens, quite the appetite was worked up.  We went in search of authentic mexican food and found it in the Mission district.  We each had the spicy chicken burrito with black beans and rice and the burrito was the size of my head!  Ate half of it and saved the other half for dinner last night :-)  I liked that they prepare the food in front of you and although there were several taquerias in the area, this one had a steady stream of customers in line and at times, out the door.  A security guard greets customers upon entering and exiting and it is my understanding that this part of town has had its problems, but I found it to be quaint and reminded me a little bit of Austin.  If you aren't hungry when you enter this part of town, you surely will be after finding parking and walking through the neighborhood.  The smell from the taquerias was enchanting...and effective :-)
author: Diane E.

description: I'm not much of a fan of Mexican food, but I like this taqueria. Easy to follow & extensive menu, clean environment, friendly staff, 3 stuffed tacos for $7, plus no upset stomach later....what's not to like? Try the fresh lemonade / aguas frescas and grilled salmon tacos.
author: Shweta V.

description:
Their shrimp taco's are great.  I don't know about anything else, cause I always get the same thing.  And by nature, I don't think a true "mexican conniseure"  would eat shrimp tacos. 

I probably wouldn't say the "BEST" ever... cause I'm a big taco truck fan... Plus, when you're eating mexican in the mission... you can't really say a big a** restaurant like pancho is the BEST.  

But they is pretty damned good, yo.
author: Erin Leigh M.

description:
In the words of Dora's backpack, "Yum yum yum yum yum, Delicioso!!!"
The burritos don't really stand out, but for the most part a burrito is a burrito is a burrito.  The chile relleno is tasty. Not too doughy. I especially like the square leather chairs at the tables.  Everything is super affordable.  I like the alfajars (sp). The dulce de leche filled cookies.
author: brenda b.

description:
When I roll into the part of the Mission...I like to play a little game called - "count the crack whores."

The rules are simple...you and whomever your with walk through the neighborhood from where you parked...dont say a word to each other cause youre likely to get accosted...and when you get to the restaurant or back to your car you compare how many "crack whores" you thought you saw.

Now agreed, the definition of "crack whore" can be very subjective, but in a effort to add some clarity Ive included the link below:

http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=crack+whore

and 

http://www.bobfromaccounting.com/7_0204/crack_whore.jpg

You should try it...its fun.

But on to the review...

Poncho Villa's is great...burritos are some of the best Ive had.  Great for lunch or for a hangover cure.  Make sure you get it "mojado" which will add cheese and salsa on top of the burrito.

Also, be sure to check out the sauces...you should sample them all.
author: Ken S.

description:
So, the whole burrito thing escapes me. My friends are always like burrito this and burrito that, and that's fine; I don't necessarily have anything against burritos. It's just that they tend to taste the same everywhere (Bay Area, of course. I'm not talking about Midwest, etc). The thing is pretty much a starchy log filled with beans, meat in a sauce ranging from better to worse, and some salsa that also varies within a very narrow range. 
Pancho Villa wrapped me up a fine burrito, but it was not better than any other average taqueria I've been to in the Bay Area. Their guacamole was fresh, I will say that. And one note of caution: I usually ask for hot salsa and have no problem with it, but the hot salsa here is *hot*. I was crying by the time I finished my burrito.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
I don't get it. I mean its good and I'm not a hater- but whats the hype about? I thought the experience was going to be orgasmic to say the least based on what I read from everyone else, but I have had comparable burritos in other areas of the city (and safer ones at that too.) Maybe I'm doing something wrong...

I guess I would go back...but only with my mace in hand.
author: Jess W.

description:
A full stomach of decent food for $5. Free chips and salsa, to boot.

I also enjoy Mexican Coke but was saddened to see that the labels have changed from "pure cane sugar" to "high-fructose corn syrup/pure cane sugar." Oh well, beer next time, huh?
author: Mr. C.

description:
Lots of choices and a good price, not to mention a great selection of Aguas Frescas.

You can get your chicken about 4 different ways here and the quesadillas are made with the good cheese with the right consistency (not mozzerela, or jack, but possibly cacique?) for cheap.

I'm pretty discerning when it comes to horchata and Aguas Frescas, so I especially like the tamarindo and fresa flavors here, yum!

I'm also always surprised that I've never seen the place run out of seats considering how many are standing in line.  I'm sure plenty are to-go orders, but still, as far as I've seen, everyone gets a seat.
author: Miss C.

description:
Ever had Mexican food in Mexico, Souther CA, TX, AZ or anywhere else other than SF for that matter?  Then you'd know this place pretty much sucks.  It's bland, white washed Mexican food.  Really nothing to be proud of in my opinion...
Why there is always a line...I will not know.
author: Matt V.

description:
People LOVE LOVE LOVE this friggin place (including my bf so I'm there at least once a week).  Don't get me wrong, its an ok burrito, but it's not as delish as people would make it seem.  To me everything tastes pretty bland and could be more fresh.  This may be sacrilidge as a Mission resident, but the Whole Foods burritos are way more tasty!

More importantly the guac, which is to me the MOST important part of any burrito, is extremely sub-par at Pancho.  Plus I got terribly sick off of the sour cream on my quesadillas once and there's always a ridiculous line.   All together ok, but nothin' special.
author: Jules M.

description:
my fav taqueria in SF.

i've been coming here for almost 20 years.  i swear, some of the same servers are still there.  some things never change.  great selection of salsa.  LOVE it.  i usually ask for a water cup so i can secretly scoop up ample amounts of my fav salsa and...yes...take small sips between bites of my grilled chicken taco and corn tortilla quesadillas.  wash it all down with cold jarritos mandarina soda pop and life is good.  the world turns, the sun will rise, and the hunt for ice cream begins.

and oh, yes, any taqueria who serves chips that don't come from a mexican restaurant supply store or costco gets extra bonus points.

everyone seems to always give taqueria cancun the major props, but can't say that its all that much better?  maybe i haven't seen the light there yet.  but i am not impressed with their salsa offerings, which i feel is an integral part of a mexican food eating experience. :-)

yay for pancho's.  mucho gracias!
author: Patrick M.

description:
Wow - this place does not lack in variety.  If anything, the extensive menu can be overwhelming! 

Have a friend go save a table for the group and then line up and order your food.  The quesadilla is yummy, as is their guacamole.  My friends ordered more non-vegetarian options and they seemed to enjoy their food as well.  Don't wear anything that you don't want to have smelling like food though - because the food smell does permeate the entire place and it will cling to you.
author: Diana N.

description: Not only does this place have the best carne asada and salsa bar in the city, but they also make the best horchata I've ever tasted.
author: J. R.

description: the only reason that this place doesn't get five stars from me is because almost no place is perfect.  i love mexican food - and "cheap" mexican food - but won't eat it just anywhere.  this is one place i go regularly, because it is tasty, quality food for a great price.  besides that, they are fast, the ordering system is up-to-date and efficient, and the staff is always very pleasant and friendly.  they also hire people to clean the tables (some developmentally disabled people - extra points in my book), and the security guard who is there at times stands by the door and opens it for those who are coming and going.  where do you find such great service and commitment to their customers these days, and such pleasure in providing good service, even in businesses that charge much more?  not very often, that's for sure.  i love pancho villa taqueria!
author: Don B.

description: The lines were long, the people in line were unsavory, they forgot my order because they were busy and the girl went on brake after I gave my order...but it was totally all worth it.  Great tacos and my wife's burrito was amazing! I will definitely will return to face the craziness for some yummy mexi-food .
author: Brad E.

description:
Got an al pastor burrito.  When I was already drunk.  And I remember being supremely disappointed.  

Only plus was the salsa bar.
author: cheddar b.

description: What up Pancho Villa Taqueria!  Just let me get that salsa recipe..  I can't figure out how you do it.  I'm at home roasting serrano peppers, jalepenos, garlic, tomatoes, stewed tomatoes, cilantro, onions, but can't figure out how you guys make that black smoky magic flavor.  I should rate you down for making such good salsa so far far away.
author: Lift B.

description: This place is awesome!  I got the 3 taco plate, upgraded to the super taco for $1.00 extra each.  Got the Chicken, Carne Asada, and Carnitas.  I have to say, the Carnitas and Chicken are just perfect!  Can't wait to hit this place up again
author: Jasper K.

description: Same huge menu as El Toro and just as delicious, maybe more. I love their refried black beans and regular refried beans. No lard but super creamy. They have like 10 options for agua frescas, YES! Also, they serve the holy trinity of salsas: green salsa, roasted creamy salsa and tomato salsa. Sure they have more than just 3 salsas but those combined are a pleasurefest. Top 5 burritos for sure.
author: Cori W.

description: From the nice man who opens the door to the biggest and best-maintained salsa bar around, Pancho Villa is a great spot to live near. It's also one of the only taquerias that has refried BLACK beans in addition to pinto. Excellent tacos. My favorites include the pastor and the spicy chicken. The agua frescas are great too.
author: Marco L.

description:
Awesome Mexican. Best salsas around!

You have to be looking to find this place, but it is well worth the hunt.

Reasonably priced and great extras, Try the fresh brewed Mango juice!
author: Mark C.

description: I consider myself a burrito snob, even a hint of turned avocado and I deem it unfit for enjoyment. The super burrito de pastor here is probably the single greatest morsel of Mexican food I have had the pleasure of consuming.
author: Dave J.

description:
i keep coming back! day and night. this place es lo mejor. it might have just knocked off Gordo's off the podium for my favorite burrito joint. ill hold off on any final decisions until i have a head to head match up. its got character, great quality meat and lots of different options if you cant handle the burrito blackout afterwards.

bottom line: this place is great!!
author: Doug H.

description:
FLAN FLAN FLAN!!!!!

Went there yesterday and I had Nachos and my friend had two tacos, delicious! 
I always have a sweet tooth after my food but usually never get anything at Taquerias...
I decided to give it a try and I was amazed at how delicious was theif FLAN!......Yummy!!

great food and delicious dessert. Can't beat the price!
author: Geena T.

description:
Noticably tastier than El Toro, which is owned by the same people, has the same menu, and no doubt uses the same ingredients. This may be due to the higher throughput of customers and subsequent increase in meaty freshness. Who knows?

Having a security guard out the front seems a bit offputting at first, but once you taste the burritos, all your cares float away on a cloud of tortilla heaven. The line can suck sometimes, though.
author: Glen M.

description:
Honestly, this place reminded me of a slightly more authentic version of Chipotle.  One walks up to the counter, orders your dish, and they make it in front of you, sliding the plate down past all of the various meats, beans, rice, etc.  

Out of the seven of us who all ordered separately, three, I repeat, THREE of our orders were screwed up.  That's a failing rate in a pass/fail class.  The food was tasty once it was prepared properly (no problems with mine) but I don't know if it's worth putting up with the service.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Bring a good read, you may be in line for a while during rush hour.

Pancho Villa never lets me down!  I had ordered a steak and shrimp super burrito and it was the size of my bicep (14 - 14.5 inches around).  Oh believe me, I finished this monster of a burrito.  It had so much flavor to it that there was no reason for salsa.

The salsa bar has everything you can imagine.  From radishes to carrots, and a wide variety of salsa flavors.  The horchata was muy bueno!
author: Shane P.

description:
I was in SF for a quick weekend getaway and came here based on a friend's excellent recommendation.  Born and raised in San Diego to a mexican mom who could cook like nobody's business, I always approach mexican restaurant suggestions with a bit of caution.  I was far from disappointed here.

After perusing the menu quickly, my friends and I decided on our meat and were quick to begin picking our toppings on our burritos-from-heaven.  We sat down on one of the cute tables with odd stool seats, and took our first bites.  Normally, in a stuffed burrito, the first bite consists of mostly tortilla and beans.  That first bite of tortilla and beans was unreal and a sign of what the rest of the burrito would bring.  The beans were fresh and tasty, the meat cooked and chopped perfectly, the salsa tangy and spicy, and everything was delicious.  My friends and I didn't want to eat the whole burrito in one sitting so that we could enjoy some more of it on the road back to LA.

Pancho Villa, I love you.
author: Rebecca O.

description:
Pancho Villa's, the premier taqueria of San Francisco, hands down. Send up one person to get the food, another for the seat, and you're good to go. Say 'hey' to Beck, in case he happens to pop in again to sing some mariachi.

Keep in mind that they don't stay open late, so you'll probably have to get your late night kicks elsewhere....Cancun taqueria perhaps
author: M S.

description:
I discovered this place when I lived in the Mission district 10 years ago and have been going ever since. 

I'm no longer living in SF but if I head there for any reason and want a burrito (or tacos or nachos), this is where I go. I don't care what the line looks like, this is the place for me. When you walk in, you're instantly hit with the smell of meet on the grill (I'm not a vegetarian so that makes me drool). 

The menu options are typical taqueria but the quality is good and the portions plenty. Anyone who eats at taquerias can tell you that each one has a distinct flavor to their meat, their beans, their salsa....I really like the flavor in the food here. I usually get the same thing, a spicy chicken super burrito and an agua fresca (love the cantaloupe). They have a salsa bar that does not disappoint.  

The location, if not the most charming, is convenient. It's 1 block away from the 16th St. BART station. 

When they put a location in the east bay, they'll get 5 stars instead of 4!
author: Miss B.

description:
PV used to be one of my go-to restaurants --- but man... after last night... It could have been at a 4* rating, but then I took my baby sister and her childhood friend.  My kid sister ordered tacos al pastor, another taco con carne asade y dos tamales (pollo y puerca).  All were --- sub par at most.  This bummed us all out because --- really, PV is an SF institution.  

On the flip side --- I truly LOVE LOVE LOVE that this place offers lengua.  Without fail, I always order a LENGUA burrioto especial.  

(One of my biggest pet peeves is going into a "Mexican" restaurant -- and they do NOT offer lengua on the menu.  Seriously?)  

There will be a wait.  Even at 9:45p at night.  There will be hell trying to find parking in the Mission.  This is a given.  

Really --- this should be a 3.5*s.  The lengua was awesome.  Plus --- they have lengua.
author: BrasilPo P.

description:
Finally came here to see what the crowdedness and fuss was about. They're a very clean place and very very nice, which is cool.

As for the food, the tortilla chips were very good, and the choices of salsas were excellent. I got the al pastor burrito especial with sour cream (beans, rice, guacamole, cheese, salsa) for $8.50. It was a decent burrito. Not gross, but not the best I've had. The meat was okay; kinda soft, not much flavor and not enough meat-to-other-ingredients ratio. I don't like burritos with a lot of chopped raw onions, and this burrito ended up having a lot of that...plus green onions from the al pastor. It was a normal-sized burrito too..which means I ate the whole thing, and I wasn't stuffed silly.

I also got to try the ingredients in a carne asada taco especial. The carne asada is quite good (at least this batch); it tastes like that grilled flavor. Yum!

The horchata was decent too, but not the best I've had.

Prices are a little steep; I've gotten better in the Mission (bigger burritos, cheaper, tastier).
author: Angela H.

description: Favorite tacos north of Mexico, great vibe and good staff, food is delicious, try the fish or shrimp super tacos.
author: A Z.

description: This place is burrito nirvana. I make it a point to visit this place at least once every time I visit San Francisco. Carne asada burrito with the works and make sure not to skimp on the cilantro (if you like the stuff) and jalapenos. The salsas are fantastic and have won awards at the CA state fair (keep in mind how big Cailfornia is when you ponder that...). The mushroom quesadilla is good too, and they have a shrimp quesadilla that looks good but I haven't tried it. Get enough chips to enjoy the salsa and an ice cold Negro Modelo (or Corona if you prefer) and you will be in heaven. Use caution though, it is easy to leave feeling fuller than you have ever in your life, if you let your eyes get bigger than your stomach..
author: Ferdi M.

description:
Too many questions.... 

But hey it's all about getting the food right for your taste....
Man there is nothing that i have had from this place that I am disappointed with. 
It wins second favorite Mexican place in SF from me.

I am soooooo addicted to those agua fresca's...
Most have more now...

The only reason (and i mean the only reason) that it didn't gt five is that it is that little more expensive than other places... but apart from that

Great Salsa,
Great service
Cool doorman,
big line
lots of food

Always good before a thursday nights 16th and mission open mic..
(along with a brown bag)
Sorted!
author: Dave L.

description: A must mexican food if your in the mission area and looking for a quick snack or meal. Everything here is made to order and they use fresh ingredients. If you have a AAA card they also will give you 15% offf!!! Make sure you show it or you don't get the discount. If you don't believe me look on your iPhone app (AAA discount icon). Anyways, the iPhone app can do you wonders of who gives discounts for restaurants and not only a tow truck anymore!!!!
author: Jay S.

description: One of my favorite places to easy mexican food. The prices are average but the happy hour (monday-friday 3 to 5) is the best! $1 tacos and $2 beers highly recommended if you like mexican food.and they are open you'll midnight!
author: Adriana K.

description:
This is a great place to eat; particularly, late at night.

I remember my first visit. The security guard, who doubles as a doorman, opened the door for me. The line was somewhat long -- with about fifteen people in front of me. About ten minutes later, I was ordering.

The preparation is comparable to Chipotle, except the food is better. The prices are not bad, as well. And Pancho Villa also has happy hour in the afternoon (not sure to the details).

You will likely find long lines. This is especially true late at night. Parking around the neighborhood is scarce. As for the surrounding neighborhood... somewhat sketchy.
author: A B.

description:
I have been coming here since my mom used to bring me at 3 years old. I have eaten at Mexican places all over California and this is the best Mexican place EVER. Let me tell you a few things that make them a true, amazing Mexican restaurant:
1. They not only have whole and refried beans, they have whole black beans AND refried black beans! Do you know how hard that is to find??
2. Their frescas (fresh fruit drinks) are actually real fresh fruit. I've never been to a restaurant that has that. Their watermelon and canteloupe juice is to die for, with the little chunks of melon in it...mmmmmmm
3. The churros are made there, not the little kind you see rotating in a box on a cart at the zoo.
4. Fresh, free chips. I consider this a basic of Mexican food, but I've been coming here all my life so I guess I have high standards, but this is not a must at every establishment.
5. The shrimp is amazing. They cook it perfectly right there and they are very generous. My surf and turf burrito had like ten shrimp in it.

Only bad thing I can say is they have raised their prices and decreased the size of their portions in recent years, but I think everyone has made similar changes since the 90's, and honestly that burrito was huge I didn't need anymore. I think it's worth the slight extra cost considering you can go to Chevy's or La Pinata and pay as much or more for food that is...well, lacking.
author: Eden S.

description: Ohhh the wonderful memories when I think of Pancho Villa's.  Great burreeeeet in the Mission.  I would give 5 stars if they grilled the tortilla instead of steaming it.
author: chuck p.

description: El Pancho Villa is my favorite burrito place in the Mission hands down. Keeping it short and sweet: their burritos are THE BOMB! It's reasonably priced and the location is easy to get to. Just try this place; I'm sure you won't regret it.
author: Kevin D.

description: love their shrimp tacos. This place is fresh, quick and ok. price. It's my go to spot when I'm craving good mexican food that I know will be quick and good.
author: Karla D.

description:
Definitely did NOT live up to the hype...The counter service took forever, the food looked like it had been sitting out for hours, and when we finally did get to eat, there was a fly in my friend's meal.  When he told them about it, they cooked him a new dish but would not reimburse him.  The food is also WAY overpriced...They actually charge for lettuce.  Yes, lettuce.  They charge for everything, as a matter of fact.  I would never go back to this restaurant...I could eat at most other Mexican restaurants in the city for less money, less hassle, and less attitude.  Oh, and there is zero atmosphere at Pancho Villa...


Update:  After a second try, it was better than my first experience (no bugs).  It's not magical, but it's not horrible.  Maybe if they had really good margaritas, I'd like them more.  Probably.
author: Katie K.

description:
My mexican haven for a quick taco, an agua fresca and a churrio.  I don't even care if eventually I weigh 700lbs...

The food is fresh, well made, and the meats and veggies well seasoned.  I always get good service here and everyone is nice.  Plus the salsa bar has a little something for everyone.

You get my full 5 rating!
author: Alicia W.

description:
One of my favorite taquerias in the mission for three reasons:

1)Excellent choice of quality ingredients. Beans, cheeses, meats, it's all here, it's all fresh, and it's all delicious.

2) Freshly made chips and salsa.  Around half-dozen salsas await you at the salsa bar. My only complaint is that the little salsa cups are too small to effectively dip a chip into. Life is so hard.

3) They bus the tables for you, and a friendly security guard opens the door for you. I know...I'm spoiled.

Don't let the line deter you. Come on in, because you wont wait on line for long.
author: Joseph B.

description:
There is a reason why this place ALWAYS has a line.  It's great food at a great price. 

I recommend the pork burrito or as I affectionately call it "the colon buster".  Yum.
author: Susan T.

description:
Best Super Veggie Burritos in the Mission.  If you want a spicy chicken super quesadilla, head around the corner to El Toro.  Same people better spicy chicken.  Yummy!

Be careful, the salsa is hot.
author: Forrest G.

description:
